Reviews.Title: “keywest t”
Reviews.Author: tjforty
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel March 13 to March 20th had a great room ocean view , the hotel was right where I wanted to be close walking or bike riding to anywhere you wanted to go. The staff were geat. I stayed eithier at the pool area Shores bar or on the beach. We had a great waitress named Heather she was funny bubbly she looked just like Reese Weatherspoon an actress she also gave some great eating places to go to. I had so much fun and met some really nice people great time. Thanks again for the stay Tim

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful”
Reviews.Author: ShoesPurses
Reviews.Content: This hotel is wonderful. It is located right on the water. Our room was on the top floor by the parking lot. The balcony overlooked the parking lot, but looking just beyond was the pool and then the beautiful view of the sea. When you lay in bed, and look out the bay window, all you can see is the sea and the cruise ships leaving on their voyage. I went with my sister for a quick getaway, but I cannot wait to return with my husband. It can be a very romantic escape. We enjoyed the sun deck that caught the sea breeze and cooled you down while soaking up the Florida sun. The pool was busy. The beach was very nice. Beach chairs were included in our room price. We were even brought a cool towel while we were laying on the beach! This is a great hotel, and I cannot wait to stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Paradise Found”
Reviews.Author: Sheila B
Reviews.Content: An exceptional hotel. My friend, a native of Miami, said it was "the most beautiful hotel I've ever stayed in." Easy to see why--manicured grounds with swaying palms and lovely flowers, the air gently scented by plumeria. Luxurious rooms with marvelous beds. And our room had a balcony overlooking one of the pools--as lovely in the moonlight as in the daylight. Attentive, helpful staff--especially Patrick and Wally. A resort I would be comfortable recommending to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Superb Property-Magnificent Views-Friendliest Staff!!!! A+”
Reviews.Author: sunlover
Reviews.Content: This was our first visit to KW and thanks to SMOB...it will not be our last. We are already booked for next February!!! Before booking and trying to decide where to stay, we could not believe all the positive reviews this resort had to offer....and as someone else mentioned in their review, totally true!!! From the spectacular views (sunrise a must see!!), to the chic and spacious rooms, to the impeccable grounds, to the genuinely friendliest and honest staff on earth, we were overjoyed with our choice. Everything was so clean (which is a biggie for us). It felt luxurious but warm and welcoming. We enjoyed our tranquil days here and if we wanted the craziness KW has to offer, we were a short walk away from Duval St. We rented bikes from the concierge and really enjoyed exploring KW. This is a must do when in KW. Make sure you go down the side streets and look at all the historical, funky, luxurious homes. The SM Beach Cafe was delicious and well priced. The service was fast and courteous. We enjoyed all our breakfasts here overlooking the beach. We really found paradise here and we are already counting our days until we return. Look no where else when visiting KW....this is the place where you want to stay!!! TO THE MANAGEMENT OF SMOB: We would like to compliment your wonderful property and commend all the fantastic people that work here. We had sadly left our stay and were half way up the keys when we realized that my husband had left his brand new business cell phone in our room. Fearing the worst, he called the front desk for any help that he could get. He spoke with Diana Dorsdy and she could not have been more compassionate and helpful. She immediately put him in contact with Jeanette in housekeeping who found his phone. She promptly shipped it to our next destination. She even called us back with the tracking number. Courtesy and service at this level are seldom seen these days and it gave us pleasure to know that it still exists at your property. This is one of the many reasons why we are returning to your property next February. Guests of Room 540 2/9/2012 to 2/11/2012

Reviews.Title: “Perfect spot for Key West Girls Weekend”
Reviews.Author: vatraveler58
Reviews.Content: A friend and I made our first ever visit to Key West over President's Day. I heartily recommend this hotel. You have fabulous water views, yet it is quiet and relaxing. It also offers rooms with two beds--unlike so many places that only offer king beds. It is also an easy walk to the busier areas of town.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Respite in a Rowdy Town”
Reviews.Author: 142Travel
Reviews.Content: The Southernmost on the Beach is a beautiful resort. We stayed in a 'West lawn ocean front' room, #613, in March. It was well worth the extra money to be in a quiet section with perfect ocean views. We could open our windows and hear the waves at night. This was our first visit to Key West and we found it to be much rowdier and commercialized than expected so it was nice to sit on the veranda at night with peace & quiet. The west lawn rooms have a shared veranda but we never had a problem with open chairs right outside our room. The beach at the resort is a public beach which filled up quickly while we were there. We spent more time at Ft Zachary Taylor beach which was prettier and less crowded, albeit a rocky shore. Parking could be a challenge at the resort at night but we eventually always found a spot, even if it was a distance from our building. The Southernmost resort is at the foot of Duval so you can easily walk or bike to restaurants, shopping, and the Southernmost Point. There is a great little Cuban cafe across the street, "Ana's". She serves great Cuban coffee & sandwiches.

Reviews.Title: “A++”
Reviews.Author: jessdallas
Reviews.Content: Family travel for 11 persons three children under the age of 5. Everything about this hotel is fantastic the food at the restaurant right by the beach is yummy and the drinks/cocktails are made with real fruit. The staff was always helpful and ready to answer questions. Go for a walk and be ready to be amused by the galleries and shops. Another great restaurant for anytime is banana cafe on Duval st short walk from the hotel. The beach is not breath taking, I 've seen better!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic!”
Reviews.Author: fivestartraveler2008
Reviews.Content: WOW, exceeded my lofty expectations. One of the cleanest rooms I have ever seen. Given the fact that the room was being turned over spring break week, amazes me even more.Felt like the room was renovated yesterday. From the front desk to the pool. All staff were extremely friendly and eager to assist. Great location on the "quiet" side of Duval. Its only a mile walk to the other end or a 2 minute cab. We rented scooters directly across from the hotel for the entire weekend. Was cheaper than a one way pedi cab on duval...and heck of a lot of fun!!!! The beach at the property is one of the nicest downtown and offers an excellent beach bar/restaurant. All the positive reviews are spot on. The property is beautiful, relaxing and offers more than you would ever need chill out in the Keys.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful place to stay in Key West”
Reviews.Author: JennieDGB
Reviews.Content: The Southernmost on the Beach in Key West is a beautiful facility. It is located one block from the southernmost point in the United States. It is at the end of Duval street where all the action is, restaurants, shops, etc. The other end of Duval Street is where the cruise liners land and 3.000 people debark daily. It is much too busy to want to stay there. The hotel has pool with a bar and it does get busy at times, but we always found chairs together. It has an al fresco restaurant which has great food. Our room was the bet part. It was spacious, with a king size bed, lots of storage space and a bathroom with a large walk-in shower. There was a balconey off the room. We were very happy with the room.

Reviews.Title: “Everyone is happy at the Southernmost”
Reviews.Author: M00ey
Reviews.Content: Relazation sets in quickly at the Southernmost. The rooms are spectacular and the amenities are second to none. Folks who are staying there as well as the help all have a smile on their faces. Great pools, great food & a great shore bar make it easy to stay at home. Don't miss the sunset music set while sitting in the adirondack chairs.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful place to stay in Key West! Highly Recommend it!”
Reviews.Author: estrnmountain
Reviews.Content: My wife and I recently stayed at Southern Most on the Beach and we had a wonderful stay! Let me start with the hotel grounds. They are beautiful! the courtyards between the buildings are all very well manicured and maintained, as well as the lawns surrounding the buildings. The fact that the hotel has it's own private beach, and it right next to a small public beach make it a great place to be if you are looking for beach time. If you are a pool person, there are definitely enough pools on the grounds to choose from. If you want a fun lively pool with a pool bar, they have it. If you want a more quiet pool for adults only, they have it, and all are extremely clean and well maintained. Although we spent our entire days out and about on the island, we did take advantage of the hammocks right by the beach at night when we got back to the hotel and really had a relaxing time by the beach with the great breezes. The hotel is in a great location. It is a convenient walk to the Hemingway House and to a number of restaurants. It is at the opposite end of Duval Street, away from the majority of the bars, so it is in a very quiet part of the island. Granted, it is a bit of a walk to get to Mallory Square or to the pier, but it's not a bad walk at all, and walking Duval Street is a very fun experience, in fact walking all over the island is a great experience. We had thought about renting an electric car or a scooter, but we never did and both of us were glad we didn't because walking the island really gives you a great flavor and adds to the experience of Key West. If you are not into walking, don't worry because therer are plenty of places to rent bikes, carts, scooters, etc, all in very close proximity to the hotel. The staff at the hotel was superb! They were all very nice and helpful, and all very genuine. We never once felt like they were forced to be nice because of tourism. The folks that work there really do seem to enjoy working there, and it shows in all they do. We were always greeted with a hello, good morning, good afternoon, etc, by every one we came in contact with. I would like to call special attention to the concierge staff, especially Bernice. She was so nice and so helpful in giving us ideas, answering questions and making dinner reservations for us. Definitely check out Hot Tin Roof and Cafe Sole. Both were excellent for dinner, and recommendations from Bernice. Our room was very spacious and beautiful. We had a partial ocean view, with a great balcony. The room was very clean and the bed was so very comfortable. After spending a full day out and about, it was so nice to come back to the room for a great night sleep. One of the days we were there, we decided to go to the Southernmost Cafe for Happy Hour. It's right on the beach and it's a great tiki type bar. The happy hour is really good for drinks, although the appetizers on the happy hour menu were just ok. The next time we are there, I would just opt for drinks during happy hour and not get any food. I would definitely recommend it for a fun place to have some drinks and people watch. You will see a lot of different people there and it makes it a fun place to hang out. I can't comment on the food at the restaurants, other than just the appetizers at happy hour, which I mentioned above. We were up early and went out for breakfast (check out Pepe's, across from A&B Marina. Don't let the looks fool you. The food is great!) and we spent most of the days out around the island, so we didn't partake of any food at Southernmost. In closing, I would highly recommend Southernmost on the Beach. It's not cheap, but then again the majority of the lodging options in Key West are not cheap, but Southernmost is definitely worth the price! It's a piece of paradise and you will enjoy it very much! To all the staff at Southernmost on the Beach, we thank you for a wonderful stay! We will definitely be back!

Reviews.Title: “The best!”
Reviews.Author: Katypears
Reviews.Content: This hotel is fantastic! Te activities director, Boomer, makes every day fun an different- he's the man!! I highly recommend this entire experience we've had here. We will most definitely be coming back!

Reviews.Title: “Going Back next year”
Reviews.Author: lrod325
Reviews.Content: The SMOTB is one of the best resorts I have ever stayed at. The staff is unbelievable. I read the reviews before I went and thought how good could it be but they were all true. Tyler and Heather at the Pool were amazing they kept us supplied with drinks and beach chairs and so friendly. The Concierge was awesome. The front desk amazing. The place clean, clean, clean, I will never stay anywhere else.. A must stay in Key West! Looking forward to going back next year

Reviews.Title: “Bloody Marys”
Reviews.Author: Beachbottom
Reviews.Content: The morning bloody Marys POOL side are beyond real ! Spicy cocktail beans :)

Reviews.Title: “The Happiest Place on Earth (for a Canadian in March)”
Reviews.Author: Heather S
Reviews.Content: My husband and I celebrated our anniversary at SOTB in early march. We stayed a week and wish we could have stayed a lot longer. We had been to Key West two years ago and stayed at a different resort, so we consulted Trip Advisor for an alternate choice. We agree with all the great reviews. Our room (623) had a 180 degree view of the ocean, contemporary decor, a fabulous bed and easy access to the pool and restaurant. We did not meet a single staff member anywhere in the complex that was not friendly, enthusiastic and helpful. Genuinely so. The spa staff was great too and I had one of the best spa massages I have ever had (and believe me, I have had more than a few) Ask for Kelly. Her treatments are spot on. The food in the restaurant was well-priced and delicious and the beach and pool had plenty of chairs. No one went without a seat. The pool staff was excellent. Our glasses were never empty and dry towels appeared out of nowhere. What else is there to say? We wanted a relaxing beach vacation and we got everything we asked for and more. We will definitely return.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Renny4
Reviews.Content: I recently came back from a visit to Key West. My husband and I went with another couple. We really enjoyed our stay! Everything was perfect! The staff was friendly, efficient and knowledgable. Everyone goes out of their way to make sure you are having a good time and have everything you need. We booked too late to get an ocean front room so we settled for the distant ocean view. You really can see the ocean, even from your bed! The Southernmost Cafe has wonderful food! The cornbeef hash at breakfast was the best we'd ever had! The hotel is on the quiet end of Duval St, but the walk to Mallory Square is easy. There are so many shops, galleries and of course bars on the way you hardly notice you've walked over a mile!

Reviews.Title: “Lovely First Trip to Key West”
Reviews.Author: SDLambros
Reviews.Content: Just spent a long weekend celebrating our 20th Wedding Anniversary at Southernmost on the Beach. We splurged on an oceanfront room and it was well worth it. Beautiful view from our bed through windows and french doors on two sides of the room and a large balcony that wrapped around. At this time of year, we could enjoy the sunrise and the sunset from our balcony - which we did daily! The room was well-appointed and the staff surprised us with a bottle of champagne for our celebration. We made use of the small refrigerator with beverages and leftover foods and were pleasantly surprised by bottled water supplied by the hotel at no charge. This hotel is at the quiet end of Duvall - just what we wanted. We rented scooters for our stay and that allowed us to explore and get to the noisy areas when we wanted that! Duvall is only 1 mile long and we enjoyed that walk many times at all hours of the day. We enjoyed the on-property restaurant, Southernmost Beach Cafe, and ate there daily. The blackened shrimp wrap was excellent and the risotto special on the dinner menu (shrimp and mushroom) was a favorite. We also enjoyed the lobster cakes on the dinner menu - those leftovers were terrific cold the next day at lunch! The drinks were nothing special and one order of conch fritters were uncooked and mushy on the inside, but the food was well worth the price. And the view while dining can't be beat! The beach is tiny and the pools are as well. However, there didn't seem to be an issue finding a chair or hammock during this sold-out weekend. If you enjoy history, definitely check out the Ernest Hemingway House - was worth the admission cost. We are already trying to figure out how to leave the three teens home for another trip to Southernmost.

Reviews.Title: “First time to Key West..not disappointed”
Reviews.Author: Diane H
Reviews.Content: My husband, 20 yr and 16 yr old and I along with my sister and her two sons, 11 and 16 came to Key West for the first time. We choose SMOTB mostly due to the comments on Trip Advisor and we were not disappointed. Before we left we set up deep sea fishing with the hotel and they were pleasant and very helpful. Our stay was great. The hotel is clean and modern. Our room was a partial view, however the view was enough for us to relax on the balcony and enjoy the ocean scene. The rooms are pretty accurate compared to the pictures on the website. The maids were excellent in cleaning as we are very messy (we tipped everyone and then forgot to tip the maids when we left) and they deserved it and I felt bad about that. The pier was great to watch the sunset and it was not a disappointment. We swam in the pool one night and although not huge was adequate and quiet, which we appreciated. All the rooms and balconies are non-smoking which is great, but there are smoker stations for those of us who may want to smoke which was appreciated. SMOTB is on the quiet end of Duvall, which we wanted, yet it is right there to enjoy. We walked from the hotel to the other end and it doesn't take long at all. Our last day we rented bikes from the hotel (you really don't need a rental unless you are venturing farther away) and rode them to the state park on the advice of the concierge. The wind was strong so the ocean was wavy, but the kids had a great time in the water. I would suggest water shoes though. The concierge was great in any questions you had, from where to eat to things to do and both the gals we worked with were friendly and helpful. The front desk was also friendly and polite and available when my sister couldn't get there until after midnight. Then when her door was sticking, someone came immediately to get it open even at that time of night. You can tell the hotel takes pride in their faciliites and cares about getting repeat guests.. Also the beach cafe was great and the hostess remembered us from two days prior and greeted us, which was nice. We did not do any of the activies the hotel plans, however it seemed like those that did were having a great time. Our only thing was there wasn't a microwave in the rooms so we could heat leftovers if we wanted them, but I found out that we could have asked and they would have tried to find one for us. So if you have a problem, just ask, it may get resolved. Overall we loved the hotel and the area and would make this our go to place when visiting the area again.

Reviews.Title: “Slice of Paradise”
Reviews.Author: Joan L
Reviews.Content: We've stayed at the Southernmost on the Beach three years in a row and plan to go back again. It offers a luxurious yet comfortable atmosphere and is a slice of Paradise. It is the best place to stay in Key West.

Reviews.Title: “Looking forward to going Back”
Reviews.Author: bckathleen1982
Reviews.Content: My husband and I spent four nights, wish it could have been longer. The propertly is very well kept, the staff is very helpful and friendly. The room is decorated nicely with a very nice bathroom and the balcony with partial ocean view is better than you would expect. Pool and beach are smaller than they appear on the website but are still very adequate - always got a chair. I liked the location because it is the quiet end of Duval. Can walk to the party side but not living in it.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous hotel, fabulous staff”
Reviews.Author: ScooterSeattle1
Reviews.Content: Stayed here over President's Day week with my wife and 15yo daughter. Spent the first night at the Southernmost Hotel as no rooms were available here and then 3 nights at the Southernmost on the Beach. All 3 of us enjoyed both hotels very much. We had a 2nd floor balcony partial view room at Southernmost on the Beach. Don't be fooled by 'partial view,' the view was spectacular. And the room was wonderful; comfortable beds and a really nice bathroom & large shower (no tub). The concierge was really helpful; through her we rented hotel-owned bikes, arranged a snorkel trip to the barrier reef (where a 6' shark swam right past, completely ignoring us) and found a really good non-touristy seafood place on Stock Island. Every staff person we dealt with was nice and helpful and we were made to feel very welcome. This was my first time in Key West in 30 years and the rest of the family had never been, but by day 2 we were talking about coming back next year. If we do, we'll definitely stay here again. My only qualm about writing such a positive (but true) review is that it'll be sold out next time we want to come. If you fly into Key West, don't rent a car, you won't need it. Rent bikes from the hotel instead, it's an easy ride almost anywhere you'll want to go.

Reviews.Title: “Great , updated rooms.”
Reviews.Author: Ilovemaineusa
Reviews.Content: If you want to be on the quiet end of duval street, this is the place to be. Very quiet, nice and literally the end of duval st. Ask for a room with an ocean view. Obviously the best rooms are the oceanfront ones. Very little chairs outside , seemed to be a chore to find a seat in the sun. Not sure if I would return, but it is a very nice place.

Reviews.Title: “A perfect spot on the quiet end of Duval St!”
Reviews.Author: DonKnox25
Reviews.Content: We chose the Southernmost on the Beach for our first trip to Key West based on Trip Advisor reviews and we were not disappointed. Once again Trip Advisor showed us the way! The facilities were perfect - attractive and well maintained. Although the rooms were a bit small they freshly decorated and so sophisticated and clean. With 3 pools there was something for everyone. We were delighted to be able to spend our time at the adult only "Tranquility" pool. Although the Southernmost is at the quiet end of Duval St it is never a far walk to anywhere. We loved it and would definitely return again!

Reviews.Title: “A Totally Perfect Vacation Experience”
Reviews.Author: tripledecks
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Southernmost on the Beach from Feb. 20th through the 24th (my husband and I and our 12 year old son). The staff at every level of this resort are there to serve your every need. We have been to many 5-star resorts in the Caribbean and have never had such good service as at the Southernmost. Everyone from the front desk, the pool and beach staff and restaurant staff are friendly, helpful and super helpful. The views are absolutely gorgeous and the pool was huge and never felt crowded. Our son loved the sunset festival every night at the other end of the island at Mallory Square. So, we got great exercise every day walking the 3 miles each day back and forth and stopping at a different restaurant on Duval Street every night on the way back. We also highly recommend the 90-minuted guided jet ski tour offered at the dock and we also parasailed. The Southernmost concierge can book everything and gave us good suggestions. We loved walking down to Mallory Square, but especially loved coming back to the quieter side of the island at the Southernmost, especially if you have children. I would highly recommend this resort and we will be back!!!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderfully accommodating for ADA needs....”
Reviews.Author: HersheyBid
Reviews.Content: This setting works beautifully for me since I travel mostly in a portable scooter. Minimal steps, elevators to the rooms, very attentive front desk staff (they made sure our room worked for my needs and the bell man actually helped us unpack and assemble my scooter. Restaurant staff was equally accommodating and pointed best route for access since I can't go over sand. Pool staff was also attentive. No room service here, but plenty of dining options within a block or two.

Reviews.Title: “Got married on February 13th here - And we'll be back February 2013!”
Reviews.Author: AlliCurtissM
Reviews.Content: This place was AWESOME. Very accommodating! The rooms were nice and the people that worked here were wonderful. The Shores Bar was fabulous - we closed it several nights! The Southernmost Beach Cafe was also GREAT! They have awesome Happy Hours and had the best wings we've ever had! I could have eaten breakfast, lunch & dinner there, every day. We had the Southernmost Beach Cafe cater our reception & the food was FANTASTIC. (The biggest and best coconut shrimp around!) The beach and pier area are beautiful - we had our wedding on the beach and took several pictures in and around the gardens and grounds of the Hotel and Dewey House. It was perfect! We will be back next February for our one year anniversary and are very excited! The people that work within the hotel, bar and cafe are all excellent and we hope to see them again, next year! Anyone that wants a perfect destination wedding that caters to your every whim and is nothing, but beautiful - get married here!

Reviews.Title: “We loved our time here and will come back!”
Reviews.Author: Debbie H
Reviews.Content: When you first drive in you kind of think oh no, how plain it looks, maybe we made a huge mistake for the price. But you soon discover that it is sooooo worth it! Beautiful grounds and view. Fun to be had like on a cruise ship if you want it, or relax on th beach or by the pool. I so appreciated the Aqua Arobics class to burn off some of the calories from the great cafe food and drinks. We loved our short time there and will return. Dave and Debbie fromTexas

Reviews.Title: “Great place”
Reviews.Author: rafannon
Reviews.Content: I would recommend this hotel for all. The beach was wonderful. Kids would have a great time.

Reviews.Title: “Come here if you want a beach experience.”
Reviews.Author: ndlptmom54
Reviews.Content: We are currently staying at Southernmost at the Beach and love this hotel. Good sized rooms, large showers, soft linens, and a pool and white sand beach on the premises. It offers everything that many Key West hotels or inns cannot. We are staying in room 614 which we love. Every morning we have our coffee in the sunshine right out on the veranda. Wonderful! Try to get on the 2nd floor, rooms 610 - 620 for an unbelievable beach, water, and lawn view. The hotel rents single speed bikes for $55.00 per week, which is reasonable compared to other vendors. You can easily ride the island because it is so flat. The only danger is other bikes and cars! The pool has long hours and no guards. There is an adults only pool available to guests at the Southernmost Hotel across the street, but we couldn't get away from the beach and ocean. It is just too nice. The hotel is close to literally dozens of great restaurants, or you can eat at the Southernmost Cafe on the premises. This is especially convenient on your day of arrival when you are tired and still a little disoriented. We loved this property and will be back!

Reviews.Title: “Great location on quiet end of duval street”
Reviews.Author: James9900
Reviews.Content: We loved this hotel. Located on the quiet end of duval street it is away from the bustle of duval but still a short walk to all the restaurants and bars. The hotel bar on the beach has an amazing happy hour deal. We met some locals there who came to this hotel just for their happy hour deals. We would definitely return.

Reviews.Title: “First mother/daughter trip to Key West”
Reviews.Author: sweetmelissa1254
Reviews.Content: I took my mom on a trip to Key West as a thank you for all the help that she has been throughout my life (especially college!). The reason I chose Southernmost was the beach, affordability, and a room overlooking the ocean. What we found to be really special about Southernmost was the bars, daily live entertainment, relaxing atmosphere of the pools, clean beaches, and welcoming staff. The hotel is situated on the quieter side of town, yet within walking distance to the bars, restaurants, and other Duval street attractions. There is a bike/scooter rental place across from the hotel. Also very conveinant is a breakfast cafe, grocery store, and trolley stop across from the hotel. Overall we found this hotel to be in a perfect location and a great place to stay. If you choose to stay at Southernmost--we highly recommend Boomer and Allie's beer school!!

Reviews.Title: “First Key West Experience!”
Reviews.Author: Ellen F
Reviews.Content: This hotel is worth the money. It is within walking distance to everything so we didn't drive for days. The private beach was the perfect size and since there isn't beach everywhere on Key West it was just amazing to look out our window to the pool, beach and ocean. Staff at the bar and grill and in the check in area were helpful and very friendly. The concierge took us in her own car to go snorkeling because it was on her way....There is nowhere else I would stay...Great appetizer and happy hour deals in the bar/restaurant...People friendly and so laid back...Go there...Awesome beautiful rooms and we slept like babies!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect...”
Reviews.Author: Crystal R
Reviews.Content: This hotel was perfect. Rooms were modern, clean and comfortable. Hotel staff was very friendly and courteous. At the end of our stay, we requested to extend our trip by a night, and the front desk made this a very easy and pleasant transaction. They had to change us to a different room, so provided an upgrade at no additional cost. The beach and pool were spotless. Stayed here in mid April and the weather was perfect. Mid to high 80's with a light breeze. Chairs were not difficult to find on the beach- which can sometimes become an upsetting issue while vacationing. One afternoon there was a wedding on the beach near the beach cafe, which we watched from our balcony- it was beautiful! This hotel is located at the end of Duval st.; it is quiet, a moderate walk away from most of the action and shoppes. If you are interested in bar hopping, you would probably want a different hotel closer to the heart of Duval st.

Reviews.Title: “sherryandron”
Reviews.Author: sherryandron
Reviews.Content: We have stayed many places in Key West - some lovely B & B's and other high end hotels. The Southernmost on the Beach was the best - great beach areas, pool and convenient to many good restaurants and Duval St. You can walk to Mallory square. Our room overlooked the parking lot - which at first we thought might be a problem, but it was very quiet even with the windows open. It was also a very nice - big room - plenty of space in the bath and on the deck. Great staff - nice job all around.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay at the Southernmost”
Reviews.Author: haddonmom
Reviews.Content: We just spent a long weekend in Key West, and had the most amazing stay at the Southernmost on the Beach. The property is beautiful - great pool and grounds and a beach, too. Every single person we encountered at this resort was friendly and hard working. The rooms are great; we had an ocean front room and it seemed fairly new (not sure if there has been a recent renovation but everything was first rate). We even had a blender in the room! The Beach Cafe is a great spot to have lunch or a drink while lounging on the beach; and the resort provides lounge chairs for guests on the beach. The Shores Bar at the pool was great and the bartenders were awesome. The location was perfect, because we were very close to Duval St., but away from the craziness of the other end of that busy street. We walked to everything very easily and were so happy to come back to our little oasis after a day of sightseeing or a night of partying. We will definitely return to the Southernmost on the Beach!

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Trip”
Reviews.Author: suewin716
Reviews.Content: We just got back from staying 5 nights at this hotel. Everything was fantastic. Everyone that works for the hotel were friendly and professional. Our room was fantastic. We stayed in one of the ocean front rooms, but honestly we might go back and book the west lawn. They also have fantastic entertainment from the Recreation staff to the entertainment at sunset. We are sure we will be back.

Reviews.Title: “More of a resort feel”
Reviews.Author: Beachkid_8
Reviews.Content: We were here for five nights at the end of January. The rooms were very well appointed and spotless. They have daily activities that make it feel like a resort. The live entertainment at sunset is very enjoyable. Do not challenge Boomer to a hula hoop contest as he must practice his moves often.

Reviews.Title: “New Fave”
Reviews.Author: AmyandBill
Reviews.Content: We just got home and I want to go back! The rooms are clean and spacious. We had a partial ocean view, which was beautiful! I loved sitting on my balcony in the morning. Everyone who works there is friendly and helpful. Loved the beach, the pier, the pools, the bar, the food. Heather was our favorite! We will be back!

Reviews.Title: “Go for the upgrade if you can”
Reviews.Author: tussey22
Reviews.Content: We were using mileage points so we upgrade to an oceanfront room. The rooms are nicely decorated and clean. They do advertise a private beach which is an area of sand on a concrete dock where you cannot access the water. There is a public beach next to the hotel. If you are looking for an actual beach, the Reach property next door looked like it had a nice normal beach.

Reviews.Title: “BEST IN KEY WEST”
Reviews.Author: pete y
Reviews.Content: One of the finest resort hotels in Florida without the staunch snobby staff attitude. Low key atmosphere with high class feel. This is more of a couples paradise (although families are quite welcome) with privacy if you need it. Beautiful surise/sunsets views. And if you book the ocean balcony rooms, its like being on a cruise ship without the hassle of getting sea sick. Very convenient location since Duval St. ends at the door step of this hotel. Golf cart, scooter and bike rentals are right across the street. Not as hectic as the uptown hotels near Mallory Square because we like the scerenity and quietness of this place. The entire staff is great includng the bartenders at the pool and personnel at the Beach Cafe. I can go on and on but you must see for yourself. PWY

Reviews.Title: “A piece of paradise”
Reviews.Author: gonesomewherewarm
Reviews.Content: We loved this resort! All of the other Southernmost resorts are nestled around this one, so you can use the pools at any of them. This one, however, was my favorite because there is a little public beach right outside of it, and, It is located on the ocean so you will have a beautiful view if you get an ocean view room. The resort itself is located a block from the 'southernmost point' in the US. It is located on Duval St. - at the other end of 'where the activity is' (cruise ships, bars, etc.). We didn't have a problem with this. It is a walk down there, but you can rent bicycles at the hotel if you wish - which everyone does! They have daily activities which were a lot of fun. Boomer was great as far as entertainment goes. The activities we participated in were the Wine School, and the Newlywed contest - both were fun, esp. since we won the newlywed game and got a free drink :-) The pool was nice, but I didn't go in. It rained most of the days we were there, but they have a pool bar, so it was nice to sit there and have drinks and chat with other couples. The front desk and concierge were friendly and helpful, and helped us to book some water activities. The restaurant was OK. Our only complaints were the pricing was pricey (for us), and the spa was not great. We spent the money on a couples massage, and we showed up before the massage therapists did. Additionally, there is only one room in the spa - tight- not really a 'spa', and IMO, not worth the money. Other than that, we were happy with our stay and would return :-)

Reviews.Title: “Great Staff!”
Reviews.Author: BoatingVermont
Reviews.Content: Our mornings started with a wonderful welcome from Susan at the coffee area at the pool front. What a wonderful person, she always had a smile on her face and made us feel very welcome. Great way to start the day! Shelley was also an asset to the hotel, not once did she walk by without greeting with a nice smile. Heather has a lot of energy and did a great job delivering our drinks and lunches near the pool. Ok, Boomer was the activities coordinator and we had so much fun playing all the games around the pool. Who would have known I could hoolahoop, not me! He encouraged everyone and did a great job not making people feel obligated to participate. I think those spectating had as much fun watching participants. And the best bartender was Mark at the pool bar and Bill at the Restaurant Bar

Reviews.Title: “Nice Property, Nice Rooms..... choose your room carefully”
Reviews.Author: doatsea
Reviews.Content: If you're looking for a touristy destination in Key West, this is the place to go. The rooms were quite lovely, the grounds were great.... the only grief I had was the poorly designed layout. Most rooms have a view of another one of the hotel's buildings and your neighbors. So, if you go make sure you get a full view of the ocean, not a "partial view" (I was a bit disappointed with that.)

Reviews.Title: “1st Time to Key West - Enjoyed Southernmost on the Beach”
Reviews.Author: Kelly611
Reviews.Content: I would recommend this hotel to anyone. It was clean, comfortable, right on the water and I would go back if I had the chance.

Reviews.Title: “Beware of Deceptive Description of Ocean View Room”
Reviews.Author: SimpleSueHughes
Reviews.Content: The location is great & the clean, well designed rooms stand on their own- BUT- no need to trick customers into booking with deceptive description of room views. We booked directly with the hotel by phone. Requested a room with a full ocean view. The person on the phone asked if we wanted an "Ocean View" or "Partial Ocean View. Upon arrival we discovered our view was looking across a small court yard into the windows of another wing of the hotel. If we went outside on to a balcony and looked off to the side we could see a sliver of the ocean and also the guy sleeping on his bed in the room next door. The hotel's binder of TV listings displayed many channels, but the large flat screen TV only got a few channels on the list, most in analog and very grainy. The parking was difficult. None was available so they told us we had to park across the street at their other hotel, which was inconvenient for moving our luggage. We were not looking for discounts or a cheap vacation. We offered to pay the $499. rates for the actual ocean view rooms. None were available. The frustration level was understandably high for us with this vacation being spoiled, yet it was the manager that lost his cool.

Reviews.Title: “Great Experience”
Reviews.Author: Lester S
Reviews.Content: This was our first trip to Key West. We chose Southernmost on the Beach based on reviews from other travelers. We were very pleased with everything. It is very quiet and the grounds are immaculate. We will definitely stay here again. Boomer did a great job with Snorkel School.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Carol M
Reviews.Content: I have nothing but praise for this hotel! The staff were all extremely pleasant, welcoming and helpful, the room was beautiful (2 queen partial ocean view), lovely shower, comfy beds, bright and clean and a balcony with a lovely view. We ate breakfast twice and dinner once in the beach cafe and all were very good with great service and a lovely setting. The pool and beach areas are all nice with plenty of loungers and hammocks. I enjoyed the poolside musicians but they may not be to everyone's taste. We didn't take part in any of the organised aerobics, wine tastings etc. The hotel is in a great position for Key West's main activities and attractions. We rented bicycles and got easily all around the island. Free car parking and no extra resort fee or fees for wifi etc. Good wifi reception throughout the hotel, bars, pool and beach areas. We booked only 2 days before arriving and we had booked for just 3 nights. We decided we'd like to stay here for longer but sadly they couldn't accommodate us in the same room, so we moved on - otherwise would have been glad to stay! We loved Key West and, if we return, we'd certainly stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Relaxation at it's best!”
Reviews.Author: Germanvillagetravele
Reviews.Content: Sadly we just ended our annual stay here and,as always, enjoyed coming back to our Key West home. We always find something new and this year the hotel offered water aerobics. We have already booked our week for next year.

Reviews.Title: “SPLURGE FOR THE OCEANFRONT BALCONY KING”
Reviews.Author: Andrew B
Reviews.Content: My wife and I spent a long weekend in Key West in January 2012. We chose Southernmost on the Beach primarily for its location - a short walk to everything and right on the ocean. We had a fantastic 3 days and would certainly recommend this hotel to friends, with one caveat: splurge for an oceanfront balcony room - you get what you pay for. Like most waterfront hotels, the Southernmost tries to work the words "water-view" into every room type. We found that the website was not entirely clear on what the view from each room type would be, so we booked over the phone after a long, detailed discussion with two members of the reservation staff. We wanted to be absolutely sure that we got the room we wanted and didn't want to have to stand on the corner of the nightstand and lean out of a window to see the ocean. In general, we are very budget minded when choosing a place to stay in the Caribbean (which we visit frequently). We tend to avoid peak season, rent houses rather than stay in hotels, and generally try to stay away from the most developed parts of the islands we visit. In this case we splurged and it was absolutely the right decision. For a few hundred dollars more we had a view of the ocean from anywhere in the room and french doors to a large balcony only a few feet from the water. We could fall asleep to the sound of the ocean and wake up to a spectacular sunrise - in full view while laying in bed! The rest of the hotel was nice. The pool and pool bar were nice, there were plenty of lounge chairs and hammocks to use. The staff was friendly and unobtrusive. But really, for us, the room was the star. It was the reason we chose this hotel, the reason we'd go back, and the reason we'd suggest it to anyone looking for a romantic weekend away.

Reviews.Title: “Just as nice as others have posted w/ 2 exceptions”
Reviews.Author: sarapalms
Reviews.Content: We just concluded a two night stay at Southernmost on the Beach. As most everyone has already stated, lovely rooms, very clean, friendly staff, quiet location. Two exceptions, however... noisy air conditioning requiring earplugs, and the worst TV channel setup we've ever seen- requiring as many as 5 numbers to view channels, with no common sense or order whatsoever. Would we stay here again? likely, but we wanted to share these annoyances.

Reviews.Title: “VERY Nice Surprise in Key West.”
Reviews.Author: FLTravelFan
Reviews.Content: I was in Key West last weekend for their Food & Wine Festival, and stayed (for the first time) on the south end of Duval. Loved it. Southernmost on the Beach is absolutely beautiful! Newly remodeled guestrooms, and very spacious. Every staff member we encountered was friendly and helpful and very welcoming. This collection of properties has everything you could want...beachfront, great pool and tiki areas. I would encourage first-timers and loyalists to give it a try! Another great feature...FREE on-site parking, conveniently close to rooms.

Reviews.Title: “GREAT PLACE AND PEOPLE”
Reviews.Author: ohjonknee
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at this place quite a few times. It is my favorite place. Quiet, comfortable and staff has customer service in mind. Omar and Diana have always been most accomodating. Will be returning for New Years Eve Celebration. Have a number of pools, a gym, near a small beach and always a great time.

Reviews.Title: “Very enjoyable”
Reviews.Author: DMCRH
Reviews.Content: Hard to find fault with anything about the room - quiet and comfortable. Location ideal too, close enough to put everything on Duval Street within easy walking distance while far enough away from the noise. Only one glitch, an undercooked tuna main course on our last night there when we ate at the beach restaurant, but the duty manager was onto the problem quickly and offered free Key Lime Pie desserts. We'd definitely stay here again if we ever came back.

Reviews.Title: “Winter get away”
Reviews.Author: Cindy B
Reviews.Content: We stayed their bed and breakfast. Mornings were noisy getting breakfast ready. Next time we would ask to stay on the second floor or at the house next door. But great location and friendly staff. We'd go back again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: greghopkins
Reviews.Content: We spent 5 nights at the Southermost on the Beach and had a fantastic time. The whole experience was first class. The music around the pool and lawn area at sunset really made our day. The hotel is in nice quiet location but close to everything on Duval St. One of the highlights was Heather who was doing pool bar service. She really took care of us and took the time to talk with us and give us some great tips and was very helpful and fun. After a few days we felt like she was a friend, not just an employee waiting on us. Thanks Heather! This is reflective of the entire experience at the Southernmost on the Beach. We will be back with friends!

Reviews.Title: “Romantic Stay in Paradise”
Reviews.Author: TravDent
Reviews.Content: We stayed 3 nights, Jan. 19-22 at this hotel. It is without question first class in all respects. This was a romantic getaway for my wife and myself and we plan to return as soon as we can. We were greeted warmly and professionally at the desk and they were only too happy to answer our questions. The bellman was right on the spot. Our room, while not facing the water, had a second floor view of water and was very well-appointed and comfortable. The food is great at the Southernmost Cafe right there on the property. The pool is beautiful. Boomer, the activities director, is fun and enthusiastic. Enjoyed magnificent sunsets every day from the west lawn while listening to guitar music. Great drinks at the bar (a great mojito!). This was our first trip to SMOTB and first to Key West also. Just go!!

Reviews.Title: “Stop Researching, Book Here!!”
Reviews.Author: Sokalled
Reviews.Content: Had I booked earlier weâ€™dâ€™ve stayed 4 nights instead of 3 and wouldâ€™ve been able to avoid Hawks Cay Resort. Southernmost On The Beach is where you want to stay not only in Key West, but also in all of the Florida Keys. During our stay in January the sunset on the water is visible from one of their 5 hammocks, from their 40 chairs on their very own pier, from their 6 chairs live music lounging area (get there early they go fast) from 25% of the rooms, and half of the pool area. My guess is that even the pier has sunset on the water views in the summer. It is perfect. The pool is sizable, modern, and the perfect amount of warm, not too much, but enough to take an evening or brisk sunless day dip. The free parking, free Internet, and access to rental bikes on property makes doing stuff a breeze. Rent bikes immediately for the whole stay TRUST ME, donâ€™t walk at all! The ocean view balcony, the spacious, super clean, super GREEN, super comfortable and modern rooms were perfect! But, the more affordable, last to go rooms on the Northeast side where we stayed (adjacent to The Reach) are on a dead end street that ends at the ocean. Meaning great views, but trucks do turn around early in the morning. We heard them at 7 or 8 each day, but we were awake already. The other noise complaint comes from the surprise 10pm Saturday fireworks that are launched from what sounded like outside our door. Honestly, at first I thought the building was collapsing. Iâ€™m an early down early up person. I would have appreciated a heads up, we were already in bed, but would have stayed up a little longer if we knew weâ€™d be right under them! Tip: The Cuban CafÃ© right there across the street has everything, try them first and save yourself some cash! I'd also reccomend Santa Maria if you want a better beach over as much sunset on the water.

Reviews.Title: “You won't go wrong staying here!”
Reviews.Author: michel1145
Reviews.Content: We stayed in an ocean view and it was awesome! We will not stay anywhere else when we come to Key West. I won't repeat what everyone else has said in their accurate reviews. I highly recommend this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Do not stay anywhere else....Trust me - I'm Canadian”
Reviews.Author: cara_wpg
Reviews.Content: Where do I even begin? After much research, google mapping, "trip-advisoring", reading blogs and reviews, we decided on SMOTB. Right from checking in, to checking out - was amazing and everything a hotel/resort should be. I mean, I get it.... Key West itself is paradise. But when you couple it with the perfect place to stay, you could swear you're in heaven. I know I may seem dramatic, and believe me, I am in no way an experienced world-traveler hotel snob.... but SMOTB far exceeded my expectations, and they will exceed yours too. 1) Warm and hospitable staff -Dexter at the front desk and Boomer the Activities Director are the only names I remember, but I had to give them props! 2)Great food- try the Tropical Chicken Sandwich and a drink called "The Horny Parrot" 3)Comfortable beds, clean room, great hair/body products, housecoats and flat screen HD TV 4)Beautiful location and far enough away from crazy Duval street (but close enough that you won't drop dead from walking there) 5)Some things to do right on the resort (all free): Snorkeling, wine tastings, live music every night, hula-hoop contests, etc... 6) Parking is FREE... usually that isn't a big deal, but you will learn that this is a luxury in Key West! 7) Don't cheap out - stay in one of the West Lawn Ocean Front King rooms. You will not regret it. You cannot go wrong here, folks. SMOTB is a well-oiled machine and will make your trip that much better. Trip tip - Rent a bike. Its about $10/day. Cheapest and easiest way to get around. You can rent them right from SMOTB, or across the street. There is also a fantastic breakfast place called The Cuban and The Conch that serves the best cuban coffee I have ever had. We had planned on trying a new destination, but after our vacation in Key West, we will now be making it an annual trip, and SMOTB is the only place we'll stay.

Reviews.Title: “Worth the price - A step above other nearby resorts.”
Reviews.Author: pkkpkk
Reviews.Content: Room 636 by far the best spot. Hotel is at Far south end of Duval but lots of things to do in the immediate area. North Duval is way too t-shirt shops n cheap stuff anyway. Butterfly house is a must. Best Cuban coffee in town across the street at Ana's. Banana Cafe for breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “Romantic Excellence!”
Reviews.Author: Tootsie20
Reviews.Content: Approaching this Hotel via South Street immediately sets the stage in terms of pure happiness and tranquility. The Hotel is even more beautiful and perfectly maintained than online pictures reveal. At check-in the staff was marvelous, securing confidence in the experience to come. Important point - stay anywhere in Key West and you are surrounded by water - within a short walk. So, since you are likely to only sleep (etc) and shower in your room, choose the cheapest version. I wouldnt pay for the view. You won't see it in the dark! We chose a partial ocean view in building A on the second floor. It has a small balcony. The room was modern, well apointed, and oh my GOD the beds were heavenly! be aware however, the ocean view is UBER partial....but who cares? We enjoyed the beach - like most places in the Keys the beach is manufactured with sea wall protection. This is not a bad thing folks. You are guaranteed privacy! At this location there is a public beach right next door that fits the bill nicely if you are in the mood for an ocean swim. The lawn area faces West and this is where the sunset entertainment takes place between 4 and sunset. In January the sun sets at about 6, so we had a few drinks, listened to the talented C.W. Colt and then took a nice walk up Duval Street to choose a dinner location. We also enjoyed the SPA. I was attened to in the cabana on the beach, my wife in the spa. Once again, a terrific experience. The Hotel operates a Cafe on the public beach as well. The food is excellent and upon check in you will get some value for dinner in the way of a special coupon. We enjoyed breakfast at the bar and lunch as well. The Mount Gay rum and Mango frozen daquiri was to die for. Try it! Upon check out we reflected on the quiet evenings and quiet room, the comfort and luxurious surroundings, the romantic feel, the pools (there are three - and one of them is for adults only), the entertainment, the service and all - and decided this was our place - our place for all future visits to Cayo Huest! Note: If you and yours love the night life find a place closer to the Piers at Front and Duval streets. This end of the key is quiet and feel relatively "local".

Reviews.Title: “Great Resort”
Reviews.Author: Shanearn
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here on the 1st of January. Being the Holiday Season the prices were through the roof, but then again so was everywhere in Key West. ($400+ per night was typical). This Hotel/Resort is in a perfect location and includes 3 swimming pools, a private beach and many other facilities. The staff were all very friendly and helpful, even though they must have been exhausted after dealing with so many tourists during one of the busiest times of the year. The rooms are average and surprisingly still using very old CRT TV's, not new LCD's as almost everywhere else. We had a great time here and will certainly stay again.

Reviews.Title: “What a terrific place”
Reviews.Author: JulieE_Traveler
Reviews.Content: My husband and I went down to Key West along with our 1-yr old daughter for the long weekend. Many people have told us they thought it was an odd place to take a 1-year old, we were just looking for a weekend away in a warm place in january, so didn't really care. We stayed at the southernmost on the beach for 2 nights and wow, what a pleasure it was! Everything was simply perfect, cannot think of a single bad thing! We got to check-in a little early: though our room wasn't ready when we got there (it was noon), Derek called us 90 minutes later, giving us just enough time for lunch and a little walking! We stayed in an ocean front balcony king - very nice, clean, lovely smell and top floors (there is an elevator) - so peaceful. There are only two rooms on the top floor, so that makes sense, but still. The most important and impressive thing at this hotel is how nice everyone was, 100% service oriented, but not in a distant, business way. I cannot tell you what a difference it makes! The other very nice thing is there is no fee for anything there. I mean, clearly, you will pay for food and drinks, but no fee for parking, internet, towels, beach/pool chairs. In addition, there is a beach just outside the property ("Southernmost beach cafe") and a little corner of sand on property, right next to a pier. So sweet. I am not sure whether we will go back to Key West, we like to try different places, but we would for sure return there if we did. It's away from the busy part of the street, but still extremely convenient to everything!

Reviews.Title: “Nice southern location”
Reviews.Author: Ken W
Reviews.Content: A bit of a walk to the northern 'touristy' part of the island, but still plenty to do and see nearby....it has a beautiful beach and restaurant overlooking the ocean as well....very accomodating as we had to shift dates around due to weather issues....overall nice stay, friendly and helpful staff....

Reviews.Title: “Great Views and a Great Bartender!!!!”
Reviews.Author: PDizzle_11
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Southernmost hotel for my buddy's bachelor party. It is a great Hotel. We came over to the bar to take in some of the gret views and ended up staying the entire day. Fantastic views, great service, and a GREAT BARTENDER named Julia really knows how to keep the party going. She was fun, friendly, and made some of the best Ship Wrecked drinks ever!!! If you have never had one you must order one at the beach bar. They are amazing and will definitely keep the party lively. If you want a fun relaxing time with great views make sure you book a room at the Southernmost Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Blissful! Modern, spacious interior, beautiful view and grounds, good service”
Reviews.Author: sweetpea1283
Reviews.Content: Just got back from a 3 night long weekend stay. We had 4 ladies for a "girls trip" staying in a 2 queen room with a partial ocean view. It was great. Sitting on the balcony or from the bed closest to the window was a fantastic view of the water and the beautiful courtyard between the buildings (we were in building A on the second floor). There were plenty of beautiful places to lounge and relax (the waterfront sandy area by our building and the side lawn with chairs & hammocks, the waterfront pool area...) The food at the pool (the restaurant) was fantastic, service was hit or miss and sometimes involved waiting for food but drinks were prompt and tasty. The staff was all very friendly and helpful. Great home base if you just want to relax and enjoy the ambiance, and within walking distance of Duval Street and the bars, shops, and restaurants if you want to get out and soak up some Key West experiences. As far as the room itself it was spacious and very comfortable for 4, large bathroom and great balcony.

Reviews.Title: “Incredible view! Great location!”
Reviews.Author: travelchick39
Reviews.Content: To be fair, we stayed in what has to be the best room on the property, room 739. The totally private balcony had double doors that opened to the most magnificent view of the ocean. Everything about the room was great and exceptionally clean. It is pricey, but worth the splurge. Slept every night with the doors open to the sound of waves and ocean breezes. Highly recommend!

Reviews.Title: “Awesome place for a special occasion!”
Reviews.Author: famllylovestotravel
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for our 20th anniversary. It was the perfect place to celebrate our anniversary! We stayed in a west lawn room on the second floor. Ask for the second floor, the views are better. I didn't see an elevator so that might bother some people but it was fine for us. The balconies are not private but we never had a problem finding a place to sit. Views of the ocean, beach, and lawn are great. There is a small public beach on the property, but there are plenty of other places to catch some sun or admire the view. My favorite place was the lawn. Staff was great, always had a smile and always helpful, couldn't ask for more . Rooms are small but great, everything you would need. Rooms are pricey, but worth it for a special occasion. On the quiet end of Duvall street, I thought it was a little far to walk all the way to Mallory Square but hotel has bikes to rent which made the trip a breeze , no need for a car. Live music by the pool and on the lawn on some days. I hope to be able to go back again some day.

Reviews.Title: “serene - with sunrises and sunsets”
Reviews.Author: Scrabblebabe
Reviews.Content: We stayed here during Christmas week -- and it was calming and lovely - exactly what we needed after a rather chaotic year in our personal lives. The hotel is just a few minutes' walk from the very "lively" restaurants, bars, etc., and we loved being able to enjoy both the activity and the quiet of Old Town, away from the cruise ships. Our spacious water-view (not waterfront) room had a balcony with sunrises, a refrigerator, no bathtub but great shower and one of the best beds we've slept on away from home. The hotel has a nice pool and several days musicians played at the pool - sometimes it was good, sometimes it was a little disquieting. We used the covered porch on the hotel's property next door (LaMer?) for Scrabble because our own balcony was too windy. We were surprised that the hotel does not have beach for swimming on site but, rather, is next door to a public beach that was not great. Free parking under the building but we didn't have a car so we walked everywhere. My husband rented a bike and tooled around town checking out the absolutely wonderful outdoor Christmas decorations on most of the houses. Such a surprise and such a sight! . Just down the street is the marker for the most southern point and people line up all day long to take pictures. Hint: if you are interested in visiting this landmark, go after the cruise ships are gone, late afternoon, and you won't have a wait at all. We'd go back to the SMOB in a flash!

Reviews.Title: “You Will Be Pleased”
Reviews.Author: coralorchid
Reviews.Content: All in all, this is a great hotel in a great location. Close to everything and yet still feels quiet and not too crazy. Efficient and friendly service, well-appointed rooms (casual island elegance is how I would describe it), decent food at the restaurants (decent, not spectacular, although the conch fritters at the pool bar were the best I've had in a while -- lots of conch and a little spicy, but very light and airy inside with a nice crispy outside). We liked the energy efficiency feature where you have to stick your key card in a slot by the door while you're in the room to keep the electricity running. When you leave the room, it cycles off and goes into efficiency mode, thus saving energy. Don't expect too much from the "private beach" -- some sand between the hotel and a sea wall. I have only two *tiny* complaints. First... why no room service? I get it that the restaurant is a bit of a hike to the rooms (past the pool, then past a stretch of sand), but it would be a nice addition if it could be managed. Second, like most hotels, they advertise that if you want to "help save the environment" you can reduce the amount of water the hotel uses by leaving your towels hanging up, which will indicate that you want to reuse your towels. Putting them on the floor indicates that you want them to be laundered. But our housekeepers took the towels every single day for 4 days despite the fact that we left them hanging up.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel for Special Occasion”
Reviews.Author: Honeymoon1107
Reviews.Content: This is a great hotel located on the quiet end of Duval St. The Westlawn rooms have great Sunset view and they have nightly live music 2 hours prior to sunset so you can enjoy the music and watch the sunset right in your rooms or right outside your rooms. The happy hours everyday from 4-7pm is great bargain! The only thing is this hotel is a bit far from the Mallory Square and busy downtown area, it's about half an hour walk each way. Overall, I would recommend this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “A slice of heaven”
Reviews.Author: Stephanie K
Reviews.Content: Well worth the drive and the money. My husband and I stayed in a king-size west ocean view and I didn't want to leave. Room was clean and the front office staff went out of their way to help our friends with a mix up in the reservations. The hotel is off the beaten path but close enough to walk to the main strip. Can't wait to return.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel for a short break.”
Reviews.Author: Shamrock784
Reviews.Content: The hotel was beautiful, quiet and in a great location. One of the great things was that you could use the facilities of the other Southernmost hotels nearby if you needed to. They were all gorgeous and done up for the Christmas Festive season. We dined in the hotels restaurant on the beach, that was a great experience, reasonably priced food with great service, as was the pool bar - great service. Easy walking distance to shops and activities, I think the thing to do in Key West in just walk and enjoy the atmosphere, it's very different to anywhere else. Chilled out. The beach was a little disappointing, we thought that it was a snorkel destination but that wasn't to be, more research next time. Not the hotels fault. Rooms beautifully appointed, comfy beds, great bathroom with lots of lovely ammenties ,lovely views. Pool area great, everything was so clean and well looked after. The drive to key west was beautiful, it pays to stop a couple of time and investigate what there is on offer. We found some great spots the couple of time we stopped. There is ample parking at the resort and once there you don't really need to take the car out again. We filled in our couple of days and probably could have spent more time at Kay West. It was the most expensive hotel of our whole trip, but I think most of Key West is expensive. The southernmost Hotel belonging to the same group is a cheaper alternative and looked lovely too. I would definitely recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing!”
Reviews.Author: Bradt4
Reviews.Content: We stayed for our wedding and the experience was top notch. First, we got a newly renovated room. The staff was so helpful and the pool bar was first class. Laundry service, consierege, and fitness room all great ammenitites. The wedding on the private beach was perfect. We cannot wait to come back!

Reviews.Title: “Location,Location,Location”
Reviews.Author: Cedward
Reviews.Content: From the lobby to the stone paved walkways around the 3 pools overlooking the Atlantic Ocean on the first floor was beauiful. We were serenaded by the sounds of Adrienne a local musician outside our door that night and had to watch the rest of her show even as the cold front came thru people stayed to listen to this island girl sing. Food at the Pineapple pool was perfect and friendly bartender Johny B kept us in stitches. Wonderful place to stay!

Reviews.Title: “Best place to stay in Key West!”
Reviews.Author: DietCop
Reviews.Content: The hotel was beautiful, quiet and best location. It's on the quieter end of Key West but within walking distance to everything. Great place to watch the sunset, get a drink or relax. I would recommend this hotel and stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “A beautiful, perfect location”
Reviews.Author: melovetravel123
Reviews.Content: My husband and I LOVED staying here during the last week of December. We had a very quiet room on the first floor and we could see the ocean. Outside our room, on the grass, a musician played each day close to sunset. We relaxed on the private beach, swam in the pool, and ate two relaxing meals at the hotel's restaurant on the beach. The staff was very friendly and helpful. Because of the great location, we only used our car once during the week, and that was when we drove to the Westin Hotel to park and take a boat to the gorgeous Sunset Key restaurant. Going to Key West was one of my favorite vacations, and staying at the Southernmost was a big part of it.

Reviews.Title: “A-MAZ-ING!!!!”
Reviews.Author: thehardages
Reviews.Content: This was our first time to Key West, and it was beautiful! The history and character of the place alone is very cool. Each part of the property differs a little from the other. It is one of like 2 places that has actual beach (since most of the key drops off into the ocean). The restaurant on the property had excellent, decent priced food and a superb happy hour special. Of course, it's not a cheap hotel, so don't look to enjoy this place and be saving your pennies. We splurged for a special occasion here, and it was well worth it!

Reviews.Title: “Great stay!”
Reviews.Author: ed e
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the hotel for a week over the holidays. The staff was friendly from the start. Great looking hotel from the lobby to the rooms. Having activities like "Wine School" was definantly a time filler worth while, had a blast! There was also a female musician on the West Lawn the last monday we were there that should have been house music all week! Rooms were kept clean and the property was kept immaculant with beautiful landscape and cool on the beach feel all around!

Reviews.Title: “Have fun with BOOMER at Southern Most”
Reviews.Author: Tim C
Reviews.Content: Southernmost Hotel Collection is the best in Key West . Boomer is in charge of guest activities and he is a blast... from Hool-hoop contest, scuba diving and beer school .... you will have fun and relax there.

Reviews.Title: “Great New Year's Eve Stay”
Reviews.Author: memcdBrooklyn
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Southernmost on the Beach for four days over New Year's eve and had a great experience. The rooms are spacious and comfortable, the property is beautiful, and you can't beat the location. Both the beach and the town (Duval Street) are easily accessible. The hotel offers lots of activities and plenty of space for quiet relaxation. The staff was very friendly and helpful. We had a great vacation.

Reviews.Title: “Free upgrade from southernmost. Super hotel”
Reviews.Author: pingosvihus
Reviews.Content: We stayed a week i december and had booked the southernmost. When checking in we got a free upgrade to sthm on the beach with fantastic beachview! So very good value for money. Nice rooms, pool area and beach. The beach and poolguys and rest of staff very friendly. Very very nice hotel. PLeased. Key west was fantastic for both the kids and us. Think sthm on beach is one of best choice if travelling with kids

Reviews.Title: “ALMOST worth the extra money over New Year's"”
Reviews.Author: lisab4498
Reviews.Content: Never in a million years would I have thought I would have paid as much as we did for an oceanfront room over the New Year's Eve holiday....but we did and it was incredible! It was fantastic to wake up to the sound of the waves rolling in, or walking out our door to nightly live entertainment on the West lawn, or simply walking outnour door and sitting in the adirondack chairs outside our room on the lawn! Was fabulous!!! We were in from 518, and had a perfect view. You need to be careful with some of the first floor rooms, so that you're not facing one of the stairways (as 515/516) were. The Shores pool bar was great too, with awesome drinks and attentive service. Still not convinced of the total value, but with it being the holiday.....I get it. The walk all of the way tothe other side of duval street was a bit of a hke; although we seemed to do it multiple times a day! Would definitely visit again!

Reviews.Title: “SMOB Knocks it out of the park....again!!”
Reviews.Author: Anne R
Reviews.Content: We stayed at SMOB Dec 13 - 20, 2011. We've been staying at the Southernmost every year since our first visit to Key West in 1998. Every year we have stayed at either SMOB, LaMer and Dewey, except for when the massive renovation was taking place - when SMOB expanded the beach property onto what was formerly known as Atlantic Shores. We love the beautiful property and all of the amenities and also love the quiet atmosphere. The staff is wonderful and we were very impressed with all of the activities and events that Southermost makes available to their guests daily. We're live music aficiandos so the daily live music at the pool as well as at sunset was a big hit with us. We'll definitely be back to visit the Southernmost!

Reviews.Title: “Paradise Found!”
Reviews.Author: travel4now
Reviews.Content: This was our first time visiting Key West and loved the Southernmost. The room was large and lovely with plenty of room for a family of four. The pool and waterfront area had plenty of chairs and perfectly placed hammocks overlooking the ocean. Boomer does a great job as activity director. We took advantage of the complimentary snorkeling, wine school, games and listening to the various musicians. This is also a great location to view the sunsets. Thanks again to Southernmost for a great vacation!

Reviews.Title: “Definitely the wow factor!”
Reviews.Author: ton_amie
Reviews.Content: This hotel exceeded our expectations, and it truly made our Key West vacation a memorable one. We loved everything about this hotel. It's super clean, modern, and well-maintained. We really enjoyed the free parking which is conveniently located on the ground floor of the hotel. We were in building B, on the third floor, a king bed with an ocean view, for two nights last week. Yes, we splurged, but it was so worth every penny.The view of the ocean was magical, and the room was perfect. Our room was not near the pools or the beach, so it was rather quiet and away from much of the outdoor activity...we loved that. We especially enjoyed the trolley stop across the street from the hotel. We bought our tickets at the shop next to the trolley stop, and we hopped on the trolley three different times in two days. Keep in mind that each ticket is good for two days. The front desk of the hotel was extremely helpful..always there to answer questions and give advice. One afternoon, we ate at the hotel's Southernmost Cafe on the beach, and the food was delicious and priced reasonably too. We highly recommend this hotel! If you are looking for a beautiful view, and you want to be on the "quiet side" of the island, yet still be close to Duval Street, then this is the place for you. We wouldn't stay anywhere else.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and view”
Reviews.Author: ldarch
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at Southernmost on the beach in December. The property is well cared for, the grounds are lovely, the staff helpful. We started each day at the Southernmost Beach Cafe for breakfast, where every person from the hostess to servers and runners were exceptionally friendly and helpful. Good food as well. We rented bikes right at the hotel and they were very reasonable. The rooms were clean and well equipped and we had a courtyard facing balcony from which we could easily see the ocean, even though it was billed as a "partial view" room. The location is a little far from the action but still a reasonably walkable distance to Mallory Square for a healthy person. That also makes for quiet nights. Overall a good stay and we would recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel!”
Reviews.Author: 14WarmWeather
Reviews.Content: Friendly staff. Excellent service. Spacious accommodations. Shower has plenty of room for two including a bench to sit on or place toiletries. Beautiful grounds right on the beach overlooking the Atlantic. Very comfortable bed. Too soft pillows, but it was fine for the week. Free bottles of water in the fridge. Loved that! The wrap around balcony was perfect for viewing the ocean, the beach, and just lounging and enjoying the ocean breeze. Most of the restaurants and activities are closer to the gulf side but there are some excellent restaurants within walking distance. I wouldn't let it deter me from staying here again. On site massage services including the option for massage on the beach. What a wonderful honeymoon.

Reviews.Title: “Great place”
Reviews.Author: kermit_11
Reviews.Content: Perfect location - on ocean and in quiet area of Duval. Staff is friendly - good atmosphere, bars, food. Place is clean. Adequate parking - can walk to most. 10 years going and will be back next year.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely AMAZING!!”
Reviews.Author: missmelissa500
Reviews.Content: We have never been to Key West before, and of course, we wanted to stay at a top notch place for just one night. I booked the Southernmost on the Beach, a basic room for one night. I was tempted to stay in at a few other hotels, but I am certainly glad we booked at the Southernmost! So we got there a few hours before check-in. Me and my husband went to the front desk and ask about checking in early. Although we weren't able to check in yet, we were given our parking pass and keys to the hotel to get to the pools and beach. So we spent the next 2 hours walking throughout the hotel, and up and down Duvall Street. When we came back to check in, we received a complimentary upgrade to a bigger room, room 301, which was an amazing surprise! The suite was absolutely amazing! Super clean, had a balcony facing the beach. It was first class ALL THE WAY! The hotel itself is literally off Duvall street, and right off the beach. It was the best of both worlds!! We didn't drive a single place, we kept our car parked and walked on Duvall Street for lunch and dinner, and spent breakfast at the restaurant/diner at the Southermost hotel. I did spent a few hours at one of the pools at the hotel. Of course I stayed at the pool next to the bar so I could have drinks while sun bathing. They had a small band playing throughout the day. The bartenders were wonderful, served some amazing drinks at decent prices. I ordered 3 drinks for under $20.00, which is a great price for a 5 star hotel. The wait staff was excellent as well. The waitstaff around the pool were very friendly and accommodating, bringing towels and picking up empty glasses. The restaurant at the hotel was on the beach, 100 feet from the water! The breakfast was amazing, and sipping my morning coffee a few feet from the beach really was the icing on the cake for me :-) We WILL return to Key West for another "mommy and daddy" night out, and we will be staying at the Southernmost on the Beach again!!!

Reviews.Title: “Loved it here!!!”
Reviews.Author: iamfromiowa
Reviews.Content: I loved the Southernmost on the Beach. Definitely be coming back again. We stayed in a room 611 on the West Lawn. Next time I would request farther down just to get a better view of the water but can't complain about anything - except wish it had a bath tub in the room. After a long hard day of sight seeing it would of been nice to come back and soak but that is a minor thing for what we had for the five nights we were there. I never slept so well before and I come home to my bed and pillow and want theirs. Julia in the Shores bar was wonderful in helping me chose a fruity drink. All staff were wonderful and asking it if we needed help and saying good morning, afternoon, and evening. Wonderful views. I can't ay enough about this place, it makes me want to go back again and again.
