Reviews.Title: “Best stay ever!”
Reviews.Author: Brian W
Reviews.Content: I surprised my wife by booking the ocean front king room. It was exactly as pictured online. The room was gorgeous, only surpassed by the view. Mike and Luis were especially helpful at the front desk, but everyone as a whole was great. Nothing was better than laying out on the hammock with my wife watching the sun rise. It was so quiet and peaceful and relaxing. I would highly recommend this hotel (and room).

Reviews.Title: “The best hotel ever!”
Reviews.Author: Lisa_SOlathe
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 5 nights for our 4th anniversary trip, and my husband and I cant imagine staying anywhere else on our future visits to Key West. We had lost baggage and had some health problems come up before our trip that we didnt think we were going to be able to take the trip. We got to the hotel and Travis and Scott working the front desk helped us with our change on rooms to accomadate our needs, and all of the staff helped us with getting our bags to us the next day. The hotel is beautiful, the pool is fantastic, teh celebration pier at sunset is awesome, teh poolside fun is great, and teh Southernmost cafe on the beach on the property is teh best. Reasonable priced excellant staff,fantastic happy hour and the BEST KEY LIME PIE ever. If you take our advice, you should stay here for sure. I forgot to mention the housekeeping is great friendly and very helpful.

Reviews.Title: “You get what you pay for :) $$$$=nice place!!!”
Reviews.Author: DWFRN
Reviews.Content: This place was absolutely top-notch!! Its located in walking distance to the famous Duval street (opposite end of the street of sloppy Joes) so it was nice and quiet. We got a West Lawn Ocean View Room on the 2nd floor. It was newly remodeled with a very nice King size bed, flat screen TV, big bay window over looking the ocean with a bench sitting area in front of it, i-phone radio docking. The room is small but is so beautiful, cozy, modern and immaculate!!! Which was all we needed. We had a view of the South Beach Cafe located on BEAUTIFUL South Beach, which has great breakfast/happy hour specials. The pool is was simple but located right next to the bar and a has perfect view of South Beach. The staff at the bar were very nice and the service was excellent!! The only hang up was when I checked in: I booked directly with the Hotel staring at the West Lawn Rooms on their web site along with their staff member looking while I was booking to affirm I was booking the right room(West Lawn Ocean view Room) in the right location (2nd floor Over looking the ocean). Instead when I arrived they gave me a room on the 2nd floor in front of the pool stating that room was classified as a West Lawn Room. I explained that I wanted the room that I booked or I'd stay in that room for a reduced rate. The "Gentleman" than attempted to check me in for 15 minutes and stated there was nothing he could do. The Manager walked by noticing the heated discussion taking place and nicely/professionally stepped in, had us checked into the correct room the room 5 minutes!!!! She apologized and gave us 2 free drinks at the bar. I normally let things go but this was Spring Break and was very pricy. I just wanted to get the room I paid for is all. Aside from that, the stay was great!!! A beautiful place, great location, clean and quiet. But you do pay for it!!! I highly recommend the West Lawn Ocean View!!

Reviews.Title: “Wow! Gorgeous rooms, and right on the beach!”
Reviews.Author: mbs_MA
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the Southernmost on the Beach mid December 2011. It's located right on the beach at the end of Duval Street, near the Southernmost point in the continental US. The rooms are luxurious and beautifully done, and recently renovated. The hotel is situated adjacent to other properties in the hotel collection. It's on the "quieter" end of Duval Street, but just a short walk to the excitement. We will definitely stay at this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, service, rooms and sea front view”
Reviews.Author: marykeanedawson
Reviews.Content: We stayed for three nights at this legendary establishment, and all I can say is "What's not to love?" All the staff were gracious, welcoming and extremely helpful. We really enjoyed the facilities, including a great bar on the beach (super happy hour!), as well as the Tranquility pool, where we went for peace and quiet.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent!”
Reviews.Author: adg-KS
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for three nights based on TripAdvisor reviews. Expensive, but completely met expectations. Comfortable rooms, friendly staff and beach was better than expected. Definitely recommend!

Reviews.Title: “Awesome!!!”
Reviews.Author: Jennifer T
Reviews.Content: We had oceanfront rooms, and WOW, what a view!!! After visiting the rest of the island, I realized this is the best hotel and views the island has to offer!! Everything you needed was right there! The restraunts had good food, the pool bar was great and very comfortable to hang out at, they had any excursion you wanted to book right at the front desk, and the rooms were extremely spacious and beautiful!!!!!! The only thing I would change about this entire property, was to put better partitions up between balconies facing the ocean, other rooms had them, so maybe they were working on it soon in oceanfront balconies, but this did not deter from how outstanding everything else at the hotel was!! My husband and I go on alot of trips each year and this was one of the best ones I have been on in a long time, Key West is awesome and so is the Southermost on the Beach hotel!!!!

Reviews.Title: “LOVE Southernmost on the Beach!”
Reviews.Author: Joan H
Reviews.Content: This is the best hotel in Key West...beautiful, relaxed and friendly. I spent 10 days there and had a blast...R and R to the Max with my perfect Ocean View room! Boomer and his willing smile make it fun for everyone...I am just sorry I missed the beer and wine schools. The whole staff was tip top and the spa massages laid me way back. Cannot WAIT to return! xo

Reviews.Title: “One night not long enough”
Reviews.Author: KenyonKid
Reviews.Content: I only spent one night at the Southernmost on the Beach. It was not long enough. This is a great hotel at a wonderful location. Feels like a holiday in paradise!. I splurged out for a room with a side view of the ocean. Beautifully decorated with a great little balcony to relax on. Wonderful walk-in shower. My only gripe is that there was no refridgerator, so keeping drinks cool was impossible. I particularly liked the bar and restaurant set up right on the sand and enjoyed a good breakfast there. I was able to leave my car in the hotel carpark after I checked out and until I left Key West in the late afternoon. That was great service. Southernmost on the Beach was the highlight of my 6 week holiday in the USA. I am planning to come back and spend more time there. Kenyonkid, Auckland NZ

Reviews.Title: “A Fantastic Experience!”
Reviews.Author: DealSculptordotcom
Reviews.Content: I used TripAdvisor to plan where to stay on our recent Key West "Couples Retreat" and I thought it only fair to pay it forward to others' considering Key West Accommodations. I chose this hotel for my wife and I and 2 other couples. So with that said, all I can say was this place was awesome! We stayed the first night at the LaMer Hotel (to use a Bed & Breakfast.com gift card) and had breakfast at Dewey House the next morning. We then moved to the SoMo on the Beach. We were in Building A Room 642 and it was one of the nicest hotel rooms (non-suite) I have ever stayed in. Fresh, clean, updated. Really nice. Great view and location (see pics). The service and quality of the staff was amazing. Very friendly and accommodating. From the front desk, to the innkeeper, to the SoMo Beach Cafe bartenders and servers, to the pool and beach attendants, to the pool bartenders, the staff truly is something to rave and write about. The rooms are beautiful, the beds are comfy, the cafe' is delicious, the pools are sparkling, the beach is gorgeous (though small), the staff is friendly and the location on the quiet end of Duval St. is second to none. Don't hesitate to book this hotel. It's great! Our group goes to different U.S. cities every December (next year New Orleans) and some in our group want to skip the U.S. World Tour and come back here every year!!!! "Nuff Said"!

Reviews.Title: “PARADISE,PARADISE,PARADISE”
Reviews.Author: sandrawiv
Reviews.Content: this resort was the best place we have ever stayed , we stayed on the west lawn and we loved it, the beach , pool area , grounds , restaurant, and bar was awesome, the best bartender in the whole world was JULIA at the shores bar , it felt like we knew each other for years , she made the best drinks and was the friendliest person , will be back next year

Reviews.Title: “Amazing!”
Reviews.Author: Ar0307
Reviews.Content: What a great time we had at southern most beach! The rooms were perfect, beds awesome, music great, staff amazing! Boomer, Heather (by pool) & mark (pool bar) were so accommodating and helpful! We will be back again soon!!!!

Reviews.Title: “A lovely, impeccably kept hotel with a stunning ocean view.”
Reviews.Author: Lulhy
Reviews.Content: The Southernmost Hotel is a lovely, impeccably kept hotel. The rooms are stylishly decorated in Key West Island style that immediately obligates you to relax and slow down. The property consists of several 3 stories buildings located at the Southernmost point of the US. We stayed in building B on the 3rd floor. Every room appears to have a nice balcony with chairs. All the balconies that face the interior garden have a sideway ocean view. The only minor problem was that the elevator in our building was out of order. The hotel has a beautiful small sandy beach with hammocks, chairs , games that will allow one to watch the most stunning sunsets of your life. It is all about beautiful sunsets in this festive little town and the celebration starts way before the sun comes downâ€¦.especially in Mallory Square (a short walk away) where you can be accompanied by all kind street vendors, magicians, pirates, Tarot readers and trick turning dogs! The staff is warm and welcoming. Key West is very small and everybody walks, rides bikes or use small scooters. The area around the hotel is excellent and offers everything you might possibly need to make your stay comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful holiday”
Reviews.Author: AK1788
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the SOTB in early November. Our room was on the second floor with fabulous views over the ocean and beach from the shared balcony. The room was clean and the bed very comfortable (like sleeping on a soft cloud). The staff at the hotel are very welcoming and so helpful with any queries. Likewise the SOTB cafe, staff very friendly and the food and drink were good value for money. There are a few places that we have holidayed that we would definately return to and am delighted to say that Key West and the SOTB is on the list. Key West is a fabulous place to visit as there is something to suit every taste and age group. We were very sorry to leave.

Reviews.Title: “We'll be back!”
Reviews.Author: Steve R
Reviews.Content: What a perfect trip. Landed in Ft. Lauderdale late Froday Night. Drove to Key West on Saturday. This Drive will help start the perfect trip...BEAUTIFUL. Checked in to Southern Most on the Beach Friday Afternoon. Room 613 was perfect. The view of the ocean was spectacular. I had to watch the sunset everynight. The pool area was fantastic. Drinks were refreshing, I liked the Keys Tea. Hotel was close enough to walk to most places,

Reviews.Title: “Best beach location in Key West, excellent service, beautiful ocean-front rooms”
Reviews.Author: dentistandwife
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed at Southernmost on the Beach for four days over the Thanksgiving holiday. It was a last minute vacation, booked just two days before arrival, and we were able to get the last westlawn ocean-front room. Our room was on the second floor with beautiful ocean front views. The balcony is shared between several rooms, which disappointed us, and there was always a crowd of guests on the balcony in front of our room at sunset. However, we were able to use it during the day. We will stay on the bottom floor next time. The hotel is definitely the best beach hotel in Key West. The beach is small but very clean and mostly used by hotel guests. Fletcher will set you'll with lounge chairs free of charge, and umbrellas cost $10. The sand is white and the water is turquoise, even in November. The pool is very clean and lined with palm trees. Towel service always has a clean towel for you and the bar waitress comes around frequently. The bartenders at Shores bar are friendly to all and make the perfect tropical drinks. We ate lunch at the bars on two different occasions and the food was good. We ate at the hotel's restaurant for Thanksgiving dinner and had a great meal. The rooms are very clean and the beds are comfortable. Our room was pretty quiet once the balcony noise died down. Every night at sunset there is live music (guitar-plays mix of tropical and classic feel good tunes) on the westlawn. There are hammocks and chairs to sit while enjoying the music. The service at the hotel was phenomenal-from the front desk, to the pool/bar staff, to restaurant staff, to housekeeping, we were treated royaly. We received extra towels when asked, late check-out, and access to their gym facilities to change intoour swimwear when we arrived before check-in. We were always treated with a smile. We can't wait to go back...already planning our next trip.

Reviews.Title: “Great experience”
Reviews.Author: Joe R
Reviews.Content: Great staff and a great experience. Room was excellent. When we return to the keys this will be the only place we will stay.

Reviews.Title: “A little bit of Heaven!!! Location, Location!”
Reviews.Author: JoviFan
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for a week during Thanksgiving 2011 - it was an amazing property !!! The location is just amazing - on the 'quiet' end of Duval Street, but still within walking distance to Mallory Square, restaurants, bars and shops!!!! (and actually a nice walk, esp for all the eating and drinking we did! We had a King Ocean view room - it was just wonderful, a large room, huge bathroom and an amazing view of the ocean - loved our little 'patio'!!! (only small downside, is if the neighbor is out on the balcony by their door, they can see right into your room)... I can't say anything about the resort activities, we never made it to them - hopefully next visit! This was my first visit to Key West and definitely not my last! Julie, one of the concierge's was lovely and helpful! The food at the Southernmost Beach Cafe was great. Arjay the waiter rocked!!! depending on when you go, there may be a short wait...bar makes great mango mojitos!!! Make sure you do hit Mallory Square for the sunset celebration - unlike any other I've seen! We also did the day trip on the ferry to Dry Tortugas - that was great - a little long boat ride (5 hours round trip) but a great trip ! Like I said, I will be back to KW and to the Southernmost on the Beach!!!! and maybe for 2 weeks next time!!! oh, we did rent a car for the week - but really only used it 2-3 days - next time we won't rent one for the whole stay, just for a day or 2!

Reviews.Title: “Relaxation and sun”
Reviews.Author: RoseL2
Reviews.Content: 2nd time here. Same room! Rooms are great, clean, modern. Staff are wonderful, especially activities director Boomer! We tOok his beer school and had a blast ! Pool us clean/warm w a bar right by it for great bloody marys, etc. mannie at the beach is helpful w chairs, etc. love this place!

Reviews.Title: “The Best”
Reviews.Author: drjoeyc
Reviews.Content: Just Fantastic , the views , the service , things to do or not to do . Entertainment on the West Lawn . Boomer and all he does , wine tasting , games , snorkeling . We had the time of our lifes. This place was awesome no need to leave for anything. But if you did a walk down Duval was very easy no Taxi needed . Will be back. Rooms were great . Pools were great . Beach just enough . Sunsets awesome from the west lawn listening to John Le Mare .

Reviews.Title: “The Greatest... (service, rooms, food, quality, location and on and on)”
Reviews.Author: Jeff S
Reviews.Content: I just arrived back home after spending the last five days in my favorite place with my favorite people. The Southernmost on the Beach is hands-down the most well managed hotel I have stayed (and I travel considerably for work) and it shows in everything they do. The rooms are fantastic (maintenance and housekeeping keep the rooms appearing brand new), the service is phenomenal, the food is perfect and the location is the best in Key West. On this trip our "perfect experience" began with Coleen at the front desk. She greeted us with a smile and it was obvious that her only concern was to make sure our stay was incredible. The level of detail is such that although the computer didn't recognize us a return guests (the room was in my last name on our last visit) she sent chocolates to our room with a note welcoming us back to the property. She went out of her way to accommodate our room requests and never made us feel like she was inconvenienced. When we reached our room it was perfect as always. The decor was upscale as was the quality of the room. The HDTV (actually connected to HD programming) was a touch not seen often enough even at the finest chain hotels. Their bathrooms are large (and extremely clean) and include a huge tile shower (one of my favorite parts of the room!). Our balcony had a great view of the ocean beyond the pool. After dropping our bags in the room we quickly headed to the pool area. We were thrilled to see Heather (whom we had met on prior trips) was serving drinks poolside and we received a welcome beyond expectation. I should mention that it was Heather's hospitality three years earlier that sealed the deal that we would be life-long Southernmost on the Beach guests! Prior to that visit we had stayed at the Westin and other upscale hotels-- but spending the afternoons poolside chatting with Heather made us realize that the Southermost was our home away from home! We were disappointed to hear that 2 days of our stay included Heather's off-days but after a quick introduction to James at the pool bar we knew that our stay was not going to be dampened. James jumped in right where Heather left off! He made wonderful drinks and provided great conversation. Like Heather, James makes you feel as if you are right at home talking with a close friend. My posting wouldn't be complete if I didn't also mention Rich, the manager of the pool bar, who has clearly made great hiring decisions! We also appreciated Rich's hospitality during our visit. I cannot highly enough recommend Southernmost on the Beach! Plan a trip-- you will not be disappointed! Just tell all of our "southernmost family" we said hello!

Reviews.Title: “Clean, Friendly, Would Come Back”
Reviews.Author: Matt D
Reviews.Content: Nice property...with the bonus of all three resorts. Best Bloody Mary's I have every had at the Shore Pool. They load them up with Olives and Spiced Pickled Green Beans... A must try if you are at the resort.

Reviews.Title: “Should be 6 stars”
Reviews.Author: HappyMiddletown_O
Reviews.Content: We spent Thanksgiving week there. The staff couldn't have been more helpful. We arrived at noon. They let us store our luggage until check-in and provided a room to freshen up and change clothes. We ate several tines at cafe on the beach. The food was fantastic. Thanksgiving meal was 4 course and better than I can cook. We stayed in bldg A. It was clean comfortable. Nice view of the courtyard and ocean. The balcony was a great place to relax at the end of a great meal. We have nothing negative to say. Use the concierge. She is very helpful. Be sure to take an ereader or book. Bookstores are very hard to find.

Reviews.Title: “Short but enjoyable stay”
Reviews.Author: chad813
Reviews.Content: I only stayed here one night on a trip through the Keys. The staff was very friendly and room was amazing!! The entire facility was clean an well kept.

Reviews.Title: “Pretty good stay, only a few complaints”
Reviews.Author: SPman00
Reviews.Content: TA did a good job leading me to this place for a short vacation to Key West. We stayed overlooking the west lawn, which was an amazing place to listen to live music and watch the sunset. The pool was decently heated (it could be warmer), but the ocean was fairly choppy this time of year and only cleared up for nice swimming for about half of one day. The grounds are well kept and the hotel had nice drinking water available in a couple of spots, which is really nice compared to some places trying to sell $3 bottled water.. Drinks at the poolside bar were decently priced, especially considering the happy hour specials. Their private peir is also a great place to watch a sunrise and sunset, which you can see both of in the winter months. The only surprise with the room was were many of the rooms had exterior entrances and not all the rooms had a private balcony. The room was nicely decorated, had a good shower, excellent bedding, had a nice flat screen television (that actually had HD TV on it). They served complimentary coffee at the pool from 6-9 and kept an ample supply in room, both of which were better than average. I only have a few complaints that keep this place from getting five stars from me: 1) We saw all these people on rafts to float around the pool and thought they would be included, then was dissapointed when I found out they cost $10 each. 2) We were also surprised at some of the trashier elements here for a hotel at this price point, there were ladies that were very drunk and yelling things that shouldn't be said around children. There were staff members that saw this and didn't do anything about it. We don't have kids, but were still surprised the staff let it go on. I guess if you can get to Key West on a greyhound bus, you're going to get some of this element anywhere you stay. 3) There were two guests that used the small sitting area outside our room to chain smoke for two or three hours for the last two days at sunset, which caused our non-smoking room to smell like they were inside our room. There was also a really roudy bunch that swiped the chairs from outside our room and took them somewhere for one evening. Overall, we had a good stay and would consider staying here again if we made it back to Key West.

Reviews.Title: “Our stay was perfect!”
Reviews.Author: Jcreidler
Reviews.Content: This is the 3rd or 4th time I have stayed at the Southernmost on the Beach. I have been to Key West several times and I will no longer stay anywhere else. Not only does the location of the hotel, the beautiful pools, the beach, the cafe, etc., make for an incredible stay, but the employees make it perfect. Thanks to people like Boomer (Activities), Skip (events), James & Rich (bartenders), and the wonderful staff at the beach cafe, you simply feel like family. It does not get any better in Key West. FYI - I did not get paid to say any of this stuff. The reason I choose to come back and stay at the Southernmost is because of how well we are treated. See you soon Boomer and everyone else who makes our stay perfect every time!

Reviews.Title: “great time at southernost”
Reviews.Author: cgkr
Reviews.Content: Paid $150 per night and the economy rooms were nice. great restaurant on the beach and good amenities around the pool area.

Reviews.Title: “Best Resort in the Souther Most USA”
Reviews.Author: Michele M
Reviews.Content: I have been visiting Key West for the past 12 years, and I ONLY stay at the Southernmost Hotel or Southernmost on the Beach. Not only are the rooms comfy, and beautiful, but the best part of this resort is the staff. I always feel at home when I arrive, and feel like I am leaving a great family behind when I leave. From the smiles, and warm welcome of the reception, the great drinks and crazy fun times at the pool bars, to the Famous Boomer who can keep you entertained throughout the day. I only recommend this hotel to anyone that wants to know the best place to stay in Key West. I am already booking my next trip back..........hmmm Southernmost Hotel with a balcony over looking the Pinnapple Pool???? Or Southernmost on the Beach with my favorite room that allows me to drink my coffee on the balcony and watch the sun rise, or turn my chair around on the same balcony at happy hour and watch the sunset!! Southernmost I will see you soon!!!

Reviews.Title: “First time to Key West”
Reviews.Author: BretL22
Reviews.Content: Recently spent 4 nights at the Southernmost for a friend's wedding. The hotel was fantastic, I honestly can't see myself staying anywhere else the next time I'm back in Key West, and typically I like to try somewhere new each time. Everything was perfect, I don't have a single complaint. Wonderful rooms, staff, pool, bar and everything else. I would recommend this to anyone without hesitation. The Southernmost made a great trip even better, I'm already thinking of the next time I can come down and stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful room and view great amenities”
Reviews.Author: cbannon00
Reviews.Content: My friend and I stayed at the Southernmost on the Beach for 3 nights. Beautiful room, comfortable bed, flat screen television, balcony, free parking and complimentary internet. South Beach is located next to the property and lounge chairs and water were also complimentary. Southernmost on the Beach is in the "quiet" section of Key West along Duval Street and just a couple of blocks from the Southernmost Point, Ernest Hemingway Museum and Key West Butterfly and Nature Conservatory. The pool was large and never crowded. The pier offered spectacular views of the nightly sunset. There was a poolside bar and a Beach Cafe Bar where we could enjoy a refreshing beverage. The Beach Cafe was on the property and we enjoyed several meals there. Mallory Square was approximately 1.2 miles away and walked there each night and enjoyed walking down Duval Street and enjoying the shops, stores and restaurants.

Reviews.Title: “I booked two tickets to paradise”
Reviews.Author: K I
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just returned from the most beautiful place on earth. The place being the Southernmost on the Beach in Key West , Fl. When we arrived we were warmly greeted by Luis. We stayed in a beautiful oceanview room on the west lawn of the property. Our room was beautiful. The ENTIRE staff was professional and friendly . Boomer kept things hopping with his hula hoop contests, sunset celebrations, snorkel class ,wine school and beer school, we really enjoyed every minute of our vacation, we actually found plenty of time to relax on the private beach. We dined several times at the Southernmost on the Beach Cafe, every meal was perfect. Made perfect by the friendly staff,delicious food and beautiful setting. The location is perfect , on the quiet end of town. Within walking distance of all the attractions. I would love to name everyone by name that made us feel as though we were the only guests staying there, you are all wonderful. Keep doing what you do. We only had one complaint, the time went by far to fast. There is only one solution, book a return visit and stay longer.

Reviews.Title: “Continues to get better all the time”
Reviews.Author: rcaton
Reviews.Content: We just ended another " way too short" triip to Key West and our favortire hotel - The Southernmost. I don't know how they do it but this place juct keeps getting better (and it is already the best). We stayed in one of the newer rooms just behind the pool and it was beautiful. As always VERY clean and 5 star. Every member of the staff is great. They are always friendly and helpful. Heather, the waitress at the pool is the best. Always there with a cool drink. The grounds are immaculate and beautifully landscaped. The beach bar and restaurant has some of the best food on the island. Make sure to catch the 4-7 happy hour. Once here, you really don't have to leave. They have everything you need. But if you want, the Duval Street party is only a few short blocks away. THIS IS THE PLACE TO STAY IN KEY WEST!!!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Staff”
Reviews.Author: mgambler
Reviews.Content: My wife and I go to Paradise (Key West) every Dec. for a week or so. We were married in Key West and when we come back time after time for the last 8 years The place is great and Southernmost has a young man by the name of Luis working for them and he is the best. Luis will double and triple check sometimes to see if your stay is OK! Southernmost has a great staff and when we retire and move to Key West I told my wife I would work part time for a company like this. I would be just great to continue helping people as they do.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in Key West”
Reviews.Author: Debbie A
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a wonderful trip to Key West. Stayed at this hotel after reading reviews on Tripadvisor and was not disappointed. Great beach and pool bar, great customer service at check-in and updated rooms with a nice view of the ocean! Patrick, at the front desk, was very knowledgeable about things to do on the island, bars, restaurants, etc. and made our stay very enjoyable. Julia was exhuberant at the Shores bar, being very courteous and cheerful. She made everyone at the bar feel at home. Fletcher, at the beach area, was wonderful getting everyone chairs, frozen strawberries, frozen towels and popsicles while enjoying the beach and sun!!!! Can't say enough about this wonderful hotel. Wish I were there now!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Fun, relaxing and romantic honeymoon location!!”
Reviews.Author: Melanie C
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Southernmost on the beach for our honeymoon this past week and had a fantastic time. The rooms were spacious and clean - we had a gorgeous view of the ocean and beach from our second floor room on the west lawn side (617) - perfect for watching the sunset. We were looking for a relaxing place to stay away from the party atmosphere typically found on the opposite side of Duval St. We definitely picked the perfect spot!! Dont get me wrong, there was plenty of fun activity to partake in. Boomer was a terrific beer school professor and spins a mean hoola hoop!! Though, as his valedrinktorians, we may have been his teachers pet! He and the rest of the southermost staff have a way of making you feel right at home and we quickly met great people to compete against for free drink tickets!! We will definitely be coming here again!

Reviews.Title: “Great Place - in a Storm”
Reviews.Author: kooss
Reviews.Content: Our three-day visit ended up being a one-day excursion because of violent thunderstorms and tornado-warning weather. However, while we were stuck in the hotel for most of the time, we were treated extremely well by the management, including their giving us credit for one night when we could not fly into Key West because of the weather. We rented a king balcony, Room 539, overlooking the ocean. The room was excellent, with beach towels and robes provided (couldn't use the towels), very comfortable beds, and easy access to the beach, the restaurant, and parking. The front desk was very accommodating, both by phone and on-site, to help us through our travel issues. The concierge in the lobby was also extremely helpful when we had to compress our sight-seeing into one day. The location is at the quiet end of Duval Street (two blocks from the Southernmost USA marker), but restaurants and many of the sightseeing activities are within walking distance. Peddling a bike is a neat way to see it all, although we didn't do that. The touring trollies stop right in front of the resort. So, overall, while we didn't get an opportunity to enjoy many of the niceties of the resort, we can certainly attest to the friendliness and helpfulness of the various people who staff the resort.

Reviews.Title: “I'd recommend to anyone!”
Reviews.Author: MelindaDunmore
Reviews.Content: We just spent 5 nights here and loved it! The room was smaller than other places we've stayed but very nice. The bed was one of the most comfortable I've ever slept on! The shower/bathroom were roomy with plenty of places for toiletries. The overall impression was very pleasant and a great home base for our stay in Key West! It's only a block off Duval Street making it quiet but only a quick walk to the action!

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Resort”
Reviews.Author: bzytraveler63
Reviews.Content: We just returned from our second visit to the Southernmost Hotel on the Beach in Key West, FL. This place is simply amazing. From check in to check out, the service is first rate. The rooms are beautiful, decorated very tastefully and extremely clean. The Pool area is great and also very clean. There are always pool attendents around the pool and the beach areas to help with anything you may need, including drinks and food. They are extremely friendly and polite. The beach area is also very nice with a great cafe on the beach overlooking the water. The food and service at the cafe is also great. We traveled with friends and one day their key did not work, they called down to the front desk and literally in five seconds, someone was up with a new key. Rich at the pool bar is wonderful and took great care of us along with Shelley the pool attendent. We will definitley return next year to this wonderful hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Experience!!!”
Reviews.Author: TeddydooAZ1
Reviews.Content: I own hotels and am very discerning. The ownership group of Southernmost gets it absolutely right. No resort fees, no charge for parking, no other hidden fees. Outstanding service. Boomer was an awesome activities director. Our corner suite - 640 was fantastic. Quiet, beautiful, terrific views of the water. Pools, bartenders and beach are great. ONLY ONE PLACE TO STAY IN KEY WEST... THIS IS IT!!!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Service!”
Reviews.Author: Tim S
Reviews.Content: When we first checked in we weren't entirely pleased with our room assignment (too close to the pool) so we went back to the front desk and Diana was able to help us relocate with no trouble at all. She was very sweet and helpful, as was the rest of the front desk staff. The bar staff was amazingly friendly and attentive. Julia at the Pool Bar and Bill at the Cafe were particularly awesome. I don't think I went with an empty glass for more than a second when they were working. There was typically some on-property activity going on during the day and early evening. For instance, Boomer and Kathy's wine school was top notch. I'm typically a bit tentative in those situations, being a wine novice, but they made sure my girlfriend and I had a great time, as well as our share of free wine ;-). As far as location, it is on the opposite end of Duval Street from most of the rowdy bars, but it's only a $10 cab ride (or 20 minute walk)to get into the heart of the night life.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel with great location!”
Reviews.Author: Ladams0430
Reviews.Content: Southernmost on the beach is awesome. The location is the best in Key West. Wonderful beach and pool facilities and right next to Duvall St. You can walk to everything, there is no need for a car. Hotel staff very accomodating and efficient.Pool bartenders Rick and Greg are great!

Reviews.Title: “Great choice for family vacation”
Reviews.Author: KansasSwede
Reviews.Content: This is really several properties now part of one hotel. The standard of the rooms varies, but overall well mantained and clean. The location is great. The pool, public beach, private beach, private pier, all are your choices to suit your preference. There is life music, a good bar, very helpful staff, all well designed to make your stay pleasant. Wifi included, works well. The beach cafe is very popular and often busy.

Reviews.Title: “Great Key West Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Jenny D
Reviews.Content: Staying at this hotel was one of the best parts of our trip. They have beautifully decorated, clean rooms with great views of the ocean. The resort also has a great pool with pool bar and beach access as well as other relaxing spots with hammocks, chairs and a private pier. Boomer and Kathy's wine school was one of many activities they host daily which included a great tasting of several wines (complimentary). Overall, very friendly staff, great location and comfortable, luxurious rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Just amazing”
Reviews.Author: linisima
Reviews.Content: It was our "turning 40" girls getaway and we had an amazing stay, the hotel room was gorgeous and the bathroom layout was like few you ever get to see. Plus the people at the front desk were always friendly and eager to help. The location in the quiet end makes it perfect as it is still walking distance to all the activity in Duval but far enough for some quiet time.

Reviews.Title: “heaven on earth!”
Reviews.Author: jackie r
Reviews.Content: this was undoubtedly the best holiday I have ever had, and I will be back next year, for sure. a shaky start, because the holiday company booked us into the wrong hotel in the collection, but the lovely staff took us to the pool bar for complimentary drinks, and with ten minutes we were ensconced in one of the best rooms there! from then on everything was PERFECT! the staff, the hotel, the beach cafe, the rooms, the beach - well, everything. it's in a nice area too, because it's only a 5 or 10 minute cab ride to the nightlife, but there is plenty to do withink walking distance. I can't praise this hotel enough. as for Key West itself, it is simply AWESOME!!! this is somewhere everyone simply must go!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Vacation”
Reviews.Author: fireblossom
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Southernmost on the beach the second week of Oct. The day we arrived it was pouring...but the very nice lady who checked us in offered umbrellas to use...Thank you...We had a room on the West Lawn (Beautiful) ...Boomer is the best!! We did beer school and snorkel school....Lots of fun!! He goes above and beyond for everyone....Thank you Boomer!! We also want to thank Rich the bartender...very nice and awesome drinks! My husband also bought me a massage for my birthday (my first)...was amazing :)...Loved the cafe too, only had one bad experience..but several awesome experiences too...Thank you Boomer for trying to make it right...We will be back....Will recommend to everyone to stay here...Loved it!!

Reviews.Title: “Great views and very relaxing!”
Reviews.Author: MD_to_SC
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Southernmost on the Beach for 4 days attending a beach wedding and had a great time. The hotel room with an ocean view (not ocean front) was large, clean and very comfortable. The king size bed was great! We enjoyed our time at the nearby pool (super mojitos at the pool bar), on the beach and at the Beach Cafe. If we wanted, we could have stayed at the resort the entire time. Parking was very easy and the staff was very friendly. Other friends and family stayed at other facilities that make up the Southernmost Resort complex, and all reported similar, very positive experiences. And even though this hotel is located on the southern edge of Key West, we had no problem walking to restaurants and other attractions further north on Duval Street, it's about 1 mile to the northern beaches. Highly recommended!

Reviews.Title: “GREAT HOTEL”
Reviews.Author: debsohio
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 2 nights. Internet site said they were booked. Called hotel directly and got a balcony room for the weekend. Room was very nice overlooking the parking lot. Loved the pool and beach access. This is why I chose the Southernmost Beach was because it was on the water. Beach area very crowded and small, but this is KW. There were some ants in the bathroom. But this is Florida and is to be expected. Was a distance to walk to the end of Duval. Great happy hour at the beach bar. Drinks were 1/2 off. Staff was friendly and very helpful. Bed was very comfy and loved the huge shower. Would definately stay here again. If you are traveling with children you may want to keep in mind that it is topless optional at the beach.

Reviews.Title: “LOVED IT!!”
Reviews.Author: Karie928
Reviews.Content: I loved my room # 640! Ocean Front Balcony, King size bed! I priced other hotels and this price wasn't bad for what I got.The staff was great and helpful.Maid service was fantastic! I'm coming down again and this is the room I want !

Reviews.Title: “The Southernmost on the Beach”
Reviews.Author: Brighton0924
Reviews.Content: My husband and I got married at The Southernmost on the Beach this past September and most of our guests stayed at one of their 4 hotels. Our guests had wonderful things to say about their stay and mine personally couldn't have been any better! The staff at the hotel are the friendliest I have ever come across at a hotel and the location, cleanliness, and amenities really make the stay enjoyable. If you are looking for a venue for your wedding than I HIGHLY recommend this hotel! The wedding coordinator is AMAZING and everything you need for your "big day" can be found here. The food is the BEST!

Reviews.Title: “What a great place”
Reviews.Author: PandT84
Reviews.Content: We said WOW When we got in the room.Everything was beautiful.Christian at the bar made great drinks for our first happy hour in Key West.We realy enjoyed the Pineapple Pool.We went to Beer School with Boomer the next day and snorkel school the day after,both were lots of fun.Rented bikes,went on a ghost tour and a sunset snorkel cruise all booked at the concierge desk.We will be back!

Reviews.Title: “Best location in Key West!”
Reviews.Author: KrisDHays_KS
Reviews.Content: Great location, awesome room, nice bar with $3 drinks and appetizers for happy hour. Stay here for the handy location and view but don't expect a beach experience here or anywhere in Key West for that matter.

Reviews.Title: “WOW This Place is Heaven on Earth "A bucket list item"”
Reviews.Author: DMAN0431
Reviews.Content: First I would like to say Congratulations to Arron and Annie on the Wonderful Wedding. Now lets talk about Southernmost on the beach. This place is all that. My family had a fantastic time. The rooms are just absolutely stunning. The restaurant was very good as well. All the bars were fantastic. John was the bartender for our wedding party get together. He did a fantastic job with proving drinks for all of our group as quickly as he could. I would like to say thank you to Southernmost management for the hospitality they and all of their staff bestowed to our family and the Arron and Angie wedding party. Omar would greet me each and every day... Now lets talk about the world renown Boomer.... I read about Boomer prior to coming down to Southernmost. I did get to meet him as I was chilling with my Family and of course he had a trivial question n for me.., I got it right and Boom..... Won a free drink from the Boomer. Shelly was also fantastic. She will find you and will make sure that you are never Hungry or thirsty. Love you Shelly. Everyone in our group are now thinking about out next visit to this TOP NOTCH , FANTASTIC RESORT. Southernmost I salute you all for a very nice Visit. What an awesome team you all are... Thank you so very much for making our visit a memorable one. THANK YOU The Phillips

Reviews.Title: “Stay Here!”
Reviews.Author: FrozenTundra12
Reviews.Content: From the minute we checked in we were taken care of. You must rent a bike and tour Key West. Stayed in Building B, the room was spacious, housekeeping was superb and the response to any of our needs was immediate. Nice view of the water. Easy access to everything - Duval Street, Mallory Square and the Historic Waterfront. The hotel was full and yet it was quiet and private.

Reviews.Title: “AMAZING!!!”
Reviews.Author: LThia25
Reviews.Content: JUST GO AND STAY HERE! THIS IS BY FAR THE BEST HOTEL IN KEY WEST!! I can't express how much we loved it here! Beautiful views....The rooms beautiful and clean...The pools are great...the staff is outstanding! You can't ask for a better hotel! And if you are looking to get married then look no further! This place will give you the wedding of a lifetime! Just take my advice and go!

Reviews.Title: “Great time wonderful place”
Reviews.Author: Vic H
Reviews.Content: We recently visited the Southermost on the beach, the grounds and accommodations were wonderful. Our trip plans changed and we took our six year old granddaughter with us. We were concerned about keeping her occupied during the stay. "Boomer" introduced himself as the activities director and problem solved. We all attended snorkeling class and passed. We were impressed that he suggested we not venture out into the ocean because of the winds and roughness, his primary concern was for the safety of our granddaughter. The pool staff was very attentive to our needs and kept us supplied with dry towels and drinks. Nice touch in the afternoon, live music at the pool and contests for the kids. The concierge was excellent and directed was to the many tour locations on the key. We rented a bike built for two at the concierge's desk and went anywere we wanted. Dined several times at the cafe on the beach the service was great, food was good, and not over priced. We'll return for sure and stay at the Southernmost on the beach.

Reviews.Title: “wonderful!”
Reviews.Author: dj f
Reviews.Content: We stayed at southernmost last week and had a wonderful time. Room 625 with a side view balcony was close to the pool and quiet. Loved the pool and activities, went snorkeling with Boomer right off the pier and wine school with Kathy and Boomer. Activities director, Boomer was a blast and had many good tips for seeing the town, no extra charge for any of the activities- great value! The pool is awesome and the cafe has a terrific happy hour. We rented bikes from the hotel and they were useful for seeing the town. This was our first trip to key west and we definitely plan to go back. Highly recommend this resort!

Reviews.Title: “Key West Weddingmoon”
Reviews.Author: SEAtrip33
Reviews.Content: The buildings away from the pool and grass area were very quiet. We had a King Balcony and it was large, clean and the bathroom was wonderful. The Pool areas were perfect with plenty of seating and courteous and efficient staff. We did not choose the cafe for our wedding dinner, but the food was good and happy hour was a great value.

Reviews.Title: “Southernmost on the Beach”
Reviews.Author: 123Catbyrd
Reviews.Content: My stay at Southernmost on the Beach was absolutely perfect. Aside from the gorgeous room and oceanside view, the staff was fantastic. I received an upgrade because the management thought that I might be disturbed by some nearby construction. I could not believe their hospitality. The grounds were immaculate and housekeeping was exquisite. Guest services saved me alot of money on an e-car rental. I nightly turn down service and a newspaper at my door every morning was a very nice touch to the stay. I can say that Southernmost spoiled me. The staff went out of their way effortlessly to make my vacation one that I will never forget. It is the only place in Key West to stay for me. I can't wait for my next vacation there . . ."living on Key West time".

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely beautiful view”
Reviews.Author: TerRon19
Reviews.Content: This was our 6th trip to Key West but our first experience at Southernmost on the Beach. I am sure we will be staying there again. We received a free upgrade, had a view of the ocean and a gorgeous room. Housekeeping was excellant and I loved the turn down service with chocolates on pillows in the evening. Every morning we went out to the pier connected to this hotel and watched the sunrise. Can snorkel or swim right at the hotel. The cafe has excellant food. We went in October when it is not as busy but they were doing alot of repairs at this hotel. One pool was shut down and another was only open part of the week. It has to be done sometime but even with all this going on, I am definetly going back to this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Best Resort at Key West”
Reviews.Author: yorkb13
Reviews.Content: Hotel has private beach and pier. Pools are great. Southernmost Cafe on premises is great. Rooms are huge, clean with great ocean views. If you are looking for a resort that is on the quieter side of Duval St that is relaxing and beautiful look no further.

Reviews.Title: “Wow”
Reviews.Author: mustang699
Reviews.Content: Fantastic hotel....in a fabulous location......great staff........heaven!!

Reviews.Title: “Amazing visit”
Reviews.Author: Gemmauk45
Reviews.Content: Brilliant visit to Key West, did parks in Orlando and Miami and this hotel was by far the best. Key West is gorgeous and a must see. If you were wondering is it worth the travel down from Orlando.... it definately is! It takes 3 and 1/2 hrs driving approx 60mph to get to Miami and another 3 and 1/2 hrs from Miami to Key West which is a must slower drive but beautiful. It did take the full 7hrs direct from Key West to Ordlando to return on clear roads. This hotel is immaculate with a private beach and the use of all the Southern Most facilities. Unlike other hotels it does not charge resort fees, safe fees, sun lounger fees etc. You get complimentary beach towels and the rooms are spectacular. Cannot stress enough how fantastic, clean and perfect this hotel is.

Reviews.Title: “We will be back next year”
Reviews.Author: mmm585
Reviews.Content: This was our first trip to Key West and we wanted a good location at a reasonable price. We were very happy with the location and the price, but the rooms were even nicer than we expected. We had a large king room with a balcony. The room was clean and well kept and the bathroom was very nice. The hotel and grounds have been very well maintained in all areas. There is a nice pool with a great ocean view. There is a beach that is easily accessible along with a beautiful lounging area overlooking the beach. The hotel is not right next to the bars and restaurants of Duval St but it is a very easy walk. We are already planning another trip to Key West next year and we plan to stay at Southernmost again.

Reviews.Title: “Two time stayer, and think the staff and place is excellent.”
Reviews.Author: pichapa01
Reviews.Content: Have stayed both times the beginning of October, rates are low and the island isn't totally full. Ok the first time we got upgraded to the building overlooking the pool at the beach. This year we're at building A, nearer to the water but the patio faces another building B, across maybe 20 yards not good. Have to pull down the screens to get privacy in the room. Maybe if enough people complain they will install some kinda of privacy screens. otherwise room and grounds are awesome. The activity director Boomer is a blast and is also the snorkling instructor. Nice entertainment in the afternoons. The conceiges are also great and stay up on all the specials being offered on the island.

Reviews.Title: “Why stay anywhere else?”
Reviews.Author: JasonB732
Reviews.Content: This was our 2nd trip to Key West. This time we brought friends from home! From the beautiful sunrises, to the activities hosted by the always active Boomer, to the potent drinks at the Shores Bar, to the beachfront location, to the short walk (stumble or crawl) back and forth to the best bars on Duval, to the friendly bartenders (Rich, Mark, James) to the bubbly servers (Heather) to the helpful front desk staff (Wish I could remember their names!)--why would you stay anywhere else? Scarlett and Julie at the Concierge desk were helpful and nice. Beer School, Wine School, Snorkel School, Hula hoop exercise, the Newlywed game--all hosted by the best Activities Director in Key West Boomer McFall. Live music and entertainment by the pool. A well stocked Gym, water dispensers and ice machines by the pool and along the grounds. Free towels at an awesome pool and a bar just steps from a beach--where you can lay out in a chaise lounger for free! Chocolates on your pillow and turn down service each night. The Beachfront Cafe has $3 drinks and a few different appetizers at 4pm. Cafe had great food and timely and attentive service--for breakfast, lunch AND dinner. The bathroom was huge and modern.There is a nice bar sized fridge that held all our drinks a sink and ample storage in the closet and dressers. A nice sized sit down desk. 2 arm chairs in our room too. I honestly don't think I'd stay anywhere else! And this is just at the Southernmost on the Beach location. Across the street is the new Pineapple Bar, a new pool--all of which looked awesome. Top notch facility with modern amenities. My only complaint(s): The wi-fi was crappy in our end of the location--but if you ask for an ethernet wire for your laptop/netbook you can plug right into the wall. And the cable went out the last overnight we were there. But---if you're on vacation---you can live without those things. We did!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Weekend”
Reviews.Author: bonnmcgraw
Reviews.Content: Beautiful, well maintained property with first class accomodations and friendly professional staff all working together to make your vacation the most memorable one ever!! Thank you, SMOB. We look forward to our next visit!!

Reviews.Title: “Paradise”
Reviews.Author: Wendy C
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 3 nights the 2nd week of September and had a fabulous few days. Close enough to walk up to Duval Street and Hemmingway's House but not noisy and straight onto the beach. The beach cafe serves a great breakfast and evening meals. The bar staff are friendly. The pool is open to late into the evening so you can swim in the dark with the pool lights flickering different colours. Even used the gym during our stay which has top of the range equipment and well air conditioned. The hotel rooms are cool and very clean. Just wish we'd been able to stay longer. Would recommend this hotel to anyone thinking of a visit to the very beautiful Keys.

Reviews.Title: “Good overall value, but lack of charm”
Reviews.Author: likeran
Reviews.Content: Many services proposed, very good location, but resort too much "mass luxuxy tourism" to be enjoyable. Rates too high.

Reviews.Title: “Best Resort Ever!”
Reviews.Author: carolinagirl1966
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Southernmost on the Beach a few weeks ago and we had the best stay ever! The hotel is the best we have ever stayed at! The staff was very friendly and willing to please. They did everything possible & more to make sure you enjoy your stay with them. It is a beautiful place and they work very hard everyday to keep it a A+ resort. They also offer a beer school, wine school, snorkiling lessons and free rentals, free beach towels and beach chairs and all kinds of activities everyday! Boomer who is the activities director is the best! He does a superior job and makes it alot of fun! We really enjoyed hanging out with him the week we were there! Definately worth every penny we spent and we will definately return again! It is truely a tropical paradise! Thanks Southernmost for the best vacation ever!

Reviews.Title: “Awesome location”
Reviews.Author: dnorris216
Reviews.Content: We just returned from five nights in Key West. This hotel is right on the ocean with beautiful views. The rooms were large and very clean. All of the staff were outstanding, very friendly and professional. During our stay we had breakfast, lunch, and dinner at the beach cafe and all meals were excellent and prices very reasonable. This was our first trip to Key West and will definatly return to the Southernmost Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Best hotel on the island”
Reviews.Author: GandGKnoxville_TN
Reviews.Content: We just returned from our Key West trip and stayed at Southernmost On The Beach. I can't speak highly enough about this place. The rooms are beautiful, clean, large, perfectly located. The staff have always been nothing but professional, friendly and courteous. We have stayed here three times and it is by far our favorite hotel. On this trip, they went above and beyond. My partner unfortunately had been ill our entire trip. Our return flight wasn't until 7pm, which meant we would have to leave our hotel room at 11am checkout and spend several hours in the heat and the rain. I went to the front desk and explained our situation and asked if I could extend our stay by one additional day. I was more than willing to pay for a full extra day so that he would not have to spend hours outside, as sick as he was. The man at the front desk (didn't get his name) moved some reservations around and said he would block out our room. When we checked out, I was so pleasantly surprised that they decided not to charge us at all for the extra time, under the circumstances. I have never received this type of first rate service anywhere before. We go to Key West several times each year, and this hotel has more than earned our repeat business and highest recommendations. Actually, they earned it even before this! Thanks to everyone there who was so helpful to us!

Reviews.Title: “very comfortable stay”
Reviews.Author: z235e49
Reviews.Content: spent 3 nites in an ocean view king- room 421- one room off the ocean front room. from our private balcony we were definitely ocean front. from the room we were ocean view. the only negative was that when you walked up the staircase to get to our room you looked at the adjacent resorts loading dock. once you entered the hallway there was no view of the loading dock. the room was fairly spacious, very clean with a comfortable king bed. the a/c worked fairly well and the shower pressure was adequate. there were 2 chairs and a small table on the balcony. there was a mini fridge, a coffee maker and safe in the room and ice machine close by. key west is lovely- kind of a cross between new orleans and venice beach, california. very walkable with a number of good restaurants. the beaches are not like the rest of the florida coast- not exactly swimmable but beautiful to look at and the water is like the caribbean- teal, light blue and light green. we knew that and enjoyed laying by the beach but not going into the water. there were small beaches at the hotel that were very nice to sit at. one day we ordered lunch from the beach restaurant- it was surprisingly good and we could eat at our chairs on the beach. we just felt very comfortable at the resort.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay in Key West!”
Reviews.Author: LB1202
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just returned from a four night vacation to celebrate our one year anniversary. We chose SMOTB primarily for its location, plus the fact that it is located on the ocean. We had a wonderful stay! The staff was wonderful (we loved Heather at the pool - she was so nice and provided great service). Our room was nice - we booked an oceanview room. It was big enough for the two of us, had a nice balcony and a nice bathroom. We rented bikes through the concierge - they were well priced and it was an easy process. We also booked the jet ski tour through the concierge - we would HIGHLY recommend doing this. The tour takes you around the entire island - fun times. We had breakfast each morning at the Southernmost Cafe, and also went to happy hour there one day. Breakfast was good and well priced. We enjoyed happy hour too. While this hotel is close to Duval Street, it is a hike to the more "happening" end of Duval. Normally we would have walked, but with it being so hot, we often took a taxi (which was very easy to get). Overall, a very nice stay. We enjoyed the hotel, had a great time lounging by the pool (they provide great entertainment each day) and loved the island and hospitality of Key West.

Reviews.Title: “Home away from home”
Reviews.Author: FirstClassPlz
Reviews.Content: Our third trip to SMOTB and it was just as good as always. Its become our September home away from home. The rooms and entire property are always exceptionally clean, sheets/towels are wonderful, beds are very comfy, employees are all friendly, the location is peacefully quiet yet still in walking distance to all the action on Duval Street. No hidden "fee's" like the other places have. This time we also enjoyed BOOMER's BEER SCHOOL!! =) The Southernmost Cafe has really good food, decent prices, great Happy Hour, (and the NFL package). I almost hate to recommend this place because Id prefer to keep it my little secret. Plenty to do right at the hotel, paddleboarding, volleyball, cornhole, poolside games/activites that BOOMER gets everyone involved in and having a great time, small beach, nice pier, great SUNRISE views. I cant say enough good things.... I want to go back as I write this....

Reviews.Title: “A fabulous...”
Reviews.Author: slg410
Reviews.Content: Fabulous view-fabulous, clean room--fabulous friendly bartenders--fabulous dinner at the cafe'--fabulous--fabulous--at the Southern Most on the Beach---Rich at the Shores Bar--The Hostess at the Cafe--From the time we stepped into the lobby until we left--everyone was friendly-helpful---they made our vacation--relaxing--and so enjoyable---Will be back!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Best place on the beach!”
Reviews.Author: Cathleenwv
Reviews.Content: We love, love, it here. The staff is great,blender and refrigerator in room, great entertainment at pool, and your private beach. We come to Key West every year, and thus is truly a hotel in paradise.

Reviews.Title: “Best Place to Stay”
Reviews.Author: Traveler_in_Maryland
Reviews.Content: We have only positive comments about our week long stay at this property. Our room was spacious and spotlessly clean with modern decor and a large bathroom with a beautiful travertine tiled shower. A deck gave a lovely view of the nicely landscaped grounds and an indirect view of the ocean. The grounds included a pool and bar, a pier with umbrellas and lounge chairs and ocean access, and hammocks both in the sun and shade to relax in. There is a small public beach area where lounge chairs and umbrellas are provided for guests at no extra charge and a restaurant with very good food (we ate some breakfasts, lunches and dinners there). We loved the location, a few blocks from the quiet end of Duval Street and with easy walking or biking to several sights in town.

Reviews.Title: “fabulous vacation”
Reviews.Author: sue f
Reviews.Content: Just returned from our wonderful holiday at this hotel.Words cannot describe how much we enjoyed our stay.From the moment we arrived the staff could not have done more to make our stay so special. Particular thanks to Travis in reception,who was very helpful on several occasions. Not forgetting Rich at the Shores Bar who cared for our liquid intake! Rooms, food and cleanlines were all excellent. The only minor grump would be allowing people to smoke around the pool area,sorry!!!!!!!! Hope to return next year and look forward to seeing you all again. Love and Best Wishes Kerry and Sue (Plymouth Uk)

Reviews.Title: “Loved this hotel!!”
Reviews.Author: Adrienne Y
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Southernmost on the Beach for our honeymoon 4 days/3 nights during the second week of September. We loved every minute of our stay! The staff is wonderful (especially the concierge service...thanks to Scarlett), from check-in to check-out everyone was efficient, friendly and helpful. The room is very nice with a big comfortable king size bed and our room had a refridgerator which was a nice plus for us to have water/Gatorade handy and cold. We chose a little poorly with the room as we had a view of the parking lot from our balcony, but we knew that when we booked the room so that is on us...next time we'll get an ocean view room! The bathroom has a HUGE shower, nice after a day of beaching and walking. It's a great location as it has a beach (it's a little small, but big enough to lounge!), but it's also close to Duval street. We chose to walk everywhere, mostly to walk off the wonderful (and reasonably priced) food and drinks we got at the beachfront cafe/bar which serves breakfast/lunch/dinner and has a GREAT happy hour, lot's of friendly people to chat with if you want. It's a bit of a hike to Mallory Square (the end of Duval St.) to watch the sunset, but the walk feels shorter if you hit some bars along the way! Be sure to wear your most comfortable flip-flops, but if you don't want to walk it, there is a scooter rental place across the street from the property. We will certainly be coming back to a Southernmost property, our only issue is which one we want to try next (we'll probably hit one of the cute guesthouses on the property next time). We loved everything about Southernmost on the Beach and highly recommend it to anyone that wants the best of both worlds (beach and cruising Duval St.) during a stay in Key West!!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent stay”
Reviews.Author: William T
Reviews.Content: We had a great stay. My wife, 2 friends, and I had 2 rooms for 2 days. We were on 3rd floor of king size partial ocean view with private balcony, bldg D. It faced the parking lot, but we had great shots of pool and ocean. Get a floor as high as you can. Colleen, Inga, and Dexter were very nice at the hotel desk. Our elevator was down for maintenance the whole time we were there, but Inga and Dexter took care of us. The bathroom was large and very clean. The bed was comfy. The pool staff was very attentive. The customer service was above and beyond expected. You get what you pay for in Key West. We definitely will be returning to this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Nice bit not great”
Reviews.Author: stevewNj
Reviews.Content: Staff was great but we had room 640 ocean front room.half of balcony faces hotel loading dock and dumpster across the street so you here trucks backing in starting at 7am. Private beach has no access to ocean unless you go off pier and water is deep. Ants all over counter top but make sure you ask about construction going on at resort. Alot of noise at pool from workers working on rooms. Make sure you ask about this. Nice hotel but not great will try other next time

Reviews.Title: “Great Time - THE BEST...!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Joanne T
Reviews.Content: I recently spent 6 days/5 nights at the Southernmost Hotel on the Beach (SHOTB) in Key West. From the minute we registered with Dexter (very helpful), our time at SHOTB was simply wonderful. Our room number was 564. The room was beautiful. The king-size bed was so comfy. The bathroom and huge shower was very nice. The staff at SHOTB was totally awesome. John and Bill behind the cafÃ© bar were awesome and very friendly & they served at very tasty drink. Heather served us drinks by the pool and she was so sweet & the best. Boomer (our activities director & all around Mr. SHOTB) was wonderful. From beer school to wine school - yup you heard me right beer/wine school, to trivia, & Boomer just being an all around great guy - we had a blast. We met many guests at the Happy Hour - which by the http://c1.tacdn.com/img2/tamgfooter/vr/ftrHero.pngway is the absolute BEST I have ever been to - do not miss the Happy Hours. Great drinks prices ($3.00) & great finger food - loved the tuna sliders ($3.00). Iâ€™m back to work now & so miss SHOTB. I have been to many tropical island vacations, but this resort is the best.....I hope to go back soon.....real soon....Joanne from Philly

Reviews.Title: “Paradise...”
Reviews.Author: thej
Reviews.Content: We stayed three nights at this hotel and loved every minute of it. We splurged on the King Ocean Front View (room 637) - we had a number of celebrations rolled in to one. The room was clean, large, beautiful and peaceful. The bed was so comfortable with silky soft sheets. And the balcony and view...worth the money!! From our balcony we could see the jet skiers, we could see cruise ships coming and leaving, there were tarpon playing in the water just below us, and sunsets and sunrise! We did not have that much interaction with the staff, but when we did, they were friendly and helpful. On our arrival my husband slipped away very briefly, and soon after there was a knock at our door with chilled champagne for my birthday and a card delivered by the hotel staff member. We used the concierge to book restaurants for lunch and dinner. We didn't know this, but in September in Key West, a lot of businesses and restaurants close for vacation. But the Concierge recommended places to eat that were perfect - we had some of the best meals this trip. Also, we used the Concierge to book "Wind and Wine" sunset cruise, and a jet ski tour around the island. I highly recommend both. We loved the location. After a few days of walking one end of Duval street to the other our feet got a little tired, so....the last night we just stayed near the hotel! Why not, it is beautiful there! The pool isn't too large, but it is really nice, and the Shores bar there is nice as well. I can't say enough good things. I would love to stay here again soon! This room isn't cheap, but as I said, we had several special occasions to celebrate so we splurged. But, having said that, the room was worth every penny to me!!!

Reviews.Title: “I Can't Wait to Return!”
Reviews.Author: Susanbarry
Reviews.Content: Huge comfy bed, extravagantly large bathroom with an enormous shower, BeeKind bath products (I'm going to buy them at home!), in room safe, flat screen TV, nice pool, semi-private beach, abundant beach chairs and hammocks, ocean view from our balcony, great staff, especially Scarlett the concierge....I could go on & on.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous accomodation and location”
Reviews.Author: lesleyharrison
Reviews.Content: My partner and I stopped here for one night in August. The hotel room was large, clean, airy and modern. We were able to check in early, enabling us to make the most of our short stay in Key West. The view from the room balcony was spellbinding, looking out over the well maintained gardens and the ocean. it was a short walk to the famous Duval street. The hotel had a lovely swimming pool, ideal for relaxing from the journey down to Key West. Next door to the hotel is the beach cafe which has excellent happy hour deals. the food here is superb and reasonably priced. we thoroughly enjoyed our stay and just wish we could have stopped longer!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent place and friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: Sreedhar G
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the hotel mostly on trip advisor reviews which turned out to be right and thank you to all. Pros Excellent and friendly staff Concierge does it all for you if you didn't get to plan ahead The hotel is a quiet location Very close to Duval street Beautiful small private beach Beautiful private pier Cons No room service for food / drinks Restaurant closes pretty early, don't blame them as Duval street is close by. Elevators keep failing always often

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: peggyharrell
Reviews.Content: Southermost on the Beach is a great hotel. We've stayed across the street from the beach and on the beach. I prefer to be on the beach, but both are very nice, well maintained and clean. It's a good location, easy walk to anything in Key West. There are plenty of places to sit and relax on the beach, parking is free. It's a nice family place.

Reviews.Title: “Rejuvenating and Beautiful!”
Reviews.Author: Blondie3--611
Reviews.Content: Was a great trip the weather was beautiful and the whole trip was very relaxing. Everything was just as we planned.

Reviews.Title: “Hello Key West!”
Reviews.Author: BPReed
Reviews.Content: We drove to Key West for the weekend from Fort Lauderdale. After a long drive, we arrived tired and hungry. SInce it was off season, I inquired whether they could upgrade our room for the same cost (queen bed). We were upgraded to a king oceanfront suite :-). Needless to say, the room was fabulous! The view - phenominal and the bed super comfortable. The workout room was clean and the equipment was good. We ate at the Tiki bar and the food was ok - nothing real special. We lounged on the beach and by the pool - a lovely day! We loved this place and will definitely be back!

Reviews.Title: “Southernmost on the Beach delivers!”
Reviews.Author: cmcd_11
Reviews.Content: A mom and her three adult daughters just spent three great nights in this beautiful and friendly resort. The Southernmost hotel complex is down Duval Street, at the quiet end from all of the Key West craziness, but if that's your thing, Mallroy Square is quite easily accessed by bike, bus or car. The rooms, with a Gulf view from our balconies, were handsomely decorated and equipped. The pool and bar area were a pleasant way to pass some lazy hours, and the beachfront cafe offered a reasonable menu and a more than reasonable happy hour. The staff were always helpful and cheerful, and the activities director, Boomer (who taught this old lady how to snorkel) was friendly and kept things moving. Like most Key beaches, Southernmost's is nothing to write home about, but once you're past the seaweed and out in that warm Gulf water it's pretty addictive. We'll definitely be back.

Reviews.Title: “back and looking forward to the return visit”
Reviews.Author: Opie63
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Southernmost the last week in August. After the 3 hour drive down from Miami Intl we were greeted by Colleen at the front desk. She was great and efficient getting us our room keys ( stayed in room 736-building B ), explaining the grounds and various attraction around the hotel and the amenities at our disposal. So off we went to our room, fist off, parking is available as FCFS- no reserved spots and its free, Handicap parking spots are available thru out. Covered parking is available under 3 of the building, we were fortunate to get a spot under building B by the stairs near our room. Elevator service is available for the first 2 floors but our room was on the third floor and the elevator was at the opposite from where we parked. Anyways the stairs gave us a great daily workout. As a side note, we only used the car once during our weeks stay. Walking is your best mode of transportation. Upon entering the room, we were met with an amazing room but this was beat by the FANTASTIC view this room has to offer, the greens and blues of the sea just took our breaths away. This room has a king bed with ocean front view, if you ever wish to pamper yourself then request this type of room, you will not be disappointed. The room was very clean not overly spacious but still large, separate bar area with a mini fridge, blender, sink and located beneath the sink area. When you do enter the room, you are in a small entry way with a small dresser and to your right is the door leading you into the huge bathroom. Again the bathroom is clean, the shower large enough to hold 6 of your closest friends. Only complaint my wife had was the lighting was somewhat dim for her likes and wished it could have been brighter. The room has a desk area with a little window seat off to the side offering ocean views, a view of the beach and roof tops. Also a large flat screen TV hangs in the corner with a small dresser beneath it. Finally the true treasure of this room is beyond the two glass double entry doors, your very private balcony with the amazing views it gives you day and night. Every morning laying in bed, we would open the doors, letting in the gentle sea breezes and fresh air, as we waited for the morning sky to glow with the rising sun. The maid service to the room is great but never consistent with when in the day it was done or on one day we did call late in the afternoon, as we got missed. 20 minutes after a call to the front desk, we had maid service with a smile and a sincere apology. Every night we did have a turn down service which was a great touch, even down to the chocolate mints left on the pillow. The grounds are beautiful, Ocean side, there is a large sandy area of hammocks loungers with umbrella providing a peaceful setting verses the common pool area which is by the public beach side. The hotel has its own private pier, with lounge chairs and umbrella's. This is one of the best places to capture the morning sun rise for all the photo bugs out there. At the end of the pier are large steps that take you down into the sea water. About 6-7 ft ( 2 metres ) deep. From here you can swim then wade over to the public beach beside the hotel. Finally the pool area for the Southernmost is large with ample seating beside it. (if you go the web site for the Southernmost you can view the area via the web cam ). As mentioned in the past, the attendants are constantly removing the towels from vacant loungers so there were always places for us to sit when we did go down to the pool. There is a bar by the pool offering an array of drinks and food service, also morning coffee is served here free until it runs out. Large beach towels are available off the bar area as well as sun lotion and gift T shirts can be purchased here. An outdoor shower near the bar rounds out the pool area. You also have access to the other pool in the adjacent property belonging to the Southernmost. Steps away from the pool is the public beach. First off its hard to control mother nature and what the tides bring in, so I do give the staff a pat on the back for making a daily attempt to keep it clean. Two tropical storms spinning around us, it was a challenge. As guests to the hotel you have access to the chairs and hammocks on the beach, just remember to show your room card, public patrons have to pay for the use. To the left in the water by the beach it is rocky but to the right and further out it is just sandy. You can wade out for a fair bit, no sudden drop off to fear. To the left of the beach, you will find a public pier. The public beach also has the Southernmost Cafe which the staff will recommend for all your dinning. Here you can have breakfast, lunch and dinner service. Full bar service is found here also. The service we found here to be great and attentive. The menu is large for all services and there should be something on it for you. The food is average but not bad, as we did try to have at least one type service each during our stay, every time getting a table by the ocean. Cafe also prepares the pool orders, with runners going back and forth regularly. With so many food options available do not worry if this does not match your palate. We know as we did go food exploring but this was a great fall back if time was short. Getting around from the hotel is easy. This being our first time to KW, we chose this hotel for its quiet side of the key. Which meant most attractions and eateries are on the opposite side, so prepare yourself for a lot of walking. Do not think of driving as parking spots are very hard to find. Duval street is the main drag and Southernmost is on it, so you really can't get lost, just start walking. Walking will take you 20-30 minutes to reach the other end by the major pier. Here is where you can watch the sun go down or stare at the large cruise ships that come into port daily, go shopping, eat, drink and have lots of fun. So walking is free, a pedicab to the other end of the Duval street will just cost you over $30 with tip, one way and takes about 15 minutes.
