Or can take a cab, this will cost just over $10 with tip and its a 5 minute car ride. Bike and scooter rentals are available across the street and throughout the key. Many choices for many budgets and depending on how tired your legs are from all the walking you will do. Public transit is available but we did not investigate it. The hotel concierge service, we used for restaurant recommendations and reservation. We were never disappointed and the tables reserved were great. Colleen at the front desk is a good source for things to do as well. The day before we left we needed to print up our boarding passes. Colleen gave us directions to the business centre across the street at the adjacent Southernmost property. Here you have free access to the internet and can print up your boarding passes. If you have any difficulty using the computer, staff are at hand to help. Being our first visit to Key West, Southernmost made it a great vacation, Thank you and we are looking forward to a return to the hotel in the near future.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel, Friendly Staff, We'll be back!”
Reviews.Author: KWest_Dreamer
Reviews.Content: Beautiful Hotel on the water with stunning views of the Atlantic. Nice Semi-Private beach, Excellent Pool. Excellent location on the end of Duval, just a block from the Southermost Monument.

Reviews.Title: “Stayed the first two nights then had to come back for our Last Night in Keywest”
Reviews.Author: gajone
Reviews.Content: We liked the whole experience. Make sure to hit the happy hour in the cafe across the beach. They also have great food. You will find the staff at the Southern Most @ the Beach to be very warm and caring. We will come back to this place.

Reviews.Title: “We loved it and we'll be back”
Reviews.Author: braided16
Reviews.Content: Everything was perfect. Got updated to a ocean view over looking the ocean and the pool. The room was beautiful. Everything was brand new. Location was great. The staff was SO SO nice. In an industry where customer service is getting hard to find, These folks were great. Activities everyday at the pool. Boomer gave snokel lessons and later taught everyone to hula hoop. Very nice experience. I've been to Key West at least 25 times, these folks did a bang up job!

Reviews.Title: “It had everying we were looking for at Key West.”
Reviews.Author: Ann352
Reviews.Content: The staff was wonderful and very helpful in helping us negotiate Key West. Our room had recently been refurbished and is was fabulous. I would recommend this hotel to anyone for any occasion.

Reviews.Title: “Really enjoyed this property”
Reviews.Author: kimbo1010
Reviews.Content: Check-in was fast and easy. Front desk staff gave us valuable information and they were fun too. Request beach front/beach view room. The middle buildings without a view would not have been for me. The grounds and buildings are immaculate, frequented by bird life. The bartender at the beautiful pool was excellent. Our room was clean and well-designed. Don't expect a microwave and the "coffee pot" was less than desirable but there is a fridge and you can grab a cup o'joe at the beach restaurant on grounds. Our balcony was spacious, suspended above the sea offering lovely sunrise and sunset views. A constant ocean breeze keeps the noseeums and mosquitos at bay. I like the pier jutting into the sea with a row of lawn chairs and tables for comfort and a stairway directly into the water. Hammocks are scattered across the grounds under lovely, swaying palm trees. Some people chose to sleep in the hammocks all night because it's so beautiful and peaceful. The food at the restaurant was delicious. You can walk into town but after doing it once we chose to use the ubiquitous bicycle rick-shaws. I recommend the Conch Train Tour and visiting the Hemingway House. You can also rent a car and drive up to Marathon Key for a wonderful dinner at the Sunset Grill with a view of 7-mile bridge and a parade of sailboats. Entertainment in town at Mallory Square in the early evening was fun. I'd love to go back. Truly this hotel was so accommodating, clean and beautiful - you will enjoy it!

Reviews.Title: “'Great Atmosphere'”
Reviews.Author: Ruud1302
Reviews.Content: We had a fine stayover in a wonderfull oceanview (side) room. The rooms are big and very clean with great bathroom and shower The private beach is nice and clean and plenty of beds The pool is big enough and plenty of beds and umbrellas Staff is very nice and helpfull

Reviews.Title: “Very nice, could have been great”
Reviews.Author: Sampsonite21
Reviews.Content: This was a very beautiful place. The rooms were very nice and big and maintained very well. The bathroom was also very big, with a nice sized shower and bench. There was no tub in our room, and our "ocean view" was a very small piece of the ocean we were able to see over the top of another building. We stayed on the second floor of building "D". The staff was very nice. Happy hour drinks at the bar were reasonable, but this is the only time I would recommend getting drinks there. The drink prices were a little rediculous for regular priced drinks. If they would lower the price to something a bit more reasonable, I'm sure they would sell way more drinks. The drinks were good though, but we usually only got one and split it while at the pool during non happy hour. The pool was great and we spent most of our sun time there. The beach area in front of the cafe had a ton of seaweed that washed up that no one seemed to want to clean up. So when we did get in the ocean, we got in by way of the private pier, which put you in over your head, so we didn't stay in too long. Being at the far end of Duvall street wasn't too bad, but it did get annoying b/c all of the excursions and tours we did were at the opposite end. So that is something to think about if you will be doing alot of activities. My only other complaint was the shower pressure. If you're a female, you know how important this is. This wasn't the worst I have ever had, but definitely notable. Also there were these tiny, almost clear, ants in the room on the counter tops and dresser. Not sure where they came from, but there were always a few around. Oh, and I did inquire about a manicure at the spa... $40 for a regular manicure. I skipped it. Overall, this was a nice place to stay. Next trip we will probably try somewhere else in the middle or towards Mallory Square.

Reviews.Title: “Totally worth all the research”
Reviews.Author: brentBatonRouge
Reviews.Content: We are all alike we make plans to go on a trip and the research begins. Of course, we all want very nice accomodations when we go somewhere - price point usually is a determining factor -- but the Southernmost on the Beach is worth every penny that you spend -- When traveling we always try to stay at a 4-5 star hotel and this hotel was great - the room overlooking the ocean was beautiful - and the interior design aspect of the room was wonderful -- very spacious and the sheets were a true 400 tc -- many hotels brag about that and they don't measure up but these surely did -- When we research we usually see these wonderful photo shots on their web-page and then get there only to be disappointed but this did not happen at the Southermost it was as lovely as the pictures. The restaurant food was good but not 4-5 star rating but to get a good meal with very casual dining it worked well . Enjoyed our stay very much and will be back !! Thanks

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay Boomer rocks!”
Reviews.Author: PJApt2
Reviews.Content: My wife and I just got back from Southernmost on the beach on September 4th. We loved it!!! Great beach and pool!!! Quiet end but you can still walk to Duval street. The rooms are spotless and beautiful! Maids are very quick too! They have a lot of events to participate in Snorkel school which I couldn't get up for (10am) LOL, but I wanted to. We participated in the beer school, wine school, trivia, walhooky, cornhole. The host of all these events was neamed Boomer McFall and he is very entertaining and fun. We would definetly stay there again. But also keeep in mind this regional chain owns the Southernmost hotel, The La Mer guest house, and the Dewey house. All of which you have accsess to all the facilities. I recommend staying at any of these properties. Also they don't over price the drinks at the pool bars like a lot of Resorts do. We spent 4 nights at the hotel and 4 nights at the On the Beach and we were extremely pleased with everything! We highly recommend staying here.

Reviews.Title: “BEST PLACE TO STAY!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Jrflossy
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just got back from southernmost on the beach on Monday august 29th. We loved it!!! Great beach and pool!!! Quiet end but can still walk to Duvall street. The rooms are spotless and beautiful! Great bathroom. The front desk people are very helpful!!! We go away a lot and are very picky were we stay. But we wouldn't stay anywhere else while in key west!!! The pool bars have good food and drinks too!!!

Reviews.Title: “Best in Key West”
Reviews.Author: Vincent g
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at the Casa Marina and the Ocean Key with the Southermost being our hotel of choice when we return. We stayed in a ocean front room which was superb. We had a welcome note of congratulations for our 26th anniversary and chocolates. The finishing were top notch which matched the hotel staff, maid staff and Annie our favorite Bar Keep at the Southernmost Cafe, try the 4-7 happy hour it shouldnt be missed. One thing to know. The hotel has many complementary onsitie activites. It was fun to get my PHD in Wine tasting from Kathy and Boomer, they were great. We had requested an upgrade to ocean front in our notes when making our reservation. At check out we were charged for the upgrade. We did discuss this with the hotel desk and it was adjusted to our origianal reservation. I would suggest asking if any upgrades offered to you are free. This will be our hotel of choice when we visit Key west again and again.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in an alright destination”
Reviews.Author: empac99
Reviews.Content: We liked key West with the touristy shops and street performers and night life, but we loved Southernmost. We were bumped from a boat to the Bahamas (thanks Irene), so we went wanderlust down through the keys and when we ran out of road, we stopped and found ourselves at Southernmost. Key West may be better suited to the "spring-break-type" crowd, and I don't know if we'll go back, but if we do, we'll stay at Southernmost

Reviews.Title: “Clean, relaxing and perfect location”
Reviews.Author: FloridaMainers
Reviews.Content: we stayed at the Southernmost Hotel and it's great because you can use the amenties at their other accomodations as well. We loved the pool at the Hotel and the bar with live music poolside on Saturday was just a bonus. Great location for visiting Duval street but away from the noise and commotion when it's time to relax. This was our second visit and when we go again to Key West (which is a yearly event for us) we will again be using one of the Southernmost accomodations.

Reviews.Title: “Great honeymoon experience!”
Reviews.Author: Hawes686
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just returned from our honeymoon to the Southernmost hotel collection, and we loved it. The staff could not have been more fun and friendly, and we really felt like people made an effort for us. Special staff shout-outs to Boomer McFalls, Kathy Nguyen, and Heather at the Shores Bar, thanks for taking good care of us! The beach and pool areas are fabulous, happy hour at the Cafe was excellent (LOVE the tuna sliders!), and the whole grounds are just really pretty and well-kept. The only minor complaint we had was that housekeeping never got to our room before 1:00pm, which was a bit of a problem for us since we are early risers and were out and about all morning and would want to use our room around 1/2pm and couldn't or would have to forgo housekeeping services. Overall though, we had a wonderful time, and will definitely be back! We would love to join some sort of membership club with this resort so we could come back every year.

Reviews.Title: “"Location, Location, Location" Southernmost on the beach has it all !”
Reviews.Author: James M
Reviews.Content: Excellent location off of the very busy Duval Street. Super friendly staff from the moment of arrival and check in until the final smile at checkout time. Rooms were extremely spacious and comfortable, huge shower with a fantastic, quiet A/C which digitally kept the room to the exact temperature you require. The pool and facilities were kept clean and tidy at all times. Probably the best and most relaxing hotel we have had the pleasure to stay. It will definitely be our place of stay the next time we are in Key West. Which is not too far away.

Reviews.Title: “Love it here, can't wait to return!”
Reviews.Author: happytraveler0801
Reviews.Content: This was our second stay at Southernmost on the Beach and will stay again the next time we head to Key West. From the moment we checked in (Dexter is an asset to your organization) until we checked out, this resort felt like our home away from home. Breakfast at the Southernmost Cafe was delicious and our waiter Cory was great. The pool, beach and grounds are well taken care of and a great place to relax. Our room had a balcony with an ocean view. It was tastefully decorated and roomy. The convenient location is close to Duval Street and all the activities, shopping and restaurants. We have recommended this resort to our family and friends.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Resort, Amazing Staff!!”
Reviews.Author: MARIANNE46124
Reviews.Content: My husband and I go to Key West twice a year and stay somewhere new each time. We've been searching for a "favorite place"..........We have found it!! Southernmost Point On The Beach is the resort of our dreams. Expect to find spacious guest rooms. comfortable beds and balconies. My favorite part of the room was the shower. You have to see it to believe it. The food at the Cafe is as good if not better, than a big fancy restaurant. Prices are reasonable and drinks are so good. You'll love the grounds and the beach. There's even a tanning pier with steps that lead right into the water. The staff goes above and beyond to make your stay enjoyable. Do not hesitate to check out this resort. You stay one time, you will be hooked!!! Can't wait to get back in May.

Reviews.Title: “Southernmost on the Beach was Great!”
Reviews.Author: Libralady
Reviews.Content: We spent three nights at Southernmost on the Beach in August and had a wonderful stay. We were greeted at Reception by Dexter who went out of his way to explain the hotel facilities, including those at the Southernmost Hotel across the street whose facilities we were also entitled to use. He even looked up two restaurants which had been recommended to us so we would have addresses and phone numbers for them. At first I was disappointed in our room location, as it was on the first floor, but I soon realized that our view of the ocean was still lovely. But, if we return to Southernmost on the Beach, I will go through the phone reservation system and request a second floor room, if available. Our room was lovely, spotlessly clean and kept that way by the housekeeping staff. My only complaint about the room itself was that there were no chairs aside from the desk chair. But, the way the headboard was made, it was comfortable to sit on the bed to watch TV in the evening. The bathroom was amazing, with a huge shower and separate tub with whirlpool jets. We appreciated the free wi-fi in our hotel room, and also the free parkingâ€¦not a small perk when most hotels charge for parking. The location of the hotel was perfect, at one end of Duval Street, easily accessible to restaurants and attractions. We especially loved the Butterfly conservatory. That is a not-to-be-missed experience with many colorful butterflies flying all around, along with beautiful birds. We swam in the ocean off of the pier which was near our room, and also used the Southernmost on the Beach pool, which was lovely. We could also have used two pools located at the Southernmost Hotel. It was nice to be able to enter the ocean directly from the pier, as the beach next door was marred by huge amounts of seaweed on the shore, and in the shallow part of the ocean. They did work in the mornings to rake and remove the seaweed, but it was a losing battle. We had three breakfasts at the Southernmost Beach CafÃ© and thoroughly enjoyed the experience. Our three different servers were all very attentive and pleasant, and the food was plentiful, tasty and reasonably priced. The restaurant is open-air, which was lovely in the morning to feel the breeze and watch the ocean. It might have been a bit hot to eat there later in the day. We would love to return to the Southernmost on the Beach Hotel, but will probably schedule that in the winter. August is a very oppressive time to be in the Keys, with heat indices over 100 most days. But, spending time in the water helped, as did the lovely sunset catamaran trip we took, where we had wonderful breezes.

Reviews.Title: “I adore this hotel”
Reviews.Author: Heather R
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 4 nights at Southernmost on the beach (Oceanfront Balcony Room) and felt like I was in paradise. Stunning room, great amenities, fun swimming/snorkle pier. Everyone from housekeeping, concierge, front desk, pool staff, cafe and bar staff were so friendly and accomodating and went above and beyond. This was a get away trip for my 40th birthday with my husband without the kids and this hotel was the perfect getaway. We didnt want to leave our room it was so elegant. Wonderful pools, beach, activities, hammocks, food. Im kind of a hotel snob and this hotel was very impressive. The rooms were stunning, and nothing was overlooked to make the room feel like paradise. Be sure to catch happy hour at the cafe for great drinks and appetizers. Parking was very easy. The atmosphere and food at the Beach cafe is fantastic. We ate breakfast there everymorning it was great.

Reviews.Title: “liked it”
Reviews.Author: xxapmc
Reviews.Content: nice stay. great location. pleasant meal at their restaurant. but the "barlady" is a dork

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely Amazing!”
Reviews.Author: Jilianld
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend (now fiance...we got engaged on our first day at the resort) and I booked this trip in April. We stayed at the Southernmost on Beach from August 22nd til the 26th. After reading countless reviews of the hotel I was really hoping that we wouldn't be disappointed. Trust me, we were not! Everything about this hotel is perfection; from the staff, to the grounds and the on site restaurant. It is located next to a beautiful beach area with plenty of umbrellas and palm trees for shade. Yes, there is seaweed on the beach and in the water but they use a tractor to remove as much as they can each morning, This is a part of nature so deal with it! (This was one of the main complaints I read about before coming.) The pool area is spotless and they have water coolers for the guests as well as fresh towels all day. We upgraded our room when we got there and ended up with a West Lawn King room. This was as good as an ocean front room if you ask me. We had a view of the beach/ocean out our window and we were only steps from the pool. The upgrade was worth every penny. Boomer, the activities director runs different events throughout the week. We went to beer school twice and also tried wine school. They were both very fun and just one of the perks the hotel offers at no charge. They also offer snorkel and paddleboard lessons but we did not have a chance to try either. The pool bar has wonderful frozen drinks and the Southernmost on the Beach Cafe has the best happy hour ever. This was one of the most memorable vacations I've ever been on and I was so grateful that it got to take place in an amazing town and hotel. I would recommend the Southernmost to anyone; and I am known to be a "hotel snob"!

Reviews.Title: “Love it, can't wait to go back!”
Reviews.Author: COOPER0911
Reviews.Content: My husband and I went down for an early 20th. Anniversary, we had the best time!. The trip to Key West was our first, and I found the Southernmost on the Beach on Expedia.com. The hotel was clean and comfortable, the staff was amazing! Everyone at the Southernmost was friendly and helpful LOVED IT!! We are already looking into going back next year with our two teen boys. 5 Stars on this hotel for sure!

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely going back”
Reviews.Author: Kelly S
Reviews.Content: From the second we got there, every one was so helpful. Southernmost of the Beach is gorgeous and absolutely somewhere we are going again. We go to Key West every year and this has been the best place we have stayed. From the pool, to the restaurant, to all of the staff, everything was perfect. Can't say enough good things.

Reviews.Title: “amazing vaca!”
Reviews.Author: erin s
Reviews.Content: this was our first trip to key west. after reading lots of reviews, we decided to stay here. we didnt want to be near the "night life". it was quiet on this end of Duval st. but thats what we wanted. we loved eating breakfast every morning at the cafe. it was open to the beach and ocean views! we loved being able to use any of the 3 pools and 2 of them had bars. the drinks are great! we didnt mind that the building we stayed in wasnt right on the beach (it was a short block away). but we werent in the room much anyways. the rooms were exactly like the pics, clean and spacious.and even though the hotel was full, we werent bothered by the neighbors. most everyone was friendly and helpful. even though we stayed at the other end of Duval st, away from mallory square, it wasnt hard to get to down there. i booked through a 3rd party and felt we got a great deal on our stay. we would recommend it to anyone and cant wait to go back! just book early, they fill up quickly!!

Reviews.Title: “LOVED IT!!”
Reviews.Author: Erin363
Reviews.Content: My fiance and I just got back from a 5 night stay at Southernmost on the Beach and had a wonderful time. The hotel is beautiful, clean, and very accomodating. Every single worker was cordial and extremely helpful with any question we had. We spent most of our time by the pool where there is live music on most days. Boomer is the Activities Coordinator at the hotel and does a GREAT job of offering fun things to do that aren't too in your face. We did the "Beer School" and participated in "Pool Trivia." He gives out tokens for free drinks at the bar for random events throughout the day which is always a plus. After walking around Duval and the surrounding streets, it was our opinion that this hotel was the best choice! It is on the far end of Duval so it is quiet but still within walking distance to all the bars and shops. Also, this hotel is great for it has a private beach area. Not many hotels in Key West have beach access so this is definitely a plus! If you are going to Key West, you have to stay here. I have traveled a lot over the years and this was one of the nicest hotels I have stayed in! It is worth every single penny.

Reviews.Title: “We Will Be Back”
Reviews.Author: NYMike929
Reviews.Content: My girlfriend and I stayed at the Southernmost on the Beach from 8/14 to 8/19. We had a West Lawn King Deluxe room with a view of the ocean. Check-in was fast and easy, our room was well appointed and the staff was friendly and helpful. The hotel is located at the quiet end of Duval so you are far enough from the craziness of downtown but not too far that you cannot walk to this area. There is a nice pool area, and a beach with chairs, towels, umbrellas, and rafts. The restaurant overlooks the ocean, the food is good they have great happy hour specials. There is something to be said for waking up, looking out your window and seeing that light blue water!! I will definitely be staying here again!!

Reviews.Title: “we loved it....great room...comfortable bed...and nice shower!”
Reviews.Author: iliveforvacation1960
Reviews.Content: We loved the hotel....the weather was very humid, so would recommend staying here in "cooler" months! Proximity to restaurants, bars and stores was good...would have rented bikes if the temp was cooler...but could walk easily to most places. Lots to see and do in Key West!Our only small issue was it would be really good if the hotel offered a transfer from the airport....only a few miles away....and taxi's charged $8/person....seems ridiculous! We also liked the sunning dock with umbrellas and chairs...great view and breeze! Excellent happy hour at the restaurant on property....food reasonably priced and good...

Reviews.Title: “Amazing”
Reviews.Author: VAinCT
Reviews.Content: Beautiful hotel with great beach and pools. Walk to nightlife and restaurants. Great fitness room and helpful staff. Great price.....half the price of Hawks Cay and 5x as nice. Nice pillow and gorgeous rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Exactly what we were looking for!”
Reviews.Author: DaveandTina
Reviews.Content: We loved our stay in Key West and at the Southernmost on the Beach! It had everything we were looking for...beach, ocean views, nice pool, quiet, comfy room, on-site open-air restaurant, within walking distance to popular attractions. We slept great, were very relaxed, ate well, got some nice pool and beach time and enjoyed walking around each day to see the sights. You can't go wrong with the Southernmost on the Beach!

Reviews.Title: “Exceptional property, Amazingly wonderful beds!”
Reviews.Author: tcaruso768
Reviews.Content: Everything about this hotel met or exceeded our expectations. In is perfectly located close to the Old Town of Key West where you want to visit daily (rent bikes or scooters if it's too hot for you to walk it!) The rooms are spacious, CLEAN, beautifully appointed, and well thought out. The staff at the pools (thanks Louis), the cafe (thanks Katie), the front desk ( thanks Wally, Scarlett and Julie!) were all wonderful, helpful and pleasant! I mention the FABULOUS beds because we frequently travel to Mexico where the beds are made by the Flintstones Mattress Company - hard as bedrock! LOL! These were like sleeping on a cloud! A few things to note: Happy hour at the Southernmost Cafe is wonderful - inexpensive and DELICIOUS - say "Pelican Wings !! Breakfast is cheaper if you eat there as well - KEY WEST IS EXPENSIVE to feed a family, and there were only three of us! I will however, recommend the Banana Cafe, a few blocks heading down Duval towards town (French crepes and omelettes, lunchfare...and dinner) I truthfully could have eaten every meal here I thought is ws heavenly! I will also tell you somethng to be aware of: If you are looking for delicous conch chowder like we were - EVERYONE on the island prepares a MANHATTAN STYLE chowder - RED BASE, not WHITE chowder! Just know that, so if it's not your favorite, you don't go around ordering it and then being disappointed. Still speaking of CONCH - there inthe Conch Republic - the best conch fritters in my opinion are to be found at the Old Mexican Cafe on Duval Street closer to Mallory Square. All of the food at this Cafe was delicious and moderately priced. Two other notewrothy places to eat : Two Friends Restaurant (moderate AND delicious) and on the expensive side, Hot Tin Roof near the pier - the food was great and the view of the sunset is without compare! We loved our time there and hope to be back to explore more very soon!

Reviews.Title: “Loved it! Can't wait to go back!”
Reviews.Author: Nicole1117
Reviews.Content: We had a very pleasant stay at Southernmost on the Beach this past August 4th â€“ 9th. We arrived at the hotel around noon and were able to check in immediately. Dexter at the front desk helped us and was very friendly. We loved our room, which was in building â€œCâ€� on the 2nd floor â€“ Room 620. It overlooked the ocean and the beach. The beds are SO comfortable, thus I never wanted to get out of bed in the morning! There was a huge flat screen TV at the foot of the bed â€“ a nice feature adding to the lovely accommodations. The bathroom itself was small, but the shower was large and beautifully tiled. I like how the shower and toilet were kept separate from the sink/vanity because it made it easier for 2 people to get showered and dressed in the room. Not only are the rooms comfortable and well-decorated, but theyâ€™re extremely clean. I donâ€™t have a single complaint about our room. The pool at this hotel was wonderful! It was very big, allowing for plenty of space between other guests in the pool. Although a lot of the chairs were reserved with towels, we always were able to find 2 together. I also noticed hotel employees taking towels off the chairs that were unoccupied for long periods of time. I was impressed, as so many resorts Iâ€™ve been to allow guests to reserve chairs with towels even when they disappear for hours. There is a basketball net on the shallow end of the pool, which was pretty cool. I also like how the pool ranged from about 3 feet to 7 feet. It was nice that they had a â€œdeep endâ€� to swim around in, unlike many hotels Iâ€™ve visited. The pool area also often had live music and we really enjoyed it! One day there were steel drums, another day there was a guy playing acoustic guitar. Obviously, the pool at this hotel was a huge plus! The Shores Bar was the cherry on top! Though we didnâ€™t swim in the other pools within the rest of their properties, we did walk through and they looked just as nice and entertaining. I initially booked this hotel because it was located on the beach, but I was somewhat disappointed with what I saw. Obviously nobody can help the fact that seaweed washes up on shore, but I never saw any employee attempting to rake the seaweed up, as I have at resorts in other destinations. I was surprised because I saw 2 weddings on the beach â€“ which were beautiful by the way â€“ but the seaweed on the beach was just distracting to me. It kept me from ever sunbathing or swimming there, which again, was my reason for choosing this particular hotel. Instead, we rented bikes through the concierge in the hotel lobby and rode over to Fort Zachary Taylor State Park. That beach there is very nice, but super rocky. As silly as they might look, your best bet is to wear water shoes there. Overall, we really enjoyed our stay at Southernmost on the Beach. Aside from the beach itself, the property is gorgeous and its convenient location on the quiet end of Duval is PERFECT. Rent a bike right from the concierge and ride around the island. Weâ€™re looking forward to our next stay at this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “A wonderful mini vacation that could have ended badly...”
Reviews.Author: Kerstin W
Reviews.Content: Southernmosrt on the Beach's staff member Michael saved us from total disaster: When leaving our room on Monday, my husband left behind a fanny-pack filled with cash, credit cards, computer keys and other extremely sensitive items. We didn't miss the pack and took off for our home in Boca Raton after three fun-filled and relaxing days at this fabulous hotel. Michael called us when we had just passed through Key Largo to tell us that a "small black bag" had been left behind in our room. We realized what it was and almost panicked. But not to worry. Michael promptly organized an insured, overnight FedEx delivery of the pack which arrived early the following morning. We breathed a big sigh of relief and felt very good about Southernmost Hotel on the Beach. We are forever thankful for the professional handling of this matter. We'll definitely be back. I've already recommended you to friends. Kerstin

Reviews.Title: “I loved it, my husband & I are returning in Jan”
Reviews.Author: CCrisp
Reviews.Content: Very nice, with 3 pools and great pool bars. Great food at the beach cafe and yes, they do have a sandy beach . At the quiet end of Duvall Street, all walkable. Loved this place.

Reviews.Title: “We enjoy and love it and come back !”
Reviews.Author: PrinzTom
Reviews.Content: so, it was great. a beautiful hotel with a great area. the rooms are very nice and the service is top. beach, pool and everything was beautiful.

Reviews.Title: “We will be back!”
Reviews.Author: Donna M
Reviews.Content: My husband, son, parentsand I spent five lovely nights at The Southernmost Resort on the Beach. Everything was top notch from the front desk accomodating our changing reservation requirements to Heather at the pool remembering what we liked and didn't like to drink! The breakfasts and dinners we enjoyed at the Beach Cafe were reasonable priced and the servers were friendly. We have stayed at some of the very best hotels (Fairmont in San Francisco, Grand Floridian in Disney World) and The Southernmost Resort on the Beach is right up there with the best.

Reviews.Title: “Best Place on Earth”
Reviews.Author: baileybananas
Reviews.Content: Just got back from my honeymoon, We stayed in the ocean front king room and it was worth every penny. Right on duval, but still extremely relaxing and quiet. The cafe had awesome food and was reasonably priced. All of the staff were extremely helpful and very very nice. I have stayed at many many places and this by far has been the best experience yet. stayed in room 639 which is right on the ocean, and ask anyone at the front desk it is one of the best rooms. room did not have a tub but did have a very large shower that was the only small negitive remark. Overall i highly recomend this resort to anyone staying on key west, It was definiatly a great experience!

Reviews.Title: “Very fun and relaxing”
Reviews.Author: Kellie C
Reviews.Content: Kathy, Boomer and Jeff are very professional and the perfect hosts for this Hotel. Boomer expecially for drawing the travelers and their children out to explore Southernmost. All the staff have all created a warmth and pleasure to this beautiful atmostphere. The Gardener is "the artist" he who created the relaxing pockets of retreats with the lovely & touchable landscapes should create more. The Homekeeping Crew kept the place in the greatest shape no matter how messy we travelers become, which can be messy. Thank you for taking pride in the Southernmost Hotel, this means a lot to me and will result in the return of a loyal customer. Keep up the challenge buy keep it the same. Kellie Conetsco Medina Ohio.

Reviews.Title: “Super rooms, staff, and beach.”
Reviews.Author: FlRo
Reviews.Content: Cindy and Michael were at the front desk, Scarlett was the concierge, Julie, Phil & Mary manned the restaurant. They all did a super job to make everyone feel welcome. The beds in the rooms were great, the sheets and towels were soft, food at the restaurant was good and they even cooked the 5 lobster and the 1 grouper we had caught, and the any outings were booked by the concierge, the pool was great and we had full privileges at the sister hotel across the street. This hotel and staff are certainly a rare find, give it a try you will enjoy your vacation if you stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Beyond Happy”
Reviews.Author: Imjessesgirl
Reviews.Content: We loved just about everything about the hotel. The rooms were nicely appointed and very clean and the view was to die for. My husband and I were greatful that it's located in the more relaxed part of town(the other end on Duval St.) What's not to love about sitting on the beach in a hammock, under a palm tree, reading a good book?? or taking a swim in the infinitiy pool after a work out in the fitness center.There's a great little cuban cafe, right across the street for breakfast or lunch and for dinner we stumbled upon The Pasta Garden of Key West(Yummy!!) while out sight seeing. We'll definitley be back to this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “beautiful place”
Reviews.Author: S_foridaBeachbum
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Southern Most Hotel for three nights. Although we were in Key West at the hottest time of the year our stay in Key west was awesome. The hotel was very clean and had all the amenities that we could ask for. The only compliant we have is the beach was dirty ( sea Kelp) during the low tide but you can't fight Mother Nature. The snorkeling was great right out from the resort. No need to pay for the extra snorkeling adventures out of Key west. Be prepared to walk quite a way for the sunset. The hotel is at least 15 blocks away but an easy bike ride. My sister added that we wished we had been offered some kind of continential breakfast. most important relax and enjoy....

Reviews.Title: “Tip to get a fantastic ocean view newly decorated room.”
Reviews.Author: MTR68
Reviews.Content: On the hotel website, go to "Maps and Directions" at the bottom. Open tihe "Property Map" and choose a room in the buildings A or B. They have elevator and covered parking. If you want to pay a bit more (which is worth) ask for the room 540. It's not listed in the map and serves as a 'dummy' for upgrades. So, ask for it. It's new, ocean front and secluded.

Reviews.Title: “A place in paradise and feels like home”
Reviews.Author: Keiswang
Reviews.Content: My husband and I drove 7,8 hours from Busch gardens in Tampa directly to Key West. It was a long and tiresome trip. When we arrived, it was almost 11 o'clock. I was not happy with anything at that point and thought we might have made a mistake to come so far for nothing particular but I was totally wrong. The day after we went for breakfast and then to the pool. After seeing the beach, palm trees and hammocks hanging around I start to relax. I figured that Key West must be the most wonderful place I have ever been to and Southernmost on the beach might have the world's softest bed I have ever slept in. The service was great and the staff was very friendly and helpful. Next time we are in Key West we will still choose Southernmost on the beach. You should consider it, too:-)

Reviews.Title: “Will definitely be coming back to stay at the Southernmost on the Beach”
Reviews.Author: AimeeMichele
Reviews.Content: I honestly thought that this would be too far away from where I wanted to stay, however it's not. With all the places you can stop at on the way to where ever you want to go, it wasn't a bad walk! I never thought of Key West as a relaxing vacation spot....I love the action, bar hopping, craziness of Duval and always have stayed right by it. However, the Southernmost always had this allure to me, so I figured why not?!? Everything from the staff to the room to the grounds are amazing! The staff are so nice and genuine. The grounds are immaculate and beautiful! The rooms, are super clean and have to have been recently renovated (everything looked brand new). The only thing I didn't like about the room was that the air conditioner unit was by our balcony and no A/C got into the bathroom. No biggie though, definitely isn't enough to keep me away and it's not like it became unbearable hot in the bathroom. You could seriously stay here for a week and never need or want to leave! Elizabeth, one of the general managers, totally went above and beyond to ensure that our stay was a pure delight! I will definitely be back and have already recommended this property to everyone I know. Stay here, you won't regret it!

Reviews.Title: “Couldn't have stayed at a better hotel for our wedding!”
Reviews.Author: Marz1123
Reviews.Content: My husband and I got married at the southernmost on the beach a little over a month ago. We had the most amazing time. This hotel was in a great location. We had a beautiful oceanview room (make sure you specify-- they have partial views, not quite the same but still nice). The rooms looked recently updated and have nice big bathrooms. Nothing beat having the pool and the beach right there for our guests. We would love to go back for our anniversary!!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Accommodations”
Reviews.Author: KenFleischer
Reviews.Content: Southernmost on the Beach has impeccably maintained rooms with beautiful views (we stayed in a oceanview w/balcony on the third floor). The staff is friendly and responsive. The grounds are well-groomed with lots of possibilities (lounging on the pier, relaxing in a hammock, poolside activities, etc.). The hotel is a short ride (~3 miles) from the airport and a short walk from the restaurant/bar scene of Duval Street. This was our second stay, and we'll definitely return!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel with a wonderful location”
Reviews.Author: sb1London
Reviews.Content: This is a fantastic place to stay in Key West - right by the ocean with plenty of areas to while away the days - a private beach, the pool, gardens... We stayed in a distant view king room - fitted out to a very high standard and well maintained, with the exception of an unbelievably loud air conditioning unit (it was impossible to sleep if it was turned on - so we used the ceiling fan instead). Staff were friendly, the hotel was a short walk to Duval St and we'd go back here in a heart beat. Rates are fairly high, but with it is understandable given the location.

Reviews.Title: “My favorite beach hotel”
Reviews.Author: TulsaTraveler0807
Reviews.Content: We loved this hotel. We were in one of the rooms on the far end of the property. We had a fabulous rooms with a huge balcony directly facing the ocean. The hotel was on the opposite end of Duval St from Mallory Square. It was about a 10-15 minute walk. The hotel has a nice pool and bar. It's next to a small beach. The hotel staff will set up chairs and tables for you on the beach. They also bring you frozen towels and treats.

Reviews.Title: “OUTSTANDING!!!”
Reviews.Author: air-we-go-again
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 5 nights in this beautiful hotel, from start to finish it exceeded our expectations. The room was superb, clean and the view was priceless !! Would not concider anywhere else when we book again. 5 star hotel and staff.

Reviews.Title: “An enjoyable stay”
Reviews.Author: samjabo
Reviews.Content: This is a very nice hotel. The hotel location and premise are so inviting. It is located at the southernmost tip of the island just a walking distance from the southernmost beach monument "90 miles to cuba". We stayed in a partial ocean view room on the second floor in building B. The view from the room was great. Room is clean and adequately equipped. That said, water pressure was noticeably low. Also the rooms' balconies were in my opinion very close with not much privacy. Finding a parking spot can be difficult if you return late. One important point to note, I did notice that practically anybody can come in from outside and enter the pool area and have a nice swim. The swimming pool was good and the tiki bar was great. The beach in my opinion is not as great as it should, though the white sands and the palm or the coconut trees are perfect. Water is mercky and rocky and can't imagine anybody going in the water without protective footware. Water was actualy too warm, but, as you go deeper, you can feel a cool water current at your feet and the water becomes amazingly clear at about 100 feet away from the beach and you can pratically see your legs from the water surface. At this distance, water is close to neck level and currents were getting strong and I had to fight my way to the close-by marina ladder where the refuge was much welcomed. The views of the beach are very nice especially from the beachfront cafe where food and service were always great while prices were not that expensive. Hotel staff were always helpful and courteous. We simply had a very nice time. Wather in Key West was hot and muggy and it seemed that Key Largo was cooler especially at night.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great stay”
Reviews.Author: asjassie
Reviews.Content: My husband and I enjoyed a relaxing 3 night stay at the Southernmost on the Beach in July. The room was very clean, and recently renovated. It had nice closet and drawer space for unpacking, mini fridge and nice, thick towels. We flew right into Key West and did not have a car, but were able to walk everywhere we wanted to go. The hotel is at the end of Duval Street, so each day we walked to breakfast and again to the sunset and dinner. We loved the pool at the hotel and it was easy to get lounge chairs with umbrellas. We took advantage of the ice machine and cold water available near the pool. The beach was pretty, but not great. It looked murky at the shore and was rocky underfoot, so instead we relaxed under an umbrella on the hotel's pier and used the stairs at the end of the pier to go into the ocean. We would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location and View...Needs Some Minor Improvements”
Reviews.Author: AKPantelis
Reviews.Content: Southernmost on the Beach is a relatively new hotel that is very clean and in a perfect location. The staff is friendly and the facilities are plentiful and well maintained. The location is at the far Eastern end of Duval Street which makes it far enough away from the noise/crowds of the party scene but close enough (10-15 minutes) to walk and not worry about transportation. There are a couple of things to point out that the resort can easily and should definitely address/improve. The first disappointment is the pool area. The resort has a great pool w/ a tiki bar that is right on the ocean. However, the resort makes no effort to control access and restrict usage to only hotel guests. This is very problematic because pool chairs get reserved and occupied very early by non-hotel guests, even though the pool rules state that usage is reserved exclusively for guests. The pool and hotel staff were even aware that non-guests had removed items from a hotel guests chair and moved their belongings, however made no effort to rectify the problem. This was a big disappointment, especially if you planning a vacation where you want to just relax by the pool. Second, the hotel towels and linens should definitely be changed. The linens are not the best thread count/quality but this can be overlooked. The towels were just simply awful. The bath towels are basically oversized hand towels and are not large enough. The texture of all of the room towels are comparable to sand paper. Especially after getting some sun, they feel awful on your skin. This is another flaw that could easily be fixed by the hotel. Aside from the above mentioned items, the overall stay was enjoyable. There are hammocks that overlook the water and a beach front restaurant that has a great happy hour and view. I would consider returning to the resort if some of the problems were addressed.

Reviews.Title: “Great Choise for our Key West Vacation”
Reviews.Author: tnoriega
Reviews.Content: Our first visit to Key West and I feel a made a great choice. The Southernmost on the beach were excellent accomodations and in a great location. At the farthest end of Duval Street but in walking distance, or carriage distance to all the main attractions and restaurants. The hotel is located right across the street to the Old Trolley tours stop and next to a great ice Cream shop and neighborhood convenience store. Great for late nigh snacks. The staff was very welcoming and provide us great customer service. We had one minor probelm with our shower upon arrival and within 10 minutes we were surprised to have a maintenance staff member arive at our door to adress the issue. While the room was probably a little small for my wife and I and my two teenagers it was still very comfortable. the next time I stay we will get a larger room. The grounds were impecably clean. We did not spend to much time at the beach since there was quite a bit of seaweed coming in but the staff made great efforts to work on keeping it clean each monring. The only suggestion i would make would be to book your own excursions on your own instead of through the concierge. While she was very nice and accomodating i ended up saving more money booking on my own. I think the hotel contract their services out to another company. One of our favorite things to do was to relax in the evening by the pool after a long day of shopping, eating and activities. It was great to come back and relax and the pool bar staff was overly accomodating in making sure we were well served with what we needed. Overall a great hotel and great experience. I will definitley be coming back to Key west and Southernmost will once again be our choice for accomodations.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent accomodations in a great location”
Reviews.Author: AHenderson25
Reviews.Content: Southernmost provides and excellent place to stay in a great location. There are a lot of fun activities provided by the hotel. The bars and restaurants are great! Fyi, they do a great wedding too.

Reviews.Title: “Great place, pools nothing special, but great location and people”
Reviews.Author: daut_travler
Reviews.Content: We really enjoyed this place and its location that allowed us to walk to Duval. People are great, the pool and beach are average. You must go to the CafÃ© for happy hour as it is good food for a great deal. If I went back to Key West I would consider staying hereâ€¦ but not in July it is way too hot. I would also consider the Waldorf property in Key West as we visited it and it looked way nice but is not walkable to Duval. Also you must do dinner at Sunset Key. It is not cheap but worth every nickel (Unlike many meals we had in Miami later in our trip).

Reviews.Title: “We came back and will be back again”
Reviews.Author: Jam050
Reviews.Content: Because of my wife's work schedule we had no choice but to come during July, never again, too hot! The best time of year to come seems to be in early Fall or late Spring. If you are energetic enough to rent a bicycle to get around during the day , do so. There are many goofg restaurants within walking distance, such as Banana Cafe ( French cuisine), Le Siboney - authentic Cuban food, and Ana's good Cuban home cooking right across from the hotel and very affordable. My wife never learned to ride a bike , so next time renting one of the golf carts or a car might be a better way to get around. The staff was really great. Of special mention are: Estrella( housekeeping), Scarlet (concierge) Juli and Phil at the beach restaurant, and Boomer-activities director, to name just a few.

Reviews.Title: “Southernmost-Most Amazing Wedding Venue!”
Reviews.Author: prettypixs
Reviews.Content: We have had nothing but warm and fuzzies about our experience with Southernmost for our daughter's wedding on April 30, 2011. Our journey started over a year ago, when we were greeted with smiling faces while searching for a wedding venue and continued until the last guest left. The whole staff was exceptional but a few people really were even more exceptional. Carrie-thank you for your relaxed and informative presentation; you has us at hello! Judi-thank you for your patience in getting all of our family and friends rooms during one of the busiest weekends of the year and special thanks from the bride and groom for the upstairs suite in La Mer. What a dream for a bride getting ready for her wedding day followed by waking up as Mrs. with a view from her balcony of the ocean. The rooms have been beautifully renovated and are so comfortable. Miguel-thank you for lugging all of my mother-of-the-bride stuff everywhere and the recommendation for Sandy's Cuban sandwich and cafe con leche! And Melissa-the coordinator extraordinaire! Thank you for your tenacity and attention to following up on details, returning phone calls and looking for solutions to all of my issues (and there were many). Your ability to make us feel like we were your only clients was amazing, given that the hotel was abuzz with it being the Songwriters Festival time. As we have heard back from our guests, all would agree that the setting for the ceremony and reception on the beach was perfect for our 100+ party. Reviews for the laua celebration buffet were outstanding-everything was beautifully presented and absolutely delish! The plantains seemed to be a real crowd pleaser! The morning after breakfast at the Gingerbread Pool was another delight. Thanks for serving up the leftover cupcakes from the night before! Yummy! Overall, the plan of the hotel was a perfect match for our event because we all spent more time being together instead of getting lost trying to find this place or that place. There was something rather magical and intimate about being surrounded by those we love and yet other guests could watch from their balconies or the side yard while the festivities occurred. It was heart-warming to have "strangers" clapping, which added to the cheers and good wishes after the ceremony. I actually "participated" in a ceremony several evenings before. It was so cool! Nothing was ever too far away. The Bistro, pools with bars, tanning on the beach or a quick swim in the ocean off the point. And yet, the southern end of Duval was across the street if guests were looking for more adventure. The only thing wrong with our stay at Southernmost is that it had to end. Thank you all from the bottom of our hearts for making this special occaision so memorable.

Reviews.Title: “GREAT HOSPITALITY, SERVICE AND LOCATION”
Reviews.Author: BIGTRAVELER18
Reviews.Content: The staff was amazing! We had the pleasure of doing a free wine tasting on the hotel grounds with "Kathy and Boomer." They really brought a personal touch to our stay. The manager even came by to thank us for choosing Southernmost Hotel. We snorkled by the pier right from the beach. The room was roomy, great, comfy bed, modern interiors. The Cuban restaurant across the beach was de-lish! The pool, bar and restaurant were all 5-star! We will definitely stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Activities Director MADE our trip!”
Reviews.Author: Danarae1
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Southernmost Hotel (across the beach) but still was able to utilize the Beach property amenities. Boomer, the activities director for the hotel was excellent. His paddle boarding and snorkeling school were great. Fun but informative and he made sure we all felt comfortable. The property is at the quiet end of Duval street but still excellent, affordable and easy cab or ticketed ride to the other end.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel”
Reviews.Author: mhmdrake
Reviews.Content: Wow! We had a wonderful time here. Beautiful facilities, friendly and helpful staff, great swimming pools and beach cafe, good location at the end of Duval Street, lots of soft sand on the beach and in the water. Would have liked to stay another 3 or 4 days, Will definitely come back here to stay again.

Reviews.Title: “ABSOLUTELY FANTASTIC!”
Reviews.Author: rbtwo4
Reviews.Content: I was looking for some where to stay and i originally found a place but then i kept searching and found Southernmost. I read the reviews and eventually said to myself Im booking this. But then i found Southernmost on the beach 3 days later! So i called reservations and wanted to see if i could change it to that one. Sure enough i was able to get a room at a great price. The room was 522 beautiful view of the garden and ocean i couldnt have asked for more! I ended up missing my connection from Mia due to bad weather in NY so i had to wait til next day for flight out to key west I was given a 50% discount for missing my one night which i thought was better than nothing. The pool was awesome, shores bar was awesome, restaurant was awesome (loved biscuits and gravy for breakfast!) beach was nice overall i WILL be coming back. Heather the bar waitress was on her game, Cindy at concierge also was a great help with out her i wouldve never got my 50% discount! Miguel was a great help with our bags and all the guys that worked at the shores bar were great. STAY HERE!

Reviews.Title: “Love this place”
Reviews.Author: Marciwne
Reviews.Content: From the rooms, to the staff, to the services, we love everything about this place. The cafe on the beach is awesome and much to our surprise, the food was priced reasonably. It is on the quiet end of the island which means we can sit out on the deck and enjoy the scenery and head up town if we want to do some partying. Highly recommend. The rooms are beautiful.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, nice rooms and friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: PRISCILLAGAVIOLI
Reviews.Content: This hotel is situated on a very good spot of Key West, a few steps fom the beach and not to far from the pubs and clubs at Duvall Street. The room is a good size, nice and clean. The staff is stremely friendly and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome location and great rooms”
Reviews.Author: Retiringonaboat
Reviews.Content: We searched long and hard to find the best place for our family in Key West. We knew we wanted to be close to Duvall, but also away from the craziness that occurs later at night. Being on the quiet end, all we had to do was get on bikes and head down the street. The rooms look identical to the pictures, which was a great relief since some of the reviews were mixed. They are recently redecorated and very transitional in decor. Wood floors, granite counters, clean lines, and "green" fixtures including a slot for the room key to start up the ac and lights reducing waste on power. I stay in hotels all the time for work and have found very few that have better quaiity thread count sheets and down pillows. I did not miss my bed at home at all due to the great sheets! Ample free parking, close proximity to public beach, private small beach, hammocks, table games outside for kids, 3 pools with pool bars and limited menu service. We were able to sit out on the small beach and pier to watch the fireworks on the 4th while the staff provided bar service and hot dogs. They even had a PA system set up with speakers to play the music from the radio station that synchronized with the fireworks. We could not have been happier with our choice.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent service and beautiful accomodations!”
Reviews.Author: curlyinparis
Reviews.Content: What a beautiful location, far from the maddening crowds of Duval Street, yet all within a 20 minute walk from its waterfront location. Rooms are beautiful ( we stayed in partial ocean view ). Property is very well maintained, and staff is extraordinary. Boomer has such a fun, warm personality and organizes wine and beer tastings, scuba lessons, hula hoop contests and more! Omar is so warm and welcoming....almost like these two are the mayors of the property! The Beach front cafe staff is great....almost too many to mention but a particular shout out to Ivan, Acey, Shelby, Cory, Corinne, Bill, John and Mateo! But the whole crew is great and so is the happy hour....great drinks and appetizers all for $3!!!!!! AMAZING and the best calamari I have ever had! Everyone goes out of their way to help make your stay great. Housekeeping staff is wonderful as well! All around great place and we will come back again, and again!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful”
Reviews.Author: Jillrq
Reviews.Content: At first I was skeptical, but I have grown to really love this place. They have tons of free activities (beer and wine schools along with other wonderful treats). Right on Duval street, so it's literally a 20 minute or less walk from anywhere you wanna be on the key west! It's just great. Definitely wanna come back!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful property in best location!”
Reviews.Author: atraveler246
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at this hotel while in Key West. The rooms are beautiful, comfortable and ours had a wonderful view of the water. The location was perfect. We rented bicycles and were in close proximity to all the old town had to offer. We will definitely consider this hotel for a future stay. SOOOO relaxing!!!

Reviews.Title: “Would definitely stay here again. Very nice rooms”
Reviews.Author: Prefertostayprivate
Reviews.Content: Nice, clean rooms. Awesome location, within walking of bike rentals, small cafe's, snacks.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel and service”
Reviews.Author: Traveling_maple_leaf
Reviews.Content: I really enjoyed my stay at Southernmost on the Beach hotel. The property is ideally located in Key West in a quiet district close enough to the main street with all the restaurants. The room (renovated and partial ocean view category) was nicely decorated with quality items. Our room offered enough view on the sea. The bathroom meets high standards and the shower is particularly large. The staff is really welcoming from the front desk staff to any facilities management employee we met. They make sure you have a great stay and that you have everything you need to feel relaxed. During our stay, coffee was offered at the pool in the morning. I would strongly recommend this hotel and would stay there again for my next stay in Key West.

Reviews.Title: “WOW what a great hotel.”
Reviews.Author: HappyTravelerEpsom
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at this hotel with some friends. First let me say that the rooms were fabulous. Everything was very clean. The shower was spacious and I even took pictures for a bathroom remodel we are doing at our home. The pillows were so comfortable that I took a picture of the UPC tag and ordered two of them when I got home. The balcony outside our room was perfect for hanging out with friends and enjoying the view and sunsets. Second, the pool was so nice. Very relaxing environment. Very few children. The beach was super and the attendants would bring you frozen wash clothes to cool off with. Plus it is only steps away from the Southernmost Cafe where you could and get an adult beverage to enjoy. Check out their website. It's everything you want and more. The staff was very polite and helped us with any questions about events, tours or the best restaurants to go to.

Reviews.Title: “Best place to stay in Key West for a fun and relaxing vacation”
Reviews.Author: LaurieAnn55
Reviews.Content: This was a perfect place for our Key West vacaton. We could walk to the Duval busy area for fun and nightlife, but stay at our hotel/pool and restaurant for relaxing and having fun too. We stayed on the West Lawn--more expensive, but the balcony and view were so worth it to us. Free coffee in the morning at the pool and free ice water/lemon all day long at the pool area. Plus the pool bars were open most all the time---a great place to visit with other guests and party a bit , too... The beach view and area was gorgeous and the happy hour and food at the restuarant on the beach were all affordable and so perfect for our trip. Our room was clean, and all remodeled. We plan on coming back every year!

Reviews.Title: “Could not have been nicer!”
Reviews.Author: luvmy2zz
Reviews.Content: We loved our 4 nights. Super clean, great service. Ocean view king room - book it, you won't be sorry.

Reviews.Title: “The best place on the island, hands down!”
Reviews.Author: lynnloveskeywest
Reviews.Content: My baby sister planned a cruise that would stop in Key West for her wedding ceremony on Smathers Beach. My husband and I decided to take our two boys for family vacation there instead of going on the cruise, and I am extremely grateful we did. I spent a month researching all the hotels and of course they all "looked" great, but Southernmost on the Beach did not have one bad review, so I booked it. I found their web cam of the pool and we gathered around every night of the week before to watch and fantasize about being there. We drove straight from Ohio and were extremely tired until we got to the hotel and saw how beautiful it was. Our kids were estatic and check in was quick and pleasant. Our room was on the second floor and our balcony gave us a wonderful view of the pool and although the description said "partial ocean view", I was blown away by how gorgeous the view was of the ocean. We could have cared less what the room looked like, but it was very nice and clean and perfect! Our only regret was not getting an ajoining room for the kids instead of having them in our room, lol. The staff were very friendly and helpful and we made friends with Sean from the pool, who told us all the best places for everything, and gave us valuable information when we said we wanted to move there. We even had a date night with him and his wife on our last night, which was very very cool. The bartender Emmit was excellent! and always made my drink as soon as I approached the bar at the pool, which I forgot to mention, the pool, was heaven, warm and crystal clear and magnificent. The absolute best thing was the pier right to the ocean. We loved that you could walk right down the steps into the perfectly crystal clear water which our kids loved that it was only waist deep. I would never ever stay anywhere else after experiencing the Southernmost on the Beach. We all literally cried as we were driving away from it, and plan on returning very soon. There isn't one thing I can possibly think of (except maybe leaving the kids at home) that I would have changed or could complain about. Every resturaunt we ate at was wonderful, every person friendly and helpful, and everything we experienced was perfection.

Reviews.Title: “Close to Perfect”
Reviews.Author: Lizzay
Reviews.Content: We stayed in room 517 which is a west lawn room. Originally requested second floor room but after seeing location [next to housekeeping storage] moved to a lower level and it was perfect. Close to pool, beach, swimming/sun pier, and beautiful view from the chairs outside our door. Worth the cost. Property is nicely laid out so it seemed all rooms conveniently located. Check-in was a breeze and will store your belongings until room is ready. Same goes for check-out. Hotel not overrun with kids!!! Nice atmosphere at the pool. Heather the server was great. Very friendly. Nice happy hour. $3 drinks and apps. Loved tuna sliders. If your looking to be in a party place this isnt your hotel. It is at end of Duval away from the party bars but a nice walk after dinner w places to stop for quiter after dinner beverages. Dinner must are Santiagos for tapas and El Siboney for Cuban. Overall spent a lot of time researching and was thrilled with our selection. Definately would recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel and rooms...great vacation”
Reviews.Author: chihuahua26
Reviews.Content: Stayed from June 5-9 with my husband and three year old son. Stayed in room 550 and we were really excited that this seemed to be the only partial oceanview room with no balconies on either side (except for the room above of course!). This occurred because the building jutted in on both sides of the room. The room itself was absolutely beautiful and very clean. I know this because a 3 year old's toy seem to be in every nook and cranny. Not sure why they don't show the bathrooms on the website because the shower area is incredible. Someone mentioned that the wifi didn't work. There is wifi for each room that is very weak and requires no password, but the one for the entire hotel is very fast. Look for the password on the little envelope that your keys come in. If you're going to Key West for the beach, think again. There is a very nice sandy area but the entry into the water is treacherous! The pool area is very nice and the waiter (can not remember his name) was very friendly and noticed when we weren't there one day. You have to try the Bloody Mary from the Shores Bar (poolside)! Definitely do the Beer School with Boomer on Wednesday. Free beer and lots of fun. One bad experience on day #2 when the pool bar did not open at 10am. I asked the guy handing out the towels when it opened and he said maybe 11 or 12? The advertised open was 10am. I called the front desk at 11am and asked when the bar opened and she told me 10am. I explained that I was sitting across the pool from it and it was not even thinking of opening. She was extremely baffled and apologized profusely. Needless to say, it opened about 10 minutes later. I was upset only because I wanted to try the famous Bloody Mary!! The Southernmost Beach Cafe has absolutely incredible food. You have to try the nachos and the coconut shrimp! However, they really need to address the hostesses. Maybe they were running on Key West time? Every time we ate there we stood at the hostess stand while the hostess (2 different ones) walked by us, stacked menus, serviced tables, etc all while the line at the stand gets longer and longer. Those duties could have been done later or by someone else. Just tell me what you're doing or when you're going to be helping me! Absolutely no apology for waiting or even any clue that we were ticked off. But again, the food was ridiculous. Everything was homemade and seasoned to perfection. In the end, we had a great time and loved every moment we spent at Southernmost on the Beach. Will definitely return (sans the 3 year old next time!)

Reviews.Title: “Exceptional”
Reviews.Author: baylor3
Reviews.Content: We just returned from my sons wedding at the Southernmost on the beach. It was amazing!! I have been to Key West 5 times and normally I have stayed at the other end of Duval. I will never stay anywhere else but here...it's that nice! This hotel had everything you could ask for...a beautiful pool on the beautiful beach and unbelievable views. We had 35 people staying at the hotel for 5 days and everyone loved it. The food at the Cafe was fantastic and not expensive at all. The bartenders at the pool bar were exceptional and the front desk went out of their way to accommodate all of the wedding party. The rooms were clean and perfect. We stayed in building C which looked out over the ocean. If you are looking for a place to hold a destination wedding, this is it! Breathtaking :)

Reviews.Title: “Beautifully Done”
Reviews.Author: wendysprague
Reviews.Content: This hotel far exceeded my expectations. The price was very fair and reasonable for the quality of the property. All said, there were three pools in total and it is right beside one of the only public beaches. The room was very tastefully decorated, more so than most, if not all, properties I have visited. When I return to Key West, this will be my first choice for a hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Not your typical $300+ plus room”
Reviews.Author: dennis556530488
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed in June 2011. Room was small and very plain considering the price. The clientele was a party crowd. This can be a plus for some. The grounds were undergoing upgrades and pool maintenance was underway as well. Noisy. The room door opened to the outside? Dangerous to passersby which are numerous. In short, if you're looking for the most for your dollar and/or a restful vacation with a tasteful setting there are much better options.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect”
Reviews.Author: asmile2day
Reviews.Content: My husband and I, travelled with my sister and brother in law to the Southermost on the Beach end of April and beginning of May. This resort was absolutely wonderful. Our room...in my opinion...was the best in the resort. Our room was on the end and just a few feet from the ocean. We had a private little deck with nice beach chairs that we could sit out in the evening we a glass of wine and enjoy the nice ocean breeze and the sunset. The rooms were absolutely cleaned to perfection. Bed was nice and comfortable. Loved the nice big bathroom with the BeeNice bathroom products. Cant recommend this resort enough! Just as an FYI...we had a problem with the safe...which was totally our mistake...called the front desk and someone was in our room within 5 minutes to patiently explain how we had not engaged the safe correctly. What customer service!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: 2diznee
Reviews.Content: Stayed 5 nights in June 2011. Stayed in Bldg B-partial ocean view room. The room was a luxurious room with very comfy beds, huge showers, plenty of room, balcany with a nice view of the ocean. The beach is very nice with free beach chairs for hotel guests. The also rent umbrellas, stand-up paddle boards. We ate at the Southermost Cafe for lunch. Very good food but a little expensive. The Hotel is on the quiet end of Duval only 2 blocks from the southernmost buoy. We walked from the hotel to the other end of Duval street many times. The only problem we had was the service at the pool side desk where you get towels, game equipment(ping pong,bean bags,ladder golf). Almost everytime we went to get towels or game equipment nobody was around and the bartenders totally ignored you so playing games or getting towels is next to impossible. The hotel is very well maintained and the area around the property is beatifull!! The swimming pool was always crowded but your allowed to use the pools across the street at the southernmost hotel. Those pools were less crowded and very nice. We would stay here again. Good place for couples.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: SkinsND79
Reviews.Content: Had a king bed with balcony, ocean view in building B. The bed was comfortable, flat screen TV, fridge, safe, and the shower (no tub) was huge. Great location-1/2 a block from Duval Street. The beach is not great, small with lots of seaweed and the Beach Cafe was okay. No complaints about staff or room. FYI-if you do charge drinks (at the pool bar) make sure to close out your tab. If not, the hotel adds 18% gratuity to your bill. If we ever return to Key West, Southermost on the Beach is where we will stay.

Reviews.Title: “great all around”
Reviews.Author: julisavell
Reviews.Content: My husband and I usually stay at nicer hotels; Omni, Hilton, Waldof Astoria. This hotel was beautiful and a great value. I've paid a lot more for a lot less. Beautiful room, great customer service, and very helpful concerge.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Hotel for your stay in Key West”
Reviews.Author: buragc
Reviews.Content: Having booked at a different hotel first, I realized there was no beach at the available. After looking around and asking around I figured Southernmost on the Beach has the largest (only a hundred feet) private beach. It is a great, great hotel. Very clean and modern rooms. Staff is incredibly helpful. On site activities were great. We did the wine tasting and were happy with it. Concierge is really helpful in booking activities off the resort. Couples massage that we got was OK, probably worth the money. I do recommend the happy hour at the cafe on the beach for very cheap drinks/appetizers every day Overall I am very happy that I switched to this hotel! If I go to Key West again, this is definitely where I will be staying. One thing that I was not very happy with was the padding on the beds as it was a tad bit uncomfortable.

Reviews.Title: “Can't imagine staying anywhere else!”
Reviews.Author: pamcarreira
Reviews.Content: We visited Key West for the first time on our honeymoon last June and stayed in an Oceanview room. Everything was so perfect we returned this year for our 1st wedding anniversary. I am so in love with this place, I can imagine staying anywhere else on Key West! This year we were upgraded to an Oceanfront room. The rooms are amazing. They are decorated so nicely and always very clean. Each room has free wireless internet, which is so helpful in planning your time on the island. Most of the rooms have private balconies or a balcony of some sort. The views from our rooms have been nothing less than stunning, and the grounds themselves are very well kept. The pool is so nice and my favorite place to be! There is a nice little beach on the property. My only complaint is the beach has a lot of seagrass, but this seems to be the norm for the beaches in the area and SMOTB is making a good attempt at keeping their's as clean as possible. The cafe on the property has good food, a great staff and a very yummy key lime pie. We ate there for lunch a couple times on this last trip. It's nice not to have to stray too far before spending the afternoon at the pool or beach. Every member of their staff from the front desk to housekeeping to bartenders are all kind and helpful and treat you like family. The rooms are not cheap, but not the most expensive in KW either. I personally think they are worth every penny. I can't say enough about SMOTB, and I can't wait to return!

Reviews.Title: “wonderful hotel”
Reviews.Author: esp0515
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a week at SMOTB. Loved it!! I am a General Manager of a hotel (think large, international - starts with a M) so I have an insider perspective on most every experience a guest can have. I can assure your, from our experience here, this hotel is expertly managed and staffed with high quality, well trained staff from housekeeping, to food service, to front desk and maintenance. I could sense the professionalism and dedication to guest satisfaction not just in our interactions, but through observation of interactions with other guests. My husband and I are avid Tripadvisor stalkers and chose SMOTB because of what we read in reviews. To some reviewers all I can say is "lighten up" No place will be perfect, especially night over night - just roll with it. We booked a west lawn ocean view room, that's what we got, we asked for an upper floor, we got first floor - ok. The hotel was sold out several nights we could have gone back to the lobby and asked for a room change but we decided to "roll with it" and it turned out we were happier on the first floor anyway- what did we know. Our first day we enjoyed sitting in the lounge chairs on the lawn, the first evening a rather large wedding group sat up in the chairs drinking and socializing until very early in the morning. Did I mention we are early to bed and up for the sunrise sort of people? The next day, to prepare for some constuction the hotel had planned on the lawn, the chairs were gone. Bummer, we thought at first, but you know we didn't experience any more noisy wedding groups outside our room. And this hotel does a LOT of weddings. The chairs were still missing 5 days into our stay, but each night was quiet and we slept well. There were a few times that beach access was limited due to weddings on the sand and once the cafe closed early for a fundraising event. OK, so there are only a gazillion other places on Key West to eat, no inconvenience there at all. Only once were we inconvenienced and that was by some other rude guest that thought it would be just fine to lock their rental bike to my husband's and my bike. We hadn't rented bikes, they were a gift from a friend who lives on the island for us to use during the week. We were scheduled to be at the dock for our excursion to the Dry Tortugas at 7:15 am, went to get our bikes and couldn't access them because whoever had rented #38 was too lazy to properly lock their bike the evening before. We went to the front desk, pretty mad and anxious that we weren't going to make our boat. A pair of bolt cutters would have been nice to have at that moment. The front desk acted immediately, though they were unable to do anything about the lock situation ( the rental company is a third party company) the night manager was getting off shift and he offered to drive us to the harbor, they even insisted we take cash to call a taxi for our ride home. Honestly, I can't imagine anyone saying the front desk staff was not accommodating or helpful. Bottom line, staying in Key West is expensive, hotels, food, drinking, shopping: everything. If you can't be happy at $400 a night, you won't be happy at $600 a night and certainly not happy at $100 a night. You're on vacation, it's Key West - it is paradise, what more could you expect?
