Reviews.Title: “Perfect place to stay to relax and enjoy Key West.”
Reviews.Author: LadyKeller
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just got married in Key West and stayed at Southernmost on the Beach. We had the best time. Our room was beautiful, room 636 I believe. The balcony was over the ocean and we spent many nights having wine on our balcony and watching the jet skiers and the watching the sun set. The hotel staff was excellent, from check in, turn down service, maid service and the spa. We met some interesting locals at the beach restaurant on the property and the food was good. The hotel is peaceful and quiet and a short walk to all the fun on Duval. We will definatley be back next year for our anniversary.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: nicholmays
Reviews.Content: Me and my wife went here for our 2 year anniversary from NYC. We had a really nice stay. The property is really beautiful. We actually stayed in 2 rooms because it was so full over memorial day weekend. We were in an ocean view for 4 nights and spent the 5th in one of the standard rooms. The ocean view room was a much nicer and newer room and was definitely 4 star hotel quality, but the other was closer to a 3. Otherwise the rest of the property feels like a brand new 3.5 star hotel as it is rated. Its nice, down to earth. It has a super fun pool area and is right next to a cute little beach. For us the location couldn't be better. If you are looking to key west for a quieter couple's trip than look no further for a hotel. Rip roaring hard partiers are probably better at the other end of duval street where they can be a little closer to the action.

Reviews.Title: “Talk about Fun!”
Reviews.Author: poohsmc77
Reviews.Content: We had the best time at this hotel! The pool was spectacular, it was a block from Duval , had a beach, restruant on premisis that was open with a water view for conveninet breakfasts, amazing pool and pool bar . There were all sorts of fun things like Free Beer School, Free Wine school, live music by the pool, contest with free give aways, raffle drawings by the pool with free give aways. Our room was amazing and clean and the maids were fantastic. They left extra towels if requested and when we arrived , there was a bottle of champaigne delivered to our room because we booked through perfect getaways. Boomer and Kathy Nyugen were amazing employees . A paper was delievered every morning to our room and , there was free coffee in the morning! The hotel had tons of bike rentals that were cheap and, it was a really clean property! The conscierge offered to take calls after she left to book us for snorkeling, and last but not least, there were water dispensers and ice dispensers for unmilited free water! I'd go back in a heart beat and recommend it to anyone I know.

Reviews.Title: “Favorite Place...”
Reviews.Author: SumBeach_1
Reviews.Content: Stayed in an Oceanfront room in the newer section. Staff was great and the room and view were even better. Only complaint (although somewhat insignificant) is the WiFi would not work out in these rooms. Distance? However, as my wife said, who needs WiFi in Key West. Don't get me wrong it can be a hike to the Square but it is worth it to stay at this Hotel. Loved the room, loved the small beach area, loved the pool bar and the small cafe was great for the money. Would highly recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Too much fun!!”
Reviews.Author: Suntanfran
Reviews.Content: This is my new favorite place. Never wanted to leave. Close enough to Duvall craziness but far enough to sleep comfortably on the quite side of town. Mark at the Shores Bar was our constant companion. He suggested all the great places to go and we enjoyed some fabulous food and fun. Much of which we found right at the resort. Great food. Delicious drinks with all the freshest ingredients and fun concoctions. Mark was a great mixologist and our new Key West friend. We never want to leave.

Reviews.Title: “Just What the Doctor Ordered!”
Reviews.Author: purelycanadian
Reviews.Content: What an amazing hotel! From the moment that we stepped out of the cab and into the lobby we were treated fabulously! All staff were friendly and bent over backwards to make sure that were were well taken care of. The rooms were luxurious and the beds were oh so comfortable! There were several weddings over the weekend of our stay and the hotel restaurant was closed one evening for a charitable event. Weddings were no issue for hotel guests and the evening the restaurant was closed The staff was very quick to direct us to close by establishments for various sundries that were needed. Can't wait to return!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect hotel for the perfect vacation”
Reviews.Author: NJ-SV
Reviews.Content: Three of my girlfriends and I were headed to Key West, and had no clue where to stay. We picked the Southernmost on the Beach because of the convenient location. That was the best decison we ever made. The location was absolutely perfect. Quiet hotel on the beach, yet also conveniently located right at the end of Duval. The entire experience with the hotel was perfect. The whole hotel was clean and modernly decorated. The rooms were incredibly clean and spacious. The whole staff at the Southernmost was friendly and accomodating. Three people stood out the most at this hotel. The first being Boomer, the activities director at the pool. He was entertaining and kept everyone incredibly happy. He was friendly and helpful. The trip would not have been the same without Boomer. The next two are Rich - pool bar manager, and James - pool bar bartender. These 2 made fantastic drinks, while also entertaiing us all day. The Bloody Mary was the best I've ever had. James and Rich treated all customers as friends, and even allowed us to make up the drink of the day. I would head back to Key West in a heartbeat, and would never stay anywhere else but the Southernmost on the Beach.

Reviews.Title: “Can't wait to go back!!”
Reviews.Author: heathsrutt
Reviews.Content: We loved SMOTB. The room was very clean (and beautiful). If you can swing a couple extra bucks get the king with the ocean view. This is what we had and the view was amazing! We had a huge balcony with sitting chairs and lounge chairs and our view was palm trees and ocean. It's great! The staff there is wonderful. The food at the cafe is great (you have to try the coconut shrimp). Positives: clean rooms, friendly staff, set a little off of duval so you are not right in the middle of all the nightlight - but, within walking distance to all the fun, great pool, great bar, live music on the weekend Negatives: they advertise 3 pools - but if you're at SMOTB you're not going to want to go to the other two, they are no where as nice. The pool is always packed Mon- Sun, so you have to go at 930 or 10 if you want lounge chairs (which is typical). We are already talking about going back to SMOTB.

Reviews.Title: “Southernmost is the most!”
Reviews.Author: Red521
Reviews.Content: Stayed 4 nights while in Key West, quiet side of Duval St but close enough to good restaurants and bars. What a place room was clean and modern updates, staff was exceptional!!! Dexter at the front desk and both concierges(sp) excellant along with waiter at pool(try the dark and stormy). I would recommend this place to all family and friends.

Reviews.Title: “Couldn't have ask for more.”
Reviews.Author: AmandaTurk
Reviews.Content: This hotel is incredible, the rooms were luxurious, the staff was friendly and fun and the tanning pier was perfect. We will be staying there again. We are already planning another trip in three months.

Reviews.Title: “An amazing but not peaceful hotel”
Reviews.Author: hegletoes
Reviews.Content: We loved our stay here. Our room 608 was fantastic - huge and very well appointed overlooking the main beach. The beachfront restaurant is great - not had one bad meal - as are all the staff right from the front desk team to the cleaners to the restaurant team. The gym has great new equipment and opens for long hours. Our only disappointment is the lack of diet drinks and the relentless noise from events that make the restaurant and that end of the beach a misery. I feel it inappropriate to shut the only onsite restaurant completely at 3pm for all the entire hotel staff to attend the employee of the year awards and guests to be subjected to their inane company compere shouting for hours on end ruining the evening and making the beach and restaurant out of bounds. This should be held off site with no disruption to paying guests. The following two afternoons and evenings nights there were weddings so the relentless music ensued. This is my only issue with this hotel. If you are looking for quiet holiday you are in the wrong place as the pool, restaurant and whatever event is on are all playing competing music mixed with whatever sports is showing on the bar screens. I would come back again but would be looking for a quieter room. Its in an amazing part of Key West at the nice end of Duval Street and in a lovely part of town. I hope this helps.

Reviews.Title: “Just a great place.....”
Reviews.Author: brittdad
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the SOTB from May 10th until we checked out on May17th. We stayed in an oceanfront king room in the new building and were very happy wife the room. I will admit that it pricey but I have stayed in other hotels in Key West and it is in line with other great rooms in the area. Where this hotel beats the others is in its service and cleanliness. The housekeeping is top notch from the towel animals to the absolutely spotless bathrooms. The nightly turn down service includes chocolates on your pillows and is down with a smile. The balconies in these rooms are huge and have lounge chairs and single chairs with small tables. The water pressure is a bit low but the place has to have a flaw. The AC worked flawlessly. The activities are handles by Boomer McFall and he does a great job. We had a great time at Beer School (free tasting), Wine School (free tasting again) and we even played The Newleywed Game which we won (free t shirts and some other nice perks). There are many other free activities during the week. The Cafe has some of the best food in Key West. We had great breakfasts each morning (going to be tough to work it off). The special is pancakes, 3 eggs, corned beef hash (real chunks of freshly made corned beef), a generous portion of melon balls, and the biggest english muffins that you will ever see all for about 10 bucks. In Key West that is a bargain and you get to eat it in there beachfront cafe looking at the ocean. We had dinner there on our last night and the filet mignon was superb along with the perfectly cooked scallops. The pools are great (you have a choice of 3) or you can swim in the ocean from the beach. The pier is lined with lounge chairs and great for catching rays and it even has a stairway into the ocean to cool yourself off. The parking here is free and it is a bit of a walk to Mallory Square on a hot day but that may have been the breakfast talking. There are nice bars at all of the pools and the drink prices are average. Julie and Scarlet at the concierge desk are well informed and always eager to help. While you are the pool search out Omar and ask him to sing some of his favorite songs for you. This man is one of the nicest people that I have met in all of my travels and he never has anything but a smile on his face. SMOTB I hope you know how lucky you are to have him. Young Joe at the Cafe was also a lot of fun to be around. He has a lot of great ideas on how to enjoy Key West and was very helpful (a local Gloucester MA. boy, even better). All in all the SMOTB is a great, relaxing place to spend your vacation in an oceanside hammock, slightly away from the noise of Duval Street. Scott in MA.

Reviews.Title: “Can't think of one bad thing to say...”
Reviews.Author: takemetoparadise03
Reviews.Content: For a girl who knew NOTHING about Key West, I researched places to stay for a long time. I wanted to find the best location, clean rooms, good pool and a hotel with a good personality. I found all of this at the Southernmost and couldn't have made a better decision! Rooms- incredibly clean and had a lot of space. I went with 3 of my girlfriends and the room was the perfect size. Hotel- Very nice with that Key West feel. Perfect location for everything and the staff was very helpful and nice! They had a great beachfront restaurant with good food, and an awesome Key Lime Margarita! Pool- May have been the most happening place throughout my whole trip. Even though there we a lot of guest at the pool, it didn't feel over crowded. Everyone there had fun sipping thier drink and floating on thier rafts all day long. It was the perfect island feel with frozen drinks and live reggae music. BOOMER!- enough said....He kept us entertained all day long! When he wasn't busy running raft races and having hula hooping contests, he was busy making sure all the hotel guests were happy and have a great time! Our pool days definately would not have been the same without him there. Bartenders Rich and James- they are definately the best ones on Key West! They are both incredibly nice and friendly, but more importantly, they make incredible drinks (they even let us come up with the drink of the day on the last day of our trip). TRY THE BLOODY MARY (best one I have ever had) Again, I have nothing bad to say about the Southernmost on the Beach. I fell in love with Key West and will definatly be returning. And I will only be staying at the Southernmost.

Reviews.Title: “Couldn't have been nicer!”
Reviews.Author: leknugas
Reviews.Content: When booking this hotel on the recommendation of a "no frills" friend, and seeing the 3 star rating at the time, we were expecting an acceptable room. However, we found this hotel to be extremely nice, at least a 4 star. The room was very nice, very clean, the beds super comfortable. The staff, from the front desk to housekeeping was very friendly and helpful. Unless, you had an end room, or were on the beachside of one building, all rooms had a partial ocean view from the balcony. Not a knock on the hotel, but if you are coming for beaches, Key West isnâ€™t the right place! While there are a few, they arenâ€™t wide and expansive like you would imagine a Florida beach to be.

Reviews.Title: “Our family enjoyed the hotel so much, we are already making plans to reunite again for the holidays!”
Reviews.Author: aaronmisha
Reviews.Content: My husband and I married at The Southernmost on the Beach. Everyone had such a great time there that we are already making plans to come back! We had 90 guests at our wedding and they all had very good feedback about their experience. The pool staff kept the young nieces and nephews busy hula hooping and playing games, while the bartender kept our margaritas flowing. We couldn't have asked for more!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, great staff...Love Boomer!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: kathycurtis898
Reviews.Content: My husband and I recently vacationed in Key West at the Southernmost on the Beach Hotel. The rooms and grounds were beautiful. The thing that made our stay the most memorable was the great staff. We want to thank Boomer McFall for keeping our days by the pool exciting and fun filled. The beer school, and the wine school were super fun! We earned a new degree in Key West...."Valedrinktorians"!!! Who knew??? Boomer was always around making sure we were entertained. Loved the poolside games especially the Newlywed game....We won by the way!! We definately will be coming back for our next vacation!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location - anything you could want for leisure, atmosphere and relaxation on beach.”
Reviews.Author: judyandtimflamingo
Reviews.Content: The Southernmost On the Beach was wonderful! For years, we stayed at another resort and this year decided to try something different, and glad we did. The accomodations were fabulous. We traveled with friends and each stayed on a different property of the Southernmost. We all enjoyed our locations. The staff was friendly and kind. Hats off to pool waitress Heather, bartender Rich, and event coordinator Boomer. They were very fun and very, very good at their jobs! We were wary of the location, given its proximity to Duvall - really wanted relaxation and quiet, but it turned out to be perfect. We had both quiet and relaxation, and perfect access to the beach and to Duval Street's fun. Enjoy! This was a very special occasion for us and the Southernmost pulled it off well!

Reviews.Title: “had a blast”
Reviews.Author: chriscas
Reviews.Content: first time in kw and had a blast in the southernmost on the beach hotel,especially in the pool area with boomer,he was great,boomer always had differrent activities,games and entertainment.i will definitely come back to kw and only stay at the southernmost on the beach.

Reviews.Title: “ALWAYS something going on !!!”
Reviews.Author: Broncos28
Reviews.Content: In about 15 trips to KW ,I have stayed at many different places. After staying at Southernmost On the Beach the last 3 trips ..I will definately NOT stay anywhere else!..We stayed in the new buildings, The rooms are the Best! ..great views and great landscaping great decor and Great showers !..at the pool area and beach area "There is ALWAYS something going on !"..every other hotel just has a pool ..S.M.on the Beach has a gorgeous Pool and bar area and BOOMER "the director of fun" as we call him, always gets everyone motivated..He always gets pool activities and games going with free drink prizes and more ..we even played part in a wine school AND beer schoolwhere everyone can be a vali-drink-torian:) and even held a snorkel school which my wife and I loved ! I give 2 thumbs up to Southernmost on the beach ..where there is always entertainment going on nearby!...if you go , you have to find BOOMER! he'll definately show you where to have fun and great things to do and great places to eat ...ps.the SM Cafe is great ..breakfast ,lunch ,and dinner ..can't beat the location either!...WE WON'T STAY ANYWHERE ELSE ....ps.we met some other couples as we always do (at bennihanas) and they came back to see our pool area after we raved about it ..they were staying at a high end hotel and were shocked at the fun going on around our pool area ..which they quickly followed up by saying " next year we're staying here "! enough said see you at fantasy fest 2011!!

Reviews.Title: “It was Paradise!”
Reviews.Author: Voice1234
Reviews.Content: First: The review by fjm100 is way off the mark. He must be getting this place confused with another. It is the most beautiful place I've ever seen. There were very few children, mostly very nice adults. Yes, they do host weddings, but it does not interfere with the guests using the beach. The staff is over the top wonderful! Boomer is wonderful!! They were attentive to our needs, recommended places to go, places to eat, etc. It was quiet and exactly what we were looking for. The Tiki Cafe food is excellent (and I never had to clean my table!). The waitstaff was great. The bartenders are the best!!! We will definitely go back.

Reviews.Title: “WOW”
Reviews.Author: tedkdb
Reviews.Content: This is a very nice hotel. Everything is great. The rooms, the property, and the staff. The pool is one of nicest one my wife have ever enjoyed, and we have traveled to and stayed at many places over the years. In particular, our room, which was classified as a distant ocean view was great. The hotel says distant, we say it is right in front of you. The room was very spacious and nicely decorated (it also had a small frig). The ground are well maintained, with no trash or junk laying around or visible. Also, there is free parking and near all the rooms. The staff, including the wait staff, bartenders, housekeeping were friendly and always will to assist. Also, Jules, at the tour desk in the lobby, was very, very helpful. The on site restaurant is only average, with the key lime pie the worst (wait staff are very friendly, however). Overall, this is a very, very nice property. The only down side was the check in. There was a very long wait to do so due to the fact there was only one clerk on duty. Waited almost 20 minutes to check in. Also, people considering staying at this property should note that it is at the opposite end of the island for the action, which was just great for us. It is over a mile to Mallory Square and most of the downtown restaurants and tourist attractions. Nonetheless, would highly recommend this hote without any qualifications

Reviews.Title: “Great experience”
Reviews.Author: SJCornwell
Reviews.Content: Great place, wonderful room, nice pools & beaches, will definitely return.

Reviews.Title: “Would stay again...”
Reviews.Author: joe61thomas
Reviews.Content: I just wanted to say that Mark the pool side bartender was absolutely awesome. We stayed there the week of April 23rd thru the 30th and he was so nice and concerned about our needs. Because of his courtesy I would come back... Joe and Evamarie Thomas

Reviews.Title: “Wedding Of Our Dreams”
Reviews.Author: DavidEli
Reviews.Content: We got married at Southernmost On The Beach in March and it was perfect. Their wedding planner Melissa was super sweet and helpful and she took responsibility for the details like it was her own wedding. The food at the wedding was great too (Florida lobster tails, paella, and steaks grilled out on the beach). The whole experience at Southernmost before, during, and after the wedding was so fun and relaxing (two things people don't normally say about their wedding). If we could, we'd redo our wedding their every year.

Reviews.Title: “Boomer Boomer Boomer”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Sourthernmost hotel on the beach and we loved it!!!! Hanging out on at the pool was a must do.... Boomer made sure that we and everyone else had a great time..... Thank you Boomer! We will definitely see you soon :)

Reviews.Title: “"Paradise in Key West"”
Reviews.Author: JohnN59
Reviews.Content: My wife, 14 yrld daughter and I stayed here from April 20th to the 24th. Definitely not long enough though. I've traveled the world and have stayed at many places and have had many experiences. Therefore, I've seen the good and the bad. We've been to Key West a couple of times before and have now found a new paradise here at Southernmost on the Beach. What a great place to vacation! Our room was spacious and comfortable with a nice ocean view. All of the staff personel were very friendly with a smile and hello and always there to serve. The food and drinks at the Cafe' were excelent as well. There's plenty to do here or you can just sit back, relax and do nothing. All the action and shopping on Duval Street was just a stroll away. The frozen strawberries and frozen towels on the beach were a nice unexpecting touch too. I could go on and on. Because of our great experince here we may have to make this an annual event. We loved it!

Reviews.Title: “Honeymoon Stay”
Reviews.Author: JenLee01
Reviews.Content: Our stay at Southernmost on the Beach was very nice. Our only two complaints were the eco-friendly air conditioning system and the lack of room service. As we all know, sometimes you just don't want to get out of bed! The location can't be beat, and the staff are as friendly as they come. The Beach Cafe has good food, but they are on "island time". It is at the quiet end of Duval Street, and there is a nice place to rent mopeds and bikes. DO NOT RENT FROM TROPICAL MOPED RENTAL or THE MOPED PLACE NEXT TO WENDY'S off of HWY 1. Richard is nice, but his electric cars are crap! My parents were jealous when they saw our room, which has a balcony with an ocean-front view. We also had a couple's massage with Kelly and Hope that was out of the world! If we ever come back to Key West, we will be staying here again.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect, Ocean Views”
Reviews.Author: SaraBates
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Southernmost on the Beach from April 13th-April 17th. We've traveled to Key West many times and typically stay in a B&B or a condo/house in Truman Annex. This time we were in Key West for our wedding and we wanted to stay in a hotel in order to accomodate more of our wedding guests. We made the right choice staying here!! The easy access to the beach and large pool/bar area was perfect! This is not something that you can get everywhere in Key West since there are not large beaches on the island. Our family and friends really enjoyed the Shores Bar and the Beach Cafe. We enjoyed drinks and meals (breakfast/lunch) at both locations. Everything was excellent--especially the Key Lime Colodas and Bloody Marys (very spicy!!). Rich was our bartender throughout the week and we really enjoyed his company and his friendly service. We also took advantage of the activities that the resort offered pool and beach side. The wine and beer school were very fun and informative. The entertainment by the pool (steel drum band/juggling lessons), was also very enjoyable. Our room was number 638, which is an oceanfront king. My wedding party and family got ready for the wedding in this room, which comfortably accomodated 8-9 guests plus our stylists throughout the day. The room was clean/comfortable, with a wonderful, large balcony. We and our guests also appreciated the location, which was away from the noisy part of Duval Street, but within walking distance of everything that you'd want to visit on Key West! We would recommend this place to anyone, and have already booked our return stay next April for our 1 year anniversary!!

Reviews.Title: “Could think of nothing to improve”
Reviews.Author: AlleghenyC
Reviews.Content: Staying at the Southernmost was one of our most enjoyable hotel experiences. The rooms are new and well maintained. The grounds are lovely. There are lots of different types of spaces: on the lawn, by the pool, on the pier, on the beach. The restaurant was affordable and had good food. The staff is incredible. They were extremely helpful when we had questions but left us alone when we didn't. Perfect.

Reviews.Title: “the best”
Reviews.Author: chiefbaps
Reviews.Content: everything about this hotel is great. the location is perfect!! Close enough to Duval St to be near the action, but a quiet little corner when you need it. Key West is not known for their beaches, but the Southernmost has a perfect beach. Gets a bit crowded because it is small, but the sound of the waves makes you feel like you are on an island and the people around you just melt away. The rooms are beautiful. We had one of the newly renovated ocean front rooms which was just the right size for the two of us, had a great balcony overlooking the beach and the lawn are which is quite lush. The staff at the hotel went out of their way to make you happy. We had a couples massage at the Spa and both of the masseuses were really good. Can't wait to go back!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Just Perfect!”
Reviews.Author: toopickyPennsylvania
Reviews.Content: Our stay at Southernmost on the Beach was without a doubt just perfect! Due to a medical emergency in Philadelphia and horrific incoming weather, we missed our connecting flight in NC and had to fly standby. (Not a great way to start a vacation.) However, once we arrived at the hotel, everything that happened prior to our arrival was completely forgotten. We were greeted immediately, informed about the various activities, and given a layout of all the ammenities - then given our key to paradise! (I had planned this vacation back in September for our 50th birthday celebration.) I booked an oceanfront room and that is exactly what we received. A beautifully decorated new oceanfront room with a king size bed, a small two chair with table area, desk, flat screen TV, wetbar area, hidden small refrigerator and in-room safe, wrap around balcony, and an oversize bathroom with large walk-in shower. The room was spotless and the air conditioning was set at a perfect temperature. On the balcony were 2 chairs with a small table and two lounge chairs. The view was spectacular! (Room A-539) The entire complex was well manicured and maintained. Plenty of lounge chairs, umbrellas, hammocks, private seating areas, pool chairs, etc throughout the complex. No need to wake up early to secure a seat - many will be available whatever time you decide to venture out. We arrived in time to make happy hour so we quickly changed and walked over to enjoy rum swizzles and vodka & cranberry drinks and some outstanding hot wings. Each item - only $3 each! The bartenders were friendly and attentive and the locals were the same. Everyone there was there for the same reason - to just kick back and relax and have a good time. Happy hour is from 4-7 everyday. We did not rent a car or scooter our entire vacation and did not miss having one. We walked Duval Street every day/night. It took us about 20 minutes one way to walk the entire street. While the streets were filled with people, restaurants did not require any waiting or reservations. If you have never visited Key West, the best way to describe Duval Street is to say it's an adult's playground - restaurant after restaurant, bar after bar, and a ton of live music playing from each place. Of course there are plenty of stores to shop as well. There are so many places to see and the sunset at Mallory Square is a must for the first time vacationer to Key West. Not wanting to lock into any time constraints, my husband and I chose activities we could do on the fly. We took a Conch Train Tour (about 90 minutes and $30/pp) that taught us a lot about the island. We didn't love it but it was informative. Also, next door to the Southernmost on the Beach, we rented Wave-runners and took a Water tour. I highly recommend that you do this. We booked through the hotel but you can save $10 if you just walk over and sign up. (This was also about 90 minutes and $130 for one wave-runner with two people.) If you are a Philadelphia fan, stop by Pat Croce's Rum Barrel Restaurant and catch a game and good food. Sloppy Joe's is another Key West landmark and usually has great live music. A great little deli/liquor/convenience store is across the street from the hotel. We purchased 12-packs , deli items, and breakfast items all at very reasonable prices. There was always something going on around the pool area. We did not take advantage of any of the activities. We were happiest on the beach, in the water, relaxing, and drinking. Night time was peaceful and quiet. Every single day was beautiful. High of 84 degrees with a nice warm breeze and sunny. Don't forget the sunscreen...saw lots of people who apparently did! We usually go on vacation and towards the end of our vacation we're looking forward to going home; not on this vacation. Would have loved to have stayed longer. Another wonderful accommodation the hotel made for us was a later check-out time. Can't say enough wonderful things about Southernmost on the Beach, other than to say it was...just perfect!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful room, gorgeous beach, great staff”
Reviews.Author: imatraveln
Reviews.Content: I would definately stay here again over the other hotels in Key West. The room is beautiful, we had a great balcony. The beach is great and has sand! (Unlike most keys beaches). The water was clean and beautiful. The bar was very cool and the bartenders were great. The grounds are impeccable. They even had yoga classes on the beach. Catch the sunrise on the dock in between the buildings - it is gorgeous. We had several very minor issues with our room upon arrival (likely due to the previous guests). They were fixed immediately with a prompt apology - very impressive. It is a large hotel, but it doesn't feel like it. We usually prefer B&B's but we LOVED this place. If you are a light sleeper, bring ear plugs or request a fan - the doors to the hotel rooms close loudly which is an issue only if your neighbors are night owls. It didn't bother my husband at all, and once I had a fan I was fine.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Value-Traveller
Reviews.Content: We stayed three nights in Room 641, being a third floor Distant Ocean View Balcony King. Lovely large room, very clean with a huge, well-appointed bathroom. The ocean view was closest to being in a much more expensive beachfront room. Convenient free parking on the ground floor. The grounds were attractive and very well kept, as was the pool area. The in room bar fridge was not working on arrival, and a replacement fridge was brought up immediately. All staff were extremely friendly. The location on the southern end of Duval Street made it easy to walk its lengh (25 minutes) and see most of the attractions. We ate a few times at the Southernmost Cafe on the beach next to the hotel, and the food was great and the atmosphere fun.

Reviews.Title: “Hospitality Reigns at Southernmost”
Reviews.Author: RCBaird
Reviews.Content: My daughter, age 12, and I recently returned from our first trip to Key West and a four-night stay at Southernmost on the Beach. This hotel is every bit as nice--and even better--than all the rave reviews indicate. From the moment of our arrival to our departure, the friendly service we received was on par with the beautiful location, facilities, and dining. We stayed in a room with 2 extremely comfortable queen/double beds and a wonderful partial ocean view. The bathroom was large with a huge walk-in shower. The pool area is clean and sparkling with plentiful lounge chairs with excellent pool-side service and good food. The food and table service at the open-air restaurant on the beach, where we ate breakfast every day and dined twice at night, was likewise outstanding and reasonably priced. To top it off, this hotel does not nickel-and-dime you: wireless internet service and parking are both free to guests! You'll find lots of fun things to do in Key West. Located at the southernmost end of Duval Street, the hotel is within easy walking distance of many attractions you won't want to miss, including the Hemingway house and the Butterfly Museum, and the walk to the historic end of Duval is an easy 15-20 minute stroll from the hotel. If you prefer to take a taxi, it's short $10-$12 ride to the marina at Mallory Square. Be sure to go there one evening to see the famous Key West sunset and enjoy the many performing artists (don't miss the cat man's show--he has cats doing some tricks you would not think cats would be willing to do), after which you can find many great dock-side restaurants for dinner. One place to consider dining is the Conch Republic--excellent food. This will not be our last visit to Key West, and when we return we will consider staying nowhere else other than Southernmost on the Beach!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic”
Reviews.Author: Anne54171
Reviews.Content: I've stayed at this hotel twice and absolutely love it. With multiple pools and beach access, along with a great location, its the best hotel to stay at for the money. Plus there is plenty of parking room which they don't charge for.

Reviews.Title: “Top Notch Resort located right on the Beach”
Reviews.Author: jenbee25
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel based on the other reviews from Tripadvisor and we were not disappointed. The Southernmost on the Beach is a great hotel with all of the resort amenities. We stayed in one of the newly renovated West Lawn rooms and the furnishings and decor were beautiful, modern, and chic. The ocean view was OUTSTANDING!!! There is a shared balcony outside of the room with seating, which allowed us to view the ocean, as well as the action at the beach, lawn, and pool. Bathroom was on the small side, but shower was big and beautiful. Vanity was located outside of the bathroom, which was very convenient, but not much storage for our toiletries. Also, not a lot of places to hang wet towels, bathing suits, etc. The hotel is located adjacent to one of the only beaches in Key West. It is a public beach, but hotel guests get beach chairs and towels for free. The hotel's pool was very lively and crowded at all hours of the day. We ended up using the pool across the street at another of the hotel's properties and were very pleased - it was less crowded and much more quiet and peaceful, which suited our needs. We found it great that guests from all of the properties the hotel owns (Southernmost Hotel on the Beach, Southernmost Hotel, La Mer, and Dewey House) have access to the amenities from all of the other properties. All are located adjacent to one another. We actually may try staying at one of the smaller properties on our next stay, but we would also be just as satisfied staying at Southernmost on the Beach again. Also, we tried the hotel's restaurant (Southernmost Cafe on the Beach) on our last night and were pleasantly surprised at how delicious the food was and at how great the prices were - there was excellent service and it was a great value; plus it's one of the only Key West dining options located right on the beach with beautiful ocean views. Overall, we had an excellent stay. What is great about Southermost is that you get to stay at a wonderful, high-end resort with more of a personal feel (nice that it's not a big chain - no resort fee and free parking!). The hotel was a bit trendier and more crowded than we typically like, but the ocean views, service, and access to all of the desired amenities definitely kept us satisfied and very happy guests. Note - the hotel is located on the "quieter" end of Duval Street, so it's a short walk up Duval to get to more of the action.

Reviews.Title: “We will definitely stay here again!”
Reviews.Author: cherylhunka
Reviews.Content: We loved this hotel. The location was perfect with eveything you need - pool, beach, quiet or party. Our room was on the first floor and had an ocean view with tons of seating outside for lounging around. The pool area was crowded but there was plenty of quiet beach area that you could relax at. The rooms were very nice, well maintained and were cleaned every day. The hotel staff did an excellent job of keeping the property pristine. It was close to everything you would want to do but far enough away from the party scene. We did rent an electric car while we were there which made our stay very enjoyable. We usually don't sleep well when away from home but to our surprise we did get plenty of rest as it was quiet and dark - two things we need to sleep well. We will absolutely stay at this property again. Kind of pricey but well worth it.

Reviews.Title: “a wonderful stay!!!”
Reviews.Author: charliemichigan123
Reviews.Content: this stay was as close to perfect as you can get. stayed on the top floor of building A. Beautiful view of the ocean. Yoga on the beach at night. would not want to stay near the pool it is very loud there. it is expensive. wonderful Cuban restaurant across the street. very casual takeout. the hotel grounds are beautiful and the beach is private. we highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: jim52513
Reviews.Content: We had a nice 4 days at this hotel. Our room was clean and modern. The location @ the quiet end of Duval was nice. The hotel had a nice pool which my 3 year old and I thoroughly enjoyed. The service @ the pool bar and beach cafe was great. The small beach on the property was perfect for little ones to play in the sand and get wet. We will definitely go back!

Reviews.Title: “Wow! can't wait to go back!”
Reviews.Author: Dnmeek
Reviews.Content: My husband and I loved our stay at the Southernmost on the Beach! The room was Ocean Front and had a great view from out window. The resort was clean, the pool was gorgeous and the beach was a nice feature for a area that is not well know for its beaches! The staff was super nice and helpful and really did their best to help us with finding our way around the island. My husband and I could not believe this resort was not ranked Number 1! Perfect location, you are away from the business of Mallory Square but still in walking distance. Two blocks from the Southenmost Buoy! Boomer is part of Southermost on the beach entertainment staff and he was so nice and friendly! This was our first trip to Key West and Southernmost on the beach really made it worth wild!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location!”
Reviews.Author: 3boysaag
Reviews.Content: My husband and I recently traveled to Key West for a birthday celebration. We decided to stay at Southernmost on the Beach after reading Trip Advisor reviews. It was a perfect place to stay. We had the choice of using the public beach next to the hotel, the private beach and pier at the hotel, or the pool area. All were well-maintained and had plenty of seating. Our room , though we were told it was in the older section, was spacious and clean - no problems at all. It was also within walking distance of everything we wanted to do but just far enough away to not be in the middle of the Duval St madness. They even let us use the fitness center after checkout to shower before our late afternoon flight so that we could enjoy our last day in Key West. Perfect location - would definitely stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “Everything you need and want..beach, pool, restaurant, friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: Kanna46
Reviews.Content: On the quieter end of Duval, we truly enjoyed our stay. Very clean, concierge was very helpful, can rent bikes on site, great pool with bar and live entertainment, bigger beach with restaurant & bar.... Was pricier but we spent a lot of time there, as well as out and about Key West.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in good location”
Reviews.Author: TravelCallie
Reviews.Content: We just spent about 9 days here. Previously we stayed at Casa Marina and really liked it, but didn't care for the somewhat remote location. We were overall happy with this hotel. It really has that resort feel with nice pools, service, and beach access. There are lots of areas to stretch out so you are not stuck in one location every day. We also liked the Cafe - good food at reasonable prices. The location is very good - love having that little cuban stand across the street where we could enjoy a cheap meal and cuban coffee every morning. Also we LOVE El Sibonney cuban restaurant and it's only a 10 minute walk. We did not rent a car and did not miss it at all. Service was great - Heather by the pool was awesome. If you are really going for Duval street nightlife everynite, I do not recommend this hotel. Yes, you can walk there, but it can be hot, you can be tired, etc. If I was going for the nightlife for every nite, I recommend staying closer to that end of Duval. If you are going to pay $300 a night, I would stay closer. Here are the things we did not like: toiletries were cheap - definitely bring your own. Internet connection was pretty bad - I travel all around the world and never have issues, but I got all kinds of weird messages from their server. It's free though. Also we were placed in a handicapped room, so the bathroom was not great. Definitely confirm you will be a reg room, with a vanity. There was no place to set anything. Also they say coffee pot on amenities, but it's not a coffee pot. It's this little coffee maker that uses weird cartridges, so although you can have a cup of coffee in your room, you can't bring coffee and filters and make it in your room. Overall, we would stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect stay with no spring breakers!”
Reviews.Author: Kellygreen24
Reviews.Content: Drove to Key West and once we saw hotel we wished we were staying longer than 4 days! Great happy hour, beautiful constant breeze from ocean. We stayed in a beach front room where we watched the sun rise from our patio. Our room was beautiful, king size bed, huge bathroom, and refrigerator. Staff extremely efficient and friendly. Concierge made dinner reservations for us along with free drink coupons for restaurant we chose. Small grocery store, gift shop, and coffee/ice cream shop right across the street. Nice to be on the quiet end of Duval Street. Ate at pool side bar for lunch. Lots of places to sit in shade, Adirondack chairs everywhere. Last night there we sat under the stars with our drinks, not looking forward to going home.

Reviews.Title: “A Perfect Vacation”
Reviews.Author: yolichas
Reviews.Content: We loved this hotel. It is lovely and perfectly situated on the island. The management was extremely friendly and very attentive to every detail. Everyone at the hotel from the front desk employees, and Boomer, the social director, to the maintenance workers, waitstaff and bartenders could not have been better or friendlier. The beach is beautiful and quiet, the pool is fabulous and lots of fun. A guest can find anything - quiet or buzz- at this hotel. And, the restaurant is excellent. For breakfast, lunch, or dinner, it is one of the best. We can't say enough about the Southernmost on the Beach. We have stayed in wonderful hotels in many cities in the U.S. and Europe, and this is right up there with our favorites. We would definitely go back.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful property wonderful service”
Reviews.Author: travelmae64
Reviews.Content: We spent the last two nights of our Key West get away at the Southernmost on the Beach, and loved it. The room was beautiful and housekeeping skills were superb. Bath towels and linens wer excellent quality and the bed was comfortable. The grassy area outside our room was a perfect way to spend a quiet day in the sun and just feet from the pool when we wanted to cool off. The filtered water and cups beside the ice machines was a nice added touch. We were entertained both nights with weddings on the beach. Great fun to have free music to listen to over cocktails while watching the sun set. I would recommend this property to anyone willing to spend a little extra money to stay in a very nice resort.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect, Perfet, Perfect.”
Reviews.Author: jeannemac
Reviews.Content: The four nights I spent here with my daughter exceeded my expectations. Loved the location on the beach on a quieter side of town. Loved the staff and all they did to make our stay wonderful. Loved the room, - newly appointed, immaculate and spacious - in the A wing. Loved the poolside bar and music, the quiet pier, the gardens and the beach. Loved affordable al fresco breakfasts and happy hours at the Beach Cafe. Couldn't have asked for a nicer place to stay!

Reviews.Title: “Awesome!”
Reviews.Author: FunMichelle
Reviews.Content: We just got back from a 6 day stay at SOTB, and I could use at least 6 more days. It was fantastic! We had a west lawn room - it was a great room, but I'll admit that a balcony would have been nice. However, there were always tons of seats on the lawn for relaxing. We had a second floor room and would highly recommend a room on the second floor rather than the first because the first floor has a lot of traffic. The staff at the resort was great. Scarlet was really helpful in getting us bikes and dinner reservations. Boomer gave us a 4.0 at beer school - which was really like a short power hour! The booze cruise after beer school may have been a bit much! We skipped wine school, but that seemed very popular as well. During your stay, don't miss a breakfast at blue heaven. I would also recommend Danger Charters for a kayaking/snorkeling adventure. It was a great trip and we would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Peace, quiet, and a view of the ocean!”
Reviews.Author: desert_red
Reviews.Content: We chose Southernmost on the Beach based on the high rating on TripAdvisor. The high rating is definitely earned. A relatively new property, we knew we had chosen well when our cab driver from the airport immediately said "that's a nice place" when we told him our destination. The hotel is arranged in several buildings. We opted for a room with an ocean view. The room was spacious with a large bathroom, king size bed, and private balcony. There's plenty to do at the hotel itself. They have a great pool area that stays open late (11 PM) with a full bar attached and great service throughout the day. You can also opt for similar pools at other Southernmost Collection properties nearby. There's a small private beach area at the hotel. The hotel is next to one of Key West's public beaches that seemed to stay fairly crowded the whole time we were there. The hotel is near all the 'southernmost' attractions on the island - just a couple blocks from the famous "90 miles to Cuba" buoy. You're at the quiet end of Duval Street, about a 10-20 minute walk to the rowdier parts. You can also opt to rent a bicycle on property or jump in a pedicab to shorten your ride and save some shoe leather. There are a lot of good spots to eat just a few blocks from the hotel. You're also about a 5 minute walk to a CVS for any sundries you might need. Service at the hotel was outstanding. We arrived before check in time. They stored our luggage and gave us a key card that got us into the fitness area, pool, and other areas as needed. They did the same when we checked out but had a long wait for our flight. Staff is friendly and seems to go out of their way to make you feel welcome. My only complaints...the hotel seemed noisy in the morning with trucks arriving for delivery, carts rolling along, and doors opening and slamming shut. I was awakened a few times around 6-7 AM with people getting ready for the day. Not so much a complaint, but a word of advice - there's a lot to see and do in Key West. I feel like we spent so much time out of our room, we didn't really get the full value for what we were paying. I don't regret staying at the hotel at all, but if I had to choose again I would likely consider either one of the property's less expensive room choices or a less expensive option on one of the other Southernmost properties.

Reviews.Title: “Key West waterfront stay - beautiful and relaxing”
Reviews.Author: Frank_and_Michele
Reviews.Content: My wife and I spent 4 nights at SMOTB. Initially wanted to book at Casa Marina but saw mediocre reviews. Still don't know about CM but SMOTB was terrific. Buildings and room were very clean and attractive. We stayed in Room 655, across the parking lot from the oceanside rooms, but a nice view of the water and beach, and had a balcony. Bedroom a bit small, but bath and foyer very nice. WIFI was unreliable; front desk said they were in the process of getting a new provider. $380 per night; seems in line with the competition. Service was very good. Concierge Scarlett did a nice job booking a fishing trip for us. Pool staff friendly and good. Same for the Cafe Bar & Restaurant. The bar/restaurant is owned by the hotel owners. It is located on South Beach, a public beach adjacent to the hotel, so the patrons are hotel guests, other tourists and some locals. You'll pay $10 for an umbrella; $5 chair fee waived for hotel guests. The beach boy was very attentive. Grounds are beautiful. You can hang out on the beach, or the lawn, or a private pier. Lounge chairs and hammocks. The quiet end of Duval Street is a block away. Walk north toward Mallory Square/cruise ships/college kids. Stop at Vino's for some wine. Check out El SIboney a few blocks east - good, inexpensive Cuban food. If you want the funkiness of Key West and a relaxing waterfront locations, this is a winner. We would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Very pleasant stay - great pools, comfortable rooms”
Reviews.Author: SksAdvntr
Reviews.Content: We really enjoyed our stay at this hotel. The rooms seem like they were newly renovated - and the pool was just fantastic. We actually tacked on an extra night we were enjoying it so much. While just south of the "strip" it's actually at least a 45 minute walk to get to the heart of Duval - but still well located. You might want to try a scooter or cab it down to save on energy - my wife and I are both very fit, but found it a bit of a drag having to hike everywhere, so we started cabbing it, which was easy and cheap. The hotel has some fun activities - we went to "Beer School" which was a hoot, and the happy hour was excellent. The pool is very large and great fun to swim in. The service was generally quite good and we didn't have any complaints there. The internet connection was free, but service was a bit spotty. The rooms were updated with comfortable bed - the floors were a bit sandy, or dusty, which was a bit irritating, but I guess a minor issue. We're a mixed couple (asian, white) and we did not find the hotel very diverse, in terms of guests. It wasn't really an issue, but it wasn't particularly "comfortable". I guess that's not very PC, but that's how it felt. We'd go back just for the pool and happy hour - but everything else was high quality too.

Reviews.Title: “We will be back”
Reviews.Author: L_C_A_B66
Reviews.Content: Wow! How can one resort have so many FABULOUS employees? The resort is beautiful. The rooms beautiful. The location... so close to the wildness of Duval, but far enough to get "away" from it all. Boomer the activities director is by far in the perfect place doing what he was born to do. He is so entertaining! We went to Wine School, and he and the sommelier, Cabe were so much fun. We never wanted to leave the Shores bar! Between Heather the most bubbly server and James the bartender we were never left waiting. By far the best staff ever!

Reviews.Title: “Best in Key West by far!”
Reviews.Author: TangoEchoBravo
Reviews.Content: Absolutely perfect from check in to check out. Personable and professional staff - especially entertainment director, Boomer (great guy, always smiling) - Bartenders (Rich, James) and all the pool side staff. The hotel grounds and rooms are immaculate from dawn to dusk. Unlike many venues in the Keys, the staff here will actually do what it takes to keep you happy - and do it FAST! We had approx 54 room nights booked accommodating approx. 40 of our friends that stayed here to attend our wedding. Not one of our friends was disappointed. They have managed to retain the pre-renovation charm even though the hotel has grown considerably. Things to consider when planning your stay here; When we return we will not select the expensive suites that overlook the ocean on the ends of the buildings. I believe it might be better to stay at the medium priced rooms that overlook the Beach area (still has ocean view). The rooms that run along the beach side provide great views, easy access to beach pool, and have nice relaxing grassy area within steps of the room. Eat breakfast at the Beachside Cafe on the hotel grounds - moderately priced, excellent service and very quick seating relative to local alternatives. Have at least one Quesadilla for lunch - one of the best anywhere! You will not need a car. The hotel location is near the opposite end of Duval, taxis frequent the front desk areas, and Pedi cabs are in abundance. Note; Negotiate your Pedi cab fare prior to the ride - especially for women. My two large friends and I took a Pedi cab from one end of Duval to the other for $13.00 - my new wife and her girlfriend were charged $25.00....hmmmm. Age limit - I believe you must be 25 years old or more to stay here. Nice little store directly in front of Hotel for misc. food, drink, etc. Thank you, thank you, thank !!! Timothy and Natalie 3/11

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: PeterDude
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed in one of the rooms with lawn view, which also means sea and beach view. Really great. Location was fantastic on the quiet end of Duval Street. The hotel left a pleasant feeling and the main thing not so good was the 1970s aircon. I am sure it must be possible to install quieter aircons for the price of this room.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location!!”
Reviews.Author: SCUBAgirl30
Reviews.Content: A friend and I stayed at this hotel in February and LOVED it!! It is in the most perfect location- walking distance to everything in Key West but no directly in the craziness!! We loved the tanning pier and small beach located at the hotel! The beaches in Key West were not great swimming beaches (very rocky) but were perfect for tanning and taking quick swims to cool off. The pool is gorgeous and we swam there daily as well. The rooms were very clean and comfortable- I think we would ask for a second floor with a balcony next time. We enjoyed lunch and drinks by the pool everyday but I would not recommend the restaurant/dinner.We will definitely stay here again!!

Reviews.Title: “Expensive but faultless - no hidden extras!”
Reviews.Author: Sunkissed089
Reviews.Content: Having fled a noisy boutique hotel in on Collins avenue, this hotel was like paradise. Beautiful rooms, quiet, great location. A great treat!

Reviews.Title: “Scenic and quiet location in Key West”
Reviews.Author: LeM68
Reviews.Content: Having unkowningly selected spring break and "biker week" for our first visit to Key West, we greatly appreciated the beautiful location of this hotel on the very quiet end of Duval. The room, nicely furnished and with a huge shower, was located on the West Lawn wing and presented a beautiful view of the water and the sunset. Staff was extremely friendly and helpful. There are three pools available in the complex along with a beach area and a nice private pier. Although the rooms in this area are quite pricey, booking through an Expedia offer saved us $300 over our five-night stay. Breakfast was not included and would have been appreciated but there is a restaurant on site and several within a five minute walk. There are pedicabs available at the corner as well as other public transportation but we walked every day to Mallory Square and surrounding areas in 20-25 minutes. The Butterfly Conservatory is a block away and the Hemingway House a ten-minute walk. All in all, a great location without the crowds.

Reviews.Title: “I feel like we were spoiled rotten by old friends!”
Reviews.Author: wegetaround43214
Reviews.Content: This spot is just fantiastic. The grounds, the rooms, the location, the pools, the beach...and beyond all....the staff. Every single staff member we encountered was beyond courteous. It was a genuine courtesy and truly heartfelt. From the very visible bartenders (Rich & James at the Shores Bar), servers (Heather) and service people to the maintenance crew (Jim), the housekeepers and other more behind the scenes people...we were made to feel so comfortable. We have been coming to Key West for 19 years...stayed in every type of accomodation...and we have truly found the sweet spot at Southernmost on the Beach They are

Reviews.Title: “Small rooms, pricey, good staff”
Reviews.Author: Carolinascouple
Reviews.Content: Since our room was approximately $400 per night - we expected more. Very nicely appointed and fabulous bed - however the room is small. The AC unit is right by the vanity - a tad icy when you are just out of the shower, and no bathrobes provided. We were disappointed that our "ocean view" was marred by the staircase going up to the second floor. Not much of a view, being on the first floor, and certainly no privacy, as people were constantly walking by. We were looking for a serene escape - this was marred one day by men powerwashing the pool deck. On the positive side, the grounds were lovely, the staff helpful and friendly, the location is good - close to great restaurants, Louie's Backyard, Ambrosia, coffee shops and grocery items are nearby. If you stay, and expect an unobstructed view for this price, don't take room 510 in Building C.

Reviews.Title: “Location!”
Reviews.Author: MoovRound
Reviews.Content: We stayed in a wing that extends into the sea. It is a two-storied motel wing that used to have parking lots on both sides, but someone with great imagination converted the lots into landscaped gardens with palm trees that looked out onto the sea. The basic rooms' layout inside is essentially what you'd expect from a hotel chain, with a generous glass and tile shower-stall. Plenty of towels. Best value are the rooms overlooking the water, and there are many of them. My only wish was for the big center window to open (in addition to two smaller windows) for natural ventilation; I am not a big fan of air conditioning. The ceiling fans are great. You get access to the largest private beach on the island (so they say) and the three swimming pools. Concierge and front desk service are efficient and prompt. I would stay here again, but I want to try the old Southernmost House mansion on the corner! Be aware that many businesses in the neighborhood use "Southernmost" in their names, causing confusion.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect to melt the winter chill”
Reviews.Author: jaxon27
Reviews.Content: We arrived after 7 hour trip from fort Myers. May look into key west express or at least miami or Key west airports. Southernmost on the Beach is perfect. We stayed in 517 C building and had a great view of the Atlantic Ocean and the night sounds of waves lulled us to sleep. Drinks at the pool yummy Mango Margaritas. Friendly staff and visitors hi to the group from Ballston Spa in NY we will see you at Spac jazz. the food at the cafe was wonderful. Trolly right across the street beer and wine around the corner. Quiet room Lovely place. It made the vacation. the concierge can make res. and discount coupons. Near to butterfly museum quiet end of Duvalll. Louies Backyard aroun a few blocks freat food A+ stay.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous stay!”
Reviews.Author: itri
Reviews.Content: There's a reason this is one of the top-rated locations in Key West - it's wonderful. We had a great experience - loved the rooms, staff, grounds/pools, etc. We ate by the pool (from the Southermost Cafe) and the food was excellent. The spa looked small, but I had a great massage. The location is perfect, too. It's short walk to town, but far enough away that you don't have the noise. We would definitely return.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel on the beach”
Reviews.Author: piteryunior
Reviews.Content: We stay 4 nights in this hotel , we prefer third floor in block B . Automatic ice machine is in the middle , so we choose a room a long way from this noise . The room was renovated with fantastic beds and large bathroom . Only two negative things : small restaurant (excellent breakfast and dinner ) and little parking car ( you can park in the other hotel Southernmost round the corner ) .

Reviews.Title: “Ideal Hotel To See The Sights From”
Reviews.Author: A_Bear_A_Bear
Reviews.Content: My fiancee and I stayed here for two nights and loved it. The location was exactly what we wanted; right at the end of Duval St, on the water, quiet yet right there at the heart of the action. It was a little pricey given the size of the rooms but the rooms were very modern and clean leaving nothing to be desired. The pool was gorgeous and the staff were super attentive. Whenever I come to Key West, this will probably be my first choice.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful oceanfront spot”
Reviews.Author: Islander35
Reviews.Content: My family and I just returned from a week at the Southernmost. The resort is gorgeous, clean, and well appointed. The rooms face a courtyard with one end fronting the ocean. The grounds are beautiful and well kept. The rooms are spacious and newly decorated. The bathrooms are large and clean. The beds are large and comfortable. Each room has a picture window and balcony that looks out onto the courtyard. The beach is small and gets clogged with seaweed, but the grounds crew combs the beach morning and night. In addition to the beach, there's sandy spot with lounge chairs and hammocks lining the sea wall. There is also a jetty with lounges and a stairway right into the water. The pool and poolside bar are the real stars here though. The pool is huge and spotless with events on each day. The beachfront restaurant is an open air spot that is open from 8 am 'til 11pm. I was pleasantly surprised with the quality of food available at each meal. The food clearly surpassed standard resort fair. Prices are what you would expect for a hotel restaurant. The bars are large and always hopping. There is enough going on to keep all of the adults in party mode, but without the Spring Break rowdiness. I felt very comfortable letting my kids roam the grounds. There is not much for little ones, but the atmosphere was perfect for pre-teens. The resort is located one block from Duval Street, but it's located on the quiet end of the island; a 20 minute walk to the good natured nuttiness of lower Duval and Mallory Square. I will definitely return to the Southernmost.

Reviews.Title: “Go and enjoy!”
Reviews.Author: Hulu
Reviews.Content: We booked for 5 nights and ended up staying 12 - says it all! Great location on the beach with big heated pool and a great beach restaurant! Make sure you enjoy at least one day at the pier behind the hotel - magic! Doors to the rooms could do with some sort of "doorstopper", you could hear when you next door neighbour arrived. Also, why not use proper duvet covers instead of layers of sheets? No room service which would have been nice. Very friendly and helpful staff at the checkin counter, the concierge could maybe do with a little bit more service minded attitude. Also, try the spa - had a great massage there! This is where we stay when we return to magic Key West!

Reviews.Title: “Best Location in Key West”
Reviews.Author: Daytonahotels
Reviews.Content: It took a few visits to Key West to find the absolute best hotel on the absolute best beach - the most reasonable beach hotel, beautiful views, clean, wonderful service - and best of all the location. You can walk down Duval Street to the sunset pier and back - na taxis necessary - no driving. Sometimes a little noisy in the late night. The Southernmost hotel is our home in Key West.

Reviews.Title: “A Key West Treasure”
Reviews.Author: RobfromPA
Reviews.Content: Stayed there for 3 nights over a long weekend of a long cold NE winter. Opted for the oceanfront room and it was beautiful. Two walls of windows and a nice sized deck. Great sunrises! Room was great, good and free wifi, small refrig and blender in room. Bath and bed wonderful. Clean and extra-comfortable. No room service, but didn't care much about it. Great adjacent beach where chairs are free for hotel guests. Nice pool area. Quiet end of Duval Street. About 15-20 minute walk to the other end for sunset. Wanted a relaxing, do nothing weekend in a comfortable place. This exceeded my expectations. Pricey, but what in KW is not in high season. Worth it.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect!”
Reviews.Author: Laurie15
Reviews.Content: It was everything we wanted. Wonderful service, location and room! Walking distance to Duval street, restaurants and beaches etc. We chose a room with a partial ocean view and we were very satisfied. Complex has quiet corners with beach chairs provided, the same for pool and beach areas!

Reviews.Title: “Solid, safe choice...just not outstanding”
Reviews.Author: raweekley
Reviews.Content: My wife and I spent 5 nights at the Southernmost On The Beach during Valentine's week. The hotel itself is extremely clean, and the grounds are very well maintained and manicured. Our room was on the second flor and very comfortable. It was a bit loud however as you could easily hear footsteps on the floor above and feel the closing of doors nearby. The front desk staff was excellent as was the restaurant staff. On our final day, our flight did not leave until 5:30p. We were given a key to the exercise room (after our 11am checkout). so that we could shower and change prior to our flight so that we could enjoy the amenities of the hotel/pool/beach during the day. Some basic expectations of a hotel at this price level ($300+ nightly) were missing. No room service. No vending. No turn down service. However these were not major sacrifices and didn't impact the quality of the stay. The location is on the far end of Duval Street and one block to the Southernmost Point marker. We did not rent a car and found everything to be within walking distance. Older visitors or those with disabilites might find sightseeing easier via cab or electric cars (golf carts) that can be rented nearby. It's approximately 1 mile from the hotel to Mallory Square and the far end of Duval. The hotel location is truly at the quiet end of Duval Street, so it will be a bit of a walk to the nightspots and restaurants. Do yourself a favor and veer off of Duval to find some hidden gems for dinner. Blue Heaven is not to be missed for a memorable breakfast/brunch. Sothernmost On The Beach is a safe choice for couples or families as you will not be disappointed with your stay.

Reviews.Title: “Honeymoon Get-Away”
Reviews.Author: GN1838
Reviews.Content: My new husband and I just returned from our Honeymoon to Key West, Florida. We stayed at the Southernmost on the Beach Hotel. One thing is for certain, we will most definitely stay there again the next time we visit Key West! We rented bikes and traveled around the island checking out a lot of other hotels. We were completely satisfied with our decision to stay at Southernmost on the Beach. The main reason? Location, location, location! This is one of the only (if not the only) hotel in Key West located on a sandy beach. We loved the view of the ocean from both the pool and the beach cafe restaurant. The fact that this hotel was not located in the busy atmosphere of Duval Street was the cherry on top of the wedding cake! We were able to walk to Duval Street and enjoy that atmosphere, but we wanted a more quiet, romantic location for our hotel, and we definitely found it at the Southernmost on the Beach Hotel. Besides location, the staff at the hotel was extremely friendly, fun, and resourceful. Thanks to Dexter at the front desk, to Julie at the consierge desk, to all the awesome bartenders (or mixologists), to the activity director Boomer, we had the best honeymoon get-away we could have hoped for. We especially enjoyed "Wine School" by the beach with Boomer. Our only regret is that we missed "Beer School" because we were off enjoying the water. But, we will definitely make sure to attend class next time we return to Key West. Finally, Southernmost on the Beach had some other very appealing features. The pool was clean and heated. We were always able to get a beach chair by the pool and on the beach. (Chairs on the beach are free to hotel quests... bonus!) Our favorite thing to do at night was sit by the beautifully lit pool at the bar. Our best meals were at the Beach Cafe restuarant. I could gush on and on and on.... In summary, we highly recommend staying at the Southernmost on the Beach Hotel! We cannot wait to go back again! :)

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: fbevel
Reviews.Content: The hotel is well positioned for easy walking trips. Our room was very pleasant, bright and airy. The concierge was helpful. The drinks at poolside were exorbitantly priced. Parking could be an issue. Although free, if the hotel was full I don't know if there would be sufficient spaces. Next time would fly into Key West rather than Miami. Only used the car to arrive and leave.

Reviews.Title: “We loved that place”
Reviews.Author: Fabio_Milano_75
Reviews.Content: We've been in that paradise for 3 days in February, the hotel was very relaxing, lots of hammocks and sun beds, just in front of the sea, access to the beach, close to shops and restaurants, great staff, super sunset and sunrise views. Only improvements could be addresses to the restaurant, which opens for the brekfast at 8:00 and it was late for us, and also once we could not have dinner there because it was full.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Resort setting.”
Reviews.Author: swisschar
Reviews.Content: The staff was very friendly. The Resort is romatic and our room was beautifully decorated. The bed was awesome. The food in the hotel outdoor restaurant was delicious. The only negative is that they do not have enough parking for guests. A beautiful setting on the water.

Reviews.Title: “Most beautiful setting in Key West”
Reviews.Author: OntarioFamilyfun
Reviews.Content: We had stayed at Southernmost on the Beach last August in the hot humid glorious weather and loved it! So we had a 5 day get-away during the first week of January and spent it at Southernmost on the Beach! Wow, we were not disappointed! We flew in from Montreal, into Miami and then straight to Key West! Once at the hotel, we do not need a car! We had a most relaxing stay, beautiful weather and watched winter sunsets from the pier. And of course we ate at the Southernmost Beach Cafe, our very favorite eating and bar spot. It was great to see Kassie and Shannon again, our favorite bartenders. Thank you for the extra olives! We soaked up some rays, absorbed the Vitamin D and loved the luxurious feel of the hotel. We were very happy to return to Southernmost on the Beach, the hotel by the ocean within walking distance to the action. We relaxed on the pier, sat by the pool! It was a glorious 5 days. We flew back to Montreal and returned to the cold Canadian winter, but felt rejuvenated. We are looking forward to returning to Key West again this summer as part of our road trip... We love the Key West atmosphere and Southernmost on the Beach is where we want to stay!!!

Reviews.Title: “Large new clean well-appointed rooms with great view!”
Reviews.Author: jarankin
Reviews.Content: Hotel was expensive but it was the top of the line and we got what we paid for. staff was great, beach restaurant was nice surprise, and pool and beach were perfect. location couldn't have been better either.

Reviews.Title: “A charming place”
Reviews.Author: kamitravel
Reviews.Content: We booked a room with ocean view through a 3rd party website and stayed for 2 nights. I should call it fantastic. The hotel is located at the end of Duval street right on the ocean. Our room was recently rennovated with beautiful decorations. Everything was really clean and spotless and the bed was quite comfortable. Our room had ocean view but it was not directly on the beach. The pool and outdoor areas were well kept but small. The hotel has a small private beach and deck . Watching sunrise from the deck was unforgettable. They had complimentary parking which is great plus in old town of key west. We didn't use the concierge but there was a bike rental accross the street and we got bikes and biked all over the old town. ( Don't use your personal car since parking in key west can be a pain ) . we tried breakfast in the beach front cafe and it was really good. The hotel is located in walking distance to all the action in Duval street. The hotel is very quite but if you are a party animal , you can simply walk to all the noise ! The only negative point is small beach and outdoor areas, but it's Keywest and everything in this tiny island is cramped !

Reviews.Title: “Best location to have a great vacation”
Reviews.Author: Picinke
Reviews.Content: Spent 10 lovely days in Southernmost on the Beach end of January. Very good location right at the beach just a few steps from the Duval street and very nice comfortable rooms. Selected the hotel after reading the reviews here and it was all as others commented. We've been visited a lot of places but Key West is one of the best locations I've ever been in the USA (we are from Hungary/Europe) Lovely beaches, lot of things to do, good restaurants and coctails. It is just great to be on the beach all day then to spend the night walking on the lively streets, enjoying the famous sunset! A bit pricey, the hotels, foods are more expensive then other cities but a very different place. It is definitely worth to go there and stay in this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous place to stay !!!!”
Reviews.Author: Jolenograd
Reviews.Content: My Husband and I really enjoyed our stay at Southernmost On The Beach. We had room 737, which was an amazing room w the best view. Very clean!! The staff was amazing and very helpful. The pool was such a hit and the Jerry colada drinks were my favorite at the pool side bar. We ate at the restaurant there three times and the food was excellent. Such a nice walk to duval St. Would really recommend this hotel!!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful, Clean, Comfortable Accommodations”
Reviews.Author: Janaanmn
Reviews.Content: My sisters and I travel often together. Key West was a great destination. We really enjoyed our recent stay at Southermost on the Beach. The resort is lovely. Location was perfect, quite with sandy beach but not too far from the hustle of Duval Street. The remodel of the rooms really hit the mark. Staff was very friendly and helpful. Pool area was very nice, loved the delicious Pina Coladaâ€™s. The scattered hammocks on the property were a nice touch. I wanted to try the Spa services but never managed to schedule, I was just too busy having fun! I did think $125.00 for a massage was a bit high, but not sure what Key West market rate is for those services. Rental equipment was convenient. We rented bikes for two days, they were a perfect mode of transportation in Key West. It was a quick and eay ride to the larger beaches and Duval street, even the finest of resteraunts had bike racks. Our favortie resteraunt "Blue heaven" was a 5 minute bike ride away - try the white snapper and key lime pie - Yum If I ever plan another trip to Key West, this hotel will be on top of my list.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect piece of paradise!”
Reviews.Author: judijorgensen
Reviews.Content: Stayed here this jan with my 20 and 23 year old daughters and it was just wonderful. got into town early on check in day, no problem, our room was ready and we were able to get settled and get a jump start on the fun. location is great, quiet with an amazing beach right out side your door. the grounds are amazing and the staff is friendly, helpful and fun! especially loved beer and wine school with Boomer! when one of the kids got sick on our check out day, they let us keep the room until 3 pm with no additional charge. we will be back and if key west is in your future you should go here too!

Reviews.Title: “Incredible place, would stay there again in a heart beat.”
Reviews.Author: Jetnut
Reviews.Content: We booked this trip through a third party site and had a different experience compared to others who booked through a third party and posted a review. We were very pleased with every aspect of our stay. The room was clean, modern and spacious, with plenty of space form our belongings. The bathroom was large with a big shower. When we booked the room it did not mention about having a balcony, when we walked into the room we were pleasantly surprised to see we had one with a great view. Service was great, from the bartender at the pool bar to the front desk, they were very attentive and accommodating. If I had to post anything negative it would be that the pool was a little to warm for our liking but have been told most of the pools in Key West were heated. All in all this was a great place to stay and will stay there again upon our return to Key West.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent service !”
Reviews.Author: WilliamPatry
Reviews.Content: First and foremost, this destination is now at the top of our return to list and it is due largely to the efforts of two staff members, Wally at the front desk and Elizabeth, the property Manager. We had a small problem with our room and both of them went out of their way to fix the problem and then to compensate us for having to deal with this.
