Because of their efforts we stayed and extra day and very much enjoyed the hotel We had a wonderful waterfront room with a large balcony, great view of the water and sunset, superb bathroom, and the cleanliness was beyond reproach. The pool staff are very welcoming, very attentive to your needs and the pool is kept in spotless condition. Overall experience was extremely satisfying and we will definitely be back. William and Paule Patry QuÃ©bec City Canada

Reviews.Title: “Excellent!”
Reviews.Author: KKCanada1
Reviews.Content: We stayed Jan 19-21. Fantastic hotel. We stayed in rm 557 - it was a newer bldg. The room was very nice. We loved the balcony, the bathroom was big. There was only a shower - no tub. The bed was comfortable. We really enjoyed the beach. It's probably the best hotel in KW if you enjoy sitting by the beach. We drove from Miami so we left our car at the hotel. There was no charge. It was easier to take a taxi to Duval $3 per person plus tip. We walked back from Mallory Square. Restuarants by Mallory Sq are very touristy. We loved Martini Restaurant on Duval. Fantastic food/atmosphere. We really enjoyed KW and would definitely come back. When we do, we'll definitely return to this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Best Place to Stay in Key West”
Reviews.Author: kelbel403
Reviews.Content: I can not say enough good things about Southernmost on the Beach. First off, the staff is fantastic. I can honestly say we became friends with the pool area bartender, Kevin, and the beach attendants. Every single person goes above and beyond to make your stay the best it can be. They were especially accommodating to me as I was five months pregnant on our trip. The location can not be beat. Not only do you have direct access to the best beach on the island, you're steps from Duval Street. I loved that it's on the quiet end of Duval so you can easily escape the hustle and bustle if you'd like. The grounds and the rooms are spotless and very comfortable. A wonderfully accommodating, clean, beautiful hotel with the best staff on Key West.

Reviews.Title: “Great location to explore Key West from”
Reviews.Author: insidetravel
Reviews.Content: Hotel and staff were very accomodating. Beds were very comfortable, shower was large, balcony was useful. Three pools on the property but the one closest to the beach was best. Small but functional workout room. Had to ask to have the sheets changed. There's a great restaurant, across the beach, where we had breakfast every day. Good food and easily affordable--very convenient. The staff were very friendly and helpful. Very good location: away from upper Duval street with the noisy drunken bars but close enough to everything to allow ready access. Good choice. I'd go back.

Reviews.Title: “Incredible!”
Reviews.Author: twotravelers17601
Reviews.Content: We arrived before check-in time and our room was not ready, so we were upgraded to an absolutely perfect room with a balcony and ocean view - what a nice thing to do for us! Stayed 3 nights and enjoyed everything immensely. Housekeeping was impeccable. We especially enjoyed sitting on the balcony, the private beach, and the pier. We walked to everything from here, yet got to enjoy the quiet away from the crowds. A wonderful experience, thank you!

Reviews.Title: “Just about perfect!”
Reviews.Author: shellgilardi
Reviews.Content: I just came back from Key West with my husband and stayed at the Southernmost on the Beach. It was just about perfect!! The resort was amazing, the staff was very friendly, and the view was out of this world. I didn't have to go more than 3 steps from my door to see the wonderful sunset every evening. The ONLY flaw that I could see was the fact that the walls were very thin and I could hear the people above me walking around at 5:30 a.m. and the people next to me have a normal conversation. I asked the mgt. for a room upstairs but was told that there was none available. I would definitely stay here again, I would just request to stay on the top floor of the building!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic room with great view!”
Reviews.Author: Ellynjd
Reviews.Content: We stayed in room 736, an oceanfront balcony king room and loved every minute. From our comfy king bed we could watch the sunrise and see the boats pass by on the ocean. Slept with the french doors open and listened to the wind in the palms and enjoyed the ocean breezes. It was a little chilly (mid-60's) but from the balcony I could actually wear a bathing suit and sunbathe because we were out of the wind. Very quiet, well appointed with eco-friendly toiletries, large walk-in shower stall and of course a refrigerator, coffee maker and bar sink. Closet on the small side, but who needs much space for a visit. Lots of dresser drawer space. Highly recommend.

Reviews.Title: “This hotel set the stage for the entire trip!”
Reviews.Author: LauriePopp
Reviews.Content: For the first time, my husband and I stayed at the Southernmost on the Beach hotel - located right on the Atlantic Ocean. This hotel had recently underwent a total room renovation - and talk about high-end! WOW! I travel a lot for business, and this ranks right up there with all the 5 star hotels I've stayed at. High end bedroom touches, ceramic and glass bathroom, refrigerator and safe in the room and more! Really loved the window seat overlooking the beach. Great place to cuddle up and watch the sunset. What made this experience even better were all the activities the staff had planned for guests. We attended Beer School and Wine School - thought it would just be some drinking going on - but we actually learned a lot! Rich handled the Beer School and Cabe handled the Wine School. Each knows their stuff! And excellent choices for the taste testing in both classes. The Beer School was held at the poolside bar - intimate group. Got to know some of the other guests and had fun laughing and learning. Wine School was held on the lawn overlooking the ocean - appetizers and wine - from whites to reds - it was amazing! The Housekeeping staff was awesome - especially Marisa! It felt so good each night to come "home" to such a sparkling fresh room. We look forward to our next trip back - completely amazing.

Reviews.Title: “room 610”
Reviews.Author: bradSomerset
Reviews.Content: we stayed with this hotel Southermost on the Beach in early December. It was very nice but you have to watch which room you get. We were in the West Lawn room 610. The access was from a walkway outside and the stairs were right outside the room so we had quite a lot of noise from people coming and going. I asked to change on check in but it was refused. Otherwise yes the walls are thin and you can hear next door. The restaurant on the beach is good value for meals cheaper than in the town. Good point the parking was free. Avoid room 510 511 610 and 611 if you can.

Reviews.Title: “This was more than we expected.”
Reviews.Author: DLC57
Reviews.Content: This is a great location and walking distance to many Key West attractions. The rooms are beautifully decorated and spacious. Great views. great staff.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice - we will stay there again.”
Reviews.Author: kurtedjohn
Reviews.Content: Southernmost is located at the quiet end of Duval Street. it is about a 1 mile walk to the other end. Our room was very nice - facing the beach and the sunsets. I wish they had private balconys, but we had a great view through the window, and they had nice semi-private areas to sit out.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely great”
Reviews.Author: macndave
Reviews.Content: Our first time to Key West and we chose this property based mainly on TA reviews. What a good choice.The location is super. Close to the action but just far enough away to be relaxing. We had a west lawn room which looked newly remodeled. It was well decorated and very clean. Hammocks and chairs were right outside our door. A huge pool was there also. The entire complex was spotless. The staff were all very pleasant and helpful. Julie at the concierge desk saved us money by calling around and getting rates for an electric car rental which is a must do event. Omar the Bellman was just the nicest person you could meet. There is a cheap daily happy hour at the Beach Cafe and you get a great view of the sunset from the pier. All things considered this is the nicest hotel we've ever seen.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful location, room, excellent staff, walking distance from anything.”
Reviews.Author: martin-design
Reviews.Content: I picked this hotel based on their web site which I found very accurate. The location is beautiful with a (not huge, but clean) beach with terrific food and drink service. There are many quiet places, hammocks and sitting areas if you don't want crowds and everything is within walking distance if you do. The rooms and staff are excellent. There is plenty to do or not do and activities are easy to arrange. The free WiFi, beach towels, lounge chairs were appreciated and I didn't feel "nickel and dimed" to death with incidentals.

Reviews.Title: “Christmas Paradise”
Reviews.Author: Fathead7
Reviews.Content: Excellent accomodations. It has been an excellent treat spending Christmas in paradise. Southernmose on the Beach has been an wonderfully relaxing experience. The staff have been accommodating and helpful. It's been an all around pleasant experience. You can walk most places and it is far enough away from the hustle and bustle of Duval.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Place”
Reviews.Author: MeghaDeora
Reviews.Content: We spent 2 nights here and loved the place. Everything from the booking to check-in to our stay was smooth. The rooms were clean and nice with big bathrooms. We were 2 couples sharing a room with 2 queens beds and it was a comfortable stay for us. The pool was warm as the weather was a li'l cold. They had plenty of beach chairs and most rooms had an ocean view. Its located on the other end of duval St away from all the action. You can rent bikes from the concierge desk on a daily basis. The also have free wi-fi which was a big plus for us

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Place & Stay”
Reviews.Author: mtngirl23
Reviews.Content: We re -searched first came with no reservation put in stay for 3 nights and extended for 2 more (Thank You! Lewis excepional help) because we loved it so much everything was perfect the room ,views,location,& staff i work in the resort business so know how everything works, our first visit to the keys and was perfect defiently will be back was a little cool but for a northern was fine with us still warm for us ,defenietly rent the bikes and ride everywhere

Reviews.Title: “Fun, clean, great staff, best place to stay in Key West, FL.”
Reviews.Author: putter2010
Reviews.Content: The resort was great. Everything what it said it was from the web page is true. The staff was great. The rooms were the cleanest hotel rooms we have ever stayed in. Boomer, the entertainment committee was great. We plan on staying at this resort every time we go. Walking distance to all the fun places on Duval, yet quiet enough to enjoy the resort.

Reviews.Title: “I cannot say enough good things about this hotel”
Reviews.Author: FlyingBurritoGuy
Reviews.Content: Our five day stay was just fabulous. Great service at the bar. Fun bartenders. The seafood and wine at the restaurant were excellent. Nice pool. Great location close to everything but in a quiet area. The balcony and view from the west lawn rooms were superb. Bike rentals were a nice touch too.

Reviews.Title: “Best Choice for on the Beach Hotel”
Reviews.Author: artgirls
Reviews.Content: The hotel was superb. Clean, well decorated, every available amenity, quiet rooms, balcony, beach view. The bed was fluffy and comfortable, the linens silky. Beyond all that the hotel staff was extremely friendly and accommodating. We couldn't have had better service. It was far enough from the nightlife that the property was quiet, but still only a walk away (or a short taxi ride if it was late at night). I would definitely recommend it - and I'd happily go back there again!

Reviews.Title: “Awesome stay - great hotel!”
Reviews.Author: fanofbuckeyes
Reviews.Content: Just returned home from a four night stay. Hotel was clean, staff was friendly and the location was perfect! We were in building D - king size room - partial ocean view...ocean was right in front of our balcony! Great food/drinks at the Cafe too! Only thing I wish the room had were microwaves, but other than that our stay was fantastic! Nice little beach, great pool, and free parking. I highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “AMAZING”
Reviews.Author: Carly82886
Reviews.Content: This hotel goes above and beyond. Not only are the rooms and property just beautiful the staff couln't be more friendly and helpful. The location is perfect if you want to be close to the action but still feel quiet and secluded. The classy coastal decor sets the perfect mood and the balcony was wonderful to have coffee and watch the ocean. Thanks to everyone for a wonderful stay. We hope to be back very soon!!!

Reviews.Title: “Paradise”
Reviews.Author: senorita08
Reviews.Content: This is paradise. The staff are friendly and helpful, the pool is refreshing and beautiful, the massages take place on the beach, there is a private beach for guests, and a public beach right outside. Rooms are light and airy, and the whole place has a relaxed, Caribbean vibe. Free parking, excellent bar - one on the beach and one by the pool, just perfect for relaxation.

Reviews.Title: “Good - But very Noisy”
Reviews.Author: ynm4142
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for two nights. We had our 3 year old daughter with us. Rooms were very clean. Looks like a new constructions but the rooms were very cramped. It is not a hotel, it is a motel. It has common lobby for all its rooms and it can get noisy when you have some drunk people at the late night. One thing is to keep in mind that this is not a kids friendly place to stay. Having said that views are really good, very easy access to the beach and a great pool.

Reviews.Title: “Hard to believe newly renovated”
Reviews.Author: lapel555
Reviews.Content: We booked a special rate on a west lawn beachview room that was just renovated. I was so disappointed. The mattress and pillows were sooo uncomfortable. The a/c unit was broken and the fan ran and ran all night. There was very little shower water pressure. The walls are paper thin- we heard talking and televisions in rooms at both sides of us. The staff was very nice and tried to address our concerns. They quickly sent a repairman to look at the a/c- he thought it was fixed but it went on the blink soon after he left. We were offered a new room but if this was supposedly the newest and best..I was afraid of what the older rooms were like. On the flip side, everything was very clean, the pool and grounds were beautiful and the people were very nice.

Reviews.Title: “I couldn't go home!”
Reviews.Author: TheMangoMen
Reviews.Content: I hope you have more than a minute...I manage The Mango Men Band and brought 40 people down to Key West for a Mango Men Tour. Judi in the group rooming department was incredibly organized and friendly and did everything she could to help me get the most out of the resort including helping me with sound for the band and meals for my guests. Once we arrived, Boomer took over as our host. I watched him treat every guest in the hotel with the same care and attention that he gave everyone in our group. We never needed anything or had any questions because he somehow answered them first. Kevin, the pool bartender, not only made us drinks, but serenaded us while playing his guitar in the down times. It was awesome! Dominic provided a perfect breakfast for our group and everyone was always happy with everything. If you go, be sure to ask for Corinne. Not only will she provide perfect friendly service, she remembers everything. If you go back the next day and she sees you coming, don't be surprised if she has your seating ready with your coffe steaming!! Though I usually keep my room spotless, running the tour took ALL of my time. Not to worry, the cleaning crew cleaned my room with as much care as my mother used to. When it came time to leave, we were so tired from the tour, we chose to stay a few extra days. The hotel treated us like royalty and made sure we were able to completely relax and enjoy the resort ourselves. Would I stay there again??? YES! I would not stay anywhere else!!

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: Jenn_BostonMA
Reviews.Content: I travel a few times a year and this is a place i would 100% go back to. I went on vacation with my parents for a few days instead of doing a traditional thanksgiving back home. The rooms are so nice and the bathroom is amazing!! The pool is brand new and has a great outdoor bar... ask for Heather... she is super nice and can give some great recommendations on where to go depending on what you are looking for. The hotel also has bike rental so you can easily go there and rent some bikes (a must do in Key West) and check out Duval St or bike around the island (takes about an hour or so). That being said if you are looking for a party place this is not where you want to be. The pool area is fun but there is no music anything like that at night. You want to stay at the other end of Duval St which is about a 10 to 15 minute walk. This hotel is connected to a sister hotel and has an outdoor restaurant/beach area which is great for breakfast or watching the sun go down. Really good place to stay and a great rate for what you get.

Reviews.Title: “This is my favorite hotel in Key West.”
Reviews.Author: Patrice41
Reviews.Content: We've been to Key West many times--and stayed in different places each time-- but this was the best for several reasons. It's a beautiful (and beautifully maintained) hotel that feels like a self-contained resort AND it's right off Duval Street in one of the best parts of Old Town. It's not inexpensive, but the amenities, the views, the location and the staff make it worth it. Southernmost has the kind of attentive customer service you'd expect at a four star hotel--but in keeping with the vibe of Key West, it's completely relaxed and friendly. We shall return.

Reviews.Title: “An absolutely stunning hotel - i did not want to leave”
Reviews.Author: Vickyc007
Reviews.Content: This was the most amazing hotel we stayed in - it was absolutely beautiful almost like a 5 star hotel but really relaxed and laidback. Amazing location right next to the beach and in the quieter, classier end of Duval Street amongst the residents. You could walk down to the raucous end of Duval Street in about 20mins. Parking is free and there was free internet in the rooms - useful as the mobile reception in Key West can be pretty poor. I stayed in a room with two beds whilst my friend had a King Bed room which were in another block. Every room has a balcony so you can look at the view. Would go back there in an instant and only wished we had stayed longer here than in Miami Beach. Really, really lovely.

Reviews.Title: “Paradise at the end of the USA”
Reviews.Author: MeltonMowbrayPete
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for three nights in room 519 in block 'C'. Fabulous and very modern room on the ground floor, facing west, for an uninterupted view of some fabulous sunsets. Hotel has a nice pool and bar although we preferred to use the hotel beach. (which is public, but beds and umbrellas are provided by the hotel) The beach bar provides good and reasonably priced drinks and food. Try the mini bar-b-q at only $3 a plate during happy hour. Hotel also has a pier and a 'Library Beach' which is great for peace and quiet. Rooms at this hotel are expensive but you get what you pay for! Location is fantastic and it is at the quiet end of Duval St/Mallory Sq. Only a pleasant 15 min walk to the heart of all the action. Recommend the 90 minute orientation trip on the island which can be organised by hotel concierge.

Reviews.Title: “Great renovations, getting crowded”
Reviews.Author: Will&Michelle
Reviews.Content: Have been going to southernmost for 9 years ( as well as recommending friends and bringing friends with us) and still enjoy it, the views are amazing, rooms are excellent, especially since the renovations/additions. The property is well maintained. You can read my previous reviews on this resort for all the great stuff. Now for the not so great, the place is overcrowded now, you used to be able to get a chair poolside without difficulty, not anymore. with the renovations they added an excellent pool bar, with that excellent bar came the highest drink prices in key west ( and i've drank in most of them). As far as appreciating returning costumers, well since they are so busy now, other than a "thank you for returning" don't expect much. Other resorts will comp you a meal, even a small discount on room or even a bottle of champaign. I guess you gotta expect this now since its no longer a small hotel, the hotel is beautiful but before this year, we never considered other places to stay, now we will. On a positive note, the restaurant on the beach has greatly improved its menu.

Reviews.Title: “Magnificent view, beautiful pool, nice relaxing place to stay in Key West.”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Very nice rooms, everything you need. They're hairdryer was better than the one I brought. Beautiful views at this resort. Spacious balconies on the oceanfront rooms. Pool very nice. We took a beer class/tasting at the pool which was very fun. Lot to do in this area, highly recommend butterfly conservatory. Good distance walk to Mallory square, only downside in my opinion.

Reviews.Title: “A Relaxing Stay, Refreshing Hotel, & Best Location”
Reviews.Author: StacyHR
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here for vacation for 4 nights and had a wonderful time. We're very pleased we chose this hotel and will stay here again when we come back to Key West. This was our first time in Key West and it was an awesome place to visit. We arrived around 2 a.m. and the front desk was open and nice in helping us check in and find our room. Below are the pros and cons of our stay. Pros of Southernmost on the Beach -lots of great FREE amenities not at other locations - large terraces with a table and 2 chairs, free parking (some covered), private beach, private pier, pool with ocean view, hammocks with ocean view, free use of South Beach, towels, chairs, beautiful gardens. -location is excellent - quiet side of Duval but walkable from many places -ocean view even though we didn't pay for it -- our "New Deluxe King Balcony" room overlooked the parking lot but we could see South Beach and the ocean just as well as that. -actually ON the water, on the south side of the island, by Duval - not many places located like that in Key West -very comfortable bed -spacious room, fridge to use -everything from the beach, the pier and the parking lot were uber clean -friendly and helpful concierge Cons of Southernmost on the Beach -very slow water pressure in the showers - not a big deal for some but I have pretty thick hair and was in there for a while getting all the shampoo and conditioner out. -the shades/drapes aren't completely light blocking like most hotels so when the sun comes up the room isn't dark. -we received a handicapped room although we didn't request it and that means the shower had this huge bench in it that made it very difficult to stand and take a shower, not to mention banging my knee on it several times. -very little counter space around the sink - the sink was stand alone and then there was a glass shelf on the wall next to it -the maid service seemed a little slow on some days - we would leave our room by 9am and come back around 1 or so and the room still wasn't made up. Other: Definitely would recommend Barefoot Billys for the Jet Ski Tour (set up by the concierge), we paid $150 for both of us on one jet ski and a 27 mile, 2 hour tour of the island. Well worth it! At first, I balked at a guided tour but was glad we did as navigating the harbor is dicey and there are lots of reefs and shallow areas in Key West that guide helped us avoid. The guide also had some great history and facts to share about Key West. If you're from a smoke-free city/state, be prepared for lots of smokers in Key West. There seem to be a lot of European travelers who smoke and lots of American smokers who visit and Florida's smoke-free restaurant law seemed to be optional here. There were smokers at the pool and beach too.

Reviews.Title: “Friendliest and most comfortable hotel in Key West!”
Reviews.Author: hddartfrog
Reviews.Content: Everyone was so friendly and helpful at this hotel that it felt like we were being welcomed by family! The rooms were very clean and the beds were the most comfortable hotel beds I've ever slept in! It was really great to see all the "green" things the hotel has implemented in order to reduce their impact on the environment. They should be a model for many other hotels to follow!

Reviews.Title: “Best Hotel on the island!”
Reviews.Author: betty1981
Reviews.Content: We were so lucky to have found this gem of a hotel. With a perfect location on the water and at the end of Duval, you could not ask for a better place to stay! The rooms were modern, clean and spacious. The beds were super comfortable. The staff was friendly and attentive. The grounds were impeccable. We will never stay at another hotel in Key West. Boomer the activity director was an amazing asset to the hotel. He is fun, friendly and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “The best value in the most spectacular location”
Reviews.Author: timfrancis
Reviews.Content: The ideal location in Key West. Unbelievably spectacular waterfront site that offers the best of both worlds - it's at the quiet end of the strip but an easy walk to all the action. A sandy, protected beach offers excellent swimming, snorkelling and paddle boarding while the adjacent fresh water pool is large enough that you're not on top of other guests. The open air, beachfront restaurant serves a full array of surprisngly well-priced meals. Try the Yellow Tailed Snapper for dinner or the best corn beef hash you'll find anywhere for breakfast. The rooms have very recenlty been updated with bay windows and luxurious but understated decor, including king-sized beds and large flat screen tv's. Our room offered a large deck that was ideal for enjoying our coffee or checking emails in the morning or for watching the sunset in the evening. We found all of the staff to be friendly, attentive and well informed. This hotel leaves nothing to be desired, you'll wish you never had to leave.

Reviews.Title: “Great service, great hotel, great trip”
Reviews.Author: aflynn69
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for the 2nd year for Fantasy Fest and cannot compliment the hotel and staff enough. The hotel is perfectly clean, the staff all friendly and helpful and the food and drinks athe Beach Cafe are great. It's hard to decide to leave the beach party to get dressed and go out for the night! I'm shocked by the other review of horrible service. The service here was impeccable, but not intrusive. This is a classy hotel, but somehow still has an at home feel, as if you're living there in a home. There are screens in the windows so you can open them up and enjoy the sea air. If all goes as planned, we will back in Room 636 again for Fantasy Fest 2011!!!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful...”
Reviews.Author: dazzle4u
Reviews.Content: First trip to KW with my mother for my birthday. This hotel is beautiful and very clean. The room was very nicely decorated and clean. We had a nice view of the pool and ocean in a new partial oceanview room. The pool was awesome, but just too cold to enjoy due to cool nights in Nov. The landscaping and lawn with hammocks were beautiful. It was nice to be able to choose where to lay in the sun-the pool or the sand. They have a cafe on the sand that has good food, pricey, but that's everything. The hotel is in a nice location, it's right beside the southernmost point marker and the butterfly conservatory. It doesn't take that long to walk right up Duval St. to the action. Now for a few disappointments....no microwave in room, which I think is crazy, you can't even heat up pizza. Or anything. The water pressure in the shower is ridiculous. It's so slow, you can hardly wash the shampoo out of your hair. We needed a few plastic cups because we used the couple they put in the room, for our drinks and ice. My mom asked at the desk for some and the man told her she'd have to go find them somewhere near the ice machine. There was no plastic cups at ice machine. We had to find some at the hotel across the street. I thought that was a little rude after paying that much for the room for them to tell you to go find your own cups. (Mom just had surgery too.) The pool and bar close kinda early, as well as the beach access. Also, when reserving, be careful of different activities going on because they won't grant you use of AAA discount, they even had a special online-stay 3 nights, get one free. They said they couldn't give us either discount because "it was boaters week." Other than those gripes, We would stay here again. It was very nice. We loved it overall.

Reviews.Title: “Waterfront quiet at the end of Duval St”
Reviews.Author: rogerroy1974
Reviews.Content: My wife and I went to Key West and were lured by the other reviews on tripadvisor and we were not disappointed. The hotel grounds and rooms were beautiful and fresh, We had a room towards the street, as opposed to by the water. The room was modern and outfitted wth dark wood features and a great deck area to sit and enjoy the surroundings. There is a nice pool with bar, and a beachfront bar. The beach area is fine for sitting out but not great for swimming. The only thing that kept this from being 5 stars was the housekeeping was not great in the bathroom(no tp given, wrinkled towels). Be aware it is a decent walk to get to bars on Duval St and hotel has FREE parking!

Reviews.Title: “Pretty But Horrible Service”
Reviews.Author: PickyNYer13
Reviews.Content: The hotel itself is pretty, easily accessible to Duval St and a beautiful view. The bad part, the service. The man that checked us in gave us a horrible attitude, the concierge knew only what sounded like she memorized from script. I also happened to hurt my ankle/foot badly. We finally got a wheel chair. I get in thinking they will help and push me to where I needed to be, WRONG!! He pushed me in the direction and then explained the rest of the way. The bell hop never arrived to help bring up luggage and the TV was broken. There are so many nice places to stay in Key West, THIS IS NOT ONE OF THEM.

Reviews.Title: “Ocean view...awesome pool...great service”
Reviews.Author: JaKwo
Reviews.Content: Key West is like going to a tropical island without leaving the US. First time there and had a great time. The room was great! Staff was helpful and friendly. Great poolside activities and staff had excellent recommendations for site seeing and restaurants. I have to say the beaches in Key West are rocky and their is a lot of sea weed but if you wade past it the water is great. The pools were great though!

Reviews.Title: “perhaps overpriced”
Reviews.Author: unlikeanyone
Reviews.Content: I feel like I am eating my words because I chose this place excited to be able to stay at a pricier hotel for once, guilt-free. Our vacation changed to include my mother-in-law after we all lost my father-in-law two months before our trip. After that kind of event, you're willing to pay good money for relaxation and location. It turned out that my in-laws had chosen this hotel already (they were considering meeting up with us on our trip). So, for many reasons, I was happy to pick Southernmost on the Beach and not feel bad about the money, for once. It was one of the few hotels that could guarantee two queen beds which were needed for the three of us. Other places could only give us a pull out couch which seemed like a horrible idea. Southernmost on the Beach has: modern Caribbean styling cute and sharp interior design sweet little uncovered porches nice finishes nice pool convenient restaurant, although I didn't try it out great customer service (but seriously everywhere in South Florida people were very polite and pleasant) quite green! with dual flush toilets, recycling containers, room-key based electrical (although this proved a problem when we realized that this meant our fridge turned off too!) Despite these great points, I couldn't believe the water pressure problem we had in the shower! As soon as we realized that the water dribbled through our shower head, I remembered what I thought was an unfair review noting that for the price, it was ridiculous for the shower to be an issue. I now see that this reviewer was not exaggerating. My mother-in-law and I discussed whether Key West had trouble getting enough fresh water and then decided that, regardless, there should be a little sign noting it was a problem if it was. However, I doubt that water pressure is such a general issue because I don't remember people mentioning it. Anyway, I am not being mean-spirited about Southernmost on the Beach. I get why people like it, but in addition to this somewhat minor problem, it was not our style. Let me rephrase, it probably would have suited my in-laws, but my husband and I are much lower key and thrifty (or cheap). While we did pay for a partial ocean view and I was aware that it would be very 'partial', it was unsatisfying to pay for a hotel right on the beach and have this sad sideways view. Plus, we were at the end farthest from from the ocean in one of the close buildings. To us, there was nothing classically 'Key West' about this place. It was clean and lovely and pleasant, but it was also very new and slightly corporate feeling. We really enjoyed Key West, but when we return, we will look for somewhere a little more laid back, a little less party and with a bigger shaded porch with or without a view or AC.

Reviews.Title: “Southermost Hotel was Awesome! Thanks Boomer, Heather, and James!”
Reviews.Author: steveandjulie44881
Reviews.Content: We had an absolute blast on our trip staying at the Southernmost Hotel in Key West! The pool and atmosphere were great, and having the beach right there was convenient and made it feel like we had it all in one place! Boomer was great with the pool side games and wine tasting, Heather was super nice and fun to talk to, and James was quick at the bar making sure we didn't get too thristy! We will come back to this hotel, really enjoyed the location, amentities, and food! Right on Duval, a quick walk to the action!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location, Perfect hotel”
Reviews.Author: dmlane23
Reviews.Content: I visited the Southernmost last year with my boyfriend, the hotel was a the far end of Duval, far enough away from all the noise but a close enough walk to get to everything. We had one of the Ocean Front Balcony rooms and it was the perfect setting. So perfect that we are going back there in May to say our I DO's. I would highly recommend this hotel to anyone that is looking for a vacation where they can relax, sight-see or party. The staff is very welcoming and the hotel is very clean. I love the Southernmost on the Beach and cannot wait to get married there!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent - Couldn't ask for better”
Reviews.Author: dvinnj
Reviews.Content: I just returned from SMHOB. My wife and I went for our 20th anniversary. First time to Key West and am very happy we chose this hotel. I can't think of anything negative thing to say. Staff was very friendly and helpful, from the front desk to the bartenders to the bellhop to the housekeeping. Both concierges were excellent. Great recommendations, very helpful in reserving activities and very patient with questions. We had an oceanfront king room. Very clean (almost new), bed was very comfy, view was great. Bathrooms were roomy, clean and a great shower. Pool got a little crowded in the afternoon and it was hot so we wanted shade which wasn't always easy to find, but there are other options such as the lounge chairs by the beach/water or under the overhang at the bar. The location is perfect - close enough to the 'action' on the other end of Duval and walking distance to most restaurants, but far enough so that it didn't encroach on the peacefulness at night. We didn't have a car and other than to/from the airport only needed to get a taxi once It's not the cheapest hotel on Key West but you get what you pay for, and this was worth every penny. Would definitely return.

Reviews.Title: “Our new favorite Key West Resort”
Reviews.Author: Hpychk
Reviews.Content: This was a our first stay at this resort. We lived in FL Keys for many years and have stayed at many locations. This is a first class resort and will now be the only place we stay when we return. There are 3 affiliated hotels: Southernmost on the Beach, Southernmost Hotel which is across the street, and La Mer /Dewey B&B. We stayed in oceanfront room, 538, at Southernmost on the beach. You can use the amenities at each facility. Our room was delightful, very newly upgraded, perfect bed, perfect views, good size fridge. And I loved the eco-friendly toiletries from BeeKind. The bartenders made very good drinks, typical hotel prices. We had bkfst at the restaurant and it was very reasonable, very fresh, very good service. You can get whatever kind of bike/scooter rental you need as well. They also have their own parking, in fact, covered. Many of the resorts charge you extra for parking and many places parking is extremely difficult. There are 2 pools, jacuzzi, small beach, and their own sunning pier that also enters the water for snorkeling/swimming. Key West is not known for it's beaches so those that are disappointed with this aspect should read a bit more about the island. It's a bit of a hike if you want to get down to Mallory Square, etc, It's a quieter section of town, there's a market across the street. And if you rent a bike or scooter, the island is yours. They have activities going on at the resort daily. You can be as integrated with the activities or be away from them. Many different options for sunning, shading, relaxing, playing. All amenities, personnel, food, etc were outstanding. The weekend price was a bit steep but if you can stay during the week, this is a bargain for an Oceanfront room for less than $300 a night.

Reviews.Title: “Great room but thats about it”
Reviews.Author: MaxC74
Reviews.Content: Spent a week at this hotel. Beautiful (and recently refurbished) room, great view of the sea, very comfortable night's sleep but I don't think it's somewhere I would stay again. Service was okay - we had a very long drive down from Miami (on vacation from London, UK) driving through Tropical Storm Nicole. Check-in was easy although we were surprised that there was no offer to help us with our car or luggage. This hotel is okay but I don't think there's as much personal service/attention that you'd expect of a hotel at this price point. Two areas that disappoint. First - no mention of ongoing renovation works, which didn't create much noise but it would have been courteous to have been told about this at checkin. Likewise - there were a couple of wedding parties which meant that access to the only restaurant (Southernmost Cafe on the Beach) was restricted at times. Once again, a little warning beforehand would have been nice. We didn't special at this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “A little overrated”
Reviews.Author: Reginald666
Reviews.Content: I picked the hotel based on trip advisor ratings for Key West hotels. Although nice, I thought the hotel was somewhat overated. Room was somewhat small, although clearly new and cleanly maintained. The bathroom did not have a vanity to put toletries on, and we ultimately put a suitcase valet in the bathroom. We had a partial view of the pool/ocean and part of the parking lot. Finally, the HVAC system was noisy and worked only when a key was inserted in a slot by the door - the hotel seems obsessed with being green (my experience is that "green" usually really means more "green" in the pocket of the hotel owner) between the HVAC system and paper shampoo bottles,etc. Staff was very helpful and friendly, although we did not have much interaction. One of the best parts is that parking is free and the ground floor was parking so we could literally park underneath our room which was very convenient. Pool and beaches were very nice. Nice hotel, but not quite deserving the high ratings (and price) I had seen on trip advisor

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location, lovely room and fantastic barman (Kevin)”
Reviews.Author: k3rpy
Reviews.Content: Hotel was amazing and situated right on the beach. South beach is small but has sunloungers and umbrellas - loungers free to residents. Hotel ppol fantastic and the pool bar has a great atmosphere - be sure to ask for Kevin - very very friendly barman will make you feel very welcome - and he makes the best margheritas!!! Rooms are very spacious and the beds are so comfortable!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Tranquility, just off Duval”
Reviews.Author: BigAlCumbria
Reviews.Content: This was our third visit since 2008, we splashed out this time on an ocean front room, rather than the ocean view we'd had previously. This room is as nice as the others, but even bigger, with a great bed, a fridge, individual aircon and ceiling fan (which can actually make the room too cold), the bathroom and shower are fantastic - the biggest I've found at any hotel. The room also has a large "L" shaped wrap-around balcony, with chairs, tables and sun-loungers if you don't want to go down to the pool or beach. The view from the room/balcony is great, you're right over the hotel's private man-made beach and only about 20 feet from the sea, which is what you see from the bed - lovely. They have free internet access and car parking, a lot of which is conveniently in the shade right under the rooms. One thing to be aware of is that the style of the buildings is a bit like a motel, with access to all the rooms from external areas and walkways rather than the more conventional inside corridor. This wasn't a problem at all and we never felt exposed or unsafe. The restaurant/beach cafe is on the natural beach on the west side of the property, we used it every day and found it to be really nice and reasonably priced. There is a concierge in the lobby to help out with things to do and activities every day at the pool/bar. We tended to just walk up to the busier end of Duval Street when we wanted some nightlife, which takes about 15-20 minutes, although there are plenty of lazier options, but mostly we were very happy with the relaxed quietness of the SOTB. My only minor issue is the same as the cheaper rooms, the balconies would benefit from some screening between adjacent rooms to make them a bit more private.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel!”
Reviews.Author: rocks_and_sky
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Southernmost on the Beach for 4 nights in early October. It was part of our first "empty nest" trip. We picked the hotel based in part on Tripadvisor reviews and wanted to share our experience. We had one of the oceanfront rooms (#538) and that was probably one of the reasons why we loved the hotel so much. The room was beautiful, with windows on two walls, nicely designed and decorated and with a large (but not private) balcony. We enjoyed the pool and the relaxed atmosphere of the hotel in general (we were there during the slower season). The staff was all very friendly and helpful, from Boomer the activities director, Heather, the pool drink waitress, Michael at the front desk, Julie the concierge and Rich who taught "beer school" at the pool. We never had any doubt that we were the customer and that they were there to keep us happy and satisfied. The cafe on the beach was very convenient, a better location for that tropical feeling than any other restaurant on Key West, and reasonably priced and good. The only thing to consider is that the hotel is at the far south end of Duval. This is good or bad, depending on what you want: it is quieter, but a longer (approx. 10-15 minutes) walk to the action on the far north end of Duval. They were just finishing renovation of the rooms on the west side of the original building while we there. Overall, there were no negatives of any kind; it was one of the best hotel stays we have had anywhere.

Reviews.Title: “We will be back. It's alot closer than Hawaii!”
Reviews.Author: rufusluther
Reviews.Content: Over the last 8 years we've been going to Hawaii which we love except for the flight. Approx. 9 hours from Chicago. This year I decided on the Keys and based on recommendations I picked the "Southernmost on the Beach". A great choice. The rooms were super as was the view. The price was right and close enough to any kind of action you need. Great service, pool activities, food(at the beach restaurant)was great. Room was very clean and all employees were very friendly and helpful. We will definitely be back.

Reviews.Title: “A fabulously beautiful spot near all the great haunts but far enough away to be peaceful.”
Reviews.Author: bunnybunbun22
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the Southern-most room in the Southernmost on the Beach. The room was absolutely lovely. We had a little private outside area looking out on the ocean. The bed was the most wonderful bed with soft linens and plenty of pillows to chose from. The bathroom was luxurious. The service was excellent - everyone was helpful and friendly. The pool is awesome and having the restaurant right across the way was great for breakfast everyday. Now here is a petty thing - there was a guy singing on the beach next to the pool and he was really annoying and truly did disturb the peaceful feeling. It was hard to read or converse. That is the one thing I would change if given a chance. We loved being able to walk Duval Street and then come back to the calm of the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Just what we needed in the Keys”
Reviews.Author: Mialane
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Southernmost on the Beach for 2 nights and would go back. -The Hotel was very nice and the grounds were beautiful. -The room was nicely decorated, clean with nice beds. The balcony was a nice touch as well. -We enjoyed the beach bar and enjoyed happy hour there each day. -The beach area was nice considering beaches are hard to come by in the area. -We rented the waverunners next door and had a great time running around in the the ocean. -The hotel was within walking distance of all the action, yet far enough away from the hustle and bustle. I would definately return to the Keys and to Southernmost.

Reviews.Title: “beautiful hotel”
Reviews.Author: pugmom819
Reviews.Content: I picked Southernmost on the Beach for our Key West vacation based mostly on trip advisor reviews. It is a gorgeous hotel, VERY clean, and very nice landscaping. The beach at the hotel is very nice and the pier is a wonderful place to watch the fabulous Key West sunsets. The rooms are large, beds are very comfortable, the shower is ENORMOUS, and my son loved the big t.v. We took our laptop and had absolutely no problems with connectivity to the internet. The hotel is on the quiet end of Duval St. and it is not a bad walk to all the activity, but I will admit, we took a taxi twice, because after a week, we tired of the walk. There is a refrigerator in the room and if you want to keep snacks or drinks in the room, my advice would be to take a taxi and pick a few things up at Publix or take the short walk to Truman St. to the CVS. The market across the street is outrageous and the snacks we bought were stale. The hotel employees that I encountered were all friendly and I very much enjoyed my stay at Southernmost on the Beach.

Reviews.Title: “Couldn't be more pleased...great ideas included!”
Reviews.Author: clang664
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at Southernmost on the Beach for our honeymoon in August 2010. Our stay was incredible. Our room was exquisite...the only issue we had was a shower door which was fixed within 20 minutes of reporting it to the front desk!!! Since we arrived early (approx. 12:00...check-in was about 3:00), our first experience was with Omar. He took our bags with a cheerful demeanor, and was equally as pleasant whe he DELIVERED THEM to our room. Our room was small, but exquisite (and our understanding was that this room was to be remodeled shortly). Tile floors, King-size bed, woodwork cabinets for closets & TV, and an oversized shower. The BEST part? A hammock bordering the beach, no more than 15 feet from our door...perfect for dozing off together after an evening on Duvall/at the Tiki Bar. Boomer (event coordinator) was great. He gave us the low-down on local "can't miss" outings, and his snorkling school was incredibly fun - no need to go elsewhere for wildlife...just head to the pier and see many fish (bring a waterproof camera!). This hotel has a fantastic "semi-private" beach!!! As we were on our honeymoon, I will say that the hotel took great care of us on our final night...if you're there on a special event, let the front-desk know! We just wish we'd have spent more time AT the hotel, enjoying their daily activities. Events that are NOT to be missed: *Wine School *Color-changing pool at night *Boomer's Scuba school (if not available, ask the front desk) *Beach (Tiki) bar...fantastic food and beverages! This Hotel had incredible events planned for EVERY afternoon...truly a destination in itself!!! My wife and I are already saving our spare change for our return trip (we started the very day we returned)!!! Tips for Key West (we wish we'd have known sooner) 1. Rent a bike from the concierge. Key West is small enough to walk, but biking makes it SOOO much easier!!! 2. Don't miss the "ORIGINAL ghost tours" (there are many...go for the original!!!). The concierge can book tickets for this as well. 3. When booking other tours, look up Jason on Duvall St (runs a cruise/outing booking agency with cigar shop). He was incredibly helpful! 4. Take full advantage of the "on-premises" activities. Our snorkling on-site was comparable to what we saw in the Dry Tortugas (70 miles away...a 2+hour cruise!!!) In all, we are already planning our return trip! It broke our hearts to leave!!! Chris & Ashley

Reviews.Title: “Best hotel I have stayed in!”
Reviews.Author: nebody2001
Reviews.Content: Having stayed in a pretty awesome hotel while in Miami (Fountainbleu) I didn't think that a hotel in Key West could beat it - but it did hands down! Stayed in B Block; had a view of the ocean :) First entry into room... wow massive room comfy bed and huge bathroom. Was so impressed I even took pics of the room! Stayed for two nights and slept the best here! Beach wasn't massive but was still good! Weather was a bit changable but still good! Nightlife is fantastic - hotel close but not too close to nightlife! Overall the best hotel I stayed at in Florida :D

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel and Location”
Reviews.Author: triplet7
Reviews.Content: This was a wonderful hotel. The hotel staff was very friendly and accomodating. The rooms were clean and spacious. The location was great. It was a bit of a walk to Duvall street and all the attractions. We liked being in a quiet part of the Key yet close enough to walk to the bars and restaurants. The pool and beach were very nice and the bar staff was superb. IWe traveled with other couples and we all had a great time. I would highly recommend this hotel!!

Reviews.Title: “The place to stay in Key West!”
Reviews.Author: GaryL60
Reviews.Content: This was our second stay at this hotel and it was even more enjoyable than the first. The staff is extremely nice and will try to accomodate almost any reasonable request. Our room was first class and included a king-size bed, large flat screen TV, refrigerator, and a spacious bathroom. We had a short walk to the pool or the beach, both of which had plenty of comforts, including lounge chairs, two bars , and a restaurant that serves excellent food. Don't miss "happy hour" from 4:00 to 7:00 P.M. daily. The hotel is also within walking distance of many of Key West's shopping areas and restaurants. Bikes, mopeds or electric cars are also convenient for those who don't want to walk or take a taxi. We're already looking forward to our next visit.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Location, Sleepy town though!”
Reviews.Author: dannopower
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Southernmost on the beach during our honeymoon from Australia in January. Hotel is excellent, we booked a water view room on the top floor and the sunrise from your balcony is post card perfect. Hotel was expensive, and the town was quite boring at that time of year, but the hotel was excellent. The pool and bar area would be awesome in summer, where you can swap between beach and pool at your leisure.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful facility, great location, perfect getaway on the ocean”
Reviews.Author: tvchip
Reviews.Content: We stayed 4 nights in Room 640, one of the oceanfront suites. It was expensive (hence my 3-star rating for value), but it was a great experience nonetheless. Our room was beautifully appointed, quite large, with a large wrap-around deck. Service at this hotel was first-rate. Everyone we met was friendly and helpful. If you drive to Key West and stay at this hotel, I recommend you park your car and rent either a bicycle or a scooter. It's much easier to get up/down crowded Duval Street and Old Town Key West with a 2-wheeler. Breakfast at the on-site restaurant was very tasty and quite reasonable. We didn't have lunch or dinner here, but the menu prices looked quite reasonable for those meals too. The pool and beach areas are quite sufficient.

Reviews.Title: “So happy we picked this one!”
Reviews.Author: 480sparky
Reviews.Content: We drove to Key West on Labor day as a birthday getaway for a 3 night stay. Check-in was quick and informative. Parking was no problem, there is even parking under the building to keep the car cool. We had a partial ocean view room on the 3rd floor. It was so nice I wish I could live there! The room was large, hard wood flooring, huge bathroom with walkin shower, large balcony, and everything was immaculate. The cafe bar offered 3 for 3, which was happy hour from 4 to 7 where certain drinks and food was only $3 each! Great rum runners! The pool was nice and cold, and the bar staff was always available for any needs. Only thing I didn't like was how many smokers were constantly at the pool. Not fun when the pool chairs are really close together. The location of the hotel is on the opposite end of the party area, so it is nice and quiet, but if you want the bar scene it is only a short walk or ride away. I hope to stay here again in the future!

Reviews.Title: “If carlsberg made hotels......”
Reviews.Author: lilly_white_tourist
Reviews.Content: By far the nicest hotel in Key west. The staff couldn't be more helpful, the location is right on Duval Street (opposite end to Mallory Sq.) but that's only a 20min walk / 5 min drive! We arrived and our room wasn't ready, no hassle to us but they gave us vouchers for free cocktails at the bar! The room we were in was in the new section and they were unreal! You could have a party in the shower alone! it was huge! A nice big balcony on it too with chairs and a lovely view of the opposite beach. Parking is ample, lots of room and it's sheltered for the most part so if you are going to be driving your car, it won't be like an oven when you open it. Maid service every day, a fridge in the room (this is actually something I look for in the states) The grounds are huge and there is so much to see there. They have hammocks down by the beach and there is nothing better than watching a lightening storm while lounging around in one of these with a cold beer! :) Duval street is buzzing all day and night, lots of pubs / clubs. We went to Irish Kevins....great pub but the band (if that's what you'd call them) were ridiculous. Didn't know any irish songs and attempted the irish rover.....but with their own words?? A few drinking games on stage that would make you think you're in Ibiza - one being t*ts for tequilla. two girls got up to play that and although he tried a few times to get more people, no-one was interested. My favourite part of the hotel was not having to parade through the lobby at x o'clock in the morning after a load of drink, the rooms are all completely separate. They are in their own buildings and you can access them through the carpark so it was really great! I can't wait to go back to Key West, and although the Southernmost is a bit pricey, it's well worth every penny! The beds are the best i've come across. And although it's a hotel for couples, it has the quiet element to it, but also the party element. It really is fantastic and I can't speak highly enough of it.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: chrisweger
Reviews.Content: Fantastic hotel directly at the beach with a small private beach and several outdoor pools. Had a fantastic room, the bathroom was amazingly huge with state-of-the-art shower and all. Good location, at the quiet end of Key West but withing a 10 minutes walk to the main street with restaurants and bars, night life and all. Would definately stay there again. Staff was helpfull in recommending what to do and organised a snorkel trip for us.

Reviews.Title: “Cant wait to stay there again!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Kandsm
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 5 days and 4 nights!!! It was awesome!! It is located in a quiet area of town, but within walking distance of everything!! Loved the pool bar and service!! The drinks were great!! The food at the beach cafe was delicious and reasonably priced. We can't wait to go back next year!!

Reviews.Title: “Can't Say Enough!!”
Reviews.Author: lsuboy
Reviews.Content: In short I would agree with all of the previous excellent reviews and can't say enough about how wonderful the hotel and staff are. We stayed here for the third time this August on our 25th anniversary trip. We were upgraded to the king suite (room 523) and absolutely loved it. The front desk staff is great and like others wrote Boomer was a great asset as activities director. He went out of his way to do whatever he could for us. The free wine tasting school was very enjoyable and wonderfully conducted by Cabe. We did miss seeing Rhonda (she was on vacation) at the bar but were well taken care of in her absence. Breakfast at the beachside cafe is a fantastic way to start your day and Cynthia makes it even more so. We can't wait to get back! If you are looking for a great beach or a uncrowded place to see the sunset be sure to go to Fort Zachary Taylor State Park. There is a small fee to enter but you can come and go all day. White sand and blue water!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel! Good service, nice pool and restaurant”
Reviews.Author: Laris_C
Reviews.Content: We stayed there for 5 days to enjoy sun, sand and ocean. It was great, there are enough beds around the pool if you want to enjoy some swimming, but you can also relax at the other points of the resort with the best view over the ocean. The service at the pool is great (best cocktails in town!) and they do a lot of activities everey day.

Reviews.Title: “Nice, but not for the price”
Reviews.Author: travel_ladybug16
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I recently stayed at this hotel. We stayed in one of the brand new suites called the "ocean front" view. The room was very beautiful and the view was spectacular. The price of the room was what we expected for a room of that nature. However, we were very shocked to find that the hotel DOES NOT HAVE ROOM SERVICE. One of the things we look forward to most while on vacation was not offered at such an expensive hotel and this was very disappointing. We also wanted to have a bottle of champagne one night, so we decided to see if we could buy one from the bar. They told us we could not and that we needed to walk five blocks to the nearest liquor store to get one. Again, this is very shocking coming from a hotel that is so pricey. Overall, the hotel is very lovely and has a great view, but as far as ammenitites and accomadation to guests, not so good. I would not stay at this hotel again when there are other hotels equally if not nicer for the same price with a little bit more guest service.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, amazing view and quiet location”
Reviews.Author: RunnerScott
Reviews.Content: Amazing view from room with a balcony overlooking the beach and ocean. On the opposite end of Duval street from all of the bars and nightlife so very quiet and peaceful. Great dining onsite at the hotel cafe. Good food for great price. Expensive room, but worth the money.

Reviews.Title: “Best hotel with resort feel near all attractions”
Reviews.Author: OntarioFamilyfun
Reviews.Content: We loved our stay when we were there in early August 2010! The staff is very attentive and we were happy to meet Omar! The rooms are extremely clean and comfortable, great AC. We stayed in 542 in A building and loved it! We had a distant view of the ocean -- beautiful! The location is perfect -- we never used our car once we parked it! We did rent an electric car to roam around town on the side streets and went on an Old Trolley tour -- very worth it! The weather was amazing, very hot -- so we went in the ocean often. The beach is not superb because of the seaweed that comes in even though they drag the beach every morning. We found that going down to the ocean by the staircase off the pier was a better idea. We went to the pool, also great for families -- lots of kids jumping in and having fun. The pool area was mostly rather crowded and it would be nice if they had a pool reserved for adults like they had at resort in Key Largo. The Cafe on the premises is the best for sure!!! We ate there often and just kept coming back! The food was excellent, even locals eat there! The prices are really, really reasonable! Great selection and superb setting! This is a draw for sure. We would definitely stay there again and are looking forward to going back!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Author: wfudd
Reviews.Content: Without getting into too much detail, this place was great. Located close enough to the excitement but far enough to avoid all the hoopla at night. Had an oceanfront room (in the B unit). Pool was great, staff was great, reception was great, the beach area was an unexpected feature. Would certainly recommend.

Reviews.Title: “lovely and wonderful.”
Reviews.Author: luvsunnydays
Reviews.Content: The cleanest hotel and a great pool with a lovely bar.But yet nice and quite at night but close to all the action.

Reviews.Title: “Wedding on the Beach, a great experience at a Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: ckgosch
Reviews.Content: We had our wedding on the Beach at the Southernmost in June. I can't say enough how much fun our families had and how great the Hotel and it's staff were. Rooms were great, beach is right there, staff was very friendly and went out of their way to make sure everyone had a great time and were taken care of. We'll be going back for a visit again sometime soon.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful views, gorgeous rooms”
Reviews.Author: puppyjake
Reviews.Content: After living in Miami for nearly 2 years my husband and i finally made our first trip all the way down to Key West - we had never made it further than IslaMorada before so we were excited to do the famous drive and have a weekend in Key West. Getting there was easy, if slow enough, (the road works were out in full force, so it was 1 lane all the way - and up to Marathon the traffic was a total pain - but once we got past Marathon things got easier and faster and the bridges were great), and the hotel was so very easy to find. Check in was a breeze - they has all the keys and welcome packet waiting for us - so it literally took 2 mins, the staff were very friendly. We booked an Oceanfront room - and when they say Oceanfront - they really mean it - you could sit in bed and just see the Ocean - now thats my kind of view! Our room was a "new" room - and it was absolutely lovely - amazingly comfy bed, great plasma TV, fab air conditioning, lovely large bathroom, wet bar area with a mini fridge, coffee facilities and a blender! btw.....they are closing the original building shortly to renovate those rooms so that they are up to the standard of the new rooms. I spent a lot of time on our balcony - reading and looked out to see - if i could change one thing about this hotel it would be to have a little more privacy between balconies - but i guess they don't want to take away from the view at all. The pool was lovely (you also have the use of 2 other pools - but we never made it to those) - they had live music by the pool on Friday and Saturday, we actually spent most of our time on the pier - i loved sitting on there surrounded by the water and then you can go down the steps straight into the ocean - so very relaxing and quiet on the pier. We had breakfast at the restaurant on the beach - which was great and good value and then we had lunch at the pool bar - also great and decently priced. The walk down Duval was OK - it was very hot (well it is august) - so i admit to wimping out and getting a rickshaw (fun but v. expensive - $30!) and a cab another (only $7). We were there for lobsterfest - so on saturday night they close off the bottom blocks of Duval and there are lots of stalls and lobster grilling going on with live music - all the restaurants take place in it so its a great way to sample different lobster recipes. If we make it back down to Key West we would definitely stay at the Sothernmost on the beach again - yes its a little walk to Mallory Sqaure and the really busy end of Duval - but thats why i like it - its nowhere near as crowded at this end and the hotels seems a lot closer together down the other end.

Reviews.Title: “Truly an All Inclusive Stay”
Reviews.Author: DiamondPerez
Reviews.Content: The hotel is kept clean, rooms are spacious, pool and sunning area were relaxing. Activities coordinated by the pool were fun and well organized. All staff, from ground person to front desk clerk, were courteous and extremely friendly. They were willing to assist in any way whether it was their responsibility or not. It felt as if I have always vacationed there. Location is perfect- on the beach but only 1 block from the main road.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful accommodations w/ the best spot to soak up the sun on Key West!”
Reviews.Author: agnewton
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed at Southernmost on the Beach and loved it! We split our stay between this hotel and the Marriott Beachside hotel, and were surprisingly sad to leave Southernmost for the larger resort. The Good: -Location - right near Duval but at the 'quiet' end. You can walk to Mallory Square in about 30-45 mins -Charming, quaint, and homey -The beds!! We have a heavenly bed (westin's brand) in our house. This bed was comparable and definitely better than the Marriott's. Super comfy!!! -The best part of the hotel is the 'beach' area tucked in the back. It's not an actual beach (although there is one right next door). This is more of an area they have filled with sand, which has palm trees, hammocks, beach chairs and a fabulous pier you can lay out on. While the pool is nice, it's more crowded and louder/active. This area is so relaxing and the view of the ocean is perfect! It definitely made the stay feel more tropical lounging here versus the pool. We came back to lay out here even after we had moved on to the Marriott. -The pool bar drinks and food are both nice -The decor of the updated rooms is attractive and enjoyable -Staff is super friendly/helpful -It has a very quaint feel to it, unlike larger hotels. It is not as fancy or commanding, but there is something really nice about that while staying in Key West I usually go for swanky and bigger is usually better for me. However this place was just right! I would absolutely stay here again. While the Marriott was very nice and I would also highly recommend staying there as well, there is something so charming and relaxing about this hotel that would keep me coming back! We requested a high floor and they gave us an upgrade to an oceanview. We stayed in room 657 which was wonderful!

Reviews.Title: “UNBELIEVEABLE!!!”
Reviews.Author: wwillsjr
Reviews.Content: It was great from check in. From the wonderful personalities at the front desk to the Southernmost Beach Cafe. The rooms were fabulous they spared no expense in the quality of furniture and materials that were put into these wonderful rooms. We had a great time and we will be returning for many years to come!!!

Reviews.Title: “Loud, but room and view were decent”
Reviews.Author: loveoutdoors5
Reviews.Content: We are currently staying at the Southernmost on the Beach right now. Nice clean room. Good view of ocean and "beach." However, we were looking for some peace and quiet, and chose this place, since this was the purported "quiet" side of Duval. We saw some reviews that suggested this was the case. WRONG! Problem is, during the day, they have some guys singing karoake from noon till about 9 or 10p. REAL LOUD. If you like the music they play - great. If you don't, well you're out of luck. You have to go elsewhere. We've been to Key West at least 10 times, and we usually stay at some nice B&Bs. But decided to try this place as something different. Should have stuck with the B&Bs.

Reviews.Title: “Great spot”
Reviews.Author: sunshineboltie
Reviews.Content: I am very picky about where I stay on a vacation and being on the water is very important to me. I realize there aren't a lot of beaches on Key West, but this did have a water frontage, so I booked it. It was very nice, clean, comfy beds, nice breezes with door open. We were in the newer building, second floor and it was literally a few feet back from the water. There is no walking beach here, be sure to know that, but it is nice just the same. The location is on the quieter end of the action. It was a walk to the end of Duvall street, but there are taxis if you need. I would stay here again for sure. I thought the room was a bit pricey, but my husband and I both enjoyed our stay. PS. The wifi was spotty here.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location and service”
Reviews.Author: SaoTomeTripper
Reviews.Content: We drove down for the weekend to celebrate my wife's birthday and booked on line. Wally at the front desk was friendly and helpful. We were fortunate enough to get a complimentary upgrade to a suite. SOTB is just what you might expect from a four star beach hotel - clean, bright, service oriented with lots of young people baring their breasts to the sun. Lots of action at the pool with a daily band or musician anyway, but quiet and romantic in the evening.

Reviews.Title: “Wouldn't stay anywhere else in Key West!”
Reviews.Author: bestjones
Reviews.Content: This is our second stay in the new property and my husband and i could not be more pleased! Staff is super friendly and the room immaculately clean. Bartender Rich was great and restaurant food was great. We love the "quiet" end of Duval and enjoyed the pool area and beach access. Ambrosia sushi restaurant next door is fantastic! Everything about Southernmost exceeds expectations.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect perfect and perfect”
Reviews.Author: Orion777
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here to relax after business meetings up in West Palm Beach and before heading back home to Illinois. First let me state that there is a safe in the room, so if you have any valuables - you can lock them up and not leave them laying around. TIP: The balconies connect so it is best to be sure to keep your balcony door locked or your neighbor can walk right in. This hotel is in a perfect location - right across the street from the hop on/hop off trolley. They also have a conceirge at this hotel and she booked all of our activities for us. The restaurant is right on the beach and there are a couple of bars on the property and a swimming pool. The lobster benedict for breakfast is lovely. The bathroom is huge. And if you like a 'green' hotel - this one is for you. They are very trendy towards going green. The beds are wonderful. Limited cable channels (about 50) but who cares, right? You really are in the room just to sleep. There is a spa which is great also. There is something for everyone at this hotel. Just make sure you stay at 'Southern Most Hotel on the beach'. There is one with a similar name across the street which is not on the beach - Owned by the same owner. My husband loved this hotel and its location so much that we are going back this winter! Can't wait! Dexter at the front desk was so very helpful, as were all of the employees. A few tips: 1. if you go on any of the fishing boats, take dramamine first. The waves were bouncy and half of the people on board our boat were sea sick and throwing up the whole time, including me. Everyone who wanted to fish though, all caught fish. 2. we got ripped off at a t-shirt shop. Here is a tip - shop on upper Duval, not lower Duval where all of the cruise ships come in. The prices vary dramatically! Also at alot of the shops, nothing is marked - and they tell you one price and ring up another price, so shop at stores that have prices marked on the goods. 3. You can walk from one end of Duval St. to the other, so if you fly into Key West, there is no need to rent a car. There are bicycles and scooters for rent all over the island if you don't feel like walking, plus the trolley. However, I am in my 50's and kind of out of shape and I walked all over and never got tired. We were in a rental car from Miami and parked the car and never drove it again until we left. 4. For souvenirs at honest prices, I like 430 Duval St. (can't remember the name but the address is on my receipt) - Its a nice little gift shop with all kinds of things for under $10. (The same items are about 50 bucks further down the street!) All in all, Key West is great, and this hotel made our stay absolutely perfect. You could not ask for a better location.

Reviews.Title: “Can't Wait To Stay Here Again!!!”
Reviews.Author: MeMeMom
Reviews.Content: LOVE this place and I'm not easily impressed. The concierge was great, the staff was friendly, and the activities director was awesome! The rooms were clean and even the towels were nice. There is also tons of storage in the room (for a hotel) which was awesome. My son took a snorkeling class with Boomer in the pool and then the concierge hooked us up with a snorkeling trip where we could also see the Dolphins. He loved it all and we couldn't be more thrilled. She also helped us locate museums and a fishing charter. We had such a great time and can't wait to go back. We will definitely be staying at the Southernmost On The Beach again. Our room faced the ocean, which we really enjoyed. At night we listened to the waves...just doesn't get much better. Have already recommended this hotel to some, 2 of whom have stayed there in the past and loved it. We honestly can't wait to go back.

Reviews.Title: “Exceptional Hospitality and Simple Quality”
Reviews.Author: JBlakeM
Reviews.Content: I had a special rate, so I can't comment on the value, but this looked like the best place on the island. Everything was so clean, so convenient, so well kept, and the staff was perfectly friendly and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “A good stay - until our room was burgled....”
Reviews.Author: GregandClare
Reviews.Content: A two night trip to Southernmost on the Beach was the final leg of our 10 day trip to Florida. A great location to finish our holiday...until the last night when we returned from a wonderful dinner - The Hot Tin Roof, well worth a visit - to find our room had been burgled. Strangely there was no forced entry and they only stole a Blackberry and my sunglasses, leaving behind a laptop and other valuables. This is bad enough but the service and aftercare we received from the hotel was nothing short of appalling. We left and returned to the UK with the promise they would resolve the issue, but the issue is unresolved and a month later. This hotel has a great location and the rooms are good. But its motel-style layout means anyone can access the grounds and corridors thus the security is poor (they don't even have cctv). My advice is to stay next door at the Santa Maria Suites or the Reach Resort who hopefully offer better security and treat their customers with a little more respect. I'd be interested to hear if anyone else has had a similar experience. Enjoy Key West, it's great.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location, great hotel”
Reviews.Author: JamesSouthAfrica75
Reviews.Content: We spent three nights at the hotel. The position was perfect and exactly what we were looking for - right on the sea in a quiet part of town, but within walking distance (roughly 15 minutes) of the centre of things. Check-in was efficient and friendly. The room was on the second floor, very clean, modern, nicely furnished and as advertised. We enjoyed the hotel's restaurant so much that we ate breakfast and dinner there each day. It is right on the beach and just a very short walk across from the hotel. The food was excellent and fairly priced and the positioning (looking out to the water) fantastic. Service was friendly and excellent. We spent two afternoons at the pool area, although most loungers are spoken for early on so you need a bit of luck to find four available. The beach itself was fine, but as you probably know, you don't come to Key West for its beaches and we preferred to stick with the pool. My wife, a light sleeper, found the air conditioning very noisy (next time I'll bring her some ear plugs!). Check-out was as efficient as check in. In conclusion, we thought the hotel was fantastic and we would definitely stay there again when in Key West.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly, lovely facilities and great location”
Reviews.Author: Isobel24
Reviews.Content: Really enjoyed a couple of nights at this hotel. The staff were all very welcoming and friendly (welcome contrast to aloof Miami!). The location is gorgeous - particularly the beach bar which has a very good happy hour (actually 3 hours!) every day and lovely food. Overall it isn't cheap (even with the happy hour!) but the rooms and facilites were of a high standard. The organised entertainment was a bit cheesy but the staff really put the effort into it, so in the end they won us over!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location & accomodation, loved it!!”
Reviews.Author: Penelope030
Reviews.Content: My husband & came from the UK to celebrate our 3rd year wedding anniversary & the long flight was most definately worth every minute. Stayed in one of the new deluxe rooms, very clean, new & modern, massive bed, shower etc. Location spot on, right on the beach & right at the most southern point of USA. Just at the quiet end of Duval Street so just a short walk from the busy bars/restaurants. The staff were very friendly & extremely helpful. We spent everyday on the beach where the beach guy came round with ice cold flannels, ice lollies & frozen pineapple chunks to cool you down. Never experienced frozen flannels or fruit before, what a fantastic idea, something that European beaches should introduce!! The Southernmost cafe on the beach did fantastic food all day, ate there quite a lot. First time I tried Key Lime pie, amazing!!
