Loved the laid back approach to life on the island & everyone so friendly. The famous sunset boat cruise is well worth doing, its a must to do!! We arranged via the hotel. Only one downside for me & that was the humidity on the island, had to ditch the heels as its baking even at night its roasting so be warned. Loose clothing & flats all the way!! Thankfully most places have good aircon especially the hotel rooms. Could do with a few bars that play some commercial/dance music as most bars were guitar types but hey as they say when in Rome!! Would highly recommend KW & this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous place to stay! Everyone was friendly, attentive and helpful!”
Reviews.Author: bdfinkel
Reviews.Content: My husband and I took three couples with us to Key West to celebrate my 50th birthday. We could not have picked a better place to stay than Southernmost on the Beach! From the moment we arrived the staff was accomodating, helping us find the perfect rooms so we could all be together, the concierge, Julie recommended perfect restaurants each night, and the pool and bar were spectacular. The staff at the Southernmost Cafe always had a smile on and never said no to any special requests - unlike some of the restaurants we went to in town. We all loved staying at Southernmost on the Beach and look forward to our return. I'll recommend Southernmost on the Beach to everyone!!!

Reviews.Title: “Home away from home, only better!”
Reviews.Author: lighthouse1123
Reviews.Content: Southernmost on the Beach was fabulous! It was our "home away from home" for 4 nights, only better than home because housekeeping not only made the comfortable beds, but cleaned the room to perfection. No detail was left undone. Truly, one of the best hotels we have stayed in. The staff was indescribably friendly and everyone was willing to "go the extra mile" to satisfy our every whim. Conveniently located on Duval Street, which meant we parked our car in the covered garage and walked EVERY WHERE we went in Key West--all the way to Mallory Square 4 nights in a row. The private beach and pier are supplied with plenty of chairs and multiple pools meant we could change scenery every day, if we wanted to. If you're looking for a romantic get-away or a family-friendly place, look no further. We will definitely be booking this hotel again our next trip to Key West.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing hotel, amazing view, amazing vacation”
Reviews.Author: nurselindaky
Reviews.Content: The Southernmost hotel was amazing. The staff was very friendly and helpful. The rooms were very spacious and clean. My daughters really enjoyed participating in all of the pool activies. The activities director, Boomer, made our trip very enjoyable. He offered recommendations on where to eat, etc. They had a great time with all of the activities. The pool attendant was rather rude, she made some very rude comments to the guests. She weasn't very friendly. I cannot wait to go back! Overall, great hotel, I would highly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “An amazing hotel that is truly paradise”
Reviews.Author: hollyd25
Reviews.Content: Southermost on the beach was an amazing hotel. The rooms were very nice and clean and the hotel property was amazing. I vacationed with my mom and sister and our vacation could not have been any better. The hotel is right on the beach and the pool was amazing. The activities director, Boomer, done a fabulous job by organizing all of the activities. My sister and I participated in the snorkling school, which Boomer, who was a phenomenal instructor. He taught me things about snorkling that I did not know until I took the snorkling school class. We also participated in the juggling contest and the photography school. All the activities was very fun. We really enjoyed ourselves and I can honestly say this was by far the most relaxing vacation that I have ever had. The lady pool attendant was a bit snobish, wasn't very friendly to the guests at all. Too bad she wasn't more like Boomer who made us feel very welcomed. He also recommended things to do around Key West and places to eat. Our favorite place to eat was the Conch Republic Seafood. It was amazing. My favorite drink became the Key Lime Colada after this trip. There was also a restuarant on the property that we ate breakfast and lunch and it was pretty good and reasonable priced. Also, there was a bicyle shop across the street. We rented bikes for transportation, I would recommend this. It was fun and enjoyable. I would highly recommend this hotel, I will be back as soon as I can!! Be sure to ask for Boomer for recommendations and royalty treatment!

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyable stay.”
Reviews.Author: 1985dawg
Reviews.Content: Our room was very well-appointed. We had the upstairs corner room overlooking the main pool and the beach. Wish we could have used the balcony more, but the heat was oppressive. The staff was polite and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Best of Key WEST For Wheelchair bound vacationers!”
Reviews.Author: LARRYTALJ
Reviews.Content: This Hotel was an in a perfect location right on the southern most point of Key West. As a physically challenged traveler (wheelchair bound) I found the room & the grounds to be well manicured and perfectly accommodating with few to no barriers to deal with. Always cleaned and neat according to our schedule, not theirs! The bed was one of the most comfortable and luxurious I have ever slept in! The staff was excellent! Friendly and very attentive to even the most petty of request! The cafe on the beach was both affordable and of very high quality cuisine. A special thanks to Front desk attendants Dexter & A.J., bar tender Johnny B. and IT manager Duane! My stay was truly a week in paradise! Thank you all very much!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for active couples”
Reviews.Author: Glennforce
Reviews.Content: Stayed Memorial day weekend 2010 and first time ever to Key West. We selected this hotel based on trip advisor rating and reviews. We were not dissappointed! Perfect location on "quiet end" of Duval Street. Approx. 30min. stroll to Mallory Square. Old Town Trolly stop and scooter rentals directly across the street. Advice; pay close attention to condition report they show you before you take posession of scooter-I pointed out several scratches they missed, but $65 for all day rental was a good deal. Also, see "Johnnie B" at the Tiki Bar...makes the best mixed drinks in KW! Key Lime marguerita-YUM!

Reviews.Title: “SMOTB was spectacular”
Reviews.Author: Miech0319
Reviews.Content: I had my wedding at SMOTB on 5/29/10, I had a total of 30 guests. I live in Las Vegas and most of my family is from Philadelphia. None of us have ever been tothe Keys and everything was PERFECTION. I have not one complaint about SMOTB or Southernmost hotel. Every single staff member was helpful, curteous, nice and went out of their way for us. Boomer was FABULOUS, he is the activities director and he set up a special activity for me and my guests bc none of the scheduled ones fit into our schedule. Sammy the beach boy was the nicest guy ever, helping up with beach chairs, beach umbrellas, floats for the ocean and frozen pineapples and popsicles to beat the FL heat. The grounds and rooms were immactulate and gorgeous...no dirt, great views and we loved the private pier!!!! The Cafe on the beach had great food and great service!!! The Wedding....it was without doubt the BEST day of my life. Melissa the catering sales manager was so helpful throughtout my process and I did not have to worry about a THING the day of my wedding. The food was TO DIE FOR! Best lobster and steak ive ever had. I could go on and on. Location was fabulous too, close enough to the action of Duval but quiet as could be at night. Long story short, this is the PLACE to be in the Keys! My group will be back, thats for sure!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Away from hustle & bustle”
Reviews.Author: col61Sleaford
Reviews.Content: Very clean . Had partial ocean view room. Room had small fridge, plenty of wardrobe space. TV rather old fashioned ( not flatscreen). Towels could have been bigger. only ate at beach cafe once for breakfast which was very nice. Ate out at other times but that was our choice. had been advised from information centre that it would only take 5-10 mins to walk along Duval Street but found it was longer than that. A must do is Mallory Square to see the sunset. We would thoroughlly recommend Sunset Peir at the end of Duval Street. Staff very friendly. There was a wedding party on one night but not a problem for us. Would definitely recommend staying here.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: harrellrw
Reviews.Content: We go to Key West every year our 15 trip, We have stayed at all the 4 star resorts in Key West. none are better than Sothermost.Took our two kids and there husbands. They stayed at the Old Southernmost Hotel, We stayed on the beach because of cost. All the rooms were great. Southernmost on the Beach is better.3 nice pools, nice beach,great Cafe on The Beach. staff was great.They even printed our boarding pass for us when we left.Best thing about this place is that the price you pay is it. No resort fees, no parking fees, no internet fees.I like that at check out all you pay is what you expected to pay when you checked in. Great place go stay at Southernmost On The Beach you will not be sorry.Best location in Key West can walk everywhere, no need for Taxies.

Reviews.Title: “Our fantastic trip to Key West”
Reviews.Author: alfaromeoKent
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Southern Most Hotel on the Beach in Key West for 6 nights and loved it. The beach, pool and room were excellent and the food at the beach bar was a delight. It was Mother's day the day we left and had breakfast and they gave all the ladies a rose, which was very emotional. It is the quiet end of Duval Street, but walk half way up and there are very lively bars and restaurants and at the end of Duval Street is Mallory Square with street entertainers while you are watching the sun go down. Ernest Hemingway's house is a spit away from the hotel and lots of other interesting attractions like the lighthouse and Sloppy Joe's Bar in Duval Street. Day and night Sloppy Joe's is very lively and has a web cam so you can phone your family and wave at them. We had travelled down from Orlando stopping at Cocoa Beach and Boca Rattan and then went straight to Key West. All in all Key West was an absolute delight. Driving over the 7 mile bridge was an experience we have never had before.

Reviews.Title: “Just Fabulous !”
Reviews.Author: luvdapalmz
Reviews.Content: Southernmost on the Beach is just fabulous. We stayed Oceanview in the new section and the room was spacious, extremely clean, and virtually brand new. The bathroom/vanity area was very large with a huge shower. The pool was a nice size and quite comfortable and always kept clean and neat. Boomer, the activities director, was terrific. Invited all to indulge in pool games but was not overbearing in any way. Heather, the pool area waitress was terrific. Very attentive and always available if you needed a drink or some food. Front desk staff was super; extremely friendly and helpful. Housekeeping was top-notch and very attentive. Concierge was wonderful, specifically Julie who just went above and beyond the call of duty to make our stay a fantastic one. She knew all the great dining spots, tourist traps to stay away from, the best sunset cruise to take, best snorkeling cruise to take, and just helpful from beginning to end, always with a pleasant smile. We are definitely returning next year. We thought about staying at Dewey House which is their B&B next door, but to be honest, with all the private beach parties and weddings that went on all week, it would completely obstruct anyone who had an Ocean Front room. It was noisy with rental companies constantly setting up and breaking down, so we likely we go back to Southernmost on the Beach hotel. All in all, a truly wonderful stay and we highly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Great B&B but don't expect the promised view”
Reviews.Author: GSage12
Reviews.Content: What started out as a much needed vacation in a quaint B&B with an ocean view, did not last long. Of the 6 days we were there 3 of them had huge tents setup on the beach in front of our balcony. So not only did we not enjoy the view, but there were either private parties or weddings that blocked your private view and access to the beach(that you paid for but did not get). This is a great B&B if you don't go there with the expectations of a Private view of the beach

Reviews.Title: “We will be back!”
Reviews.Author: fsudruski
Reviews.Content: This hotel had it all! Beach access, pool access, pool bar access, and great views! It was away from all of the madness Duval can be, but not too far away. We walked to many restaurants during our two day stay and relaxed the whole time. A great place for romance or if you want to bring the whole family! Check offseason rates during the summer because they have great specials of 10 and 20% off!

Reviews.Title: “Ahhhh.....Key West”
Reviews.Author: rsa744
Reviews.Content: Southernmost is a great Key West Resort. With an awesome pool, beach, lawn, pier, hammocks, view, conceriage and Happy Hour ($3 apps, beer, drinks and wine 4-7 at the beach bar). Its just far enough from Duval to relax but still close enough to walk where you need to. We have a great time! The rooms were nice, clean and moderately sized.

Reviews.Title: “Southernmost on the Beach and La Mer House...cozy and comfy.”
Reviews.Author: jacksonsfan090909
Reviews.Content: Our family just returned from a long weekend at Southernmost on the Beach and La Mar House in Key West. The resort is an easy one block walk to Duval Street. The service at the resort was exemplary. From check in to check out, all our needs were handled quickly and in a professional manner. Each resort employee we encountered was friendly and helpful. We had breakfast daily at the Southernmost on the Beach cafe and Cory was our waiter each day. He was polite, friendly and a great waiter. Breakfast was well priced and delicious. Our grown children stayed at the Southernmost on the Beach Hotel and we stayed in the La Mer House. The accomodations for the two facilities were quite different. The rooms at the hotel were typical of any hotel. The rooms were clean and comfortable but not memorable. They seemed to be overpriced for their size but it is Key West. If you stay in the hotel, be sure and request a room that faces the beach. As in most hotels, the location of some rooms is much better than others. The accomodations at the La Mer House were wonderful. The La Mer House is a bed and breakfast. It is very quaint with tropical decor and very comfortable. Our room had a wrap around balcony with a view of the pool and the beach. A continental breakfast was included with the room as well as "tea" in the afternoon. The "tea" included hot and cold tea, fresh fruit and pastries. The La Mer House is steps away from the pool and the Beach Cafe. Close enough to be in the middle of all the excitement but private enough to be quiet and cozy. If you are traveling to Key West, I highly recommend the La Mer House.

Reviews.Title: “Service with a smile”
Reviews.Author: NC123Nj
Reviews.Content: This hotel is a real gem. It's nestled on South Beach just down the street from the most southern point bouy. We stayed in Building B., which is all new. Building C has older rooms with nice upgrades, and the west lawn rooms have a beautiful ocean front view. The room we had was beautifully decorated, plenty of dressers, closets, and the bathroom was very roomy, the shower could fit 4 people! No tub, though. The beds were very comfortable with luxury linens. The beach (South Beach) has beach attendants, and is swept every morning to remove the seagrass. The water was beautiful, warm and very shallow..you could walk a long way out and only be waist deep. We ate several times at the beach cafe and everything was top notch. The tuna (sashimi) was really really good. Veggie burgers and quesadillas also very good. The drink menu at the pool bar was extensive and the bartenders were all so nice and friendly. I'd like to send a special shout out to Heather, the waitress at the pool, she was outstanding. She has a bubbly personality that no one can resist. The front desk personnel were also very nice and helpful. The hotel is at the very end of Duval St. so to walk to the end (Mallory Sq,) takes about 25 minutes, but there's so much to see and do on the way, you don't notice the distance. Pedicabs cost about $16.00 to and from Mallory Sq. Cabs cost about $8-$10. You definitely get what you pay for here and it was worth every penny.

Reviews.Title: “Great place - great hotel”
Reviews.Author: superleaguebulls
Reviews.Content: Great hotel in a fantastic location, rooms huge, great bathrooms and amenities, 3 pools with tiki bars and great service from the staff, Parking is free which saves you $30 per night so good value hotel, Breakfast in their beach cafÃ© are both fantastic and good value â€“ and good food, Kew west is a great place and this hotel is ideally placed to see this great town, Its also at the quieter end of Duvall st ( the better end) and away from the large music bars that are at the opposite end

Reviews.Title: “Our Southernmost Stay”
Reviews.Author: KrisE4
Reviews.Content: Stayed here numerous times!! When traveling w/ friends..get them to give you a room w/ and adjoining room..we got a great deal!!

Reviews.Title: “Friendly staff, relaxing, fun atmosphere”
Reviews.Author: ButtonBarley
Reviews.Content: This was the second hotel that we stayed at on our honeymoon (we booked three for the week), and we really enjoyed it. It was true Key West - on the beach, laid back, fun atmosphere. The other guests ranged in age, but mostly they were from 30s to 50s. The pool was cool with a fun tiki bar, and the activities director, Boomer, was great. Hugely sociable with lots of energy and ideas for things to do. We won a drink coupon and t-shirts within an hour of checking in. The Songwriters Festival was in town this week, and had a performance at the pool, which was neat. Also, our room was great. It was a little old, but we had a private patio that looked right onto the water, and the rate was very reasonable. The chain apparently owns a bunch of properties all adjacent to each other and we were told by other guests that the cute, less expensive accommodations next door had all of the same privileges as ours (pool, etc) so we'll probably try that next time. I think they were called La Mer.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding resort!”
Reviews.Author: tugavan
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 6 nights at the newer buildings on the beach, room was very clean, and comfortable, staff was polite and helpful, always a smile no matter at pool, front desk, even the maintenence staff, friend stayed across the street at southernmost hotel, and that just appeared older, but rooms were kept clean and staff just as nice, can't go wrong in being relaxed here, concierge very helpful, walking to everything is doable, would stay here again without hesitation.

Reviews.Title: “Best experience at a hotel ever!!!”
Reviews.Author: FloridaGirl85
Reviews.Content: My husband and I were married at Southernmost on the Beach on April 10, 2010. We stayed at the Southernmost on the Beach April 8-12, 2010 and I don't think we could have picked a more perfect place. We had a lot of family and friends who stayed at the hotel as well and they absolutley loved it! Every single person who works at the resort is amazing, from the house keepers, the girls at the spa, the wait staff at the southernmost beach cafe, and especially the catering director. We stayed in a large ocean view room with a balcony and it was a bit pricey but we splurged since it is our wedding and it was well worth every single penny. The view was the best part, nothing but ocean for miles and miles! The rooms were super clean and bright and airy. The grounds of the hotel are beautifully landscaped and the pool area was great. There is a pool bar there and nice tropical music playing out by the pool. You must eat at the restaurant, The Southernmost Beach Cafe, they serve breakfast lunch and dinner. My husband and I had a chance to eat each meal there and we are very glad we did. The food and service were on point. If you are going to Key West or are thinking about going, you have to stay at this hotel, you won't be sorry!

Reviews.Title: “Paradise!!”
Reviews.Author: jennyjuops
Reviews.Content: This hotel was amazing! We loved EVERYTHING about it. The pool was great. We swam during the day and at night. It was warm, but refreshing in the heat of the day. At night it was lit up in all different colors and was warm. The beach, although we didn't use it., was beautiful. The restaurant on the premises, SoutherMost Cafe, was great too! We ate breakfast and dinner there, a couple of times. The food was delicious and the service was wonderful. The location was phenomenal, right on the beach.. Our room was even more than I expected. The arches, the bedding , the flooring, flatscreen TV, and the decor were all beautiful. The bathroom had the biggest shower I have ever seen. The view I chose was,"distance ocean view." This was perfect. The balcony overlooked a beautiful garden area and the ocean was right at the end of the garden. It was PERFECT! The location was ideal for us. It was close enough to Duval Street, where the action is, but far enough away to have peace and quiet. It's about 2 miles up to hot spots on Duval, so you dont want to walk. We rented bikes one day, an electric car another day, and one night we jumped into one of the many bicycle rickshaws that run up and down Duval Street. I highly recommend this hotel and wil definitely stay there again when we make another visit to Key West.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect place to enjoy Key West!”
Reviews.Author: kelleyg30
Reviews.Content: We arrived on a drizzly Monday afternoon and despite the weather, immediately felt relaxed. There was such a great laid back energy to this place; perfect for couples. The pool is gorgeous with a bar and friendly wait staff. We stayed for 5 days and on one perfect sunny day we decided to simply hang out by the pool for most of the day - the enthusiastic staff was encouraging everyone to participate in games (Noodle raft race in the pool and then later a "Beer School" where we learned the nuances of diferent beer and enjoyed a tasting quiz later). At first, we resisted joining in, but I'm glad we did because we had a lot of fun and enjoyed meeting new people! The room was stunning; we splurged and went for an oceanfront room with a balcony; gorgeous and well worth it! One night I couldn't sleep and enjoyed the luxury of reading for about an ahour on the balcony overlooking the ocean and palm trees - so peaceful! Highly recommend this for couples. Restaurant is okay for beachfront dining, but definitely a variety of great dining options close by (Louie's Backyard, Nine One Five, Banana Cafe...)

Reviews.Title: “Southernmost exceeds expectations.”
Reviews.Author: bobpic
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the SHOTB prior to the renovation; it was a couple of years back. We really enjoyed our stay back then and this yearâ€™s stay was phenomenal. We requested a certain room in the newly renovated building facing the ocean and our request was granted. The room was great, very comfortable bed, great shower and top-rate service by the housekeepers. The grounds are nicely landscaped and well maintained. The concierge was very helpful and provide excellent service. We have a few suggestions that they may take into consideration. With, and Iâ€™ll guess, triple the number of guests that the SHOTB now can accommodate, the sitting area around the pool is limited to the number of guests that can sit around the pool. All chaise lounges are taken by 7:00 am and if you get there after that, you are out of luck. Just like on a cruise ship, the â€œchair-hogsâ€� stake their claim for the entire day. OK, let us go to the beach instead. Before the renovation, I believe the beach was private, (I recall Tom, the Leisure Engineer). Now, the beach is public, anyone can use the beach and get a chaise lounge for $5.00. We saw this happen on two occasions, (may have been more), where hotel guests came down to use the beach but there were no chaise lounges available. OK, letâ€™s use the private beach. If you do, thereâ€™s no rest-rooms, no cold drinks available and if you want to use the pool, you have a small hike through the parking lot to the pool. The Beach CafÃ© has been nicely redone but, itâ€™s the same size and has the same number of staff. We wanted to have lunch at the cafÃ© but we were told there would be at least Â½ hour wait. Fine, now what are we suppose to do, wait there in the heat for Â½ hour or more? Or, should we go back to our chaise lounge and return every 10 minutes to check. A way of announcing when your table is ready via a PA system such as TGIF has would really be helpful. If they increase the number of guests that the resort can accommodate, they should also consider increasing the size of the beach cafÃ©. We feel that the Southernmost Hotel on the Beach has lost some of itâ€™s charm. Bigger doesnâ€™t always mean better. Will we stay at your resort again? We love what they have done and most likely we will be back.

Reviews.Title: “"Worth every penny"”
Reviews.Author: B Bob C
Reviews.Content: We loved the Southernmost on the Beach. The property is large and includes two hotels as well as two "vintage" inns and a beachfront cafe. We stayed in the newest property - The Southernmost-on-the Beach hotel. The rooms are beautifully furnished, the balconies offer a direct view of the water and the bathrooms are large and well equipped. Quite simply, it is a delightful place to stay. The property is located on the southern end of Duval Street but it is far enough away from the night time noise and partying of Mallory Square and the more raucous parts of Duval. Yet the action is within walking distance as are shops, restaurants, and bars. It is also just a short drive to Zachery Taylor state park which has the best location on the island for viewing and photographing the sunset. There is a full service concierge in the hotel lobby, a lovely pool area and bar, a white sand beach, a small Cuban store and eat-outside cafe across the street, and a trolley stop across from the lobby area. Savor the Southernmost on the Beach experience. It is undoubtably one of the finest full service hotels in Key West.

Reviews.Title: “# 1 place to stay above all the rest”
Reviews.Author: sonjan912
Reviews.Content: my wife and i would highly reccomend this place to any one that likes to be treated like family. the staff was exceptional especially the bar staff at the pool area. please tell Rich, Mellissa and Heather, Giselle that we miss them. this place is close to duval st., but far enough away to be peaceful. but take this advice and rent bicycles to get around. need more daily activities

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in a wonderful location but....”
Reviews.Author: Bob_Miami
Reviews.Content: There's no question that this hotel has a great location and the renovated room we stayed in was beautifully decorated. On top of that, all of the staff that we spoke with were really friendly. But all of this comes at a price - I paid nearly double the rate for a similar quality hotel in the center of New York. Plus I paid $50 extra to have an ocean view room. It turned out that this 'ocean view' room meant that if you went out onto the balcony and looked to one side you saw the ocean, but just from looking out of your window you see across a lawn into other rooms. Personally I think that's a con. The kitchen service was also really slow - after waiting 45 minutes we ended up cancelling an order (as we went for Easter weekend it may be better at other times). Overall, no regrets about staying there, except for wasting $50 to get a view of other peoples rooms!

Reviews.Title: “Terrifc stay at a great reort hotel”
Reviews.Author: RogDodgeUK
Reviews.Content: We stayed 3 nights in March 2010. We had a room on 3rd floor near the sea but not looking directly on to it but I almost felt this was better as you could see the hotel, beach and garden too. The room was beautifully furnished with excellent bed and also bathroom facilties. There is a pool area (see the website) with a great bar and a great place to hang out and meet people. It was really busy during the day but quiet and relaxing around 6. If you want a quiter spot during the day then there is a really clean and beautiful piece of beach area immediately in front of the main hotel building. Such a great spot they had a wedding there whilst we were staying there. Melissa the bar lady recommended the Striphouse restaurant at the hotel next door and this was a great find (it's rather tucked away but you can get a great table outside really close to the sea. Southernmost on the beach is at the quiter end of the busy tourist Duval street but we enjoyed taking the walk up there several times. Hotel next to a piece of beacj that rolls into the sea with a really great bar/cafe/restaurant which we found great for lunch. Couple of small piers head into the sea and the one directly off the property has steps at the end to take you into a shallow sea with a great sandy bed. Only a shame we were there 3 days. Would stay there a week without hesitation (Key West is a great destination anyway but this hotel made it for us)

Reviews.Title: “southernmost on the beach is perfectly located”
Reviews.Author: AWod
Reviews.Content: Hotel was perfect for any traveler. Perfect location on the quiet end of Duval, but close to everything. The staff was exceptional, extremely helpful and friendly. Conch train pick up is right across the street. My wife and I said as we were leaving we would absolutely come back again. Important to ask for a room facing the water, otherwise you face a parking lot or another building. View is important to us.

Reviews.Title: “Best place in Key West”
Reviews.Author: blaine123
Reviews.Content: We stayed in a beautiful room in the La Mer house overlooking the ocean. The service and amenities were top notch. The continental breakfast served on the patio each morning was fabulous, especially the french bakery goods and the lattes. Thank you Randall. The sound of the waves put me to sleep every night. I can't wait to visit again.

Reviews.Title: “Go out on the pier for sunrise”
Reviews.Author: BuffaloNative
Reviews.Content: The New Ocean View King room was nice, although in the future I will splurge for the New Oceanfront King, difference being a better view and a larger deck. The toiletries in the room were made from honey! The shower was huge, as was the flatscreen tv. Todd the Manager was great, as was the night time front desk man Wally. The pool was spacious. The grounds of the property were well manicured. The ocean views throughout the property were unbeatable. To maximize your stay I encourage all to get up early to watch the sunrise from the private pier, it rivals the sunset. The Southernmost Beach CafÃ© is a few short steps away; we took the opportunity to have a late night dessert on a whim, huge pieces of key lime pie and chocolate raspberry cake.

Reviews.Title: “ABSOLUTELY FABULOUS”
Reviews.Author: KendyC
Reviews.Content: GREAT hotel, BEAUTIFUL!!! ROOMS, very friendly people. greattt cocktails! (try the mango margherita:) ) Just steps away from Duval Street, the most living and famous street in Key West. At the end of Duval Street you can find the pier with the boats that take you out to snorkling,parasailing,jetski ... (tour: ultimate adventure tour -incl sunset tour)

Reviews.Title: “Great Place for a Great Weekend”
Reviews.Author: atlbeachbum81
Reviews.Content: My friends surprised me with booking this hotel for my bachelorette party - it was the perfect hotel for that! We didn't want a crazy spring-break style weekend, more of a fun beach weekend, which is exactly what we got! At first I was afraid that going to Key West would mean never seeing the ocean since I always heard there is no beach in Key West, well this hotel has the cutest little beach, and its not too rocky or rough. Plus, the pool was great! Right on the beach, close to the bar and the beach restaurant. The rooms were fine, clean and with 4 of us in one room we were never too squished. The beds were fine, and the sheets were clean. The bathroom was clean and we had a large real shower (not the bathtub and shower combo). The only complaints we had were that the beach restaurant was extremely slow - and we had one really bad experience. We all ordered breakfast and one of our friends ordered the quiche special, well the waitress brought out all of our food except hers and said that they had changed the quiche so did she want it or something else but our friend couldn't eat the ingredients in the new one so she ordered something else - so all of us except her had our food and at the end of the meal they still charged her - they even had to fix the bill because it had too much on it. I just felt like they should have done something since they made the mistake and should not have brought out the rest of our food if her meal was not ready. The food was fine but I would recommend going somewhere else. We also just had a little issue that the concierge told us we were getting one deal at one of our activities but it turned out that was not the case and we didn't find out until too late so we kind of felt tricked. But overall it was a good trip and all of us agreed it was a super cute hotel that we would love to come back to one day.

Reviews.Title: “Best Hotel in Key West”
Reviews.Author: nmbbjm44
Reviews.Content: If you are thinking about visiting Key West and are debating which hotel to select, look no further! This hotel has it all...great location, newly remodeled rooms, pools, beach, restaurant, and of course bars! What more could you ask for when visiting Key West?!? Our terrific experience began upon check-in. Although check-in is not until 3 p.m., our room was available when we arrived at 1. We booked a newly remodeled, partial ocean view room and it was worth every single penny! During our stay, we made sure to soak up the sun both on the beach and poolside - both were excellent. We also took advantage of the $3 happy hour specials at the Southernmost Beach Cafe. We wish we would have rented bicycles every day from the concierge...for $10/day this is a great way to get around to see the island and avoid the outrageously priced, hard-to-come-by parking spaces! (Parking is free at the hotel). We also booked the â€œCommotion on the Oceanâ€� sunset sail through the concierge and it was wonderful! When we were booking our trip, we considered several other hotels. We looked at all of those hotels once we arrived in Key West and we were glad we selected Southernmost on the Beach. When we return, this is where we will stay!

Reviews.Title: “One of my all time favorite hotels”
Reviews.Author: work2travel_0323
Reviews.Content: I've traveled the world and stayed in some of the most amazing resorts and SMOB is high up there on the list. The hotel was extremely clean, modern yet cozy. The staff was exceptional (especially Rich & Gisella at the Pool Bar and Sully & Dan at the Beach Cafe). I loved the new and updated rooms (we even had partial ocean views). The location is fantastic at the end of Duval Street so close enough to walk into the party but quietly tucked away from the noise. The property has 3 pools (1 which has a fantastic view of the ocean), a private beach, pool chairs all around the resort so you can see the ocean at all times. This hotel compares to my stay at the new Westin Resort in Maui which I never thought could be beat! SMOB is a bit expensive though!

Reviews.Title: “8th visit to Key West, and it gets better every time!”
Reviews.Author: Roxiematilda
Reviews.Content: We visit Key West every February for a mix of business and leisure. The past 2 years we have stayed at SMOB. This property is really beautiful. The staff is very helpful. The rooms are great - very spacious & the beds are comfy! So many great restaurants, all within walking distance.

Reviews.Title: “Best Hotel I Have Stayed In!”
Reviews.Author: CR9999
Reviews.Content: Ok, so we paid top money for it. $475 dollars per night plus tax for one of their new Grand Oceanfront Rooms. But it was hands down the best room I have ever stayed in. Being able to open the balcony doors and have over 180 degrees of sea view, to be able to see the Key West sunrise and sunset from our corner room balcony. Absolutely outstanding. Maid service was always prompt and efficient, in both servicing the room daily, and the nightly turn down service. Huge room, huge bathroom, huge shower. Huge balcony (corner room (636)). Enjoyed the food and vies from the Southernmost on the Beach Cafe, and while the hotel could probably do with a different restaurant on site, Key West has so many within a walkable distance, it is not imperative. The infinity pool was lovely, even if I did only get the chance to dip in it briefly, and the pool bar staff, in fact all the staff, were very friendly and helpful. If you are going here, go ahead and pay the extra for the best room, it is worth it. We could have happily sat on our balcony for our 8 days here, though with so much to do on Key West we did get out and about as well. We will certainly be returning and hopefully for two weeks, can't wait to get back to room 636! Will hopefully get chance to upload some photos soon.

Reviews.Title: “One of the best hotels we've stayed in.”
Reviews.Author: chewy380
Reviews.Content: An excellent hotel. Nothing negative to say. They let us have our room at 11am although check in was at 3pm. A gem on a fantastic island.

Reviews.Title: “Picturesque Resort, truly beachfront on quiet end of Duval”
Reviews.Author: KeyMe
Reviews.Content: This picturesque resort is just as described in their marketing materials. We stayed in the "A" building. The room was very modern and clean. The bathroom was especially nice, with a HUGE walk-in shower. (Not yucky white bathtubs and shower curtains here!) The views are wonderful, from the grassy courtyard area between buildings, to the small and private sandy area overlooking the water. There is a public beach immediately next to the hotel. This is more than adequate for our needs and you get a complimentary beach chair for everyone in your party...just show your room key to the attendant. We definitely will stay here again the next time we visit Key West. All of the staff were very excellent except for one testy bartender--which only resulted in him losing our business for the entire week! (how silly to not have bartending be top notch in a notorious drinking town where there are so many other options).

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great room with great decor”
Reviews.Author: aspenDelaware
Reviews.Content: The location to Duval St. was perfect, yet just far enough by a few blocks to not be bothered by any noise from the rowdy college kids on spring break. Great restaurants are within walking distance, as well as Hemingway's house. The hotel room was beautifully decorated and immaculate with a nice marble bathroom. We had a balcony with a partial view of the water. The whole complex is laid out very nicely with nice pathways and landscaping, and plenty of free parking. There were lots of beach chairs and hammocks on a nice sandy beach. The service we experienced was great...they were happy to recommend restaurants and they let us check-out two hours late.

Reviews.Title: “Wish I were there now. (Heavy sigh....)”
Reviews.Author: KansasCityBeachfan
Reviews.Content: The location and surrounding natural beauty are wonderful. You can't stay any closer to the water. The landscaping was beautiful and well maintained. The weather was so perfect that for a time we actually forgot that it was January. The hotel offers just the right mix of activity and opportunity for quiet reflection on nature's beauty. The bed was the most comfortable we have ever slept on. The view from our room (and everywhere else) was awesome. The shrimp and crab meat omellete at the cafe was excellent and we found our waiter, Brian, to be the most pleasant and helpful employee by far. We returned to the cafe for happy hour and enjoyed the rum punch, ocean breeze and company of new friends. Total relaxation! Walking distance to everywhere and back if you're reasonably fit. If not, taxis are reasonable and bikes and scooters are available for rent. The shop across the street has smaller selection but better prices for mementos than many shops along Duvall street but the nightlife on Duval is not to be missed especially if you're a people watcher. The hotel offers free coffee at the bar for early risers. Just help yourself to a cup and take it around the end of the building to grab a hammock or lawn chair from which watch the sun rise over all of that beautiful blue/green water. Chances are there will only be you and a few other early birds there. There is a laid back vibe to the whole island that is unmistakable but even more so at the hotel. Can't put it into words but you'll recognize it when you go for yourself. We can't imagine staying anywhere else and we'll be back for sure.

Reviews.Title: “A great place”
Reviews.Author: AUKTourist
Reviews.Content: A good quality three star hotel. You pay for the location but it is worth it.

Reviews.Title: “Better rooms available for not much more”
Reviews.Author: ColdWinnipeggers
Reviews.Content: Our very first time in the Keys. My husband and I were originally checked in at the Best Western, but just thought for the heck of it we would ask what the prices were at the SMOTB. We were pleasantly surprised and immediately changed our hotel! We stayed in an older room the first night, but were able to upgrade at a very reasonable price to a fabulous room with a balcony and much nicer furniture/linen/bathroom in the new buildings by the ocean for the next 4 nights. Great location as you are so close to all the action, yet it's quiet. I would suggest renting your bikes from across the street, rather than at the hotel - much cheaper and that's really a wonderful way to see the old Town. And don't forget to ask the concierge for coupons to the Hemmingway House (great tour) and the wine and cigar bar just down the street from the hotel. You should also check out the Fort Zachary state park. It's beautiful and well worth the small admission fee.

Reviews.Title: “Southernmost Hotel on the beach, Wonderful place, convenient to everything!”
Reviews.Author: MassachusettsCarol
Reviews.Content: My husband, daughter and I went to the Southernmost Hotel in April 2009. We had a wonderful stay, place was very clean and the staff was very friendly. I researched so many hotels before I went and we were so glad we stayed there. It was quiet, we had our own beach too. When we were laying in the sun, an employee of the hotel came over and gave us a frozen towel to put behind our necks and sprayed us lightly with water too cool us down. This little treat was great. The little open air restaurant on the beach was good too. It is located right at the end of Duval St.

Reviews.Title: “Great Atmosphere on the Beach”
Reviews.Author: SceneITNOW
Reviews.Content: If you want to feel like you're at the Keys then stay at Southernmost. Nice rooms, great areas to sit and enjoy the scenery. Professional staff. Resturants/bar onsite. It was nice to stay in a resort instead of a strip motel. Worth the extra money. Nice place for families, singles and couples. I would definately come back to this property.

Reviews.Title: “excellect accommendations and service”
Reviews.Author: floridaanniez
Reviews.Content: we had an excellent experience, from check in to check out. the location ( on the beach ), to the view, the friendly and efficent staff to the room itself were better than cold be expected.

Reviews.Title: “Located in the best part of Key West”
Reviews.Author: tcs3675
Reviews.Content: This hotel is located at the southern end of Duval St. This end is quiet and peaceful but an easy walk to all the excitement. I will always stay here when traveling to the Keys. Free parking and plenty of it (very important)! The only issue we had was a rather loud second floor guest. Not any fault of the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “A fabulous hotel in the most wonderful location at the Southern end of Duval Street”
Reviews.Author: Jimmypagekent
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed in room 737 which had the most amazing view of the ocean, it is the room in the picture on their web-site. The hotel was immaculate, clean, bright and airy. Very relaxing, those hammocks are so comfortable. The food in the beach bar was superb, extensive menu and very good quality. The staff were very attentive and gave excellent service. Being at the end of Duval was not a problem, in fact it is at the quieter, more up-market end. Every day we made the trek along Duval, where there is no shortage of quality restaurants whether it be for breakfast or evening meal. You must try Blue Heavan in the Bahama Village for breakfast, don't worry about the roosters! Or BO's, a fish shack near Caroline Street. Such character ! The only tacky bit was the cheap clothes shops, they are all the same and the staff very pushy. We loved the hotel and Key West so much that we will definately return.

Reviews.Title: “Another perfect stay”
Reviews.Author: dleepenn
Reviews.Content: This is not a cheap place to stay, but the maintenance and quality of the hotel is perfect. Our room was clean and fresh. Furnishings are excellent quality and the room was classy with a nice big shower. My only complaint is that in the older rooms, where we stayed this time, you can hear people in the rooms on each side. This is not a problem in the newer section. The advantage of the older section is that you have a nice ocean and beach view. We've stayed at this hotel every year for the past 4 years and every stay has been good. They do need to work on their WiFi network. I could not get a reliable wifi connection from inside my room. I had to sit outside to use my computer with the network. They also have hard wired connections to the room, but that did not work either. This is definitely something that needs work. Some extra WiFi base stations would solve this. Everything along Duval is within walking distance and if you cannot walk, there are bike cabs all over to take you wherever you need to go. Because of its location, it is nice and quiet too.

Reviews.Title: “Southernmost was a great place to stay with wonderful ocean views.”
Reviews.Author: 3Jayhawks
Reviews.Content: Our room had a great ocean view, parking was included, and there was no resort fee. The staff was wonderful, and they were happy to recommend restaurants and activities. Dexter was especially helpful with recommendations when my husband and I were checking in after the concierge desk had already closed for the evening.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location,bad taste rooms!”
Reviews.Author: PiroskaOslo
Reviews.Content: Stayed here mid january 3 nights! Happy that we had ocean wiev rooms,beautiful! Really a nice location at the end of the city and America! Duval Street and the ocean next! The small rooms was like going back to the early 1980. Yellow walls and bad taste furnitures. The whole hotel was untrendy and perfect for a bad-taste party, but the location made up for it, and we had a wonderful stay here!

Reviews.Title: “just wonderful”
Reviews.Author: molly'snene
Reviews.Content: first time visit to Key West and Southernmost on the Beach was the perfect spot. We had a 3rd floor room at the beach end of building C... the new buildings beachfront. Lovely view, very nice room, comfortable bed, balcony overlooking courtyard between buildings.. palm trees and landscaping...and the small man-made beach, water and pier. Loved the cafe on the beach. Food was very good, staff friendly, and just a perfect spot to begin or end the day. Concierge was very helpful. Walk to Souternmost point, Butterfly Museum, Hemmingway house, and the beginning of Duval st 1/2 block away... small convenience store accross the street. So very convenient! Great experience!

Reviews.Title: “Great Service.. very accommodating”
Reviews.Author: knup342
Reviews.Content: Went to Key West for our annual family trip to Florida. This was my first time. The original hotel we booked was horrible so we immediately went looking for a new hotel. We ended up luckily finding this gem. The office was able to find us rooms last minute and was very easy to work with. Beach Cafe had great breakfast and an even better happy hour. Pool bar and service were both great. We had to change rooms for our last night and we forgot a few things in the old room; beer and a shirt. After one call the beer arrived at out door in minutes. Until the staff brought the shirt to the new room we had not even noticed it missing. Stayed in the newer buildings. I would definitely recommend this to travelers.

Reviews.Title: “Romantic and luxurious - can't go wrong.”
Reviews.Author: LondonTim79
Reviews.Content: Stayed here in late June 2009 - my fiancee and i had a wonderful time. We decided to treat ourselves and stay for 3 nights - pure luxury. Massive bed, huge room - exceptionally clean. You couldn't really ask for more. You pay a fair amount for a sea view room - but it is worth it and felt we certainly got value for money. I would say this is by far and away one of the very best places to stay in Key West. Own private beach, great pool, wonderful service and not far from the main action. It was a 25 min walk or so up to the waterfront to where a lot of the restaurants and boats for day trips were, but that didn't put us off one bit. If you want to enjoy a bit of peace and luxury and not find yourself slap bang in the noisy centre then you cannot go wrong with the Southernmost. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Southernmost Hotel on the Beach is fabulous!!”
Reviews.Author: JudiAustin_Minnesota
Reviews.Content: Southernmost Hotel on the Beach is the most beautiful and accommodating hotel at which I've stayed. Food and staff at Southernmost Cafe on the Beach were excellent also. This was our first trip to Key West. We walked everywhere. The concierge, Julie, treated us like royalty. Everyone in Key West is so friendly. I plan to return, bringing other family members here to do more sightseeing. One week was not nearly long enough to take it all in, especially since we returned to the beach each afternoon to soak up the wonderful, warm sun. Looks like the night life is especially fun. Our hotel was so nice and quiet, and when we wanted activity, we walked up Duval street to tour the island. Judy from Austin, Minnesota

Reviews.Title: “Nice location, bad service.”
Reviews.Author: j0yr1de07
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I came to stay here for my 21st birthday. The location is ideal, right on duval street. The hotel really looks nothing like the pictures. The room was decent, they all have balcony's. The bed was hard a rock, so were the towels. The TV looked like something that came out of my living room in the 80's. The toilet broke and wouldn't flush on the last day we were there... and no one bothered to come fix it. The bar/restaurant was cute and the happy hour was great... otherwise the drinks are very expensive. My boyfriend accidentally called the spa instead of the front desk... which was fine because they didn't answer. They not only texted him multiple times, they called repeatedly.. probably about 15 times.. and left multiple voicemails (and this was after he told them to stop calling) The Beach was about 5 feet long. Disappointing. The concierge will try and sell you cruises.. thats about all they are good for. save yourself the trouble of bad service, and stay at a bed and breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Nice Hotel, Customer Service Lacking”
Reviews.Author: DF0403
Reviews.Content: We booked a West Lawn Oceanfront room. The room was on the first floor in a building which is perpendicular to the ocean so we actually were facing an adjacent beach which is actually a small, man made beach along a concrete wall. I questioned this with the woman who checked us in. She told us that the "real" oceanfront rooms were "premium," as if the 335 I paid per night is small change. Nevertheless, the location is quiet, plenty of chairs and chaise lounges throughout, very relaxing. The room was adequate. Old TV with static reception. Comfortable bed. Poor wi-fi signal. If you need to use your laptop in the room, bring a patch cord. Wifi is good by the pool. Toilet did not flush. I called twice. Noone ever came so I fixed it myself. I had email issues and requested to speak to a tech from their internet provider. Called twice, no-one returned my call. They ran out of shampoo and there seemed to be a shortage of towels.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: geoheim
Reviews.Content: Nothing but great things to say about Southernmost on the Beach. Our room was very nice and spacious and had a great view of the pool and ocean. The front desk and concierge staff were all very pleasant and helpful. The pool was very nice and it was great having the bar and cafe so close by (special mention to the friendly service from Richard, Melissa, Heather and Tim at the bars and Joseph in the cafe). Liked the relaxed atmosphere at the southern end of Duval and still had easy access (15 minute walk or $6-7 cab ride) to the bar action at the other end. This was our first visit to KW and we can't wait to go back. Would definitely stay at SMOTB when we return.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful experience. Loved every minute of our stay”
Reviews.Author: rbronz82
Reviews.Content: This was my first stay at the Southernmost at the Beach. My wife and I came to KW for the Food and Wine Festival, which was a blast. Southernmost had the best package for the festival, so we figured that we would give it a try. I am so glad we did. The staff was friendly and very helpful. The views were incredible. We didn't go to Mallory Square to see the sunset. The view was better from the hotel. The beach cafe was very convenient and the prices were reasonable by Key West standards. We enjoyed the coconut pancakes for breakfast as we looked out at the ocean. Rooms were spotless and beds were very comfortable. Everyone from housekeeping to concierge made us feel welcome. We can't wait to get back.

Reviews.Title: “Best Sleep I've Ever Had”
Reviews.Author: Kem42
Reviews.Content: The room was gorgeous. Beautiful beds with plush bedding that were super comfortable to sleep in. The bathroom was just as pretty with a large shower and beautiful marble counter top. Complementary shampoo and conditioner is environmentally friendly and was the best smelling hair product I've ever tried (I made sure to collect the extras :] ). Our room was always spotless when we came back from exploring everyday which was such a nice change from back home! The location was beautiful-- our balcony had a view of the ocean and was the perfect spot for watching the sunset. You need to come here-- it made paradise even better!

Reviews.Title: “The Southernmost Hotel in the US”
Reviews.Author: AlexandroB
Reviews.Content: Private Beach, Private Pool, near center Key West, Room ok.....Good Package

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Value at the Quiet End of Duval Street”
Reviews.Author: akker1
Reviews.Content: I visited for 5 nights with my siblings for a winter get-away and couldn't have been happier with our choice of hotel. Southernmost on the Beach is very clean, the grounds beautifully landscaped, the rooms well apponted (with refrigerator and safe) but most of all the entire staff was genuinely friendly like they truly enjoyed coming to work each day. The location is ideal in my opinion, on the quiet end of Duval but still within walking distance of shops and restaurants as well as the Hemingway House and Lighthouse. The Butterfly Conservatory is just a couple of blocks away. Mallory Sqaure is more of a hike, perhaps a half-hour walk, but you can take a taxi or a pedi-cab or even rent scooters to get around. A car is not necessary in Key West. Southermmost on the Beach is literally on the beach and we had a great view of the ocean. The hotel complex also includes a couple of small historic guest houses as well as the older Southernmost Hotel across the street. There are 3 pools altogether, but we never left the hotel pool on the beach. The pool area is great and the daytime waitress, Heather. is a delight and the evening bartender, Kevin, is a great guy (ask him to play some of his orginal music on CD) and both provided excellent service. There are also a number of seating areas on the property to relax with hammocks chaise lounges and Adirondack chairs. There is a restaurant on the property (right on the beach) where we ate breakfast every day - excellent - as well as dinner twice. It is a good value and the food is good overall , but the prime rib I had one night was awful (but other entrees were very good). There is no room service however. There are so many great restaurants in Key West I'd recommend other places for dinner unless you are prefer not to leave the hotel for the evening. Lodging prices in Key West are high, and we found this hotel to be in the middle range overall, but considering the location, rooms, amenities and service it is an excellent value. We plan on staying there again next year.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect, Relaxing, Quaint and location, location, location!”
Reviews.Author: bubbli1
Reviews.Content: Living in S. FL nearly 20 years you'd think I'd have been to the Keys before, but this being my First trip I couldn't have asked for more. The Southernmost on the Beach was perfect! First the location is second to none, the staff is super friendly and the rooms (newly remodeled) make you feel like you are staying in a quaint comfy room. The view is amazing from several spots on the grounds and the food and drinks were great! Duvall street is just steps away. Even though we were here for a romantic get away I would also be able to come back with our kids....and definitely will!

Reviews.Title: “Awesome honeymoon!”
Reviews.Author: sunnyfunvirginia
Reviews.Content: It's been months since we went, but my husband and I absolutely loved our stay and we talk about it all the time. We stayed in the new section overlooking the courtyard but only two other rooms between us and the ocean. The view was fantastic! Southernmost on the Beach is the nicest hotel with the best staff and it was great fun all around. We had zero complaints! We can't wait until July 2011 to return for our anniversary.

Reviews.Title: “You have to stay here!!”
Reviews.Author: Lulugirl53
Reviews.Content: We hated to leave this piece of paradise right here in the USA. The rooms, grounds and service was impeccable. We took a trip to Key West from Key Largo where we are staying for a couple of weeks and just fell in love with this property. We wish we had stayed here for the whole time. We will be back.

Reviews.Title: “5 perfect nights in Key West...”
Reviews.Author: tob1647
Reviews.Content: I looked over all the Tripadvisor review before going to Key West in December '09 with my fiancee. I booked the Southernmost Hotel on the Beach based on the stellar reviews. I was pleasantly surprised with our stay there. The staff was very polite. The maintenance guys were constantly combing over the grounds and landscaping. The walk to the heart of Duval st. is about 15 min. Great breakfast at reasonable prices at the hotel restaurant. Great little convenience store across the street. We stayed in the older West Lawn oceanfront area but I have to say, the room looked brand new. Oh yeah, free internet and no resort fee!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful!”
Reviews.Author: Bobby89
Reviews.Content: Wonderful find. Loved the old Floridian style of the hotel, and the rooms were large, beautifully decorated and furnished. The only negative about the room was the pathetic strength of the shower- but not much to complain about. The hotel is also really well located, about 2 minutes' walk from the centre of things in Duvall Street.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing room!”
Reviews.Author: RafiCanada
Reviews.Content: We booked a room in the Southernmost hotel, but we ended in a room on the parking lot of the hotel, with no balcony or terrace (1st floor) and at the end of the building, so on a street corner. The room was beautiful though, very clean and tastefully decorated. The day after we visited the whole site; Southernmost hotel where we were, Southernmost Beach hotel, and the 2 mansions. We asked the reception if they had available rooms on the beach, or with a view on the Ocean, as the weather was not exceptional (cold wave), so we wanted to spend good rest in our room. We were transferred in an amazing room, huge and luxury, with an great Ocean view on the balcony. We just upgraded our holidays for peanuts! They've been helpful and really nice. The concierge helped us booking para sail (so cool!) and a car to visit around. The staff in this hotel is very nice, and the rooms are great. Ask for the Southernmost Beach hotel, between the beach and the street, rather than the Southernmost hotel, between 2 streets. The location is great too, at the end of Duval street, close enough to nice restaurants, but far enough from the noise of the bars.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome experience”
Reviews.Author: zoeyaries
Reviews.Content: We just got back from staying at SMOTB and can I say spectacular!!! From the moment we got there until we left we had suberb service. We stayed in the newer part, one king bed. Our room had a distant ocean view and private baclony, it was gorgeous. In my opinion with the beach, the access to all the pools, the private pier, and the hidden hammocks we were staying at the best place in key west. The bed and the bedding were so comfortable, the cafe on the beach had great food, great ambiance , and was reasonable priced. The reason you stay here is location , location, and the views!!! Right across the street you have a little conveince store with a great cuban food stand!!! This place in my opinion is the place to stay when you are in the Keys, we will be back!!!

Reviews.Title: “Rude, unfriendly and overpriced. Definately not going back”
Reviews.Author: jcmadrid
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel over Christmas and were dissapointed in general. Yes, the location is ideal and the rooms are well appointed with a sea view and most of the extras. But the accomodation is overpriced for what you get. We had a look at the Oceanview Hotel and thought it was much better value for money. But what really got us was the incredibly rude reception staff, especially one recepcionist called Wally. When we checked out he was impressively rude to me simply because I asked for a modification to my details on the invoice. The room service was also pretty bad considering the category of the hotel. One morning we found a HUGE cockroach in the bathroom and when I phoned reception to ask them to remove it all I got was "Oh yeah, Ok." No apology, no interest whatsoever. Another day I tried to get the configuration for the WiFi connection and was told by another recepcionist "We donÂ´t do that here, youÂ´ll have to wait for the IT guy." Again, really rude. So if you can put up with rudeness and indifference, as I said, the location is ideal but personally I would look elsewhere as there is lots to choose from in Key West and this hotel is a big contrast to the generally friendly people you meet in other places.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous above and beyond the brochure,VIP all the way”
Reviews.Author: Trimurti
Reviews.Content: It said partciall ocean veiw but it was full ocean veiw they didn't give themselves enough credit for the wonderful veiw of the sun rise and sunset from the balcony and walkway.Rooms where designer quaility .make up mirror a real plus and not bolted to the wall.Service immediate beyond clean ,crown molding, soft duvets, large flat screen T/V which spoiled me am now looking to buy one.

Reviews.Title: “Good but lacking”
Reviews.Author: zr9000x
Reviews.Content: Nice spot, good parking. Front desk not as informative as should be. Rooms a little small for price. The bathroom was a washout--no room for amenities--no counterspace or plug-ins Beach front cafe was good. I have had better for one quarter of the price. It is however one of the better places in town

Reviews.Title: “Wedding”
Reviews.Author: illinifans007
Reviews.Content: This is a great place for groups coming to KW where everyone is paying their own way. The budget minded can stay at the Southernmost Hotel across the street and for those who want views of the ocean and/or more modern rooms they can stay at the "on the Beach" . Location is great for enjoying Duval St. without being right in the middle of everything. Staff was helpful and very nice. Convenient to beach and shopping access. Prices were as good or better than most places. One thing to know, "ocean view" means you will be able to see the ocean from your room, not necessarily a room overlooking the ocean. Some rooms were technically "ocean view" but nothing special.

Reviews.Title: “Treated us as royalty”
Reviews.Author: klkitchen
Reviews.Content: Awesome view from the room. Our room was right on the water. Food at the Southermost at the Beach Cafe was tasteful and not too over priced. What you're paying for mostly is the views.....which were priceless.... Key West itself was interesting. Lots of tourists shops selling the same crap 'made in China'. ...and of course there was "Margaritaville". Enjoyed the stay, even though "IDA" decided to go up the gulf the same week end. Save up your nickles and dimes, catch a plane to Miami and drive to the keys..7 mile bridge is quite an experience.

Reviews.Title: “LeMar Hotel and Dewey House - PERFECT!!!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: NausetBum
Reviews.Content: We stayed in an ocean view mini suite from 12/27/08 - 1/3/09 and could not have been happier with both the room and the service. Sam, one of our concierges was FABULOUS! Room was perfect - charming and comfortable - and the sound of the waves lapping on the beach outside our windows lulled us to sleep each night. The only negative about the whole trip was that this is one of the busiest weeks in Key West. We will go back again, but more "off season". I would highly recommend a stay here!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect! Beautiful, relaxing and rejuvenating.”
Reviews.Author: Dplm
Reviews.Content: We had the most amazing time here. The room was lovely. The bathroom was spacious. Everything was immaculately clean. Even the bathrooms at the pool were always spotless. We had an ocean front room with a wraparound balcony. The views were stunning. Literally postcard perfect--the views looked exactly like the brochure. We were very close to all the action (sunset at Mallory square, shopping on Duval street). The staff was very friendly and helpful. The concierge helped us plan our snorkeling trip--which was amazing too. The fitness center was opened all the time. We loved the hammocks on the beach, and the pier had the perfect angle for watching the sunset. We were so relaxed and comfortable. I am already dreaming of when we can go back there.

Reviews.Title: “Superb experience...5 star service”
Reviews.Author: drofo
Reviews.Content: This place has it all. Easy access to Duval St., Beautiful rooms, fabulous food, beach access, swimming pools, OUTSTANDING service, they make you feel like royalty. Parking and wi-fi included. Spa and fitness center on site.

Reviews.Title: “The Very Best in Key West”
Reviews.Author: Luxury-Ireland
Reviews.Content: I stayed here at the beginning of December on the end of a ten day trip to Florida. The hotel is located as advertised at the very southern point of the USA. It has wonderful rooms with balconies overlooking the ocean with two queen beds, comfortable linens and excellent amenities. The beach next door is perfect for an ocean dip and the pool and pool bar downstairs has great cocktails and ambiance. The shops and restaurants are a pleasant ten minute stroll down Duval Street. The concierge at the hotel arrange all sorts of activities and events. I would highly recommend this hotel to my friends and clients visiting Key West.

Reviews.Title: “Southernmost gave us the most best wedding ever.”
Reviews.Author: dertmcgurt
Reviews.Content: An absolutely fantastic stay at Southernmost on the Beach was the backbone of our amazing wedding weekend in Key West. The location is perfect, the sunsets are mind-blowing, and the facilities are superb. Melissa at Shores Bar makes the best Bloody Mary I've ever had and the rest of the staff was excellent as well. We really have no complaints whatsoever. It's definitely worth the money. Enjoy!

Reviews.Title: “Horrible sheets and pillows”
Reviews.Author: Callie565
Reviews.Content: I 'm really sorry to complain because the rest of our stay was so wonderful. Loved the room, the pool, the food at the cafe on the beach and especially the friendly staff. But the sheets were so uncomfortable because they were pilling.( For those not familiar with the term it is when fabric forms little balls from friction on it). It made the sheets feel like there was sand in the bed. The foam pillows were also uncomfortable and felt like solid blocks beneath my head. That being said, I would come back in a heartbeat, I would just pack my own bedding.

Reviews.Title: “Quiet, on the ocean, great rooms and beds!”
Reviews.Author: 50doll
Reviews.Content: Third stay for us.....booked in the new section with partial view of the ocean....two wonderful queen beds, balcony.....do not stay in any room close to the pool or bar due to noise....best hotel in Key West....45 min walk down Duval to Mallory Square....concierge has connections to all you need....a wonderful getaway to revive a relationship!!!

Reviews.Title: “still a great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: Will&Michelle
Reviews.Content: Have stayed here several times in the past, they have renovated the resort and added a couple of buildings, the renovations are beautiful, and the new rooms are amazing. They added a bar by the pool which is great, and the service remains excellent. We had a minor problem with the hair dryer in room not working, it took less than 15 min and there was a new one at the door. The one recommendation I would make pertains to the on site spa, they have an oceanfront massage area which is not very private, not even an area to change in, they need to add sometype of changing area or even a privacy curtain or wall. While my wife and were getting massages people walk right by you and she had to change practically in a garage near beach, not what we expected. Would not recommend massages there (i believe the spa is an independent business renting space in resort). The rest of the resort was excellent and we are already making reservations for our next trip there

Reviews.Title: “Paradise Found! Most relaxing trip we've ever taken”
Reviews.Author: aflynn69
Reviews.Content: We're already planning our return trip. Stayed in new west lawn oceanfront This hotel was excellent. The room was perfection-perfectly decorated and a relaxing at home feeling you don't always find in a hotel. Great oceanfront balcony w/ view of sunrise & sunset. Windows with screens so you can get the ocean breeze at night. Private, but service was always there if you needed. Beach was GREAT. Beach Cafe GREAT. Service GREAT. Location GREAT. Far enoough removed from the bars on Duval to go relax at the end of the night, but we did need to rent a golf cart. It is a far walk to go out barhopping. But hey...who doesn't love driving around in a golf car.

Reviews.Title: “Great new rooms!!!”
Reviews.Author: jatco
Reviews.Content: We are frequent guests at Westin resorts in the Caribbean and the new rooms at Southernmost on the Beach are as nice, if not better than, Grand Cayman or St Maartin's Westin Resorts. We were in an oceanfront king room and they are roomy, with great beds, great bathrooms and great views. Our hats are off to Southernmost group for your new rooms. Thanks for a great stay!!!

Reviews.Title: “Impecible room, decor and service”
Reviews.Author: GoBG
Reviews.Content: From the moment I stepped into my room at the Southernmost, I felt I was on an exclusive yacht. Not only was the room large and spotless, but the decor was soothing and comfortable after being out in the bright sun. I enjoyed coffee on my private balcony each of the five mornings I was a guest there. The pool area was inviting and well kept with a wonderful bar area. I ate several times at the Southernmost Cafe next door - just a short walk through the sand as it is right on the ocean! The food was delicious and the sea food very fresh and well prepared. At the Hotel as well as the Cafe, the staff was friendly and knowledgeable. Although this was my first visit to Key West, I can't wait to return to the Key and the Southernmost! P.S. The Cafe has a fantastic wine menu!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent place to stay”
Reviews.Author: RBonTheLake
Reviews.Content: Great place to stay - on the quiet end of Duval St. We had a room facing the water. It had a balcony which was nice to sit out on in the morning. However, the balconies are NOT private which took away from it some. Room was spacious with lots of light. Large bathroom. Good water pressure. Quiet. Very comfortable. Towels were not very soft. Staff was pleasant and accommodating. Can park underneath which keeps the heat out of your car. Wi-fi is pretty slow but free.

Reviews.Title: “Wedding Ceremony”
Reviews.Author: KWTrveler
Reviews.Content: My wife and I were married at Southernmost On The Beach in September 2009, with approximately 25 family and friends as guests. The ceremony package of up to 50 guests was the perfect solution for our gathering. Melissa, the Sales Catering Manager, did an amazing job of working with us and our music vendor, officiant and photographer to assure everything was addressed and perfect. We chose the location between the buildings for more privacy as opposed to the area on the beach, which was also very nice, but not as secluded. Chairs were arranged, arch was decorated and the area was beautiful. We were also provided with a lovely room, and utilized their massage on the beach service, which we both highly recommend! Had a great time and looking forward to returning.

Reviews.Title: “Mixed Feelings about Southernmost on the Beach”
Reviews.Author: suemartin
Reviews.Content: To make reading this review easier I have broken down the resort into categories. Rooms: Great rooms at Southernmost on the Beach as long as you are away from the pool. Rooms near the pool are noisy until 11pm every night with music and guests who swim and party. Air conditioning units are incredibly noisy and disrupt sleep. The units turn on and off constantly throughout the day/night. Restaurant: Go somewhere else. EVERY day the kitchen got our breakfast (simple meals) wrong. Undercooked food, undercooked food, dry as sand pancakes, etc. Bar at Restaurant: Needs a renovation and the barmaids are cocky and rude. The comments heard passed to patrons by this group of washed up bartenders were inappropriate and unprofessional. And 2 out of the 5 can't make a decent drink. Skip this bar except perhaps during happy hour. Housekeeping: Somedays so-so. Didn't change sheets when requested. Never replaced water bottles. Clean hand towels were a gift. And, dusting must not be part of the routine. Be care, Housekeepers leave main key for all guest rooms loose on their carts and they leave their carts unsupervised for long stretches of time in the hallway. Housekeeping supervisor needs a personality. Pool Bar: Rich is nice guy. Drinks are outrageously priced and management obviously doesn't care. Mixed drinks $10! Come on already...the main ingredient is water/ice. Even the bartenders know the prices are ridiculous.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome, beautiful, relaxing, well worth it”
Reviews.Author: Bette50
Reviews.Content: This is the most beautiful place!!! Went with my 2 best friends for my 50th birthday and couldn't have asked for a more gorgeous hotel. We had a new queen balcony room with partial ocean view, which they upgraded closer to the ocean, so the view was amazing. The room was perfect, the shower was huge (we could have all fit) and I couldn't quit saying how wonderful the whole area was. While seeing the other choices for hotels and/or bed and breakfasts to stay in Key West, this is definetely the best choice. It is well worth the money. The beach cafe is very nice, sitting outside with a view of the beach and ocean and food was good. Highly recommend and would go back again.

Reviews.Title: “Great View”
Reviews.Author: bythewater240
Reviews.Content: We stayed in an ocean front unit. Excellent decor and very nice balcony. Excellent service by the front desk. Great location on the southern side. My only issue was the cheap bathroom paper and the lack of refill on the shampoo the second night. For over $350.00 a night you figure a replacement 1.5 ounce shampoo isn't asking too much.

Reviews.Title: “Best Hotel in Key West”
Reviews.Author: tgross
Reviews.Content: My wife and I celebrated our 25th Wedding Anniversary back in May. The rooms were outstanding...roomy, clean, and well-appointed. the grounds are wonderful...don't miss the pier for laying out and the hammocks for relaxing. And, the pool bar is great...nice cocktails while you enjoy the pool and the view of the Atlantic. If you are ever in Key West this is the place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic room, great view.”
Reviews.Author: BigAlCumbria
Reviews.Content: We had an ocean view room, which genuinely did have a beautiful ocean view, if we had to pick fault, then the balconies aren't very private, could really have benefited from a bit of a wall or screen between adjacent ones. The room itself is the nicest I think we've ever stayed in, large, good aircon, huge bed, nicely decorated & great bathroom area. They also provide an empty fridge for your use, (much better than an overpriced mini-bar!), stock it from the Cuban deli right across the street. The onsite restaurant/beach cafe is good for all meals from breakfast to dinner, but doesn't seem to do any room service, I had the best fish (grouper) I've ever had there. Our room was in the newly developed section and there was shady car parking right below the rooms, which are accessed from an open corridor. It's pretty much right at the bottom of Duval Street and we mostly just walked up to the busier, Mallory Square end, a taxi is under $10. It's not a cheap place but seem to have regular deals, we did a buy 4 get the 5th free package. The concierge service was very helpful and knowledgeable about things to to, but was a different person almost every day. The onsite Spa seemed to be very expensive, didn't try it, just saw the pricelist.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Choice”
Reviews.Author: thbrad
Reviews.Content: We originally booked one of the older rooms but were upgraded to one of the newer rooms upon arrival. The room was perfect and it felt like we were the first to stay in it. The pools were nice. We used the pool across the street at the Southernmost Hotel because there were not any crowds.
