The pool on the beach side was always crowded and folks looked like they were having a great time, it was just not our speed. The happy hour was great, I wish we could have went more than once... there is so much to do in Key West. If you are looking for white sandy beaches, this is not your place. While there are plenty of places to relax by the water, this place is lacking a great beach. Not a big deal though since we knew going in that Key West was not known for great beaches. On the down side, I left my camera charger in the room (completely my fault) after check-out and realized it when we were almost an hour's drive from Key West. We called and were told to call back and speak with housekeeping. After several calls with housekeeping, we have found that they are completely unresponsive. Apparently they do not realize that their lack of follow through can impact repeat business.

Reviews.Title: “could'nt have picked a better place to stay!!”
Reviews.Author: snifdog
Reviews.Content: My wife and I picked Key West to celebrate our Birthdays and with lots of searching for a place to stay we picked Southernmost on the Beach. We wanted a room with a view of the ocean, so we got a balcony room at the new part of the hotel. When we pulled up to southernmost on the Beach with a convertible we rented we said to one another Wow! The whole propertys grounds were beautiful, the pool and pool bar were wonderful. When we opened the door to our room we just loved it ,the room was the best very clean! We woke up every morning to a different sunrise.Everyone at the southernmost was friendly!! We would go back again! Southernmost on the Beach is our place!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Stunning”
Reviews.Author: Dawn29
Reviews.Content: This was our 1st trip to KW, but it won't be our last. To say this "resort" is gorgeous is an understatement. It's truly stunning. I would put this resort up against any located in the caribbean. We booked in the newer remodeld bldg (Rm 636). It is located on the 2nd floor with stunning views of the water. The room is breathtaking. The bath facilites include a separate space for the commode, a glass enclosed shower with seat and octagon window. A large vanity with complimentary bath supplies and the nicest surprise a full sized hair dryer. This room includes a small fridge and sink, flat screen HD tv and room darkening curtains. The beach area is large and includes beach chairs and unbrellas. The pool area is where everyone goes. It is an infinity pool up to 7' deep. There are no rafts or floats, but they do have many noodles to float around on or with. At night the pool is lit up with colored lights. A night swim is a nice way to end your day. The staff are accomodating and helpful. The concierge desk has many discounts and/or coupons for restaurants, excursions or drinks. Ask for a dinner suggestion and they are right on. They will call you a cab if necessary. With the high degree of humidity in Sept this was the way to go. The food at the on-site restaurant is a little expensive, but all of KW is. The pool bar offers a wide variety of drinks (offering a drink menu). I suggest trying the Zen. It's light and refreshing on a hot, humid day. Music is played during the daytime and piped through speakers located around the pool deck. Iced water is available all day without charge. And the water is good to drink. We will defnitely visit here again. You can't go wrong.

Reviews.Title: “Gotta love happy hour!”
Reviews.Author: KS-transplant
Reviews.Content: We spent a week at Southernmost on the Beach toward the end of July, & while it was hot, we had a fabulous time. Our room was great. I fell in love with the large tiled shower. We had a great view from our balcony, and we loved hanging at the pool or the Beach Cafe during happy hour. If you're spending time on the beach, they bring around frozen strawberries, pineapple, and watermellon. We had considered a few more expensive hotels closer to Mallory Square, but we were glad we chose the Southernmost instead & will definitely stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “Can't wait to return”
Reviews.Author: sage97
Reviews.Content: The room and view were great. Located on the quiet side of Duval, but an easy walk. The poolside bar was nice, but a little pricey. The rooms were well designed and very clean. The staff was really nice and helpful. We only wished there were donuts and coffee in the lobby for breakfast. We think for the price that would have been an option, instead always getting dress going to the cafe across the sand, or out in the car. My husband and I will most certainly return. All in all it was great and I would and have recommended this hotel to friends and family.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Accomodations”
Reviews.Author: MeanGreenTX
Reviews.Content: WE stayed here for our 5 year anniversary. Beautiful hotel with a great pool and one of the few beaches. I couldn't ask for a better place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Room, great views of the ocean.”
Reviews.Author: tschmaus
Reviews.Content: Our property was well maintained. Our room was recently renovated as the bed was huge, the bathroom was tiled and the shower was as big as my bathroom at home. You could fit 8 people in the shower. The comfy king sized bed had a direct view of the 50" flat panel TV and had high defination channels. Honestly i could have laid in bed and watched TV all day. The swimming pool had a pool side bar and you could order from the menu. Wait to book your activities until you arrive because the concierge, Amy, can suggest where to go, what to do, and she has great hook ups on the island. Everything was clean and I can't wait to go back.

Reviews.Title: “Wow!”
Reviews.Author: Sjc462
Reviews.Content: What a location! Paradise! We were lucky enough to have a room on the pool and beach side, however we were in low season so if booking in high season and looking to save money go for the Southernmost hotel as you have the same pool and beach rights as their sister properties. The best thing is you can swim in the pool up to 2300 hours. However, when we booked in the receptionist told us that there was a wedding at the restaurant so we could not use that however what they failed to tell us was that they'd obviously given the wedding party permission to swim fully clothed until 0100 in the morning. Because the night receptionist would obviously have dealt with this. Kevin the barman is welcoming and a good source of trips and has a goodlocal knowledge of things to do. We had breakfast one morning at the hotel restaurant.....don't. The service is poor, expensive and all they want to do is to place you in the sun so the eggs aren't the only thing to be fried! Go to Camille's in nearby Simonton Street if high season or a weekend book in advance. For eat's use the Hog's Breath Tavern, Sloppy Joe's or Guy Harvey's which are all at the Mallory Square end. To see the sunset then book into Fury cruises sunset snorkel and cruise, they have various stands along Duval Street including one right at the Mallory Square end. You get to snorkel North America's only natural reef and on the way back the Beer and Rum Punch never ends! The crew are also extremly friendly and welcoming. You also get to see the sunset without the crowds! My top tip is leave the car at the hotel, you could rent one of the electric buggy's but you have to pay for parking so instead rent a moped for your time there, its a fantastic way to get around Key West day or night and reasonably safe as long as you don't ride around like Easy Rider! Also they are free to park. We rented from a place called sunshine rentals but shop around and use the avaiable coupon books most of the companies will deliver and I think the ones out of the old town are a lot cheaper. A trip to this hotel would not be complete without usung the Ice Cream shop opposite which I think is a side line for a realtor's office!

Reviews.Title: “Nice, but will NOT go back”
Reviews.Author: KKozy
Reviews.Content: The room was nice but VERY expensive. There are no extras to make up for the cost. NO over and above customer service and we were there for our wedding. We DID NOT feel special and they did not even give a bottle of champagne on our wedding day or night. For the price, we wanted to feel like a King and Queen. But instead, we were TOTALLY ignored!!!! We will NOT stay there again!!!!

Reviews.Title: “couldn't ask for a better experience”
Reviews.Author: Redheadtraveler29
Reviews.Content: My husband and I went to Southernmost for our honeymoon - I am so happy we picked this location! The hotel's location was near the quieter end of Duval street - which was perfect for us. It was a short walk to a myraid of wonderful restaurants and a ton of fun activities. The staff was so great - Julie, our concierge recommended a great charter boat for kayaking, snorkeling and sailing. Without her knowledgable advice, we wouldn't have been able to find that great boat. The front desk were all friendly and attentive every time we went and talked to them. There were always grounds crews out and about, making sure the landscape was spotless and perfect. The pool and bar were so relaxing and fun, great bartenders with knowledge of the area. We will definitley be back and will recommend this locaiton to any one who is looking for a place to stay in Key West.

Reviews.Title: “like to go again”
Reviews.Author: Astrid63
Reviews.Content: Had a grate time there. The poolbar is super! The pool is very relaxing. The rooms are great. Only the last two nights were terible. . The fire alarm went off ervery few minutes and they coudn't fix it.

Reviews.Title: “Can't say enough good things about Southernmost on the Beach!”
Reviews.Author: cmiller2003
Reviews.Content: I was lucky enough to get one of the corner oceanfront rooms, which had amazing wrap-around views of the water as well as the string of boardwalks to the "north." I enjoyed waking up early, making myself a cup of coffee and sitting out on that huge balcony watching the sun rise. The room is literally at the water's edge, so when I had to work on my computer, I would prop open the double doors, and the sound of the waves made it seem like I was right there on the beach without even leaving my room! The property has lush landscaping and is well-maintained. There are small quiet beaches hidden throughout the property with hammocks and lounge chairs, or you can go to the busier part of the property to have someone fecth you your drinks. The rooms are spacious and clean, and I made good use of the mini-fridge and wet bar--very convenient! I also appreciated the fact that they don't charge for parking, WI-FI or resort fees. I met a couple who was staying at a property right next door that was paying for all of that! Being at the quietier end of Duval was also a big plus for me. I like the atmosphere up there better. Places like Martin's and Grand Vin are within stumbling... er, I mean walking distance! I will highly recommend Southernmost on the Beach to all of my friends.

Reviews.Title: “AMAZING! Can't wait to return!”
Reviews.Author: ciciwade
Reviews.Content: My husband and I booked this hotel for Labor Day weekend 2009 and we absolutely LOVED it. We enjoyed everything from the pier, pool bar, pool, beach, restaurant, and our room was fantastic. We booked several excusions through the concierage (Scarlet) and she was wonderful! Everything looks even better than the pictures on the website show. We cannot wait to go back next year!!!

Reviews.Title: “CHILLED!!”
Reviews.Author: ticalf00
Reviews.Content: My wife and I visit Key West yearly. We stay at a few preferred hosteleries but this was our first stay at The Southernmost on the Beach. It is the first time we actually 'Chilled' and had the most relaxing time ever. This was made possible by the resort's physical accommadations, but more importantly, by the STAFF's genuine concern for it's customers and making sure their stay and needs were met without disappointment. Every question or request of staff support was handled quickly and to customer satisfaction. There isn't enough space to do the establishment's personel justice! We especially liked Omar, Preston,and Estella(?) our pool attendant.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic”
Reviews.Author: Cageyconnie
Reviews.Content: This hotel had a great location and was within walking distance from everything. It is at the quiet end of Duval Street, which was wonderful. The entire staff was great. The pools were clean, the rooms very comfortable and had many amenities for us. The beach was beautiful and the beach staff brought frozen fruit, ice pops and frozen washcloths about every two hours. The cafe on the beach had excellent food and the wait staff was very friendly and efficient. The rates were good and they have many packages to choose from. The parking was free which was a definite plus as most places charge for parking. I will definitely stay there on my next visit to Key West.

Reviews.Title: “Nice and Clean”
Reviews.Author: olegopher
Reviews.Content: We stayed for two nights to try the other side of the island. The room was large and clean, pool area was very nice. We enjoyed the company of Rich and Melissa at the pool bar, freindly and helpfull. Being right on the water was nice and my wife enjoyed the hammocks out by the water.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Room”
Reviews.Author: UkDinoDog
Reviews.Content: We stayed in a new room with a partial sea view. Room was outstanding and well worth the extra. Pool area was great although a rowdy group of adullts with mission to party occupied it most of the time. They did get out of hand on a couple of occassions (using very explicit language and doing stunts in the pool) somone complained (with small children) and manager dealt with them efficiently and effectively. Our only issue was the cafe, we had breakfast there once, we thought it was very poor and when you get the bill with GRATUATITY NOT INCLUDED written in huge writing gives you an indication of where their priorities are! Overall though a fantastic place and probably best place we have stayed in the keys.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel, awesome pool bar.. horrible concierge.”
Reviews.Author: chacha5
Reviews.Content: Well.. I had been planning a trip to Key West for months to scatter my dad's ashes and we finally made it down a week ago. The hotel was beautiful.. great views, clean, food was good at the cafe.. wonderful service at the pool bar.. thanks Kevin, Rich, and Melissa :) However our stay turned for the worse when we used the hotel concierge to book a few trips. I won't go into what they were but needless to say we were disappointed. She booked us on the busiest day without telling us.. she talked us into something that was not for us. She probably knew what she was doing but was trying to make money instead of help new comers find activities they enjoyed. She gave us the wrong time to be at a ship and they wouldn't let us on and charged us for the trip anyway. We tried to tell a manager that she gave us the wrong time and no one seemed to care. Like I said, nice hotel... just beware of the concierge.

Reviews.Title: “GREAT HOTEL WE LOVED IT”
Reviews.Author: CNTRYLIVIN123
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed for 6 nights in a new king size room with a balcony. We loved everything about the room which included an awesome shower, coffee maker, in-room safe and refrigerator. The pool was very nice and clean with a view of the ocean. Pool bar is open until 11:00pm and if Kevin the bartender is working you will have a great time. The location was great and within walking distance of most sights. If it's too hot or your not up for a walk you can rent a bike or scooter ( scooters are awesome ) catch a cab or take a trolley. The hotel has a private beach nothing to get excited over, none of the beaches on this island are great. The reception staff was extremely friendly and very helpful. I do recommend the Hemmingway House, bars/shopping on Duval, Mallory Square sunset, a jetski tour around the island ( located next door on beach at Reach Resort and a scooter rental ( only way to see the island ). I would definitally stay at the Southernmost on the Beach again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel with an amazing view of the ocean”
Reviews.Author: sposse33
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Southernmost on the Beach in the "old" rooms. However, the room looked like it was new. The room was very clean and the staff was friendly. The location was great on the beach and a walk or bike ride from the "happening" part of Duval St. There are 3 pools at the Southernmost hotel bunch. The one one the beach has a bar as well as the one across the street. There is a somewhat hidden pool that is by the conference center that was very private especially at night. I would definitally stay at the Southernmost again.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: mom23ingt
Reviews.Content: This was a very nice hotel. The rooms are large and roomy and the balcony was very nice. The staff was exceptional. The pool area was nice and clean and family friendly. We had a great time at this property.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome experience for our wedding!”
Reviews.Author: lizzy4489
Reviews.Content: My husband and I recently got married in Key West, FL on August 1, 2009. We held our reception on the beach at Southernmost on the Beach. It was the perfect location for us and turned out to be more beautiful than I imagined. The food was delicious and the staff was great. We stayed at a suite at Southernmost on the Beach for our last 2 nights. The room was absolutely beautiful, and it was great for me and my bridesmaids getting ready on wedding day. We also stayed at the Southernmost Hotel earlier in the week, as did most of our guests. Everyone had nice rooms and had a great time at the pools, bars, and the beach!!! We had such a fun and amazing time at the Southernmost Collection! We can't wait to return to have more fun!

Reviews.Title: “So good we changed plans and stayed longer”
Reviews.Author: blackadder_wd3
Reviews.Content: We stayed at The Southernmost on the Beach for three days in late July 2009. We originally planned to be there just two but we loved Key West and the hotel so much we switched plans and stayed an extra night. Our room, 607, had an ocean, beach and pool view and could not have been more convenient. 2 minute stumble down the stairs and we were in the pool and/or bar. Although there was always music playing, the room was actually very quiet and The hotel also had a strict 11pm cutoff, so no problem at night. The Reception staff were very helpful, especially Linda who sorted out our extra night with no fuss and we even kept the same room. The only minor issues we had were that the air conditioning unit in the room was effective but noisy. On the last day our bathroom light was flickiering and the hair dryer fell off the wall - but now I am getting picky. Finally, the beach cafe where you can have breakfast had a limited menu - very tasty but even after three days we were looking elsewhere to eat. But these were just minor niggles that did nothimng to spoil a wonderful three days in a beautiful lolcation - we will definitely be back to Key West and I ahve no hesitation in recommending this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great room with an even better view”
Reviews.Author: DocSuMo
Reviews.Content: We stayed in one of the new Oceanfront King rooms (#540) - on the second floor - and it was wonderful. It was clean, updated, and refreshing. It always felt so good coming back to our room after spending the day exploring. They really did a great job in renovating these rooms. The view from the balcony was incredible and I loved sitting out there reading my book. (Only complaint would be that the balconies aren't very private if your neighbor is out on theirs as well) I also loved sitting in the hammocks that dot the property. It was fairly quiet and definately peaceful. The free wireless internet worked perfectly and the front office was very accomodating in letting us use their fax machine, several times. Parking is free and we always got a spot close to the room (and in the shade no less). They don't charge resort fees here, like many of the comparable resorts I looked at. The Cafe on the beach is pretty good. They have happy hour from 4-7pm with $3 drinks and apps - but you have to be sitting at the bar to get this deal. The pool was nice and I got a few drinks from the pool bar. The beach was not bad for the Keys. Overall, I really loved this place. I wish we could have afforded to spend the entire 8 days there!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect headquarters for paradise”
Reviews.Author: 32tango
Reviews.Content: This hotel is right at the south end of Duval Street, within comfortable walking distance of most of the attractions on Duval. It looks freshly renovated, everything brand new, and our room was gorgeous and spacious. New beds, decorations, flat screens in HD, and it looks like almost every room has an ocean view. Cold A/C (a necessity in July) ceiling fans, free fast internet, and a beach. The bathroom is huge, and they are generous with towels. My spouse has said for years that the beaches in the Keys are terrible. Her opinion has been changed, because there's 100 feet of clean white sand at low tide, about 80 feet at high tide, and the sand is raked/swept every day. 20 feet away is the Southernmost Cafe. The drinks are cool, the happy hour(s) long, the menu varied and the food cooked/presented imaginatively. If you don't want to go anywhere and just relax, you don't have to move. Finally, the service is friendly but efficient, and very approachable with a "what can we do to make your stay perfect" attitude. I am returning again and again and again.

Reviews.Title: “Small and Comfortable, amazing stay!”
Reviews.Author: Sizzle8
Reviews.Content: I went with my Dad and although we only stayed 2 nights, it was an amazing place to be. The restaurant on the beach is exceptional with great views and the food was really good. With three pools and a few spa pools, it was small but at the same time, roomy. There were a few buildings, only 2 floors on each with stairs on the outside, not like a big hotel with elevators! The rooms were small with a TV, wardrobes, beds, big shower, toilet and sink but the style matched in with the hotel. Plenty of room for parking, great service and the people are friendly. It is located at the far end of Duval Street which is famous for it's Arts and Crafts. Many restaurants and shops near by. Also, next to the hotel is a spot called, "The Southernmost" as it is the most southern geographical point in North Amerca. It is suitable for anyone really as this hotel is quiet, yet right in the middle of all the action in Key West. Amazing!

Reviews.Title: “Our new room was lovely.”
Reviews.Author: NewYork_NYBlackbird
Reviews.Content: The bed was one of the most comfortable I've had in a hotel, and I slept like a baby. The air conditioning was excellent, and very important in July. To the extent our vacation was less than perfect, it was our own fault for going to Key West in late July. One day lying out on the beach was the maximum my poor old skin could handle. I could imagine being there in February or March and really enjoying both the beach and the pool, which were very nice. I'm sure the food at the cafe on the beach is very enjoyable during those months when air conditioning is not needed. But do be warned that the cafe is NOT air-conditioned, and there is no room service in the rooms. I am not a particularly happy camper when I have to walk several blocks before my morning coffee just to get some breakfast. But if you don't mind that, and you get one of the new rooms (ours was distant ocean view, king-size bed, 3rd floor), you will have little to complain about. And if you appreciate a serene, zen-like room atmosphere and beautiful bathrooms as I do, then you may not ever want to leave the room anyway.

Reviews.Title: “Great place; stunning views!”
Reviews.Author: trisndev
Reviews.Content: We stayed in a "West Lawn oceanfront king" room in the older building. We had a great view out the window to the lawn and Atlantic. Check in was great. We arrived at 11 and our room was ready so we were able to check in early. My husband stepped on a sea urchin on our last night, and the staff was very helpful in helping us determine how to treat the stings. One reviewer complained of the small private beach; however, the public access South Beach is right next to the hotel, and it was never overly crowded, and hotel guests get free use of the beach chairs and umbrellas.

Reviews.Title: “The only place to stay in key west, clean, great atmoshere and close to all”
Reviews.Author: xmasdsf
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at Southern most on the beach as well as the hotel, The new areas on the beach are breaktaking. it is by far the only place to see while in key west. The beach cafe is great. we had breakfast there in the morning, good food and quanity. the view from the beach cafe is wonderful, just to sit there and have your breakfast and take in the ocean view and breeze only 30 feet away. very relaxing and yet if you want to visit the nightlife of Duval Street it is right there off Duval. no need to bother with cars or designated drivers, just walk up and down duval street and you really don't need much more than that. staff was extremely helpful and polite. Very clean rooms - pool view room are great for the southernmost hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Loved this awesome place on Earth”
Reviews.Author: MyHeartIsInJamaica
Reviews.Content: I stayed in Ocean View Room 642 (2nd floor). It was 3rd room from the beachfront rooms. I cannot say enough about how gorgeous the room was. The balcony was Yes, private & the views were so beautiful. I could plainly see the pier & the ocean from here. Checking in was super smooth. The room had a king size bed, flat screen tv on the wall, new tile throughout the large bathroom & super size shower area. The bed was sooo comfortable & so were the pillows. I am very picky about cleanliness & this hotel gave me zero fears. Towels, soap, shampoo everything was well picked & not cheaply chosen. The internet connection worked fine & parking was free. Elevator access was perfect. The balcony had patio furniture (2 chairs with a small table). I sat out here drinking coffee in the a.m. or relaxed in the evening just to breathe the air. There was plenty of dresser space for a full week of clothes for 2 of us. The room had its own hair dryer, iron & ironing board, security safe & small mini fridge for drinks. It also came with a small coffee pot with all of the condiments (coffee, cream, sugar (variety). There is a laundry area on the property near the office if you need to wash clothes. Everyday waking up here was lovely just gazing at the clean beautiful room. The groundskeepers were always busy cleaning & tidying. The small quaint beach area had chairs & umbrellas & small tables (no fees-all free). I asked for extra towels I got them, I asked for coffee - I got it. The location was the best & by looking at the neighboring hotels I am soooo pleased & happy about my choice. I got every pennys worth-NO DOUBT. It felt good knowing that my $ was spent worthwhile. We rented a car (it was cheaper to add it to my vacation package than to not). Im glad we did, it allowed us to get around & venture around the island more at any hour. Although we did not eat at the hotel - I did once want to order a late night snack from the restaurant but they didnt deliver. As others have said the hotel is far enough from all of the busy busy Duval street partying- so you are still at peace & safe. Check out was smooth & the staff were accommodating -housekeeping cleaned everyday if you requested it. I needed to print a coupon from the web & the desk clerk let me email it to them & they printed it for me! Howâ€™s that for service!!! If I ever go back to Key West I will stay here. We visited the turtle hospital in Marathon about 1 hr. away, the Dolphin Research Center in Marathon all in one day. We took 2 Catamaran Sunset cruises (Sunny Days is the best max 6 people awesome captain), snorkeled, parasailed, rode waverunners-around the island, & danced at the Garden of Eden just for fun. This was a fantastic trip. I travel around a bit & can say that this was truly quality. I was torn between the Waldorf & Southernmost & Im glad I chose this one. It was far worth it & the nickel & dime fees at the other

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful New Room and Stress Free Stay!”
Reviews.Author: gopher_traveller
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Southernmost on the Beach July 12-July 15th 2009 and had an absolutely incredible experience. Our trip to Key West was the best travel experience we've had as a couple and will definitely be returning soon! We stayed in the "New Oceanfront King" room which was on the third floor of building "A". You walk in to a brand new room that still has that new construction smell. Modern lighting fixtures, crown modlings, and beautiful, quality furnishings appoint the room. The bathroom has granite countertops and high quality Kohler plumbing fixtures. There's a walk in fully tiled shower with a bench. The toilet is also in a separate room and is powerful enough to suck down a grapefruit I swear :) King size bed with great linens, and there is a granite wet bar with blender, cofee maker, sink, mini fridge, and safe. A great set up and an easy way to save some money on drinks by bringing your own beer/mixers. Our room had a huge wall mounted 42 inch plasma tv - not that you're going to want to watch it with the view out your wrap around windows with roman shades. French doors open out to a wrap around balacony with 2 chairs, 2 small side tables, and 2 full chase lounge chairs. The view spectacular out into the atlantic. Check in went smoothly and there was plenty of free parking in the fully lit parking lot. Pool is nice but full of kids - if you're looking for something just head over to "south beach" and have Juan set you up with a chair/umbrella. The beach is free for hotel guests, but make sure to take care of juan - he works hard! The beach is small, but the sand is nice. There is a fair amount of sea weed/grass washed up on shore and in the water, but just hop over it and once you get 10 feet or so out into the water it's not rocky at all and the sand is quite nice. You can walk out quite a ways and get a nice view of the southernmost point in the U.S. Very cool. Restaurant/cafe is great, but of course you'll want to eat your way around downtown and spread the love a little bit! Overall, you can't go wrong with Southernmost on the beach - at least the new rooms, so make sure to ask for one. We were offerred to move to the bed and breakfast, but politely declined in favor of our pimped out brand new room. Got turndown service every night - was a very nice touch and wasn't expected or must have been included in the room rate.

Reviews.Title: “2nd visit even better!”
Reviews.Author: ecsmom
Reviews.Content: We stayed at SMOB last year during the construction and had a great time so we didn't hesitate to return this year. I booked the least expensive room with the 5th night free promotion which made it about the same price as last year. We had a "new king balcony" room in building D. I have to say that the new beds and pillows are better than what we have at home. I didn't hear hubby snore once! :) We enjoyed sitting out on the balcony in the mornings and watching the sail boats. The rooms on both sides were occupied but we never heard a thing. Service at the pool is great. both at the bar and at the tables and lounges. Rich makes awesome mojitis and rum runners. Towels are available by the bar for the pool and beach, We found everyone to be very friendly and made some new friends. I am sure we will be back for a 3rd visit!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Vacation”
Reviews.Author: josee1969
Reviews.Content: We just came back from one of the most wonderful vacation in a long time. We stayed in the new rooms at Southernmost Hotel on the Beach and had a wonderful time. The new rooms are absolutely beautiful, the service was great and the Southernmost Cafe's food was delicious. I would recommend staying at this resort to everyone.

Reviews.Title: “Southern Most - At The Beach”
Reviews.Author: JRD33141
Reviews.Content: Hello, We've just returned from Southernmost - Key West. My brother and his wife stayed at Southernmost - OTB. For those familar with the southern tip of KW, this hotel has taken the site of the old Atlantic Shores. We stayed at Southernmost Hotel. My brother had room 638 - ocean front. The room was spacious, had a wrap-around balcony, wet bar with fridge, big screen LCD TV, and great views. The bathroom was great, with a huge shower area. Parking was plentiful with the best spaces being under the building in the precious shade. Remember - even though there's a good breeze, it's still in the high 90's in KW in July! The beach bar is righteous, Cindy & Sara will take great care of you and with drink specials ($3 rumrunners) and $3 appetizers form 1600 to 1900, you can't beat it! We spent every afternoon there! The restaurant serves B, L, and D. We had breakfast 3 days and it was a good value. Corey waitied on us each time and was great! If you are looking for high end - brand new lodging, in Key West, we would highly reccomend SM - OTB. The room was gorgeous - the beach clean - the food and drinks very good - and the hospitality EXCELLENT! Please understand, SM - OTB and it's associated properites are - just like the name implies - on the southernmost end of KW..(It's not just a catchy name).. If walking to Mallory is a problem, the local cabs charge $3-4 for each passenger from SM. Not a bad deal when you consider the peace and quiet of the south end. This is a good place that simply keeps getting better. ENJOY! L&J Miami Beach

Reviews.Title: “Heavenly Honeymoon”
Reviews.Author: jklobs
Reviews.Content: My new wife and I recently had the opportunity to stay at the Southernmost on the Beach Resort and were absolutely delighted with our experience. The room we had was the one on the website, with the private balcony overlooking the ocean. The view was truly magnificent. The staff at the resort was extremely helpful and professional. This was one of the best vacactions I have ever had. I would recommend this resort in a hearbeat.

Reviews.Title: “Can't wait to go back”
Reviews.Author: Baxterdog8
Reviews.Content: We've stayed at Southermost Hotel twice now and would have no hesitation to go back again... and again. Rooms are really clean and comfortable, great bathrooms with large enclosed shower and all the nice touches - decent toiletries and coffee maker etc. As this is the only hotel we've ever stayed in at Key West I can't compare it but if there are 2 better places I'd be really surprised. All the staff were great and helpful and the other guests we talked to were also repeat visitors - and we met some really nice people outside on the balcony in the evening watching the sunsets and the cruise ships sailing off. It was also nice and quiet, away from the noise and the masses at Mallory Square. A totally fabulous and relaxing experience in a beautiful place. Can't wait to go back!

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely magnificent!!”
Reviews.Author: threepowells
Reviews.Content: Southernmost on the Beach should be rated the #1 hotel in Key West. I'm not sure the pics on the website do it justice! The rooms were great. We stayed in one of the older rooms with a balcony and ocean view. It looked just like a new room. Service was impeccable, pool was awesome, fitness center had plenty of machines, and the location was great. If we return to Key West I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Website does not do it justice....”
Reviews.Author: AWin76
Reviews.Content: We selected this hotel never having been to Key West and just going off other's reviews...it was AMAZING! This hotel's website does not do it justice! It's an amazing property..right on water..right next to South Beach (name of beach in Key West)...hammocks, lounge chairs, umbrellas everywhere...easy access into ocean right off private pier. The pool area was perfect, great drinks at the pool bar. We got the King Bed with Garden view and it was basically a building 100 feet from water. Once again, it was perfect spot to stay in Key West!!

Reviews.Title: “Perfection in Paradise”
Reviews.Author: pres13
Reviews.Content: My fiancee and I stayed at the Southernmost on the Beach for a much-needed escape from a miserable northeastern winter/spring. Chose SMOTB for its location--which is perfect for all Key West activities. All rooms have ocean views, but splurge for the oceanfront rooms--you will not be disappointed. Something to be said for relaxing on your private balcony overlooking water that seems painted from a palette of heavenly blues and greens. Rooms themselves are magnificent, nicely appointed and comfortable. Staff could not be friendlier or more helpful with any/every request. Great front desk staff, concierge, restaurant personnel, cleaning crew, pool attendants (say hi to Cella--she's the best!). You can relax at the pool, on the beach right outside your door or on the very cool tanning pier, from which you can take a dip in the aforementioned water by simply walking down some stairs. You're a two-minute walk from the Southernmost Point in the U.S., and an easy stroll to Duval St., with its myriad bars and restaurants and unmatched people-watching opportunities. In fact, you can pretty much walk anywhere in Old Town Key West from here, including to Mallory Square for the famous sunset celebrations. Hadn't been to Key West in some 20 years, but after staying at SMOTB, can't wait to get back. No place else we'd ever stay. The location and amenenities makes this hotel ideal, but its people and their level of service really make it something special. Just a great trip. Truly a slice of heaven in paradise.

Reviews.Title: “I would stay again in a heartbeat!”
Reviews.Author: cmackDetroit
Reviews.Content: I just got back from a week at the Southernmost on the Beach and cannot say enough about the hotel. We were greeted by wonderful hotel staff from the front desk (Hector) to the pool (Gizella). We stayed in the newer King oceanview rooms and have never felt so comfortable in a hotel room. They were clean, large, and I wish I had that shower and bed here at home. The pool was great and the Southernmost on the Beach Cafe was excellent. We ate there alot and everything was delicious. Kathy and Brian were great servers and we had alot of fun with them. Our flight out was cancelled and we were given a room across the street and the Southernmost Hotel and did not like that nearly as well. The staff was just as wonderful, but the hotel needs to be updated. I will definately stay at the Southernmost on the Beach again.

Reviews.Title: “can't say enough!!!!”
Reviews.Author: kissesac
Reviews.Content: This is a great group of hotels! The veiw from our ocean front room was spectacular. The room it self was very nicely appointed, clean and comfortable. Unussualy large amount of storage space ,which was very nice since we were traveling with two small children and all the stuff that goes with them. The hotel complex had three pooles between the two hotels, all of which were very well maintained. My only complaint in this area was the music. Im not a fan of modrn music and would realy have liked it if the pool next to the TIKI bar had played more "islandy" feelling music. That said the smaller pool (still very nice) had no music at all so you could always go there for a quite swim. The staff at The Southern most was excelant! Very freindly and always ready to help! Great range of room prices depending on veiws. All with in a few steps of beach or pools! Southern most on the beach is a little more expensive than the reg. southern most, because its on the beach. But the original Southern most is just across the street and im sure a good bet Also the hotels are right around the corned from the reasurants, shops and bars.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel, Misleading Advertising, Rude Front Office”
Reviews.Author: tlabell
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a family vacation to southern Florida and the Keys. My wife and I met in Miami and visited the Keys many times. We decided to take our teenage kids back to show them where we met. We wanted to be near the activities of Duvall Street, but still have some privacy. The Southernmost on the Beach Hotel met our needs. I agree with the other reviews, that the hotel was clean, the pool was great and the location was within walking distance of everything. Our reason for posting the review was the misleading advertising of an ocean view room and the way we were treated when we questioned it. We booked an Ocean View room for $329 a night on the hotel website. When we arrived we were given room 524 which was at the farthest end of building B from the ocean. To see the ocean you had to go out on the balcony, look 90 degrees to the right and you could see a 10 yard wide view of the ocean about 300 yards away. We could not believe this was the ocean view so we went to the front desk and were told that was it and that only a few King bed rooms faced the ocean. The next day we went up on the balconies of building C to find that they all had a panoramic view of the ocean. We went on the web site and found that they advertise both an ocean view and a partial ocean view room. We went back to the desk with a different person to relate our findings and again were told that our partial view from the balcony was the ocean view. It is obvious when you see building C that our view was not ocean view and the fee we paid for this ridiculous view was also much higher than the fee listed for a partial ocean view. We gave up a room at our time share with the HIlton, to pay for this partial view. Our reason for posting this review is to caution everyone about the definition of ocean view. We would suggest that you specifically ask how much of a view you will have and from where if the view is important to you and you are paying for the view. Outside of this disappointment and the rude way we were handled, the hotel lives up to its billing.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Weekend”
Reviews.Author: jazzergirl
Reviews.Content: We recently spent a relaxing weekend at Southernmost. We booked an ocean view room, not one of the newly remodeled rooms, but still beautiful! We were in room 605 overlooking the pool and the beach. It was very clean and the view was spectacular! I can't say enough good things about the hotel staff. Everyone we had the pleasure of dealing with was friendly and helpful. We truly felt pampered. Brain who supplied us with beach chairs was great! He brought us towel-cicles, sprayed our feet with cool water and gave us a cup of frozen fruit to enjoy. All of it made a very HOT day more pleasant. The location is wonderful also! It's nice to be on the quiet end of Duval St and the walk to Mallory Square is easy. The only suggestion I could possibly make would be for the hotel to offer room service. It was nice, however, to have a small fridge in the room. Our time at Southernmost was not nearly long enough so we are already planning a return trip!

Reviews.Title: “Great resort in Key West”
Reviews.Author: OhioHappyTraveler
Reviews.Content: Very attentive staff, nice rooms, great location near the quiet end of Duvall but still within walking distance of everything. Balconies with ocean views and reasonable rates. I was very pleased with out stay at Southernmost on the Beach.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Location, Chill Atmosphere”
Reviews.Author: Vacashe305
Reviews.Content: We just stayed 2 night @ Southernmost on the Beach and had a nice experience. We had a room facing the ocean, which was nice to wake up to. The room was clean and seemed to be recently renovated. The hotel is located right on the beach which is extremely hard to find in Key West. There was even a wedding being celebrated at the Hotel on the beach during my stay here. It has a pool w/bar and a restaurant all within 50 feet of one another! It is located on the quiet end of Duval street which is nice, but walking distance to all the crazy bars if you are into that. The staff was pleasant and concierge extremely helpful! You get what you pay for @ Southernmost on the Beach.

Reviews.Title: “Great *new* room - OK location. Would stay again for right price...”
Reviews.Author: TravelChic214
Reviews.Content: Stayed Memorial Day Weekend - Southernmost on the Beach was our second choice after the Ocean key which was sold out. Stayed with our two daughters ages 12 and 15. The room was great. New and modern. Very comfy beds. Balcony with partial ocean view was nice BUT only if our neighbors were not out on theirs. No privacy whatsoever on balcony. Bathroom was very large with a large shower. The grounds were nicely manicured. Hammocks are a nice touch if you can get one. Pool nice and clean. Parking is free and easy. Staff was the worst part. Understaffed at check in. Had to wait 10+ min to check in. Not overly friendly - just rushed. Night staff at front desk was downright rude. The night guy def. hates his job. I am convinced. Bartender at the pool was very slow. Too long of a wait for a drink when it was not busy. We rented a electric car and asked staff where to park. We parked where they told us and the car was moved over night to the street and we got a ticket! Not right. FYI: This hotel is NOT walking distance to everything. Unless of course you are in full hiking/walking gear. If you are dressed for dinner or a night out on the town you won't be able to walk. It is just too far and would be too uncomfortable in heels/dress shoes. Ocean Key or Pier House are much better choices for location to bars/restaurants/Mallory Sq. Also: NO sunset view. You have to go all the way down Duval to catch sunset - again, NOT walking distance. Unless you like LONG, LONG walks in the heat. So: if the price is right - stay. We paid $300+ a night. I wouldn't do that again. I'd spend a few extra bucks and head to Pier or Ocean Key. And don't forget NOT all rooms are created equal. You have to ask for the 'new' rooms!

Reviews.Title: “just as beautiful as web-site shows”
Reviews.Author: TampaBayLittlefred
Reviews.Content: the staff is excellent. rooms are beautiful and large. huge flat screen tv. great view from balcony. excellent bar staff. excellent cafe with full menu. get it? it is definitely the place to stay! the view and the entire layout is perfect. there are quiet places to rest or enjoy others by the pool.

Reviews.Title: “Sitting on the dock....”
Reviews.Author: Paveplage
Reviews.Content: A lovely place that we hope to return to. The staff was excellent, especially the concierges who went out of their ways to find us restaurants and reserve bikes, snorkel trips, etc. You can trust their suggestions. Large, quiet, airy rooms and a lovely dock that extends out into the sea and gets nice breezes. (Grab a chair early in the morning!) Excellent location, too. We only had a few gripes. The largest was the blaring music poolside. This is always a problem at resorts like this because the bartenders and waitresses like to have the noise, though I'm sure it annoys more than half the guests. Ask in the front office to have them turn it down. The restaurant is mediocre and a little grim, but useful at lunchtime. (Lousy breakfast.) And note that the rooms with 'ocean view' only have a partial view unless you get the large suite. Not that it matters if you're out by the beautiful water. All in all, a great experience, though not at all a bargain.

Reviews.Title: “Super convenient location with breathtaking views and awesome service.”
Reviews.Author: alk11nd
Reviews.Content: I love Southernmost Hotel and Southernmost hotel on the Beach. Their service is outstanding and the rooms are super clean. The staff are so wonderful, accomodating, friendly, and all have great personalities. I would never stay anywhere else in Key West even if my other location was paid for. This was our second time there and we loved the location the first time, that we decided to stay there again and get married on Southernmost Beach. The wedding coordinator (Melissa) was absolutely wonderful. She made the whole experience for us very relaxing. Our guests also loved the Southernmost Hotel so much, that I am SURE they will be going back. We will be going back there again, but not soon enough. I cannot say one negative thing about this place. Everything there was perfect from check-in to check-out.

Reviews.Title: “This is Heaven”
Reviews.Author: ddelaquila
Reviews.Content: Just stayed at this property for the third time! Everytime in a different section, and always amazed! The staff is also great! The Beach Cafe has great food, and right there. It is a good walk down Duval, but as long as the sun isn't out, it is a very enjoyable stroll. We just took a cab down and walked home. Go to Louies Backyard...The Afterdeck for drinks on the beach...it is very close by. The pool at night is so refreshing and they play great music...Jack Johnson, just very chill. The rooms are fabulous. I cannot say enough, and will be back next year.

Reviews.Title: “Best Trip Ever”
Reviews.Author: KimW51
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Southernmost on the Beach and it was one of the best places we have stayed from start to finish. The staff were helpful and so upbeat, from the check in staff, to the bartender, to the cleaning staff. We had our luggage shipped there and it was waiting for us in our room. We had Room 53 which has to be one of the best rooms in the place - Own private patio with the most beautiful view. Hammocks on the grounds, great pool, great location - definitely walking distance to everything. Can't wait to go back!!!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel”
Reviews.Author: jorgenhaa
Reviews.Content: This is a fantastic hotel in Key West. Everything was perfekt. Thanks for a great weekend.

Reviews.Title: “Best spot ever! Best one you can imagine in the area!”
Reviews.Author: juliaxix
Reviews.Content: Beach where Tennessee Williams used to swim. Marveloussly turquoise water. Palms, hammocks, incredibly white sand, fantastic swimming pool, charming staff. You pay a bit more than in other spots in the town, but boy do you get what you're after! The town is so small that it is close anywhere anyway. Unless you wish to stay in an epoque villa a few streets away, this is the place 2 go! Very clean and modern bathroom, daily cleaning service, free of charge WiFi. You can snorkel in the proximity of the hotel, you can go and visit Ernest Hemingway's villa and many more :)

Reviews.Title: “Much too expensive for what it is...”
Reviews.Author: PaulLux_9
Reviews.Content: We spent a night there beginning may 09. Their web site and location are really nice...however the hotel management forgot to say : 1. That the room with a view on the ocean actually have only a small window in front on which everybody walks to get to their own room (so you have to use the blinds all the time). 2. That we could hear pretty much everything that was going on in the room next door. 3. That there was a wedding party that night, and we had to use earplugs in order to feel that the speakers were not in our room. Oh I forgot : there is one magnetic key that we forgot to leave at the reception : USD 9.5 After having paid USD311 for the room. A real rip-off.

Reviews.Title: “Great views but the room could have been better”
Reviews.Author: alcie27
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed in room 623 the last week of April and the views were fantastic. This is the room that is in the older part of the hotel and it's on the end with a GREAT view of the ocean. But even with the wonderful views I wouldn't stay here again. We were in Key West the last week of high season so we paid a very high rate for the room thinking that it would be worth it for the views. But we had ants all over our bathroom, the shower door was broken, the safe didn't work and when we checked out we found out they entered the wrong code on our account when we made reservations. Because of this code error we got a 25% discount on nights three and four when we should have gotten a 50% discount on those nights. The guy at the front desk was not helpful at all and told me to call reservations when we got home. So based on what we paid I think that we could have found a much better place to stay, even if we didn't have the ocean views and if we go back to Key West we won't be staying at the Southernmost on the Beach again (or any of their other properties).

Reviews.Title: “Could not ask for anything better! SMOB made our trip special!”
Reviews.Author: AlohaStyle
Reviews.Content: My wife and I along with our 5-month old baby stayed at the SMOB for a couple nights and loved it so much, we extended our stay one night. We couldn't have asked for a better hotel, room, location, service etc! Since we had a 5-month old baby and would be in our room more than usual, we spent a little extra for their new building's Oceanfront room and it was well worth it! I typed up a Key West trip report and talked about my hotel experience and here it is: Wow, was this room NICE! As you walk in the room, you are staring at the crystal blue water through the deck french doors. On the deck, the ocean is directly below you with wide views to the left and right. Wow, I think we saw Cuba! :) For anyone thinking about the Southernmost on the Beach, I would HIGHLY recommend it! Of course people may have different opinions based on what room they get, but we could not have been happier with our room, cleanliness, service, pool, beach, location etc. The room was immaculate, clean and very modern. It came with a fridge and nice kitchen/bar area, a nice sitting area, huge bathroom with nice shower and an awesome wrap-around deck with a few chairs, 2 tables and a lounge chair. We received turn down service with chocolates and the shades being drawn. Hotel guests receive free lounge chairs at the beach which is really nice. The beach shack worker even came around offering free popsicles which was a nice treat while simmering in the sun. The beach had some seaweed/grass wash up, but nothing major. We could easily walk the beach and was able to let our 5-month old take in the ocean waves for her very first time! The pool is nice with a newly built pool bar adjacent to the pool. There were plenty of chairs, tables and shades for people with wait service taking orders for drinks and food from the Beach Cafe. The pool was decorated with 2 small cascading water falls which served the purpose of giving me a great neck/shoulder message while being in the pool. I would definitely recommend this hotel for anyone!

Reviews.Title: “Luxurious and Relaxing Resort!”
Reviews.Author: irishhag
Reviews.Content: While a bit pricey for our budget, my sisters and I found that this hotel was worth every penny! Our room was very clean, big, and looked out onto the water (spectacular!)! Everyone was very nice, and the pool was perfect. There were amazing hammocks, and that was my favorite part. I don't think I'd stay anywhere else-- it was clean, beautiful, relaxing, and the atmosphere was great-- no crazy partiers or geriatric community-- just a lot of people there to relax and have fun. Perfect!

Reviews.Title: “BEAUTIFUL”
Reviews.Author: BostonSunshine16
Reviews.Content: We were originally staying at the property across the street, the Southernmost Hotel. we had a little sugar ant problem, which they tended to right away. They explained to us how sugar ants are harmless, and they are everywhere on the island, but when we walked across the street and saw the Renovations they had done to Southernmost on the Beach, we asked to be moved. They moved us with NO problem, everyone at the desk was very nice...and we headed to our "New" room!!!! They did a Wonderful job, the buildings across the beach are Beautiful!!! People were walking around maintaining the grounds, and the pool area, they had smiles on their faces, worked hard and paused to say, "hello". The rooms are Gorgeous!!!!! Overlooked the beach, and we had the best weather, and a Wonderful time!!!! We LOVED the Property and KEY WEST!!! We will be back!!!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Hotel”
Reviews.Author: rrcoopers
Reviews.Content: Great hotel... Beatiful location, very nice rooms and amenities, and the staff was terrific. You'll love the hammocks and balconies, and a very, very comfortable bed. We'll definitely be staying there again.

Reviews.Title: “This was the best vacation we've had!”
Reviews.Author: RestfulReader7
Reviews.Content: The hotel is beautiful and the staff is incredibly friendly and helpful. Everything is clean and beautiful. The hotel has been remodelled recently and it shows. The landscaping is well cared for as is the pool and the rooms. We had a wonderful time relaxing in the hammocks and swimming at the pool. The hotel is on the quiet end of the island, fitting our purposes well. Every staff member treated us well, even remembering our names sometimes. I can't recomend this hotel enough for rest and relaxation.

Reviews.Title: “A wonderful stay and amazing wedding”
Reviews.Author: JenD_in_DC
Reviews.Content: I am just back from getting married on the Southernmost Oceanfront. I cannot say enough great things about my experience this past weekend. The staff at the Southernmost were all gracious and attentive, but I must give special thanks to Melissa Shaffer who assisted us with our wedding, John at the front desk of the Southernmost on the Ocean and all the wait staff who worked at my wedding and brunch the following morning. If you are thinking about getting married in Key West, this is your spot. The setting is beautiful, the food is delicious and there is nothing like watching the sunset while partying on the beach. Most of our guests stayed at the Southernmost on the Beach and raved about the new rooms. By all accounts they are well-appointed with terrific views. We stayed in Room 410 at La Mer, which is a beautiful room with a large wrap-around terrace. The pool at the Southermost on the Beach is so warm and clean. I uncharacteristically skipped the ocean altogether. My husband and I also indulged in the couples massage on the morning of our wedding. This took place on a secluded area of the beach and was very relaxing and peaceful. We will come be back next year for our first-year anniversary--assuming we can get in once people discover this amazing hotel.

Reviews.Title: “This was a perfect experience”
Reviews.Author: jerrygarcia50
Reviews.Content: Our family of five booked a reservation at The Southernmost on the Beach at the 11th hour last year. It was such a great experience we did it again this year (2009). The amenities, service and setting were fantastic. Key West is a bit like New York City -- you like to see Time Square but you'd really rather stay somewhere else. At the Southernmost, your proximity to all the cool stuff on Duval Street is close, but it is set on the beach on the opposite side of the Key from the cruise ships and partiers. It is quiet, beautiful and secluded. The upgrades during the winter of 2008 are a hit, too. We would (and will) definitely stay at the Southernmost on the Beach again.

Reviews.Title: “2nd Honeymoon”
Reviews.Author: jerzman01
Reviews.Content: My wife and I recently made our 2nd trip to Key West, FL to revisit the town and places of our Honeymoon 6 1/2 years ago, We chose to return to the Southernmost on the Beach Hotel complex. Specifically, we stayed at the Le Mer / Dewey House at 508 South Street in Key West. A lot has changed in the past 6 1/2 years ... newly acquired property, newely constructed buildings, the acquisition of the Sunset Cafe and general upgrades all around. The complex is simply beautiful. The southern veiw is exceptional. Sunrises are amazing. The entire staff (especially Sam & Heather) absolutely know how to treat their guests! From the daily breakfasts & afternoot teas, to the complimentary robes, being pampered at pool side, the white sand on the beach, the cleanliness of the facilities, the constant attention to the landscaping, the evening bed turn-down service, complimentary resturaunt coupons ... they leave their pampered guest wanting for nothing! We've vacationed at sea side resorts both in the USA & abroad. Few of the really nice places we've stayed can ciompare to what we experienced at the Southermost on the Beach facility. Carole & I thank everyone very, VERY much. We won't be waiting 6 1/2 more years to see you all again. Dave J.

Reviews.Title: “Impromptu mother/daughter trip over Easter”
Reviews.Author: kjow
Reviews.Content: We booked our trip 6 days before our arrival- took advantage of the "5th night free" deal. Everthing was amazing! The veiws-phenomenal, staff- friendly, food-great! The pictures of this place did not do it justice- IT IS BEAUTIFUL!!! I only wish I would have talked to the concierge, Julia sooner. We met her the last day we were there and she was so nice and knowledgeable of the island and all it's activities. She has lived there her whole life- what better resource could ther be?! We did the "Do It All" adventure with Sunset Watersports- that was a blast!!! We rented bikes for a few days and rented an electric car for 2 hours. The bikes were way better- the parking isn't so great in-town and you end up having to walk anyway. This facility far surpassed our highest expectations- it's was Wonderful!!! We will be back!

Reviews.Title: “Caribbean without leaving the US”
Reviews.Author: RoboColorado
Reviews.Content: I love this place. The rooms are gorgeous and the location is fabulous. It's located at the calm end of Duval St., yet it's just a few blocks from all the action. The other end is a little honky tonk for me. All of the good restaurants are within walking distance. The new pool and pool bar is right on the ocean with a garden area adjacent. With the beach next door, there is always a cooling breeze. Staff was very helpful and good concierge desk. We flew into Miami and drove down. We rented a car one way and dropped it off upon arrival. We rented another one to go back and saved a bundle. You don't need a car during your stay. We'll be back for sure.

Reviews.Title: “a place we will never forget !”
Reviews.Author: Fakke
Reviews.Content: A top hotel to stay. The location is best of the best next to the beach. We came all the way from Belgium and travelled around in Florida. We have been in several hotels and we must admit that this one exceeded our expectations. It is truly a must see and a must do ! The staff is exceptional. They are so helpful and friendly. We would like to thank Monika Peerson in particular (housekeeping). She managed to send us a package to Kissimmee Florida (Disney) after we had checked out in Key West and forgot something in our room. She was so friendly and helpfull, so especially for her : a big THANX. We will definitely come back to this hotel. Franky, Annelies, Dylan & Kyle from Belgium

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Stay--Highly Recommend”
Reviews.Author: Thorn054
Reviews.Content: My family and I stayed at the Southernmost on the Beach resort and absolutely loved it. The rooms are all newly renovated and most have a great view of the ocean. The pool area is beautiful and the grounds are extremely well kept. In fact, we saw several staff members walking the grounds daily and inspecting things. They really keep the place in top shape. While this hotel is at the quiet end of Duval Street, everything is easily within walking distance and there are tons of places to each nearby. I travelled with teenage kids and they found plenty to do nearby. My family can't wait to go back and stay at this resort again. Stay here--you will not be disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “ok, but small rooms and very noisy cheap a/c unit”
Reviews.Author: Digest
Reviews.Content: Pros: Clean rooms, clean property beach access right on the water with pier for laying out Nice small lawn Grounds are well kept staff was very nice No pets allowed which is always a plus Cons: Renovated old motel - small rooms, very bulky furniture for the size of the room, bad lighting A/C , kept us up all night, very cheap window system, very noisy NO ROOM DARKENER SHADES, bulky window treatments Pool not saltwater, chlorine ballance was off

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Hotel and Great Time”
Reviews.Author: USCGolfer
Reviews.Content: My family and I stayed for five days during our Spring Break. The hotel was perfect. We stayed in the new section in a room with two queens size beds. It was very nice...comfortable beds, big bathroom, walk-in showers, flat screen HDTV...would recommend to everyone. It is at the very end of Duval Street but in an easy bike ride of everything while being in a quiet location. I would not only recommend but will be back.

Reviews.Title: “Southernmost on the Beach is a fantastic hotel that provides a Carribean feel right here in the United States.”
Reviews.Author: dhcolb
Reviews.Content: My wife and I spent five days at Southernmost on the Beach. I am a very picky traveler and have to say that they exceeded all my expectations. The room and the hotel grounds were spotless and magnificent. The pool area was right next to the beach and had a beautiful view of the ocean. The staff of the hotel was very nice an accomodated all of our needs. I highly recommend this hotel for couples and families. We plan to visit again as soon as possible.

Reviews.Title: “Comfort, Cleanliness,Charm equals Great Value”
Reviews.Author: sneakersNewjersey
Reviews.Content: This is the REAL DEAL, what you see is what you get. My wife and I asked for an oceanview room, and we got an exceptional ocean view room with a balcony. The staff was always friendly and helpful. Their cafe on the beach has excellent food, (Brkf, lunch and dinner ) and the prices are reasonable. This resort is well maintained and cared for. It is in the quiet part of town, close to everything, one block from Duval St. This resort exceeded our expectations and we had a very relaxing, enjoyable and fun vacation, WE recommend this resort to all age groups. We can't wait to return.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Santa Maria, but SMOB was by far the best place to stay for the price”
Reviews.Author: waterchaser
Reviews.Content: Our second trip to the Keys found us at the Southernmost at the Beach... and I mean ON THE BEACH. The bar at the pool was always hopping... the beach was a stone's throw away and the restaurant (ON THE BEACH) was fantastic. A very short walk to Duval Street and a short crawl home. We could not have asked for a better vacation. We will be back SMOB! p.s. Try Opera for dinner one night... you won't believe the food. I think I had the best filet of my life.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Room”
Reviews.Author: GBGilly
Reviews.Content: We were really surprised to find the kind of room we had for the price. Location to the beach, resturants and the heart of Duval St. was the best. I would stay at this place everytime I come down if the prices do not go too high. Other places miles away were more expensive and then you had to drive after having fun all day. This place is within walking distance to most attractions. Landscaping was exceptional, flowers, plants and lawn that looks like a putting green. Pools with tiki bars/priceless

Reviews.Title: “Unbelievable,Very Nice,Friendly and fun”
Reviews.Author: searay24
Reviews.Content: One of the best places I have ever stayed. I have done alot of travel abd I will definately be back. The staff is wonder

Reviews.Title: “Southern Paradise - a true find”
Reviews.Author: cross-check
Reviews.Content: I've stayed at 5* hotels. But I honestly don't remember them very vividly. Southernmost is not a five star but I will never forget my two days and nights here. This was not just a regular stay, this was a true get-away experience. Maybe it was the hammocks in the garden, maybe the location on the beach, maybe it was the ocean view when opening the front door in the morning, maybe the sturdy rum runners at the pool bar, or maybe just the great company but there was something over this place that can't just be categorized as "excellent". Amenity-wise there's free wireless, free parking, a welcome package upon arrival, decent breakfast next door on the beach, daily events at the pool, massage at the pool and close to everything else. I never wanted to check-out. I will come again. I will stay in an ocean view room because it's SO worth it. Overall rating: Loved it.

Reviews.Title: “A Time We Will Never Forget”
Reviews.Author: keywest4life
Reviews.Content: This hotel gave us an experience that will last forever. The service was top notch, the food was incredible, i can't say enough about the visit. We are coming back this year for another great experience.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it!”
Reviews.Author: himicats
Reviews.Content: This was our first trip to Key West and we loved it. The room was great, bathroom very roomy. Oceanview was good. Lounge chairs for the sunset were perfect. We'd go back in a heartbeat.

Reviews.Title: “Had a wonderful time!”
Reviews.Author: ladygirl
Reviews.Content: We stayed there for 4 days in February and after reading many reviews (mostly positive) I'm glad we chose this resort. We stayed in a brand new building, opened only a couple of weeks. The room was lovely with a balcony. Although we didn't have a direct ocean view (the front desk offered a couple of room options for us) both the beach and pool were close and easily accessible. The service was exceptional and the area was quiet and many of the restaurants were in walking distance. We did take the trolley tour which took us to Mallory Square and were able to get off the trolley at any of the stops and pick up the next one, which was very convenient. I would definitely stay at this resort again. Now that I have seen the layout I would probably ask for a more direct view of the ocean next time.

Reviews.Title: “stay here if you want peacefullness”
Reviews.Author: davewrines
Reviews.Content: Hi this hotel is great My wife and myself came here for our honeymoon stayed in room 638 wrap around balconey on the end complete view of the ocean and quiet and peaceful you could here the waves in this room is located on the 3rd flr the beach is to the right and sitting location write down below Stayed here the week of 3-24-2009 the room is huge .Huge walk in shower 5x4 and clean the housekeeping staff there awesome ,along with the rest of the staff very accommodating thanks southern most for having a great honeymoon sincerley D rines PS these photos are not docked they are mine

Reviews.Title: “My favorite place in key West”
Reviews.Author: csiebert
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at the Pier House, the Hyatt and several other places and the Southernmost on the Beach has been the best. It's convenient location is ideal for walking everywhere. There's also a bike and shooter rental across the street if you desire to cruise around. Can't say enough about the hotel to do it justice. We stayed in the new king ocean front room. It was a beautifully decorated large room with a wonderful bathroom. We had a wet bar w/refrigerator that was a great extra to keep water, wine and a few beers cold. We enjoy spending time in our room(on the balcony) listening to the surf and taking in the beauty of the ocean, especially being there at full moon. Can't think of a better place to do that than the Southermost on the Beach. The staff was very attentive...always doing "the extra" to make our stay more comfortable and enjoyable. The pool was nice(but cold)...great place to have refreshments and lunch. The beach cafe, which is right outside your door, is very good. They have done a fantastic job re-landscaping the resort. Many great restaurants within walking distance. My favorite is Louie's Backyard, pricey but worth it. El Siboney has good cuban food, Camille's just up the street served a wonderful breakfast. Le crepes of France(?) has the best gazpacho, plus crepes and salads are outstanding. Could go on and on but time to close. I rate Southernmost on the Beach as a 5 star.! Will definitely go back in 2010.

Reviews.Title: “Best choice if you like the beach and want quiet but want to be close to nightlife”
Reviews.Author: MDI1
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel based on some tripadvisor recommendations and we were not disappointed. It was the perfect choice for us. We loved the location, the beach, the pools and the room. I would highly recommend this hotel and would definitely stay here again. With that said, I would not recommend eating at the restraurant. There are much better places to eat in Key West.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful, peaceful location”
Reviews.Author: Cheshiretravel
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 5 nights, on our first trip to Key West, in an Ocean View room. The room was beautifully furnished, clean and well equipped. The shower room was enormous, with plenty of space to put things down. The bed was comfortable, and the tea/coffee machine was welcome. There were plenty of places in the grounds, or on the beach to sit in hammocks and sun loungers, but our favourite spot was on the jetty. Sitting there, in the Florida sunshine, watching the pelicans diving for fish, was absolute bliss! The Ocean View was actually a sideways view from the balcony. As our room was only the second room back from the ocean front, we still had a good view, but people in about the eighth room back may have been disappointed. The buildings and gardens were all of a high standard, and the location was peaceful. It took 25 minutes to walk down to Mallory Square. The staff were friendly and helpful. The restaurant was alright, but we preferred the Banana Cafe for breakfasts (on Duval St, on the right, about 200 yards down). Other great places to eat were The Bistro (on Duval St on the left, past Truman and Olivia) and Cafe Marquesa (Fleming and Simontown). This latter was rather cramped - they had squeezed a few too many tables in, making it congested and noisy - but the food was fantastic. The Butterfly Conservatory just round the corner on Duval St had a wonderful gift shop. Overall, staying at the Southernmost on the Beach was a most delightful experience.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful, Relaxing, Tropical Paradise!”
Reviews.Author: Nukeguy0
Reviews.Content: We just completed a stay at the Southern Most on the Beach. We really enjoyed our stay and look forward to the next one. The people at the front desk were very accommodating in all aspects! They even extended our check out time to accommodate our late flight and told us where we could store our bags temporarily. It really makes the stay all that much more enjoyable when you feel welcome and not like you are a bother to anyone! The entire complex looks great after the addition and gives a very pleasant and relaxing atmoshere to enjoy! They maintain a very high level of standards and make you feel very much at home! Looking forward to our next stay,

Reviews.Title: “Paradise Found...”
Reviews.Author: Michigangirl09
Reviews.Content: Paradise foundâ€¦thatâ€™s pretty much how I feel about Southernmost on the Beach. Iâ€™ve stayed at the hotel before and have loved the whole experience, but they just finished the new rooms, the new pool area and fitness center and itâ€™s breathtaking. I donâ€™t know about you, but when Iâ€™m on vacation, I usually donâ€™t want to spend much time in my room - until now. I stayed in one of the pretty new rooms with an ocean view and a small balcony that I could enjoy the sunrise from. The rooms are really spectacular and beautifully appointed with dark mahogany furniture, crisp white linens, a duvet, modern lamps, and a flat screen TV. Youâ€™ll lose yourself in the big comfy bed. Iâ€™m not sure if itâ€™s a feather bed, but it felt like it. The shower is really roomy and even has a bench to sit on. The bathroom has fluffy white towels and great amenities like shower gels, lotions, and a blow dryer. What was also cool was the new â€˜eco-friendlyâ€™ heat and air conditioning. When you walk into the room, you insert your door key into a slot and then you can turn on the air or heat. When you pull the key out, it turns the air and heat off â€“ a really nice energy-saving tip that I think we all appreciate these days. The old parking lot has been replaced with grass, palm trees, chaise lounges, and hammocks, and offers another area besides the pool to relax, sun, read or just hang out. The pool area has a hip new bar that we took advantage of. The private pier is still there and is still great to relax on. Also, the whole oceanfront area by the pier is sandy now and offers another area where you can chill out. We left the property a couple of time to wander down Duval, but other than that, we just hung out and read by the pool or on the beach. You really never have to leave, unless you want to. The CafÃ© makes great food for breakfast, lunch, and dinner and theyâ€™ll even bring it to you at the pool. While a lot has changed, some things never do â€” and thatâ€™s the Southernmost hospitality. The team there â€“ from the bartenders to the staff at the Beach CafÃ© to the front desk â€“ all go out of their way to make sure you feel at home and have everything you could possibly want. Itâ€™s nice seeing all the familiar faces year-after-year, too, which is great testimony to the management team. If you havenâ€™t stayed at Southernmost on the Beach, try it. Itâ€™s the best resort on the island of Key West and now itâ€™s even better.

Reviews.Title: “Pricey but nice”
Reviews.Author: APatter
Reviews.Content: Very nice staff. Rooms small but nice. Beds nice. Room clean. VERY disappointed in balcony with ocean view. Full of bird droppings. Chairs covered with bird droppings. Table covered with bird droppings. Bad! Hotel restaurant led MUCH to be desired. Poor service and cold food. But it was very pricey must admit. Very very small beach area. Great location though within walking distance to all downtown sites.

Reviews.Title: “Not bad, but there is better.....”
Reviews.Author: MitziMom
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the new Southernmost on the Beach last week and were disappointed to be awakened by landscape construction each morning. The noise made the balcony rather unenjoyable. We had been assured that the construction would be finished when we arrived. The room itself was quite nice with very classy decor and a huge bathroom and shower, lots of amenities such as a blowdryer, ironing board and iron, mini fridge and lots of storage. I loved the tile floors that look like wood! The landscaping between the buildings is very nice and the new sandy area between Building A and the other building seems like it really should have been a pool. It was finished the last day of our stay. Looks great....but too late to enjoy. Unfortunately, Building A also backs up to the loading zone of the Reach hotel and it too can be noisy. The worst part for me, was the disjointed feel. With the older part of the hotel mostly across the street (along with two pools and jacuzzi), it just didn't have a resort like feel and you need to walk thru the parking lot and pool area to get to the restaurant for coffee. We didn't swim as it was too cool during our stay. Pluses 1) GREAT location on the end of Simonton or Duval Streets. 2) proximity to Abondanza (a really romantic italian eatery), 3) adjacent to the Southernmost point and 4) lovely rooms in the new buildings.
