Minuses 1) Motel feel as you drive under your building and park. 2) Elevator reaks of cat pee in building A 3) Not quite finished 4) A disjointed feel between the two hotels 4)Proximity to Camille's - YUCK! Having been to both Casa Marina and Southernmost on the Beach, I would choose Casa Marina hands down. Last year, Casa Marina had some of the same issues, but this year, the staff was helpful and friendly and for my money...I'd stay no where else next time.

Reviews.Title: “Best Hotel in Key West”
Reviews.Author: camellia10
Reviews.Content: We came to Key West about four years ago, and were going to stay here but I got scared by reviews. This year, I decided we definitely wanted to stay here, and have had a FABULOUS time, so I wanted to make sure to write a good review. I have stayed in five places in Key West, and this one is, by far, my favorite. We had an oceanfront room that had a gorgeous view of the gulf. It was one of the new rooms that just opened in Dec. 2008. Comfy bed and pillows. Mini-fridge and coffee maker in the room. Easy to use thermostat for air conditioner. The bathroom was wonderful-large with good shampoo/soap etc. Shower was large with a bench. Wrap-around windows and balcony with chairs and a lounger right on the ocean. The decor was subtle-navy blue, white and khaki. Beachy without being tacky. The USA Today was delivered to our door every morning. We ate breakfast and lunch at the restaurant. The food was good and reasonably priced. The bar tenders were very nice and the drinks were affordable. (The drinks are less expensive at the restaurant bar than the pool bars.) I swam in the heated pool at the Southernmost Hotel, which is part of the property. While the one at Southernmost on the beach has a great view. it was not heated, and it was a bit chilly while we were here. Complimentary beach towels make it easy to swim in the ocean or the pool several times a day. What I like best about the hotel (besides its oceanfront location) is the fact that it is right on Duval, but at the quiet end. It noticeably got quieter as we walked back from the Mallory Square area last night. I am not a late night person, so I appreciated the calm and quiet With the new addition, they put in lots of pretty landscaping. Overall, I would recommend this hotel to anyone! Things to do nearby: Butterfly Conservatory, Southernmost Point, Bike and Scooter Rentals, Duval Street with shopping, several restaurants. At hotel: three pools, two pool bars, one restaurant/bar, a semi-private beach with free chairs and towels for hotel guests, gift shop, private sunning pier, probably more things that I did not try! (And, though I sound like I'm writing a sales pitch-I'm a writer, and that's how I sound!)

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful brand new direct ocean view room, construction during the day”
Reviews.Author: puddlejump
Reviews.Content: We took advantage of Southernmost OTB's December 2008 holiday special right before Christmas, when they discounted their brand new rooms. The new rooms are fantastic, spacious, clean, comfortable, hardwood floors, classy furnishings, wireless internet, huge bathroom. We got one of the rooms directly on the end of the building overlooking the water, with unobstructed views; it was like being on a cruise ship with a balcony, only with a lot more space. One drawback is that the adjacent resort has a service loading area at the end of that street, so you cannot open the wrap around windows on that street side, unless you want that ugly view; we had a corner room with wrap around deck. Additionally, there was landscaping construction going on below during the daytime; Bobcat and lots of digging. The new buildings and rooms were completed and furnished, all that remained was the landscaping, so in a few months (by February?) it should be serene. Parking is included on the ground floor of the new buildings, the new building had no ground floor rooms; this was very convenient, since we could drive anywhere we wanted on the Key. We were told we were the first guests to stay in that room. Dexter at the front desk is awesome! Unheated pool felt cold, heated pool was cool, hot tub was boiling. We ate twice at Alonzo's, once at B.O.'s fish wagon, once at the NY Pasta Garden. All were good, but B.O.'s took 30-40 minutes just for oyster po' boys and conch fritters. NY Pasta Garden is a good deal. Alonzo's was tasty, crowded during happy hour. Loaded up on Key Lime pie and lime products at Kermit's. We strolled Duval Street and did touristy stuff during the day. Did not stop at Bahia Honda this time. It was a nice relaxing trip. Our room with the balcony view was so great, we spent lots of time in there. Definitely one of the nicest hotels on Key West, if not the nicest, as most do not have direct water access nor a beach. You know you are in a good spot when you see people coming down on foot, moped, car or bike just to check out your view. On the peaceful southern end of Duval, but close enough to walk to the busy area. Curious to see how their rates are once the construction is finished.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed the Southernmost”
Reviews.Author: CinReg
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the new rooms "on the beach." They were beautiful and roomy - with a large bathroom and shower. The staff was very friendly and helpful, and the food at the restuarant was great and not over-priced. The property is located across the street from the Trolley Stop and around the corner from The Butterfly Museum. If we ever make it to Key West again, we would surely stay at this resort!

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay in The Keys”
Reviews.Author: MidwestCouple2009
Reviews.Content: From Her: We recentley stayed in Key West from Jan 8-12. We were so fortunate to stay at The Southernmost on the Beach. We book an intro rate with this hotel in the new part. This had recently been renovated. The staff gave us rooms next to each other. Room 639 and Room 640. When we opened our room doors, Wow! We entered a spacious nautical room with an ocean front view. The private balcony was only 5 feet away from ocean. The rooms were spacious and new. There was a grocery store across the street with trolley stop. We were one block away from Duval street to the South. This was nice an quiet away from the nightlife of Duval Street. The beach was within walking distance. We enjoyed laying in the hammocks near the private pier. Breakfast was great at the Cafe on the beach. We hope everyone enjoys their stay as much as we did. From Him: Being from the midwest we didn't think staff at hotel or resturants were to freindly. Night life was fun, people watching was awesome, and parasailing great. Food good, bonus if u like seafood, lots of choices. Mallory square was fun at sundown, talent was interesting, not great but entertaining.

Reviews.Title: “Little peace of Heaven in florida Keys”
Reviews.Author: sarahanne1972
Reviews.Content: Stayed here from 18th-31st Dec 08. We could'nt believe our luck as the hotel has just had a facelift and complete re modification. This was wonderful everything was brand new, we walked right onto the beach from our room. Wonderful hotel on beach with excellent food, and very very clean accomodation top top marks and highly reccommend to others. Situated on quiet end of Duval Street so peace and quiet guarenteed but for party and fun on duval st only 10-15 min walk. Cant wait to return

Reviews.Title: “Good value on quiet end of Duval”
Reviews.Author: PhillyBased
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Southermost Hotel on Duval (SHOD) 12/21/08-12/27/08. It was our 3rd trip to Key West but our first time staying at the SHOD. Overall, we had a lovely experience. Our favorite bars and restaurants are on the Mallory Square side of Duval, so we found ourselves hiking the mile or so Duval walk several times a day. We stayed in one of the cheaper rooms overlooking the parking lot. However, our room was quiet, and although a bit outdated, very clean. We had no issues except for one morning when our AC unit was rattling. We called the front desk and maintenance immediately came up to fix the problem. Also, our luggage didn't make it to Key West on the same plane, unfortunately! The airline delivered our suitcases to the hotel, and the staff immediately brought them to our room. The pool area was wonderful, with many chairs in the sun and also shaded. The pool bar had some easy snacks such a hot dogs and chips/salsa. Several days we walked over to the Southernmost Beach Cafe for a bigger lunch. If you're looking for a good pool and tiki bar for a better price than the Westin or Hyatt or Ocean Key, this is a great location. Some restaurant / bar recommendations: 1) Alonzo's Oyster Bar (at A&B Lobster) on the marina - we ate here 3 times! The food is fantastic (especially if you like oysters) and atmosphere lively. 2) Conch Republic Seafood on the marina - we always stop here for a drink. Great views of the water. 3) Roof Top Cafe - we had our Christmas night dinner here. Fancy but not stuffy, eat outside on the deck. Great for a special occasion. 4) Sloppy Joe's - a must to hear some good live music Activity recommendations: 1) Butterfly Conservatory: this is right across Duval from the hotel. What a pleasant surprise! Exotic butterflies in a lovely greenhouse. 2) Day trip: We rented a car at Tropical Rent-A-Car (across street from hotel) and went up Rte 1 to about Mile Marker 40. At MM 29, we went to the Key Deer Refuge on Big Pine Key. This is free (please leave a donation). We didn't see any key deer (which are nocturnal), but we did spend time at the fresh water pond (called Blue Hole) and saw an alligator. We then drove up to MM 39 to Bahia Honda State Park. Lovely little beach and walking trails where we saw several iguana. 3) Sunset Cruise: Take the Fury catamaran sunset cruise. We are partial to Fury since we were married on a Fury sunset cruise in December 2007. Laid back and the crew keeps your cup filled with beer. Best way to see the sun set is out on the open water.

Reviews.Title: “Incredible Stay”
Reviews.Author: aj273
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Southernmost on the beach this past weekend and we had one of the best vacations ever, other then the fact that the stay was too short. The hotel and staff were wonderful and you can't ask for a better location to stay if you are in Key West.

Reviews.Title: “Most Beautiful Location Ever”
Reviews.Author: beachlurk
Reviews.Content: Excellent. This is a quality hotel in a spectacular location. Well-appointed room. Beach, complete with a nice gentleman to bring you complimentary mini-cups of chilled watermelon cubes. Sunrise in one direction, Sunset in the other, perfect both ways. I felt wonderfully spoiled the whole time. Remembering it will always make me smile.

Reviews.Title: “Great pool and pier”
Reviews.Author: JacquelineB
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Southern Most on the Beach early Nov. Pool is now open, although patio area on one side closed (looks likea new bar being built). Building work makes sitting round pool not an option as quite noisy /dusty - there is a grassy area with chairs and hammocks which is good option. We spent most days on the pier - whilst you can still hear the building work you are facing away. As other reviews suggest it looks like this will be great when complete but I am a litle sceptical about how the facilities will cope with increase in customers. Work looks likely to be complete 2009. Rooms are spotless, looks recently decorated. Beach bar does a great breakfast. Great location for Duval street - about 20/25 minute walk each way (well "ish" --- it depended on the weather and the beer consumed). I thought a little expensive for what it was but then you are paying for location - I would definitely go back but after the building work is complete

Reviews.Title: “The most beautiful hotel on the beach in Key West”
Reviews.Author: pgricco
Reviews.Content: This hotel is the southernmost hotel in Key West and it was just perfect. My only complaint (which really isn't a complaint) is that they are adding on the hotel in the large lot next door. The plans for this hotel is amazing and I cant wait to go back and see the results. However, if we wanted to sleep really late, we were out of luck - the construction was a bit noisy but they are almost done. The hotel staff was OUTSTANDING! They were very accommodating and friendly. The best staff member was Juan, the beach guru and favorite of all the guests. He took care of us during our time on the sands! THANKS JUAN! The room was beautiful and just a few short steps to the beach. The beach cafe is also amazing with great drinks. A great hotel and a great vacation! I'd go back tomorrow!

Reviews.Title: “Not much of a beach”
Reviews.Author: jdt58
Reviews.Content: A very small beach and not good bathing off it either.There is also buliding work going on so the pool is closed.The pool in their adjacent hotel can be used however.

Reviews.Title: “Southernmost was Superb”
Reviews.Author: VirginiaTwinTraveler
Reviews.Content: My husband and I had the opportunity to stay at Southernmost on the Beach July 24-27 to celebrate our 10-year anniversary. It was our first visit to Key West and we'd compiled quite a bit of recommendations on places to stay, eat, visit, etc. I must say we were very happy w/ the choice to stay at Southernmost on the Beach. The first night we stayed, everything was just as we expected and ideal. The next day, Friday, we were a little concerned about the preparations going into a reggae concert to be held on the property and were a bit bothered by the fact that the parking spots in front of our room had several larger trucks (concert-related) and really made sitting on the porch to enjoy the view and some R&R impossilbe. But, we were most impressed by the hotel's willingness to move our room and offered to do so w/out a fuss or w/o guilt trips, etc. I can honestly say, if we'd had to "battle" for a different room, it likely would have jaded our trip. The hotel did everything it could to ensure our visit was a good one and they efficiently and effectively handled a large concert crowd. We had no idea the magnitude of the concert when we rec'd the "heads up" phone call at home prior to our arrival and it wasn't until we arrived and saw just how big of a deal it was that we better understood all it entailed. The staff seemed completely organized and on the ball and the intrusion to the guests was minimal. We hope to return to Key West again and we'll certainly want to stay at Southernmost on the Beach. The location is PERFECT (maybe 2 blockes to the action on Duvall, but far enough of away that it's not loud or obnoxious. And it's right on the beach--which is RARE in Key West!)

Reviews.Title: “Love Key West, Nice Hotel but a little disapointed.”
Reviews.Author: imailin
Reviews.Content: We rented this hotel and they told us that the deluxe King Room from which we paid $166.00 a night will have an Ocean view private balcony. Turn out that when we got there our "Ocean view balcony" was not more that the hall way to all the other rooms.... yes, we did had a ocean view but not a private balcony. For the Money was not worth it. I could just rent a room for $110 a regular room at Southernmost Hotel (owned for the same company but across street). They were under construction (which I new about) but they never told me that the Pool was going to be close, so we had to cross street to the Southernmost Hotel to go to the pool (which had the tiki bar closed as well) The cleaning service was nice, and the location of the hotel is excellent. I have no kids but I also have another complaint: On Saturday July 26 they had a concert in the private beach the Hotel has. So since Friday they were doing preparations. Same people from the hotel that had kids did not buy the tickets (which I understand since it was $25 per person) the problem is that they CLOSE down the beach from 2 pm on Saturday (when the concert was going to be at 7 pm) and they did not allow people to go to the ocean. WHY??? Why? People rented the hotel for that weekend was not advised that the beach was going to be close down!... now think about this: you have kids in a Hotel in Key West with a closed pool and closed beach.... no fair!!!!!! They also gave us two roomâ€™s keys (as usual) but by the second day one of the keys did not work any more and we got lock outside the room for 15 minutes until someone came and told us that â€œit was nothing but a OP (operation problem) with a bad attitude like if we were responsible. Poor customer service!

Reviews.Title: “Great stay”
Reviews.Author: BriBriUK
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 5 days had a great time.Rooms were clean and tidy staff very helpful. Aircon was a bit noisy. Try and book an upstairs room they are slightly bigger and theres a small balcony as well. No real beach to speak of but there is plenty to do nearby. Would definitely recommend the snorkelling trips had a great day out.

Reviews.Title: “Questions before you book here”
Reviews.Author: donna007_8
Reviews.Content: What a lovely website--how beautiful it looks on line---we decided that is where we will celebrate our 25th Wedding Anniversary. And then we got there::: The Pool---closed--Why? CONSTRUCTION on the property. The Beach---dirty, seaweed (never raked up)and the smell. I am not kidding--it smelled. The odor carried its way into the resturant on the beach. (made breakfast unbearable)--- The rooms were clean--They did have other properties across the street that had pools and we were allowed to use them. But honestly that just took away from the romantic feel of the place. We paid to have ocean view and on the beach and near the pool. But the pool was closed, the beach was dirty and smelled and we had to walk across the street to the other property to swim--We might just have well not paid the extra money to stay by the beach it was a waste. We are frequent travelers of beaches and this I tell you is NOT a beach. Ask before you book. Donna of South Elgin, Illinois.

Reviews.Title: “Not bad...not wonderful....Doable.....”
Reviews.Author: JessieStarr
Reviews.Content: Property is at the quiet end of Duval. Get ready to walk at least a mile each way if you want to go to the other end of Duval where most of the bustle and sunsets are....we drove but parking is very hard to find. we walked everywhere. there are people taxis but they charge too much. The property was clean, room was nice and clean. Bathroom was nicely rennovated. But its just a room. Bed, TV, bathroom...and the photos misled me because i thought we had a true balcony, but really each room just has a walk out to the walkway/balcony that is all connected. and its outside your entry door. so there is no balcony off the back of the room. the photos on the web site are totally misleading there. The beach is small and cute, but the water is totally unswimmable and even too brown/murky/seaweedy for wading to cool off. we didnt even use the beach here because it was too hot to not have somewhere to cool off. this is not a true beach, just a sandy spot. So overall, the hotel was so-so. The pool was out of order which we did not really care about anyway because it was small and unattractive. Go to the Southernmost hotel pool with the tiki bar. MUCH nicer! We were lucky to meet a honeymooming couple and stay at their 2-bedroom luxury suite for our last night, at no cost. These are 1.5 million$ suites that they rent out for less than $250 a night and are 2 bedroom, so VERY affordable if you have 4 people. They were AWESOME, subzero appliances in the kitchen, 3 bathrooms, granite counters, kohler applicances, glass walls, an tropical poool set up. So this blew the Southernmost out of the water. It was called Santa Maria suites and ill write a review there too. Anyway, the Southernmost is at the quiet end. If we go back, I will stay at the Santa Maria suites or at one of the many cute questhouses/b&bs...they are more centrally located. The 2 beaches in Key West, Smather's beach and Fort Zachary st park are good. We had a car so we drove. Dont try to walk to Ft. Zachary Taylor beach, about a 30 min. walk each way in the HEAT....drive there. Nice beach, decent water but not totally clear and rocky bottom. Smathers is much longer and has many food vendors. There is a lot of sea grass but if you walk over it, you get to a clear portion of the ocean which is great. We did a Fury all day boat tour which had snorkel, parasailing, jet skiing, kayak, breakfast, lunch, drinks and other water games. $139 pp, includes a sunset cruise which is pretty boring but has free alcohol ( for another day).....have done many many tours and this one ranks up there as the most worth is one. That is a lot of activity for $139 pp...very good price. did a lot of research on food beforehand and it paid off. You MUST go to: Blue Heaven - breakfast Santiago's Bodega - dinner (tapas) ilTrattoria - Italian dinner and there is a salsa bar in the back, separated Ambrosia - Japanese 5 brothers for empanadas and cuban lunches Rooftop Cafe for dinner Hog's Breath bar for $10 oysters overall, loved Key West, loved the food especially, the bars, Duval street, the beaches, even though there are few, the people, everything, it was great!

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, shame about the building work and noise”
Reviews.Author: traderWirral
Reviews.Content: A great setting for a hotel and as they say right on the beach and just off Duval Street where it all happens with about a ten/fifteen minute walk to sloppy joes and the cente of town. The room was fine with all you could need if not a touch on the small side. booking in was no problem but after that the reception staff offered little or no help with local knowlege or any small problems we may have had. The main drawback was the MAJOR building work that was taking place during our visit. A large extention to the hotle was under construction just to the rear of our room and work would start at 8.00am. At one point the pool was shuttered off whilst it was still in use. We felt that on occasions we should have been given a 'hard hat' to get to our room. This we felt should realy have been made mention of on the hotel web site. Still worthg a visit, but wait until the work is over!!

Reviews.Title: “It's the Southern"most"”
Reviews.Author: thewanderer93
Reviews.Content: As a first-time guest at Southernmost on the Beach, my experience was wonderful. I was on the second floor with a beautiful view of the ocean and the beach, which was a great spot for catching the sunrise and watching the activity on the beach (or the lack thereof.) The beach is nice and intimate with lounge chairs, umbrellas and the Southernmost Beach CafÃ© that you can wander up to in your bathing suit or shorts. Whatâ€™s great is that itâ€™s open air, so thereâ€™s always a breeze flowing. The food is excellent; I especially liked their Sesame Tuna and their Key Lime pie. Plus, they made a really tasty vodka gimlet. I loved my room. It was nicely appointed with colorful new bedding, a bistro table, two chairs, and more than enough drawer and hanging space for clothes. My room also had a built-in desk for my laptop, free wireless internet and â€œworkingâ€� air conditioning. The first night I was there, I couldnâ€™t get onto their wireless network, so I called the front desk and by the time I returned from dinner, I was pleasantly surprised to find their IT guy had taken care of my problem. Itâ€™s rare to find such prompt and friendly service. The location of the hotel couldnâ€™t be better. Right in Old Town, I walked everywhere - the Butterfly Museum, the galleries and restaurants on Duval Street, and Mallory Square for the sunset. If you donâ€™t feel like walking, the hotel has cute scooters for rent. If youâ€™re a wine lover like I am, wander down to Grand Vin, introduce yourself to Buzz and chat with the locals. We had a great time at this lively little joint. Louieâ€™s Back Porch, Antoniaâ€™s and La Te Da are some of the other cozy places we stopped at to have drinks and dinner. I would definitely stay here again and would highly recommend it to anyone whoâ€™s looking for the best location, a quiet beach and great accommodations.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel, Better View”
Reviews.Author: MappyB
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Southernmost on the Beach mid-May 2008 with three girlfriends and had a great time. There was only one disappointing thing, we had paid extra for an ocean view room with private balcony, and our room was directly over the parking lot, with the ocean to the left through the palm trees. That was a bit misleading. However, the facilities were great, our room was not near the current construction, so we had no distractions. The beach was small with a cute restaurant on site. Beach chairs were $5.00 for the day, however, so be prepared for that cost. The pool was very well maintained and the temperature was great. There is a tiki bar on the other side of the property, Southernmost Hotel, and the staff there was fantastic. Our server was so nice, attentive, and friendly. The atmosphere of the hotel as a whole was perfect, you couldn't be more relaxed. I only downgraded my rating due to the non-direct ocean view, but I would absolutely stay at Southernmost on the Beach again.

Reviews.Title: “First choice in Key west”
Reviews.Author: onthesnow
Reviews.Content: This is the finest location and property I have ever seen in Key West. Having stayed at various locations in Key West and now having stayed at Southernmost, I wouldn't even think about staying anywhere other than Southernmost and its annexes, Dewey House and La Mer. The facilities, staff, cleanliness, furnishings and service were all flawless.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay!”
Reviews.Author: efcoleman75
Reviews.Content: Beautiful views! Great Service! The ongoing construction did not disturb us at all. Heard people complaining about the beach because it was not pristine and had some seaweed on it. I saw them rake it twice during our 4 day stay. The water was calm and beautiful. The beach chairs were free but they will charge you $5 for using an umbrella and there were no signs warning you of this extra charge. The sunning pier was great with chairs, umbrellas and steps right down to the water, if you aren't a big fan of sand, this is great! The pool was beautiful and staff was extremely helpful. About 1mile walk to the action end of Duval but nice that the Inn wasn't near all the noise. Prices are a little steep but overall it is worth it. Would definitely stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “Love-Hate Visit”
Reviews.Author: SuttonPlace
Reviews.Content: Will not go back there! Cannot recommend the place! Positioned at the Southern end of Duval Street The Southernmost on the Beach is a fine facility. Our room as requested had full ocean view and the detail of its appointment compensated for its small size. To park the car at reasonable distance from the room is a continuous battle every time you move your car. Insufficient spots. The beach bar/restaurant though far from gurmet is a nice plus. Despite all these said, and even without what really upset us, we thought it was overpriced. The check-in was exceptionally friendly. The problem was the housekeeping. Or rather, the lack of it. The room was not made up the entire day (we stayed 2 nights). A quite uncooperative property manager (Adelheit S.) failed to accomodate our basic and repeated requests to clean the room. Why she sent a housekeeper exactly in the single half an hour that we were in despite that she knew that we are leaving in minutes (we had been out for the rest of the time from 9:00 am - 5:30 pm) and then she accused us rudely of refusing service I can have only one guess: they are serious staff problems at the Southernmost and therefore the service is substandard at best.. An iritating factor is the "sweet" barrage of correspondence that the management showers on the prospective and past visitor. They requested a post-stay evaluation, but as this turned out to be negative they left it without any answer. Just a good PR, a receptive response, would have taken care of this iriate and wronged customer and I would have gladly forfeited this public review. However, they haven't got either a polite property manager, a good housekeeping service or a smart PR person.

Reviews.Title: “April 2008”
Reviews.Author: TNBearfan
Reviews.Content: Wife and I stayed April 2-5, 2008. Stayed in an ocean view king suite and loved it. The bed was comfortable, ample closet and drawer space, nice bathroom with dual vanities, tile shower and separate bath, nice wet bar like kitchen with microwave, mini-fridge, cups, plates, silverware, blender, and toaster. View was nice overlooking the pool and the adjacent beach. Had a nice safe in one closet that you programmed a new code every time you locked it, so no keys and no pre-programmed pass codes. Beach was VERY rocky, and if you want to use it, aqua-socks would be required. Pool was clean and clear. Hotel is located at the quiet end just off Duval, and we regularly walked to all the attractions. Only took the car out once to check out other areas of Key West. Construction noise was present, and did wake us one morning at 7:30am, but only one morning. They are building adjacent to the hotel, but we really didn't notice the noise. They've blocked view of the construction site (and prevented dust and debris) with plastic. Check in was a breeze, parking was sufficient, but if they were very busy, you probably would have to park across the street at their other hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Could do better - great pool though!”
Reviews.Author: Amanda A
Reviews.Content: The good points - a great pool, one of the best I have been in. Clean and clear, and we had it mostly to ourselves! Our room was clean, the beds were comfy and there was enough wardrobe and cupboard space. BUT the building work that is going on at the moment was more annoying than we had been told. The workmen seemed to do the loud pile driving from 7 am in the morning. We lay there wide awake from 7 am one day - the day we were supposed to have our lie in on. We complained to the management but they could not do anything. Oddly when we lay by the pool we didn't hear any noise - they seemed to be noisiest early in the morning! Also, our room was on the ground floor and cars parked right outside the window. So we kept the blinds shut when we were in the room in the day which made the room slightly dark. The hotel gave us an extra lamp as soon as we asked. At the end of our stay, because we had complained about the noise and the light, we were given 10% discount off our bill, which we were pleased about. I think I would have preferred to have a more central location, this hotel was right at the end of Duval Street, with all the action at the other end! My mother did not want to walk a mile every day to get there so we took taxis. So overall, clean pretty hotel, helfpul staff, fantastic pool, but I was disappointed, especially for the price.

Reviews.Title: “March 08”
Reviews.Author: dwkestner
Reviews.Content: stayed from Friday - Tuesday, noise was not a problem, parking was ok, rooms were nice and better appointed then a "motel" as described before. Pool was good enough for me. Meal and drinks at the beach bar were fine and staff was helpful. We were allowed early checkin. As far as expense, everything in Key West, food, drinks lodging is expensive. it was nice to be able to walk to so much (we did take a taxi to a sunset cruise at the Westin Dock). None of the pools were spectaular, but they were generally uncrowded, and we injoyed the tiki bar at the sister resort. The beach was seaweedy and water was murky (beause of high winds).

Reviews.Title: “Very nice, some negatives”
Reviews.Author: evieleigh
Reviews.Content: Everything was very nice. Very clean, nice front desk staff. Concierge didn't speak much English, and when I asked a question, he just said he didn't know. Other problems, the construction next door. They were just about on our roof at 7 am nailing etc. It was annoying. I knew about it in advance, and was assured there were no issues. Very wrong. The other negative is that there is a bar on the beach, but you are not allowed to take your drink to your chair. The staff at the beach bar was very indifferent. They didn't care if you ate/drank there or not. Rates are high considering the construction.

Reviews.Title: “Location Location Location...love this place!”
Reviews.Author: kerri53
Reviews.Content: This place is nearly perfect....the rooms/bathrooms were roomy and immaculate (had a room with two queens with private balconey overlooking the ocean/beach bar)...close enough to walk to the "action" yet far enough to allow for a little quiet. Beach bar was wonderful...reasonable prices and how can you beat the location. I read the other reviewers complaints re. construction noise...they did not appear to be working the three days we were there (perhaps b/c it was a weekend?)....no noise at all from that.

Reviews.Title: “Still Way Too Much Noise”
Reviews.Author: TWOBLINDMEN
Reviews.Content: Stayed at hotel first part of Feb. for long weekend for wife's birthday in a second floor room overlooking pool and beach- great location - watched the sunset everynight, easy walk to Duval St. - rooms nice and well appointed - beach small, but ok, bar and resturant on beach had good food and service. The previous notes I read before going indicated problems with construction noise. I didn't give them full credit - should have. They are building 80 new rooms right next door to current hotel. Every morning the noise started between 7:00am and 7:30am - Saturday, Sunday and Monday morning. Thought they might have given us a break on Sunday, but it was the worst. Not only were all the construction vehicles making lots of noise, but it sounded like something was being attached to our building or they we tearing something off of our building with all the hammereing and vibration that was going on. I truly don't believe management gives a damn about it - told me at check out I should have called the front desk - like it was my fault and they were somehow going to stop all the construction. - and when I sent a response to their email request for feedback - I indicated the above problems and have yet to see any response. Would not stay here again at least for a couple of years -- they told me at check out the current 80 rooms will be done in Oct. 08, but then they are going to start working on the old building and new pool and beach -- sounds like it may be 2010 or 2011 before all the construction and noise are gone -- for all the noise this hotel is very very over priced.

Reviews.Title: “Expensive Motel!”
Reviews.Author: Andalu
Reviews.Content: Pricey for a motel, wow. The rooms are clean, but it truly is a drive-up motel, with an old pool. It's right on the beach, but not a very pretty or usable one. It is nice that it's a bit away from the noise but still very walkable.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding”
Reviews.Author: Mayzinger
Reviews.Content: We had an outstanding time. The room was great, we could hear the waves crashing at night. We stayed in a King, balcony ocean view room. Pool areas were great and the beach was fantastic. Walking distance to everything. Construction behind the property is not an issue, the hotel did let us know it was going a few weeks before our stay which we appreciated.

Reviews.Title: “Nice but NOISY”
Reviews.Author: Tracylynn2821
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I stayed at the hotel for what we thought was going to be a long quiet New Years week stay. We were wrong, we were woken up on New Years Eve morning at 6:30a by construction going on next door. By 7:30a the lamps on our night stands start to vibrate so much they moved across the tables! I complained to the front desk and yes they were nice about it but then went on to tell me to expect it again New Years Day morning. Sorry this is not what I want on vacation. We ended up checking out the next day and moving to another hotel down the street. Had it not been for the construction this hotel would have been great, the noise was just too much way too early in the morning.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the beach location”
Reviews.Author: LetsGoIslandGirl
Reviews.Content: We (my husband and ) just returned from our Dec 6-9 stay. We would definitely stay here again for the beach access. We are lazy people so we like to roll out of bed and onto the beach. This was our first trip without the baby, so we chose Key West because we were looking for a place without lots of babies/kids. There were a few, but for the most part Key West is for the adults. Our room was a 2nd floor balcony, but it overlooked the parking, so we didn't hang out there. We had heard about the ongoing construction, but we did not hear any noise at all. No trucks, no banging, nothing. We saw the workers, so they weren't off or anything. The rooms face the other side anyways, so even if they were banging around I'm not sure we would have been bothered. The property is in a really nice quiet location and an easy walk to Duval Street. Our room was nice, but we weren't in it hardly at all. The 2 houses across the way (La Mer and Dewey) looked really nice though, but not worth the extra cost to us (maybe if it was a special occasion). We only stayed out by the pool our last day, so we wouldn't be all sandy for our return home. It was nice, but nothing could beat the beach. There were only 2 umbrellas available for rent, but we were able to get one easily. Maybe because it was $10. We think they are nice especially if you plan to lay out all day. You can leave for lunch and come back, so you do have your chairs/umbrella for the whole day. We didn't care for the food at the beach cafe. Across the street is a little cuban cafe and we got our cuban coffees there for the beach. Banana Cafe was fantastic for breakfast. Of the 3 nights we were there, we ended up eating dinner twice at 915 because it was so delicious (the whole fish was perfect, also yummy was the chicken wrap, devils on horseback, and chipotle conch chowder). For our third dinner, we were very pleased with dinner at Alice's. I had a skirt steak that I'm absolutely craving right now. I don't remember where we ate ours, but stone crab claws are must. Mangoes was a nice place to sit for lunch, but we were very disappointed with the way oversalted food. The mushroom appetizer was just gross. Back at the hotel, the front desk was kind enough to print our boarding pass for us. We drove from Ft Lauderdale airport, which we would not do again. I don't know how much more it would have cost to fly directly to Key West, but I don't want to drive the 4 hours next time.

Reviews.Title: “Building Site”
Reviews.Author: bobmoodydoc
Reviews.Content: We stayed 5 nights and left on the Friday after Thanksgiving. A very nice room but the adjacent building site was noisy from very early in the morning. The pool is advertisedas Olympic-sized. I do not know what this is meant to convey but the pool is not 50m in length. Front desk staff were very helpful but the car was often left on the other side of the road in the sister hotel(Southernmost). because there was no room at Southernmost on the Beach.

Reviews.Title: “Love Love Love this place!”
Reviews.Author: Mbeth1263
Reviews.Content: We started out our honeymoon at the Tropical Inn B&B. It was nice, but not worth the $$$. Toward the end of our stay in Key West we happened upon the Southernmost Hotel. If you're not a guest at the hotel for $5 they give you access to their beautiful pool and a cocktail. We ended up staying an extra night just so we could stay here! We got a cabana right next to the pool at a GREAT price. I wish we would have known about this place from the get go, we would have saved hundreds of dollars. If you stay here be sure to order food at the pool bar, they had the best sandwiches I have ever eaten and are really reasonably priced. The room was small, but beautiful and clean. All we really needed since we weren't in it much at all anyway. We will be staying here for our anniversary next Sep.

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant”
Reviews.Author: Tiggerleic4
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Southernmost whilst touring for 4 nights. It was great. Room overlooked the pool and on to the private beach. Everything was near to hand. Shop was just across the street. Cruse ships in the distance, tropical rain storms and sun sun sun!! $5.00 for a beach chair was fine, drinks were on tap and we hopped back through the gate to the pool which was a good size. You don't want to swim in the sea it is a little dull. Just watch the sand creatures my husband got eaten so spray feet well with DEET. I really struggled to fault it. I think this is my favoutite from the 7 we tried, you could easily stay here for 2 weeks. We went on a wild dolphin tour with dolphin adventures, that was cool, there was just us and the dolphins and I even learnt to snorkle. Not cheap at Â£200.00 for 3 hpours but a life experience!! Definatley will be coming back

Reviews.Title: “best customer service ever!!!!”
Reviews.Author: love2vacation25
Reviews.Content: we loved this place!!! down the street from all the hussle and bussle!! wonderfull pool- and gergeous sunrise's! we booked a room overlooking the ocean and pool- but got moved to the Lamar house right next door- because of a disturbence with construction- much more secluded. very romantic! southernmost on the beach is a great getaway but if you r able to splurge a little go with the lamar house!!! the concierge was most helpfull and got us a great deal with in room masages!!! front dest way better than ever expected!!! for those wondering if this is the right place to go or not- stop thinking about it and just do it!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “loved it”
Reviews.Author: galemelmer
Reviews.Content: this place was great , friendly, modern, clean, and staff very helpful.perfectly situated with view of the beach and pool with easy access to duval and everything else...eat at camilles just around the corner

Reviews.Title: “no complaints at all!”
Reviews.Author: mcmenamy
Reviews.Content: We had a great stay at this hotel. Room 215 was the reason we enjoyed our stay so much as the private balcony (good size) and great view made it really fun. The pool must be one of the biggest around (at least of the one's we saw) The hotel/motel is bigger than the pictures show on their website as well as the beach located right next to it. If you go during the busy season it might be tough to get a lounge at the pool but we never had a problem. The tiki bar on the beach was great and the food was amazing. I did not venture into the water because its not the greatest but KW isn't a place to go to lay on the beach. There is a convienent store right across the street that you can get the necessary essentials and beer/wine to purchase to save some money from spending at the bar the whole time. It certainly is away from the main excitement of Duval st. but with all the eating/drinking you do the excercise is appreciated. Enjoy.

Reviews.Title: “Great location - great bridal suite for our wedding”
Reviews.Author: tifgmu2003
Reviews.Content: My fiance and I went to Key West from Washington DC to get married back in January. We chose Southernmost on the Beach for our bridal suite since our wedding was being held on the beach at the Duval Beach Club, which is the beach the Southernmost Hotels get to use. We chose the Southernmost Hotel across the street (not on the beach) for our guest room block of 30 rooms since it was cheapest. We were not pleased with that hotel there due to A/C problems, customer service, etc, but their property on the beach seemed like a different hotel. We were super pleased: Location: Awesome! Our balcony view was of the ocean and overlooking the beach where our wedding was to be held. This is the beach club that you can eat all your meals at while at the hotel. Very casual, and great prices. Very relaxed and "key west." The pool was really nice and very peaceful - never hoards of children in there. Room: Beautiful!! After all our problems at their property across the street (Southernmost Hotel) - we were ecstatic to walk across the street and into our room and see how huge it was, and the view. The reservations desk told me that this room was their best - with high ceilings, sitting area, HUGE bathroom with separate glass shower, etc. It was about $320 a night in high season. The bed was super comfy. Most hotels seem to be upgrading to really comfy pillowtop mattresses and I was pleased to find that this hotel had too. The bed was great - we slept so well. We were also happy to see coffee out for guests every morning by our room also. DO NOT stay at Southernmost Hotel - stay at the Southernmost on the Beach - you will be happy that you did. They may be the same hotel property, but it's like a different world at the one on the beach - especially the staff. Besides, you can always walk across the street to the tiki bar at the other property, but the view is priceless at Southernmost on the Beach.

Reviews.Title: “Most excellent vacation”
Reviews.Author: chasdancer
Reviews.Content: Southernmost has the most wonderful staff. Our view was amazing. The room was lux without being overly priced. The beach bar/restaurant was fun. You have to love a vacation with a "leisure engineer." Take some time to enjoy the Tiki Bar across the street at the sister hotel. The only drawback was the construction going next door. However, this is not something under the control of Southernmost and will likely be completed in the near future. It is only a problem if you want to sleep in. And, who wants to do that in paradise?

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel..except for construction”
Reviews.Author: KDFrosty
Reviews.Content: Stayed at Southermost on the Beach 8/26-8/28 2007. THE PROPERTY NEXT DOOR IS UNDER CONSTRUCTION AND WILL INTERFERE WITH EARLY MORNINGS AT THIS HOTEL! We were awaken by construction vehicles tearing apart the parking lot next door, and loading it in to dump trucks. This happened both mornings starting at 7am. We stayed in one of the "Ocean View, Private Balcony rooms" and it was worse off than a lower class of room because of the construction noise. Had there been no construction, I would have give this hotel only a slightly better rating. The staff is GREAT, the beach is really not. It was overcrowded (during the off season), and smelled like decomposing sea grass...which is exactly what it was covered in. This property, unlike the Southernmost Hotel (sister hotel) DOES NOT have a bar at the pool, but does have one on their "private beach", which charges $5 for a chair. For the same (or less $$) I wish we wouldve stayed somewhere else.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasantly surprised”
Reviews.Author: cherryislandgirl
Reviews.Content: This was a very nice hotel, well maintained!! Outside access, so air conditioners in room. We stayed on the Atlantic side of the island and are glad we did. It is more intimate and I am a water person. Glad the Hyatt was booked.; it would not have met my personal taste (closer to the nightlife). Mind you, we had a pool, ocean view, & balcony, room #226. There are 3-4 rooms above the pool with a balcony. Worth the extra $$ & privacy glass. Otherwise, there are a few at the end of the hotel. As mentioned in another review, 215 has it's own private balcony and is the only room that looks directly out to the ocean. The pool is very refreshing, extremely well maintained without the smell of chlorine. The staff are very personable. FYI comp. coffee poolside each morning. The beach and tiki bar right next to the hotel are nice. $5 for chair rental. Only drawback, no full length mirror in room, plenty of closet space. Nice kitchenette W/Blender, microwave, frig. Walk-in shower was awesome! Really pretty setting.

Reviews.Title: “Charming Hotel”
Reviews.Author: 1laughlin
Reviews.Content: After reading the reviews, we decided to book this hotel. Our room was nice with a great view of the ocean. The staff was very friendly and we loved the pool and beach areas, especially the Tiki bar on the sand. You can easily walk to the end of Duvall street to watch the sunset and the sunrise from the adjoining pier was truly beautiful! We can't wait to return to this gem.

Reviews.Title: “Great family resort!”
Reviews.Author: ssg23
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for 4 nights and were very happy with the accomodations as well as the pool and location. It is a 10 minute walk to the action of Duval Street. There is a small beach and great sunning pier on the premises. There is a very good breakfast at the Duval Beach Club next door. Down the street there was a general store for miscellaneous staples. We will definately stay again!

Reviews.Title: “SOTB - Nice!”
Reviews.Author: sll713
Reviews.Content: My family and I visited Key West and stayed at this hotel for my 11 year old brother's birthday. We originally requested a room towards the end - closest to the beach, but upon arriving we did not get this. We did not mind at all since we still had a top floor room and most of the rooms have a beach/ocean view anyway. We ended up being very happy with our room because we still had a partial view of the beach/ocean and we were very close to the entrance part of the pool and beach, plus we were very close to everything else by the street. We also had a private balcony, unlike the rest of the rooms towards the end of the property and all the rooms on the first floor. Their balconies were just walk way upon entering their rooms like any regular motel. Plus we noticed at night that the end part of the hotel is very quite and very dark - not too many lights. Kind of creepy. It was very quiet where we were at too but we were happy to have a few lights lit. The girl at the front desk was very nice and helpful. She gave us tips on reasonably priced places to eat for breakfast. The beach club across the hotel on our private beach was nice. A little high in price but expected. They had yummy hot wings and ice cold beer. Plus hamburger and food for the kids. They also served breakfast in the morning, though we did not try it. The beach was nice but had lots of rocks in the water which made it hard to walk your first few steps into the water, once passed that - it was fine. Be sure to wear water shoes. My brother had his and did not hurt his feet at all. We spent most of our time in the pool which was big and never full. Be sure to visit the Southernmost Point - walking distance from hotel. There is an ice cream shop and a little Cuban place to eat with outdoor seating across the street of the hotel. We only had breakfast there but it was very convenient. The trolley stop is also across the street - perfect if you reserve a tour. This is highly recommended. It takes you all over the island with hop on and off privileges all day. The tour guy is very interesting and you learn and see a lot. Mallory Square is a must. Also a Glassbottom Boat Ride is fun too - do this at sunset! On a small negative note: Because we stayed so close towards the front part of the hotel, we noticed that the cleaning people did not get to our room until 1 or 2 pm. at one point we were in our room and had to wait at our balcony for them to clean up. They were pretty fast (15 mins) but was still a hassle. All in all this is a nice hotel... and recommended but I would probably stay closer to Mallory Square next time since we did spend a lot of our time there.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Hotel”
Reviews.Author: MissDubyaVee
Reviews.Content: My mom and I traveled to Key West in June 2006. We just decided to get out of West Virginia for a while, so we booked a flight and headed out. The pictures on the Southernmost Hotel on the Beach website show exactly what the hotel looks like *unlike most hotel websites* Our room was on the 2nd floor with a view of the beach and ocean. The room was virtually spotless, everything matched. It was a good size, comfortable beds. The property around the hotel was beautiful, decorated with palm trees and hibiscus flowers. The pool area was also very clean. There were blow up rafts laying around the pool, and my mom and i spent most of our days on rafts in the pool. The tanning pier was also nice, but most of the time, it was so hot and the pool served as a better option =] The hotel is located on the quiet end of Duval Street. It was very relaxing and quiet. I dont think i would ever stay in a different hotel in Key West. Overall, our Key West vacation was wonderful, and our stay at the Southernmost Hotel on the Beach made it even better. I can't wait to go back =]

Reviews.Title: “LOVED the Southernmost”
Reviews.Author: lehsky
Reviews.Content: I LOVED this hotel. I chose it because it got good reviews from people on this website and I couldn't have been happier with my decision. We wanted to be on a beach, but close to Duval street and Southernmost on the Beach accomodated both. It was so cute and small, but had everything we needed. The small beach has a bar and restaurant, there an option of 3 great pools, and a pier to lay out on. The staff was very friendly and the place was very well kept. My favorite thing about it was the location. We were on the Atlantic side so we had the beach and it was quiet, but we were located right on the end of Duval Street so we could walk to all the restaurants and bars. There were little convience stores and restaurants so you could grab a quick sandwhich or snack across the street. The beach was small, but the perfect size for me. Just enough beach to lay out without it being too crowded, but good for the wading in the ocean occasionally. It would be really great for small children because it would be very easy to keep an eye on them. I would recommend this hotel to everyone - young, old, couples, and families. I found their website not to provide a lot of pictures so I am attaching some. I hope they do it justice because I just loved it.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice Pleasant Stay”
Reviews.Author: eddie110992
Reviews.Content: The hotel staff were very helpful and accomadating. The room was clean and the balcony had a view of the beach! There is LOTS to do that is within walking distance. Here is a tip - rent a scooter - it is fun and easier to get around!

Reviews.Title: “Nice Option: Clean, good locale, nice rooms”
Reviews.Author: RonRockyPoint_NY
Reviews.Content: Nice Property with helpful staff. I received the room I wanted and it met my expectations. Everything was clean. Room 212 second floor corner -king bed -ocean view- with a balcony. $260/night weekend June 2007

Reviews.Title: “Almost perfect...”
Reviews.Author: SammyC7
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Southernmost on the Beach for two nights during one part of our honeymoon. This place was great! Great location, great views, great pool, great rooms, and great prices... The only gripe I had was that the nighttime security guards weren't too laxed about using the pool after 10:00 or so. I tried and tried to see if I could go for a swim, but they wouldn't budge. Other than that, the place was fabulous. The only thing that bugged me about not being able to use the pool was that I had always heard how laid back everyone was in Key West, now they sweat a little thing like after hour swimming. Anyway, aside from that the place was definitely worth recommending...

Reviews.Title: “Can't wait to go back!!!”
Reviews.Author: kbear4
Reviews.Content: We stayed here from May 9-May 13. The rooms were spotless- the staff was very helpful. This was the second time we stayed at this property and I was even happier this time. The rooms have been updated. I was even happier to find that I could actually walk into and swim at the beach next door this time. Have not one complaint and to be honest after staying at at least five different properties in Key West I will look no further and stay here in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Great location for a quieter Key West experience”
Reviews.Author: ecvj
Reviews.Content: A great choice for a Key West visit-the adjacent beach and pier are great additions to the nice pool. We enjoyed mornings andd evenings on the balcony just looking at the ocean view and relaxing. Rooms were comfortable, quiet and spaceous. Staff was friendly. If you like historic houses, there are dozens to admire nearby as well as a good choice of restaurants and shops. This site is a great alternative to the tackiness of lower Duval.

Reviews.Title: “Is it me? Is it really that fantastic?”
Reviews.Author: Postcorner
Reviews.Content: There is no doubt that this is a nice hotel in a picturesque setting whose location could not be better to explore Key West and yet be away from the hustle of the other end of Duval Street. The staff are indeed very pleasant, helpful and even friendly. The rooms are nicely decorated and clean with good facilities. The beach is indeed right there and provided you have a top floor ocean view (at the end of the building away from South Street) then it has a special feel to it. It is this that you pay for as the hotel in my opinion when compared like for like with other 300 dollar/night establishments falls short. The rooms do no have balconies which is a shame given the view. There is an outside corridor which you can share with your neighbours unless you have one of the few rooms we saw with private balconies (I guess they must be 400 bucks a night). The layout is that of an overnight two storey motel although clearly a better standard. Breakfast is not included but is available across at the bar/ restaurant on the beach, which whether evening or morning is extremely pleasant although slightly shabby which adds to its appeal in a way. The pool area is nice and the pool itself a good size. You also get use of the sister hotels facilities although that is across the street so not the best in your bikini (hers not mine!). We arrived a day early and the front desk accommodated us although we did have to move rooms after the first night which they organised for us, bags and everything which was nice. On the point of staff however we did observe one employee enjoy a drink and leave his cup on the stairwell just in time to avoid tripping over it. He then proceeded to just walk off which we thought a little odd. The room itself also lacked the attention to detail of better hotels such as the shower cubicle base being cheap plastic and the curtains being behind a table making them difficult to close. Perhaps the most annoying was the adjacent nightclub which backs onto the property at the 'ocean-end' where the alleged more expensive rooms are located. If you don't mind your room beating with the base of an evening then fine, this is Key West afterall. It did go off regularly at about 11.30pm but it was annoying if you were in the room relaxing. Don't get me wrong, very nice hotel which was a fine end to our vacation but either the details need to be sharpened up on or they need to review their prices (IMHO).

Reviews.Title: “wonderful stay”
Reviews.Author: jacey123
Reviews.Content: I am the type of person who researches extensively my travel destinations. This recommendation could not have been more appropriate. My family and I spent three wonderful nights at the Southernmost on the Beach, mid April. We found the hotel to be perfect. The rooms were very clean, had a beautiful view of the beach and ocean, and found the location great. The hotel stafff were very friendly, too. We explored the whole Island and can not recommend a better place than SOTB. Right off Duval St., but quiet and removed from the late night action. Loved Key West and can not wait to go back again, just a very special place!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “It's All That and More”
Reviews.Author: arielmm7
Reviews.Content: I am a Floridian and haven't been to Key West in over 15 years, so I did a lot of research before I made a reservation. The reviews on TripAdvisor were all excellent and right on the money, this is a wonderful place to stay. Take it from someone who lives in Florida and has been to many beaches, this hotel has it all. The property is immaculate and so are the rooms. The rooms are not huge, but very clean and tastefully decorated. The employees are all very friendly and helpful. The location is great, you are close enough to walk to shops, restaurants and attractions and you are right on the beach. Don't be fooled by other hotels that claim they are on the beach, most of them aren't. Some are across the street from the ocean, but there is no actual beach to walk on. We really enjoyed the sunning pier that extends out into the ocean with lounge chairs and umbrellas, it was very relaxing. All the action is on Duval Street and you are a few steps away, but on the quiet end of the street. I can't say enough about this place, you have to go there and see it for yourself. They own several other properties and they are all just as nice. If you want a great experience in Key West go to the Southernmost Beach Resort, you'll never want to leave! Make sure to visit the ice cream shop across the street, the ice cream is homemade and delicious.

Reviews.Title: “Love it love it love it!!!”
Reviews.Author: Athena2007
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a 5 day stay at the Southernmost. It was wonderful. The grounds and rooms are top notch. Next door is a quiet, well kept public beach with a bar (not many beaches in the Keys). The bed was just like home, my husband and I slept well. Great location, there is a grocery store down the street, so you can stock your frig in your room. The pool is beautiful, and the staff are very attentive to your needs. They have a wonderful tanning deck that goes out into the ocean.You are about a little more than a mile from Mallory Square, which is great because you are close enough, but far enough not to deal with the noise at night. Just rent a bike, scooter, etc., if you won't feel like walking, but it is a very fun walk indeed! I have no complaints and would happily stay there again and again!! Thanks Southernmost!!

Reviews.Title: “Loved it!”
Reviews.Author: ldeanok
Reviews.Content: I have just returned from a long weekend spent at Southernmost Hotel on the Beach. I must say it was one of the best experiences I have had in a hotel stay. The hotel was gorgeous. The room was immaculate and had everything we needed. The room was advertised as a "Partial Ocean View", but in my opinion was a full ocean view. I'm assuming they called it Partial because the view had the beach on the right and the ocean on the left as opposed to straight out on the ocean. Everyone at the hotel and for that matter all over the island was extremely friendly. The Duval Beach Club was right next door and everyone there was great too. I highly recommend this hotel to anyone that visits Key West. The price was on the high end, but entirely worth it and I will definitely be staying there the next time I visit Key West.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect”
Reviews.Author: bopwham
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at Southernmost on the Beach for our 25th wedding anniversary and it was perfect. We stayed in room 213, which allowed for a view of the ocean and palm trees. Our room was the 3rd from last in the building. If you have a room the other end, you still have an ocean view, but also the parking lot. The room was well appointed and comfortable. Room service was prompt and complete. Location wise, it was ideal. It was at the southern end of Duvall St, which is the main street with restaurants, gallerys, shops, etc. So it was close to the main attractions, yet far enough from the noise and lights of Duvall St. To walk from the hotel to the other end of Duvall St is 1.25 miles. The hotel staff was very helpful and pleasant. I had overbooked for one night and they took it off without any question or charge. We had never been to Key West before, but after being there and seeing other accomodations, we wouldn't stay anywhere else. Keep in mind, our place was one of a few in the Southernmost Hotel and Resorts facilities. They have the hotel(not on the beach) and two B&B type places, all within the same area.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place to Stay”
Reviews.Author: golf07
Reviews.Content: My stay lasted six nights and I was very pleased. Southernmost on the Beach is part of the Southernmost Hotels and Resorts, which are comprised of five properties. Four of them Southermost on the Beach, Southernmost Hotel, Dewey House and LeMar Hotel are right next to each other. As a guest of any of these locations you are allowed to use the facilities (pools, tiki bar, etc) that each offer. Right next to Southernmost on the is a public beach, not very big but it is right there., where you can rent chairs and there's a small resturant too. The hotel offiers a private deck with lounge chairs that sits right over the beautiful blue/green water, there is also a stairway that goes right into the water...cool! The hotel is located at the southermost end and is about a 1.3 mile walk to Mallory Square where the sunset celebrations are held. But the walk down Duval Street keeps you occupied with all the stores/resturants/bars. The hotel offers parking spaces either at Southernmost on the Beach or across the street. You really do not need a car in this area, there is no place to park on Duval or other streets and if you find one it's .25 cents per 10 minutes. I rented a car for two days only to visit the upper keys, the other days, I rented a scooter. Use the Visitors Center at the hotel to rent one, they are less expensive then other rental places. See David at the Vistors Center, he's great and will also book trips for you. The people at the hotel were friendly and helpful. Overall, the place was nice and quiet (no one allowed under 25 years of age, unless accompanied by parent/adult). I loved this policy, especially at spring break time. The only issues I had were that a new bathmat was not provided everyday ,the ice bucket was never emptied and they did not put the ironing board back in the closet. So, I used a towel, emptied the bucket myself and put back the board. That's the worst of it. When I go back to Key West I will stay again at this hotel and have already recommended it to several co-workers. Oh, the pictures on the website are really just as pretty in person.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay!!!”
Reviews.Author: 2-of-usConnecticut
Reviews.Content: We stayed here from 2/11/07 to 2/17/07- it was great! This hotel is one block over from Duval Street and right on the beach. This area is quiet at night and has beautiful views. You have a pool, access to two more across the street- a beach right outside your door and a picture perfect view of the sunset every night. This hotel is clean, has plenty of closet and drawer space and the staff is wonderful. We originaly were booked at a resort but trip advisor reviews let us know that construction was a constant issue.We cancelled the reservation and re-booked with Southernmost on the Beach and we would go back again and again. Thank you trip advisor for helping us find this gem!

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay - Southernmost On The Beach”
Reviews.Author: wlawson
Reviews.Content: The wife and I just got back from a four night stay and were very pleased with our choice of hotel. Great location (quiet late night), great view, newly painted, clean grounds, great staff, beach, and beach bar. Our second time to Key West, last time we stayed at Hilton at Mallory Sq (now Weston). Southernmost smoked them. We will be back.

Reviews.Title: “As Good As It Gets”
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Southernmost on the Beach for five nights, Jan 15 to Jan 20. We had been to Key West about six years ago and stayed at the Hilton, (now the Westin). While the Hilton was nice, this place is so much better. Friendly staff, great ocean views, nice beach, and good resturants nearby. We had a second floor ocean view room that was very clean. The king bed was excellent. The room was well appointed and quiet at night. The beach is owned by the city and is well kept. Chairs can be rented for five dollars per day. The outdoor bar at this beach is under cover and serves breakfast, lunch, and dinner. The ocean itself does have a lot of coral on the bottom. You must be careful, but it is swimable. This resort has three swimming pools. One located on the beach side and two across the street at the Southernmost Hotel property. This property also features a tiki bar next to the pool and is a nice place to relax. As stated in other reviews, this hotel is at the quiet end of town. However, one can easily get to anywhere in Key West. Bikes can be rented on site as well as motorized scooters. Cabs are all over and reasonable. We had seen the tonk on Duval St. before so we only went "downtown" twice. My wife and I agree this is a can't miss hotel. We hope to return and would not stay anywhere else. The Southernmost Hotel, located across the street from Southernmost on the Beach, also looks good. No ocean view but very nice. leonardexcop@aol.com

Reviews.Title: “A wonderful surprise!!”
Reviews.Author: chmpgnstrwbrycpl
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I wanted to get away to Key West, a place I had never been, and he hadn't been in twenty years. I went online to get an idea of hotel classes and cost. I browsed pictures and read a few reviews and decided that this would be a good hotel to stay in....well we were wrong....it was undoubtedly THE BEST hotel we have ever stayed at for the price we paid!! and more!!! As we were driving down the street toward the hotel we were impressed with how clean, quiet and attractive the area was. The front desk reception person was extremely helpful (thank you Michael!!). We were excited to have a second floor room with a view of the ocean and the sunset!! The rooms are tastefully decorated, spacious, and very clean. The pool area was inviting!! If you want to go to the beach, it's just a few steps outside your door. There's a beach bar there as well. Nothing was ever crowded or too noisy. My NYC boyfriend is a very picky eater and I was worried we wouldn't find great food. We took a chance in asking Michael for recommendations. He was dead-on!! Every time we asked a front-desk person about a restaurant we were pleasantly surprised!! Great food for every meal we had!! Also, to meet some of the locals for informative, friendly recommendations, head up to Duval and walk one block to a tiny coffee shop on the left. Go in the morning for a cup of coffee and a breakfast treat....the locals are warm and friendly and are quick to give you advice. Another MUST-DO, if you are looking for the most romantic, intimate dining experience, go to Latitudes. You must call to make a reservation!! And make it at sunset. A boat takes you to Sunset Key, a very exclusive island. The restaurant is on the beach, so make sure to request a table in the sand!! The food was incredible, our waitress was very accommodating and friendly, and her suggestions from the menu were perfect!! What an incredible memory!! THE most romantic dinner we've ever had!! If I were forced to say anything negative about our stay, it would be that the pool chairs were extremely uncomfortable!! So were the beach chairs. Additionally, my boyfriend loves to swim in the ocean, and he was disappointed to find that the bottom of the ocean was rocky, and had lots of coral. But that's it!!!

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed our stay!”
Reviews.Author: rykzk
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Southernmost on the Beach partial ocean view room for 2 nights. The room was pretty and clean. Staffs were very friendly and helpful. We rented bikes at the information counter in the hotel. It cost $15/24h. We bicycled around the island and had a lovely time! Bike Route along the shore was wonderful. We saw sunset from both Mallory Square and the front of the hotel. Mallory Square was very crowded, but this hotel was not, so we could see it thoroughly without blocking our view. Very beautiful. View from our partial ocean view room was OK (see my photo). We saw not only the ocean but also parked cars. We heard footsteps from the balcony (the second floor) whenever people were on it while we were in our room (the ground floor). We suppose second floor rooms are better about the view and the noise.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: kmjacobs84
Reviews.Content: I was hesitant to stay at this hotel because of the 2.5 star rating and lack of photos of the property. However, after looking at other properties and other prices I decided to book a room at the Southermost on the Beach. The property was great!! The staff was very professional and helpful. I enjoyed the beautiful pool, clean and modern rooms, and the peer! From what I could tell we made the best choice of hotel. You won't regret staying at this hotel, it is the best in Key West!! P.S. don't be fooled by some of the amazing websites of other Key West hotels, some of the most pricey were rather worn down and dirty looking. I hope you have a wonderful and relaxing trip in the Conch Republic a.k.a Margaritaville!! And don't forget to enjoy an amazing meal and mojito at Louie's Backyard Restaurant it is right around the corner.

Reviews.Title: “Very enjoyable stay”
Reviews.Author: pflau
Reviews.Content: I stayed there for one night during my two days trip to Key West. I picked this hotel because it is right at the beach and I wanted to be able to catch the famous Key West sunset. Even though I eventually caught the sunset at Mollory Square instead, the hotel turned out to be a good choice because it is just a short drive to the other end of Duval and also a short drive to the other beaches along the southern edge of the island. The room is great and importantly at least to me has internet connection. The only reason I am not giving it five stars is it does not have some of the little things that I take for granted in a regular chain hotel such as a bathtub (it has a shower instead) and a sink with indentations for soap and that is recessed so water doesn't run everywhere. Also, there is no place to hang the face towel. One good thing though is that there is a frig under the sink but it is off and you have to turn it on to use it. Overall if I were to go back to Key West again this hotel would be near the top of my list of places to stay.

Reviews.Title: “A Nice Spot on the Quiet Side of Key West”
Reviews.Author: GoHoos99
Reviews.Content: My wife and I (first time visitors to Key West) booked our stay at Southernmost on the Beach due to the positive reviews from TripAdvisor members -- and we weren't disappointed. It's a very cute, walk-up motel located near the quiet end of Duval Street. Amenitiies are easily accessible -- pool, beach, tanning deck -- and you are within easy walking distance to almost anything you'd want to do while in Key West. We were in a shoreline view room on the 2nd floor that offered nice views of the beach and ocean. Would strongly recommend that anyone coming to Key West (esp. if you are looking to be slightly out of the hustle and bustle) would stay here. Enjoy!

Reviews.Title: “Beach friendly, locale great!”
Reviews.Author: KrissyKris
Reviews.Content: Wonderful location. On the end of the main drag, far from the square but not a big deal because you can rent bikes there, plus walking down the length of the street is fun. Not a ton of beaches in Key West but this hotel has its own private beach and fun little open air restaurant. Rooms clean, pool great. My husband and I highly recommend. Also check out Smathers Beach and don't miss the butterfly conservatory!

HotelInfo.Name: Southernmost on the Beach
HotelInfo.Address: 508 South Street, Key West, FL 33040
